the code of the city of st augustine florida ____________ published by order of the city commission ____________ adopted  effective  > current officials of the city of st augustine florida ____________ nancy shaver mayorcommissioner roxanne horvath vice mayorcommissioner ____________ leanna freeman todd neville nancy sikeskline city commissioners ____________ john regan city manager ____________ isabelle lopez city attorney ____________ darlene galambos city clerk officials of the city of st augustine florida at the time of this codification ____________ tracy w upchurch mayorcommissioner ____________ henry f green iii v noel helmly henry l twine richard l white city commissioners ____________ joseph pomar jr city manager ____________ geoffrey b dobson city attorney ____________ paula b owens city clerk preface this a complete recodification of the general and permanent ordinances of the city of st augustine florida source materials used in the preparation of the the 1964 as supplemented  and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city commission the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1964 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state law have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this system the numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of is numbered 12 and the first section of is 41 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections or even whole chapters can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 31 and 32 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 315 new chapters may be included in the same manner if the new material is to be included between chapters 12 and 13 it will be designated as care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division indexes the indexes have been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the indexes themselves which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the appropriate page or pages affected will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised sheets are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of roger d merriam supervising editor and ronald k mclaughlin editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to city attorney geoffrey b dobson city clerk paula b owens and the city staff for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys affairs municipal code corporation tallahassee florida adopting ordinance ordinance no 9204 an the the city of st augustine 1992 edition as prima facie evidence of the ordinances of the city of st augustine general and permanent as therein specified  adopting of the the city of st augustine 1992 edition as positive law of the city of st augustine  and providing an effective date be it enacted by the people of the city of st augustine florida the matters set forth in the the city of st augustine 1992 edition shall together with the then current supplements if any establish prima facie the ordinances of the city of st augustine general and permanent in their nature in force on  or the effective date of the most recent ordinance included within such supplements if any in the event of conflict between ordinances as enrolled on the records of the city clerk and the provisions of the the city of st augustine and supplements if any the provisions of such enrolled ordinances shall control  provided however that whenever any provision of such have been enacted into positive law the text thereof shall be accepted as the official text of such ordinances that of the the city of st augustine 1992 edition be and the same is hereby adopted as positive law that all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this take effect immediately passed this 24th day of february ad 1992 s tracy w upchurch mayorcommissioner attest s paula b owens city clerk supplement history table the table below allows users of this quickly and accurately determine what ordinances have been considered for codification in each supplement ordinances that are of a general and permanent nature are codified in the are considered included ordinances that are not of a general and permanent nature are not codified in the are considered omitted in addition by adding to this table with each supplement users of this be able to gain a more complete picture of the s historical 12819 included 52 1901 12819 included 52 1903 12819 included 52 1905 42219 included 52 1906 42219 included 52 part i  charter laws footnotes  1  editors note the city of st augustine was originally incorporated by the territorial acts of 182 pages 86 87 since that incorporation it was reincorporated in 182 188 191 192 1923 and 192 when the present charter was enacted of the made up of the charter laws of the city as amended or supplemented the editors in compiling the existing charter laws have in many instances moved sections into more significant article headings except as stated no material within the sections has been disturbed and appears here as recorded in the official journal in the secretary of states office the section subsection and paragraph numbering and lettering of this compilation of the charter and amendments have been supplied by the editors as well as catchlines and article headings the true identification of each section as to its chapter and section number appears in parentheses at the end of each section all sections that are no longer effective have been superseded or that consist of mere legislative dicta have been omitted all words phrases corrections etc other than placement of statutory references in a uniform style supplied by the editors in the actual body of any section are placed in brackets or are noted in editors notes obvious misspellings have been corrected without notation a comparative table immediately following the charter compilation shows the disposition of each section herein article i  transition  corporate limits short title this act shall be known as the charter of the city of st augustine florida and in all subsequent amendments thereto it will be sufficient to refer to this act as the charter of the city of st augustine florida laws of fla 1925 ch 111  221 existing municipality abolished editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  1 it has been deleted as obsolete new municipality created the inhabitants of the city of st augustine florida as its limits are hereinafter established shall continue to be a body politic and corporate to be known and designated as the city of st augustine florida and as such shall have perpetual succession laws of fla 1925 ch 111  5 rights and liabilities of old municipality vested in new the title rights and ownership of property uncollected taxes dues claims judgments decrees and choses in action held or owned by the municipality of st augustine shall pass to and be vested in the municipal corporation organized under this act to succeed the municipality abolished laws of fla 1925 ch 111  2 obligations not to be impaired editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  1 it has been deleted as obsolete officers to continue in office  ordinances unimpaired editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  4 it has been deleted as obsolete liens not impaired by act editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  4 it and to make rules and regulations for its use and the price to be paid for said water nothing in this act shall be construed to divest the said city of its title or ownership of any property of said of fla 1955 ch 312  1 it has been deleted as obsolete secs 122127  reserved article ii  city commission and city employees composition  qualifications of members  terms of office  manner of election the city commission of the city of st augustine florida shall consist of five 5 members and who shall be qualified electors of said city with one of the commissioners to be designated as mayor in accordance with this charter each commissioner shall be elected at large in the manner hereinafter provided commencing with the general election to be held in november 199 three 3 commissioners shall be elected the candidate receiving the highest number of votes cast for seat one to serve for a term of four 4 years  the candidate receiving the highest number of votes cast for seat two to serve for a term of four 4 years  and the candidate receiving the highest number of votes cast for seat three to serve for a term of two 2 years and thereafter commencing with the general election to be held in november 199 three 3 commissioners shall be elected the candidate receiving the highest number of votes cast for seat four to serve for a term of four 4 years the candidate receiving the highest number of votes for seat five to serve for a term of four 4 years the candidate receiving the highest number of votes cast for seat three designated as the mayorcommissioner seat to serve for a term of two 2 years thereafter in general elections to be held in november of each even numbered year successful candidates for seats one two four and five shall be elected for a term of four 4 years and the successful candidate for seat three receiving the highest number of votes shall be elected for a term of two 2 years laws of fla 1925 ch 111  8  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  2  laws of fla 1955 ch 312  1 2  laws of fla ch 671975  8   41387   31290   81406 cross reference election of member of city commission as mayor  503 powers generally  members to judge own elections etc  forfeiture of office on conviction of crime the city commission shall constitute the governing body of the city with powers as hereafter provided to pass ordinances adopt resolutions and appoint an administrative officer to be known as the city manager and to exercise all other powers hereinbefore or hereafter provided a quorum of the city commission shall consist of three commissioners but a less number may adjourn from day to day to compel the attendance of absent members in such manner and under such penalties as may be prescribed by ordinance and no legislative action on the part of the city commission shall be valid unless concurred in by a threefifths vote of all the members of the city commission the city commission shall be the judge of the election and the qualifications of its own members subject to review by the courts any member of the commission who shall be convicted of a felony or a crime involving moral turpitude while in office shall forfeit his office laws of fla 1925 ch 111  8  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  2 editors note the last sentence has been altered to read as shown it appears to be amendable by ordinance see ago 07325 members of the city commission to be residents and electors florida appointed by the city commission of said city after having served for a period of thirty days such official upon request within three days thereafter shall be entitled to a public hearing within fifteen days after said removal and the final removal thereof shall not be effective until after such public hearing laws of fla 1955 ch 3122  1 secs 212217  reserved article iii  powers and duties general state laws all general laws of the state applicable to municipal corporations now or which may hereafter be enacted and which are not in conflict with the provisions of this charter or with the ordinances and resolutions hereafter enacted by the city commission shall be applicable to this city  provided however that nothing contained in this charter shall be construed as limiting the power of the city commission to enact any ordinance or resolution not in conflict with the constitution of the state or with the express provisions of this charter laws of fla 1925 ch 111  219 general powers the city of st augustine florida by and city commission shall have and is hereby granted the right power and privilege a taxes to levy taxes and assessments b public works to control perform and furnish all public services including the services of a civil or other engineer for the purpose of obtaining data estimates plans and specifications for proposed or contemplated public works or improvements except as otherwise herein provided c acquisition of lands to acquire by purchase gift devise bequest donation lease or condemnation any real or personal property or any estate right easement or interest therein situate within or without the corporate limits of the city of st augustine for any of the uses purposes and needs of the city of st augustine florida and upon the acquisition of same to hold use manage maintain control sell lease donate exchange mortgage pledge or otherwise dispose of and encumber the same d lands buildings water eminent domain to maintain and further public improvements and works of all kinds including municipal and other public buildings armories markets toll bridges airports and all buildings and other structures necessary or appropriate for the use of the city and to acquire by condemnation proceedings or otherwise any and all lands riparian or otherwise and other rights and easements necessary for such public works and improvements  to purchase hire construct own maintain operate or lease works for supplying the city and its inhabitants with water  to acquire in any lawful manner in any county of the state of florida or without said state such water lands and land under water as may be deemed necessary for the purpose of providing an adequate water supply for said city and for the piping of said water from such land or lands under water herein authorized to be acquired wheresoever situate to the said city of st augustine for constructing and erecting necessary dams pumping stations and any and all other works in connection therewith  to make all reasonable rules and regulations for promoting the purity of its water supply wheresoever situate and for protecting the same from pollution  and for this purpose to exercise full police powers over all lands comprised within the limits of the watershed territory tributary to such water supply wherever such land may be located in the state of florida  to impose and enforce adequate penalties for the violation of any such rules and regulations  and to prevent by injunction any pollution or threatened pollution of such water supply and any and all acts likely or considered likely to impair the purity thereof  and for the purpose of acquiring lands or materials for any such use to exercise within the state of florida all powers of eminent domain for any of the purposes aforesaid the said city of st augustine by and city commission shall have the right power and authority to acquire by condemnation purchase or otherwise any estate or interest in such lands or any of them or any right of easement therein reserving to the owner or owners thereof such rights or easements as may be prescribed in the ordinance providing for such condemnation or purchase of any lands or interest therein the city may sell or supply to persons firms or industries residing or located without the city limits any surplus of water it may have over and above the amount required to adequately supply its own inhabitants e wharves bridges to establish build construct maintain and operate public lands public wharves docks and toll bridges within the city  and to acquire by condemnation or other lawful manner all lands riparian and other rights approaches and easements necessary for the purposes aforesaid  to lay and collect reasonable duties or wharfage fees on vessels or boats using any such landings wharves or docks  to assess and collect tolls from and upon any municipally owned toll bridge or bridges of the city and to fix the rate of such tolls and to provide for the application of the revenues derived from such tolls to any municipal purpose or purposes  to dredge or to deepen the harbor or rivers or any branch or portion thereof within the limits of said city  to prescribe and enforce reasonable rates and regulations for the protection and use of its said properties f aircraft regulations to license and regulate all and every manner and kind of air vessels operated over the city  and to stipulate the height at and the manner in which said air vessels may be operated above the area included in the city limits and to license and register the pilots thereof  to establish and maintain and equip municipal airports and to regulate the use thereof and to prescribe and collect fees or tolls for the use thereof g plats fills conveyances to develop by filling platting bulkheading reclaiming dredging subdividing or otherwise improving as may be prescribed by the city commission for the health comfort convenience and amusement of the inhabitants of said city all lands acquired by the said city by purchase or otherwise and lying and being within the corporate limits of said city as hereinbefore set forth  such development may be carried on under contract with persons firms or corporations or otherwise as the city commission may deem wise  and in the furtherance of such development of all land acquired by said city by purchase or otherwise the said city commission shall have the right and power to make execute and deliver good and sufficient deeds of conveyance under such restrictions as may be prescribed by the city commission to persons firms or corporations for private purposes and to receive and accept money or other valuable considerations the kind and amount to be fixed by said city commission in payment for the conveyance of such lands  provided however that all moneys derived from the sale of such lands after the costs of such development have been paid shall be used in the building of municipal wharves docks and terminals yacht basins piers parkways golf links and suitable buildings to be operated in connection therewith sanitation and for the furtherance of commerce and navigation h historical sites it is hereby declared and enacted that the preservation restoration and maintenance of the city of st augustines ancient landmarks sites buildings remains and other property of historical or antiquarian interest of scenic beauty recreational or scientific utility remarkable phenomena or other unusual features is a public use for the observation education health pleasure benefit and general welfare of its citizens i underground wiringbuildings  zoning the city of st augustine by and city commission be and it is hereby authorized and empowered by its zoning ordinances to define the terms residence place of residence business place of business business residential historical park parking scenic and boulevard areas and districts  to limit regulate control or prohibit the erection or construction of any pole object or thing for carrying holding or maintaining any overhead wires  to limit and regulate the location or require the placing underground of all overhead wires within the boundaries of the city of st augustine florida  to prohibit regulate and control the construction erection maintenance and use of any and all signs billboards or displays of any nature over and upon the streets of the city of st augustine florida and over and upon the property of any individual person firm corporation or association situated within the corporate limits of the city of st augustine florida  to regulate control and limit the architectural design kind of material height size and location of buildings and structures hereafter erected  and to regulate and control the use and alteration of present buildings and structures and those to be hereafter erected and constructed  to require the alteration and razing of present buildings or structures or portions thereof which are in conflict with the zoning ordinance or ordinances of the city of st augustine florida  to regulate control and determine the area of yards courts and other open spaces and to create and establish regulate and control business residential historical park parking scenic boulevard and other similar areas and districts and combinations thereof and to prescribe for each such area and district the business trades and industries that shall be excluded or allowed and regulated therein such regulations shall be designed to promote the public health safety from fire and other damages preserve and maintain ancient landmarks buildings remains sites and other property of historical or antiquarian interest of scenic beauty recreational and scientific utility for the education pleasure benefit and general welfare of the inhabitants of the city of st augustine and their property and shall be made with reasonable consideration among other things taking into consideration the location of the districts its peculiar suitability for particular trade or industrial uses historical scenic recreational scientific and educational value and the conservation of property and enhancement of property values in such districts and the direction and general supervision of building development in accord with a well considered and duly adopted plan  the grant of specific powers in relation to the regulation of buildings and the location of business trades and industries shall not be dependent upon any state law j traffic the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby granted full power and authority by ordinance or ordinances to regulate and control all traffic of any nature whatsoever and prohibit where necessary the use of motor vehicles over upon and in its streets roads parks parking areas and boulevards  and to regulate and control the width height and weight of any kind of any and all motor or other vehicles  to establish terminals for passenger and freight motor lines and when so designated said passenger and freight lines shall take on and discharge their passengers and freight at only such designated terminals k underground wiring the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby granted the power and authority to regulate control or prohibit by ordinance the erection or construction of any pole object or thing for carrying holding or maintaining any overhead wires and of the stringing of any wires on any pole object or thing within the incorporated limits of the city of st augustine florida and to compel by legal action all individuals firms associations or corporations owning or maintaining overhead wires on poles or other objects or things within the limits of the city of st augustine florida to place said wires underground and to raze the poles objects or things on which they are now strung l signs and advertisingcity streets the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby further granted full power and authority by ordinance or ordinances to prohibit regulate and control the construction erection maintenance and use of any and all signs billboards or displays of any nature over and upon the streets of the city of st augustine m sameprivate property the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby further granted full power and authority by ordinance or ordinances to prohibit regulate and control the construction erection maintenance and use of any and all signs billboards or displays of any nature over and upon the property of any individual person firm corporation or association situated within the corporate limits of the city of st augustine florida n eminent domain the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby granted the power of eminent domain upon payment of just compensation to take the fee title to property or any right easement or interest therein less than the fee as may be necessary for the preservation restoration and maintenance of its ancient landmarks sites buildings and other property of historical or antiquarian interest of scenic beauty recreational or scientific utility remarkable phenomena or other unusual feature for the elimination of signs billboards or similar mediums of display for the relocation or the placement of overhead wires underground and for the relocating of the razing of the poles objects or things upon which said wires are strung within the corporate limits of the city of st augustine florida o acquisition of property the city of st augustine florida by and city commission be and it is hereby authorized and empowered to receive accept and acquire by gift devise bequest donation purchase lease condemnation or otherwise historical landmarks sites remains buildings monuments cemeteries or other antiquarian interest or value scenic beauty scientific interest recreational utility remarkable phenomena or other unusual features books manuscripts and other personal property of historical value relics as well as money for the purchase and maintenance of same and to hold control own and use the same and provide for the restoration care and preservation of the same  and in the same manner to receive accept and acquire any property immediately contiguous to and adjoining any such real estate which is necessary for any such educational scientific or historical purpose or for the accommodation of the public in visiting such historical site object or place or which is essential to the carrying out of the intent and purpose for which the park preserve site or memorial was created  the city of st augustine by and city commission be and it is hereby specifically authorized and empowered to hold use manage control sell lease donate exchange mortgage pledge or otherwise dispose of any such property or any part thereof upon such terms and conditions as may be prescribed by the city commission of the city of st augustine florida whether the said property was acquired by gift devise bequest donation purchase lease condemnation or otherwise p city may act as trustee the city of st augustine florida by and city commission or other governing head be and it is hereby granted the power and authority to act as trustee for any money and property real or personal which may be placed by gift devise bequest donation or otherwise in its hands for the use and benefit of said city andor for the use observation education health benefit pleasure and general welfare of the citizens of the city of st augustine florida andor for the restoration preservation and maintenance of ancient or historical landmarks sites cemeteries graves military works monuments locations remains buildings and other property or objects of historical or antiquarian interest or value scenic beauty scientific interest recreational utility remarkable phenomena or other unusual features of the city of st augustine and to bind the said city its commissioners or other governing head in the acceptance thereof and to any and all conditions attached to such gift bequest devise or donation  that such money and property shall not be subject to or held liable for any claim indebtedness judgment mortgage or lien which has been or may be obtained by any person firm corporation or association against the city of st augustine florida  that the said property or money coming into the hands of said city in trust shall be held and used only for the purposes for which the said property or money is placed in its hands in trust and that all such money and property shall be inviolate and not subject to any action at law or equity against the said city of st augustine florida for any of its said obligations q general law the enumeration of the particular powers herein shall not be construed or held to be exclusive but in addition to the powers enumerated herein implied thereby or appropriate to the exercise thereof the city of st augustine florida shall have and may exercise thereof all other powers which are conferred upon cities by the general laws of which under the constitution and laws of florida it is and would be competent for this section expressly to enumerate r codification of ordinances the city of st augustine florida shall have the power and is hereby authorized by and city commission at any time to appoint some person or persons and authorize him or them to arrange and codify the ordinances of said city and to publish such codification in an appropriate volume which shall become the laws of said city upon the adoption by ordinance duly passed by the city commission  and provided further that in the exercise of the power by said commission to adopt said codification it shall not be necessary to publish said codification but the publication of the ordinance adopting the same shall be sufficient to make the codification of such ordinances binding as the laws of said city laws of fla 1925 ch 111  7  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  1  laws of fla 1937 ch 188  1  laws of fla 1947 ch 248  1 editors note former subsection i pertaining the state the city commission may by ordinance or resolution prescribe the manner in which any power of the city shall be exercised neither the commission nor any of its members shall dictate the appointment of any person to office or employment by the city manager or in any manner prevent the city manager from exercising his own judgement in selecting the personnel of his administration the promote and publicize city a the city commission of the city of st augustine florida is hereby authorized and empowered to use such means and media as said commission deems advisable to publicize and make known the advantages facilities resources products attractions and attributes of the city of st augustine florida  to promote the said city as a site for conventions and gatherings of all kinds  to create a favorable climate of opinion concerning the said city  and to cooperate with any and all other governmental agencies in accomplishing these purposes these are hereby declared to be valid municipal and public purposes b the city commission of the city of st augustine florida is hereby authorized and empowered to pay the expenses of such activities and the cost of carrying out the purposes of this act out of general municipal funds said payment may be made without regard to whether the expense or cost is incurred within or without the limits of the city of st augustine florida c it is the intention of the legislature that the authority granted in this act shall be cumulative and that funds expended hereunder shall be in addition to all other expenditures authorized by law laws of fla ch 652158  13 secs 308312  reserved article iv  executive and administrative officers division 1  in general in whom power vested the executive and administrative powers of the city not herein otherwise provided for shall be vested in and exercised by the following officers and departments a city attorney a municipal judge and three departments as follows department of public safety and welfare and public works department of records and taxation and department of finance laws of fla 1925 ch 111  35 editors note references in the above section to a municipal judge are obsolete see fla const art v  20d4 investigation of departments officers  process  procedure the city commission or any committee thereof the city manager or any advisory board appointed by the city commission for such purposes shall have power at any time to cause the affairs of any department or the conduct of any officer or employee to be investigated and for such purpose shall have power to compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of books papers and other evidence and for that purpose may issue subpoenas or attachments which shall be signed by the president or chairman of the body or by the officer making the investigation and shall be served by any officer authorized by law to serve such process the authority making such investigation shall have power to cause the testimony to be given under oath such oath to be administered by some officer having authority under the law of the state to administer oaths  and shall also have power to punish as for contempt any person refusing to testify to any fact within his knowledge or produce any book or papers under his control relating to the matter under investigation laws of fla 1925 ch 111  218 oath of officers editors note was the city commission or city manager in fixing the salary of any officer clerk or employee shall determine whether or not such officer clerk or employee shall give bond and the amount thereof which bond shall be procured from a regularly accredited surety company authorized to do business under the laws of florida the premiums on such bonds to be paid by the city all such bonds shall be filed in the office of the city clerk laws of fla 1925 ch 111  185 editors note pursuant to city instructions finance director has been changed to clerk in the last sentence division 3  mayor election  powers and duties the commissioner elected to seat three shall serve as mayor and shall preside at all meetings of the commission and perform such other duties consistent with his office as may be imposed by it and he shall have a voice and vote in the proceedings of the commission but no veto power he may use the title of mayor in any case in which the execution of legal instruments of writing or other necessity arising from the general laws of the state so requires but this shall not be considered as conferring upon him the administrative or judicial functions of a mayor under the general laws of the state he shall be recognized as the official head of the city by the courts for the purpose of serving civil processes by the government in the exercise of military law and for all ceremonial purposes he may take command of the police and govern the city by proclamation during times of grave public danger or emergency the powers and duties of the mayor shall be such as are conferred upon him by the city commission in pursuance of the provisions of this charter and no others in the absence of the mayor the other members of the city commission shall select one of their number to perform his duties laws of fla 1925 ch 111  19   5483   81406 editors note substitute for adopted  was approved at referendum held may 1983 division 4  city manager appointment  qualifications  temporary manager during absence etc the city commission shall appoint a city manager who shall be the administrative head of the municipal government under the direction and supervision of the city commission and he shall hold office at the pleasure of the city commission he shall be chosen solely on the basis of his executive and administrative qualifications without regard to his political belief and he need not be a resident of the city or state at the time of his appointment during the absence or disability of the city manager the city commission may designate some properly qualified person to temporarily execute the functions of the office laws of fla 1925 ch 111  31 cross reference city manager to have exclusive authority in the employment of city employees  305 compensation editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  32 and laws of fla 1931 ch 155  1 it assumed ordinance statutes pursuant to fs ch 166 and has been deleted as not needed term of office the city manager of the city of st augustine florida shall serve at the pleasure of the city commission laws of fla 1925 ch 111  33  laws of fla 1931 ch 155  2 powers and duties generally the city manager shall be responsible to the city commission for the proper administration of all affairs of the city and to that end his powers are and they shall be a to see that the laws and ordinances are enforced  b except as hereinafter specifically provided to appoint and remove all subordinate officers and employees of the city  all appointments to be made upon merit and fitness alone  c to exercise control and direct supervision over all departments and divisions of the municipal government under this charter or which may hereafter be created by the city commission  d to see that all terms and conditions imposed in favor of the city or its inhabitants in any public utility franchise are faithfully kept and performed  and upon knowledge of any violation thereof to call the same to the attention of the city attorney whose duty it is hereby made to take such legal steps as may be necessary to enforce the same  e to attend all meetings of the city commission and of its committees with right to take part in the discussion but without having a vote  f to recommend to the commission for adoption such measures as he may deem necessary or expedient in the interest of the city  g to keep the city commission fully advised as to the financial conditions and needs of the city and to submit for its consideration an annual budget  h to perform such other duties as may be prescribed under this charter or as may be required of him by ordinance or resolution of the city commission  and i the city manager of the city of st augustine florida or his designee shall be the purchasing agent of said city by whom all purchases of supplies shall be made  and he shall approve all vouchers for the payment of same in the capacity of purchasing agent he shall also conduct all sales of personal property which has become necessary or unfit for the citys use competitive formal bids should be solicited for any single item which exceeds the purchase cost of five thousand dollars $500000  provided however that when such formal bids have been received on public works construction contracts to be let by the city and they are in excess of the estimated construction costs as prepared by independent engineers or architects on behalf of the city then and in that event the city manager may subject to approval of the city commission negotiate the terms and conditions of such construction contracts with any qualified contractor whether low bidder or otherwise so as to bring the cost of the proposed contract within the engineers andor architects estimate or the amount of money available to the city for such contract laws of fla 1925 ch 111  34  laws of fla 1955 ch 312  1   112282   121090 editors note the last sentence of the above section has been transferred to the ordinances cross reference duty of the city manager in the preparation of the annual city budget  1402  expenditures other than salaries in excess of $1000 shall be made by competition  1410 to be head of various departments the city manager as the administrative officer of the city shall be the head of each department provided for under this charter and shall be responsible for its successful and businesslike operation he shall be the active head of the department of public safety and welfare which department shall have cognizance of all matters making for the welfare of the community such as the control of its charitable and correctional institutions and the management and supervision of all public improvements works and undertakings of the city except as otherwise specifically provided for under this charter laws of fla 1925 ch 111  52 appointment of health officer  duties editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  53 while it is a part of the charter it has been deleted as and control the use construction improvement repair and maintenance of all recreational facilities of the city including parks playgrounds and public gymnasiums bathhouses and social centers  he shall 73608  1 2 editors note ch 73608  1 2 amended the charter but did not specify the manner thereof hence inclusion herein as  417a and b was at the discretion of the editor division 5  city attorney qualifications the city attorney shall be a lawyer of at least five years experience admitted to and having authority to practice in all courts of the state laws of fla 1925 ch 111  38 cross reference ordinances to be voted on by the electors of the city to be first submitted to and approved by the city attorney  521 special duties the city commission shall appoint a city attorney who shall act as the legal adviser to and attorney and counselor for the municipality and all of its officers in matters relating to their official duties he shall prepare all contracts bonds and other instruments in writing in which the municipality is concerned and shall endorse on each his approval of the form and correctness thereof and no contract with the municipality shall take effect until his approval is so endorsed thereon he shall prosecute and defend for and in behalf of the city all complaints suits and controversies in which the city is a party he shall furnish the city commission the city manager the head of any department or any officer or board not included in any department his opinion on any question of law relating to their respective powers and duties laws of fla 1925 ch 111  36 of the city commission or as are prescribed for city attorneys under the general law of the state and which are not inconsistent with this charter and with any ordinance or resolution which may be passed by the city commission laws of fla 1925 ch 111  37 division 6  city clerk appointment  duties generally there shall be a city clerk who shall be appointed by and serve during the pleasure of the city commissioners and who under the supervision of the city manager shall be director of the department of records he shall attend all meetings of the city commission and shall keep a journal of its proceedings the correctness of which proceedings as entered in such journal shall be certified to after each meeting by his signature and by the signature of the presiding officer of the city commission he shall be the custodian of the seal of the city and of all records and papers of a general character pertaining to the affairs of a municipality he shall attest to the signature of the reserved division 9  fire department footnotes  4  editors note at an election held on  the electors adopted the provisions contained in former fs ch 174 relative to civil service for police and firemen in cities and towns of one hundred twentyfive thousand population or less composition  powers and duties generally of fire chief the fire force of the city of st augustine shall consist of a chief who shall be a fire warden and as many subordinate professional officers professional firemen and employees employed on a full time basis as the city commission shall by ordinance determine is reasonably required to afford fire protection to the city in determining the level of fire protection to be afforded the city commission shall consider the recommendations of the insurance service organization the national fire protection association the fire chief the city manager and the level of service afforded cities of a comparable size the fire chief shall have exclusive control of the stationing and transfer of all firemen and other officers and employees constituting the fire force subject to such rules and regulations as may be prescribed by city manager or by ordinance of the city  he shall have exclusive management and control of such officers and employees as may be employed in the administration of the affairs of his force in case of riot conflagration or like emergency the city manager may appoint additional firemen for temporary service the fire chief shall have subject to the remaining portions of this charter the right to suspend any officer or employee of the fire force because of incompetency neglect of duty drunkenness failure to obey orders given by proper authority or for any other just or reasonable cause and shall immediately report the fact of such suspension to the city manager for final action laws of fla 1925 ch 111  57   8888 authorized working hours  exceptions no member of the fire department of the city of st augustine florida shall regularly be required to remain on duty more than one hundred fortyfour hours in any two consecutive calendar weeks  provided however that all members of the fire department of the city of st augustine florida shall be subject to call in the event of a general fire alarm during the time when a fire emergency so requires  and provided further that nothing herein contained shall be construed to repeal any provision of any law or ordinance of the city of st augustine florida allowing vacations to members of the fire department of the said city laws of fla 1949 ch 261  1 sameinapplicability may by ordinance or resolution appoint a board of trustees to be composed of three members who shall be citizens of said city one trustee shall be appointed for one year one for two years and one for three years and shall hold office until their successors are appointed and qualified the said trustees shall take charge of manage conduct and exercise all the powers necessary for the reclamation and filling in of all marsh or submerged lands acquired by said city by purchase or otherwise to sell and convey such reclaimed lands upon such terms conditions and restrictions as the said trustees deem best for the interest benefit welfare comfort pleasure and convenience of the citizens of said city and to that end are hereby authorized to do and perform any and all acts necessary laws of fla 1925 571777  1  a  1 10873   2 91376   12378 it had assumed ordinance status pursuant to fs ch 166 and has been deleted as inconsistent with fs   secs 513515  reserved editors note a  2 4873 repealed former  513515 pertaining to the procedures for enacting ordinances and resolutions which were derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  25 26 30  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  4 5  laws of fla 1953 ch 294  1  and laws of fla ch 612738  1 ordinances submitted by petition of votersrequirements  procedure any proposed ordinances including ordinances for the repeal or amendment of ordinances then in effect may be submitted to the city commission by petition signed by at least twenty per cent of the total number of registered voters in the municipality all petitions circulated with respect to any proposed ordinances shall be uniform in character shall contain the proposed ordinance in full and shall have printed or written thereon the names and addresses of at least five electors who shall be officially regarded as filing the petition and shall constitute a committee of the petitioners for the purpose hereinafter named each signer of the petition shall sign his name in ink or indelible pencil and shall place on the petition opposite his name the date of his signature and his place of residence by voting precinct or ward and by street and number the signatures to any such petition need not all be appended to one paper but to each such paper there shall be attached an affidavit by the circulator thereof stating the number of signers to such part of the petition and that each signature appended to the paper is the genuine signature of the person whose name it purports to be and that it was made in the presence of the affiant and on the date indicated laws of fla 1925 ch 111  197 samepetition to be filed with clerk  submission to commission all papers comprising a petition shall be assembled and filed with the city clerk as one 1 instrument within ninety 90 days of the date of the first signature thereon and when so filed the clerk shall submit the same to the city commission at its next regular meeting and provision shall be made for public hearings upon the proposed ordinance laws of fla 1925 ch 111  198   42384 sameconsideration by commission  election may be held if rejected  new petition required the city commission shall at once proceed to consider such petition and shall take final action thereon within thirty days after the date of submission if the city commission rejects the proposed ordinance or passes it in a different form from that set forth in the petition or fails to act finally upon it within the time stated the committee of the petitioners by written demand filed with the city clerk may require that the proposed ordinance be submitted to a vote of the electors in its original form if with or prior to such demand a petition for such election signed after the final action or inaction of the city commission is filed with such city clerk bearing additional signatures of five 5 per cent of the electors of the city none of whom were signers of the first petition the city clerk shall forthwith cause notice of the filing of such demand and petition to be published in some newspaper of general circulation in the city and shall also within five 5 days certify to the city commission the proposed ordinance stating whether or not a special election is demanded in the petition the percentage of registered voters who signed the two 2 petitions in the aggregate and the date on which he published the notice last mentioned such proposed ordinance shall state the title of the ordinance to be voted on and below it the two propositions for the ordinance and against the ordinance immediately at the left of each proposition there shall be a square in which by making a cross x the voter may vote for or against the proposed ordinance if a majority of the electors voting on any such proposed ordinance shall vote in favor thereof it shall thereupon become an ordinance of the city laws of fla 1925 ch 111  201   42384 sameordinances to be approved by city attorney before any ordinance so proposed shall be submitted to the city commission it shall first be approved as to its form by the city attorney whose duty it shall be to draft such proposed ordinance in proper legal language if called upon so to do and to render such other service to persons desiring to propose such ordinance as shall be necessary to make the same proper for consideration by the city commission laws of fla 1925 ch 111  202 cross reference qualifications and duties of the city attorney  421 et seq samemethod of amending ordinances passed by electoral vote no ordinance adopted by an electoral vote can be repealed or amended except by an electoral vote  but an ordinance to repeal or amend any such ordinance may by resolution of the city commission be submitted to an electoral vote at any regular election or at any special municipal election called for some other purpose provided notice of the intention to do so be published by the city commission not more than sixty days nor less than thirty days prior to such election in the manner required for the publication of ordinances if an amendment is so proposed such notice shall contain the proposed amendment in full such submission shall be in the same manner and the vote shall have the same effect as in cases of ordinances submitted to an electoral vote by popular petition laws of fla 1925 ch 111  203 zoning ordinances  amendments editors note was derived from referendum petition to repeal or amend ordinanceswhen and where filed  contents if at any time within said thirty days a petition signed by thirtyfive per cent of the total number of registered voters in the municipality be filed with the city clerk requesting that any such ordinance be repealed or amended as stated in the petition such ordinance shall not become effective until the steps indicated herein shall have been taken such petition shall have stated therein the names and addresses of at least five 5 electors as a committee to represent the petitioners referendum petitions need not contain the text of the ordinance or ordinances the repeal of which is sought but shall contain the proposed amendment if an amendment is demanded and shall be subject in all other respects to the requirements for petitions submitting proposed ordinances to the city commission ballots used in referendum elections shall conform in all other respects to those provided for in section 233  520 of this charter laws of fla 1925 ch 111  204 editors note the first sentence of the above section has been deleted as superseded by  512 samereconsideration by commission  election the city clerk shall at its next meeting present the petition to the city commission which shall proceed to reconsider the ordinance if within thirty 30 days after the filing of such petition the ordinance be not repealed or amended as requested the city commission shall provide for submitting the proposed repeal or amendment to a vote of the electors provided a majority of the committee named in the petition to represent the petitioners shall be in writing filed with the city clerk within twenty 20 days after the expiration of the said thirty 30 days so required in so doing the city commission shall be governed by the provisions of section 200  519 of this charter respecting the time of submission and the manner of voting on ordinances proposed to the city commission by petition  excepting that the question of calling a special election for such purpose shall be determined by the demand and number of signers of the petition requesting the repeal of amendment of such ordinance which number shall be not less than twentyfive 25 per cent of the registered voters  and excepting further that the city commission may call and fix the time for a special election for such purpose if in its judgment the public interest will be prejudiced by delay if when submitted to a vote of the electors such repeal or amendment be approved by a majority of those voting thereon it shall thereupon go into effect as an ordinance of the city  but if any such amendment is clearly separable from the remainder of the ordinance and does not materially affect the other provisions of such ordinance all sections of the ordinance except that sought to be amended and those dependent thereon shall take effect as though no referendum of any portion of the ordinance had been demanded laws of fla 1925 ch 111  205   42384 sameordinances submitted by initiative petition subject to referendum ordinances submitted to the city commission by initiative petition and passed by the city commission without change or passed in amended form and not required to be submitted to a vote of the electors by the committee of the petitioners shall be subject to the referendum in the same manner as other ordinances if the provisions of two or more ordinances adopted or approved at the same election conflict the ordinance receiving the highest affirmative vote shall prevail laws of fla 1925 ch 111  206 sameapplicable to emergency ordinances ordinances passed as emergency measures shall be subject to referendum in like manner as other ordinances except that they shall go into effect at the time indicated in such ordinances if when submitted to a vote of the electors an emergency measure be not approved by a majority of those voting thereon it shall be considered repealed as regards any further action thereunder but such measures so repealed shall be deemed sufficient authority for the payment in accordance with the ordinance of any expenses incurred previous to the referendum vote thereon laws of superseded by fs    et seq secs 602613  reserved division 2  primary and general elections when elections to be held the primary and general elections for the election of city commissioners of the city of st augustine florida shall be as follows the primary election shall be held on the tuesday ten 10 weeks prior to the general election and the general election shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday of november 201 and thereafter primary elections shall be held on the tuesday ten 10 weeks prior to the general election of each even numbered year and the general elections shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november of each even numbered year laws of fla 1955 ch 312  3  laws of fla ch 671975  1   41387   7912   12714 when primary and general elections not necessary if only one 1 candidate qualifies for a group a primary and general election for that group shall not be necessary if only two 2 candidates qualify for a group then their names only shall be placed on the ballot for that group in the general election and a primary election for that group shall not be necessary if more than two 2 candidates qualify for a group a primary election shall be necessary for that group the names of unopposed candidates shall not appear on the primary or general election ballot each unopposed candidate shall be deemed to have voted for himself or herself laws of fla 1955 ch 312  4  laws of fla ch 671975  7  laws of fla ch 74598  1  laws of fla ch 81480  6 reserved editors note at the direction of the city  616 has been deleted of voters editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  88  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  79  laws of fla 1931 ch 155  8  laws of fla ch 81480  3 it was superseded by fs    and unconstitutional in part dealing with poll tax see harper v virginia board of elections 383 us 663 1963 arrangements  appointment of chairman of city canvassing board inspectors and clerk the city commission shall make necessary arrangements for holding all municipal elections and appoint a canvassing board who shall canvass and declare the results thereof the canvassing board shall be comprised of the city attorney the officer before whom the candidate for office qualified and a member of the city commission who will act as chairman the chairman of the canvassing board shall be selected from among the members of the city commission by the mayorcommissioner the chairman of the canvassing board shall not be a candidate with opposition in the election being canvassed nor an active participant in the campaign or candidacy of any candidate with opposition in the election being canvassed if the chairman of the canvassing board is unable to serve or is disqualified the mayorcommissioner shall appoint as a substitute another member with the same qualifications if a substitute member cannot be appointed as provided elsewhere in this subsection the city commission shall appoint as a substitute member a qualified elector of the city who is not a candidate with opposition in the election being canvassed and who is not an active participant in the campaign or candidacy of any candidate with opposition in the election being canvassed laws of fla 1925 ch 111  190  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  81  laws of fla ch 81480  2   41387   41387 when polls are open  ascertainment of canvass of returns  declaration of result  certification of election the results of the voting at all polling places shall be certified by the canvassing board the chairman of the canvassing board and the city attorney shall transmit such returns to the city commission at a meeting to be held at  noon on the day following the election at such meeting the city commission shall canvass the returns and the results as shown from such canvass shall be by the city commission declared to be the results of the election the qualifying officer shall on or before  noon of the second day after the election furnish a certificate of election to each person shown to have been elected laws of fla 1925 ch 111  191  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  82  laws of fla 1949 ch 261  2  laws of fla ch 81480  4   42384   41387   41387 editors note the first sentence of the above section has been deleted as superseded by fs   paper ballots the whole number of paper ballots to be printed for any primary or general municipal election for the nomination or election of candidates for the office of city commissioner shall be divided by the number of such candidates and the quotient so obtained shall be divided by the number of ballots in each series of ballots to be printed the names of the candidates shall be arranged in alphabetical order for each group in the first series of ballots printed the first names shall then be placed last and the next series of ballots printed and this process shall be repeated until each name shall have been first these ballots shall then be combined into tablets or pads with no two of the same order of name together the ballots shall in all other respects conform as nearly possible to the form of ballots prescribed by the general election law of the state of florida laws of fla 1925 ch 111  192 of the state of florida laws of fla ch 81480  7 nomination of commissioners  petition required  regulations for petitioners  payment of qualification fee  groups candidates for the office of city commissioner shall be nominated at a nonpartisan primary election where there are more than two 2 persons nominated for each office to be filled as hereinafter provided any person possessing the qualifications set forth in this charter shall be entitled to have his or her name printed upon the ballot at the primary election by written petition circulated by such candidate or on his or her behalf signed by at least twentyfive 25 qualified electors of the city of st augustine florida each of said petitioning electors shall in all respects be qualified to vote in the ensuing general election to be held in the city of st augustine florida such written petition shall be filed with the appropriate filing officer no earlier than noon of the 71st day and no later than noon of the 67th day before the first primary election or the same will not be recognized each petitioner signing said petition shall add after his or her signature his or her place of residence including street and number and voting precinct and also the date of the signing of said petition each petitioner may subscribe to one nominating petition for each office to be filled and no more all signatures shall be written in ink or indelible pencil or the same shall not be recognized each candidate so nominated shall upon his or her acceptance of such nomination as provided in this charter pay to the qualifying officer at the time of qualifying the sum of twentyfive dollars $2500 as his or her qualification fee candidates shall run in three 3 groups designated as group one group two and group three  and each voter may vote for one candidate in each group the nominating petition of each candidate shall indicate the group in which his or her name is to appear on the ballot  that is to say whether in group one group two or group three  and unless so indicated the petition shall be deemed a nullity no candidates name in any primary or general election shall be printed on the ballot if said candidate has notified the officer before whom the candidate qualified in writing under oath no later than noon the thirtieth day prior to the primary election that he or she will not accept the nomination or office for which he or she filed qualification papers the candidate who has withdrawn as a candidate for one group may qualify as a candidate for a different group provided he or she complies with all the qualification procedures provided herein laws of fla 1925 ch 111  193  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  84  laws of fla 1949 ch 261  1  laws of fla ch 671975  6  laws of fla ch 74598  1  laws of fla ch 81480  6   41387   12808 reserved editors note requiring candidates to file acceptance with the city auditor and clerk derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  194 and laws of fla 1929 ch 143  85 was repealed by laws of fla ch 81480  8 primary and general election  when candidate deemed elected  tie votes a in the primary election and in the general election to be held in may 196 and in each primary election and in each general election thereafter the candidates for city commission shall run in three groups designated as group one group two and group three and each voter may vote for one candidate in each group in the general election the successful candidates in group one and group two shall be elected for a full term of four years and the successful candidate in group three shall be elected for a full term of two years b1 at the primary election if a candidate receives a majority of the votes cast in his group then his or her name shall not be placed on the ballots for that group in the general election each unopposed candidate shall be deemed to have voted for himself or herself in the event that a candidate in any group does not receive a majority of the votes cast in his group then subject to the provisions of subsections b2 and b3 of this section the names of the candidates placing first and second in that group and their names only shall be placed on the ballots for that group in the general election b2 in all primary elections where there is a tie for first place in any group the names of and only the names of the candidates so tying shall be placed on the ballots for that group at the general election b3 in all primary elections where there is a tie for second place in any group and the candidate placing first in that group did not receive a majority of the votes cast in that group then the names of and only the names of the candidates placing first and tying for second in that group shall be placed on the ballots in the general election c in any general election the candidate in each group receiving the highest number of votes is and shall be deemed held and declared to be the person elected in the event there shall be a tie vote in any general election between two or more persons receiving the highest number of votes in any group the tie vote shall be decided by lot to be conducted by the city attorney city manager and city clerk laws of fla 1929 ch 143  87 charter amendments amendments to this charter may be submitted to the electors of the city by a twothirds vote of the city commission and by petition signed by thirtyfive 35 per cent of the electors of the city setting forth any such proposed amendment shall be submitted by action of the city commission unless such amendments are authorized by the state municipal home rule powers act the ordinance providing for the submission of any such amendment other than that authorized by the state municipal home rule powers act shall require that it be submitted to the electors at the next regular municipal election if one shall occur not less than sixty 60 days and not more than one hundred twenty 120 days after its passage  otherwise it shall provide for the submission of the amendment at a special election to be called and held within the time aforesaid if such amendment is approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon it shall become a part of the charter at the time fixed therein laws of fla 1925 ch 111  220  laws of fla ch 81480  1 use of voting machines the city commission of the city of st augustine florida may authorize the use of deleted as superseded by fs   secs 770774  reserved division 5  gasoline taxes exemption from certain state gasoline tax the city of st augustine florida a municipal corporation under the laws of the state of florida is hereby expressly exempted from the provisions of section thirteen of senate bill 155 as now amended and which was passed by the legislature of the state of florida at its 1937 session and which act is known as an act imposing an additional tax upon gasoline or other like products of petroleum  providing for reports of sale of such commodities to the comptroller of the state of florida  providing for the distribution of the moneys derived from such tax and fixing a penalty for the violation of the provisions of this act  providing that the gasoline inspection laws of the state of florida shall apply to this act and the city of st augustine aforesaid is hereby authorized and empowered to create and fix the amount of gasoline tax levied and collected within the municipality and which said tax shall be independent of any general state revenue law laws of fla 1937 ch 188  1 authority to levy and collect tax the city of st augustine florida a municipal corporation shall have and is hereby granted authorized and empowered city commission the power and authority to levy and collect a tax upon gasoline sold within the city limits of the city of st augustine florida laws of fla 1937 ch 188  2 referendum clause this act shall take effect after the approval and acceptance of the provisions hereof shall have been submitted to the qualified electors of the city of st augustine st johns county florida at a special election or at the next ensuing city election if the majority of all the electors voting at said election shall vote to approve and accept the provisions of this act then and in that event this act shall take effect and be in force from and after the date of canvassing and declaring the result of said election if the majority of all the electors voting at said election shall vote not to approve and accept the provisions of this act then and in that event the provisions of this act shall not be operative for any purpose  that said election shall be held and canvassed and the result thereof declared in accordance with the laws pertaining to elections in the state of florida laws of fla 1937 ch 188  4 editors note no records
