derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  51 it has been deleted as a  1 92473 abolished the municipal court effective oct 1 1973 article ix  police department jurisdiction  anastasia island the police jurisdiction granted under this charter shall extend to and be of full force and effect upon anastasia island and all existing ordinances and any which may hereafter be enacted dealing with the police powers of the city shall be of force and effect upon such island persons violating such ordinances and who may commit breaches of the peace upon the said anastasia island shall be subject to arrest by members of the police force of the city of st augustine and to trial before the municipal court of said city just as though the offense had been committed within the actual corporate limits of the said city laws of fla 1925 ch 111  45 editors note references in the above section to a municipal court are obsolete as a  1 92473 abolished the municipal court effective oct 1 1973 hot pursuit within st johns county a any member of the police department of the city of st augustine florida is hereby authorized to pursue across the city limits line and arrest where apprehended in st johns county any person suspected of having committed an offense against the ordinances of the city of st augustine florida provided the pursuit of such person is continuous after having originated within the corporate limits of the city of st augustine florida b any member of the police department of the city of st augustine florida is authorized to continue a hot pursuit beyond the limits of said city to any point in st johns county and arrest upon apprehension any person suspected of violating any ordinance of said city c hot pursuit as herein used shall be construed to mean pursuit of a person suspected of violating an ordinance of the city of st augustine florida said pursuit being within the limits of said city and continuing without interruption beyond the limits of said city to any point within st johns county florida laws of fla ch 652162  13 arrests editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  44 it has been deleted as it related to the municipal court which court was abolished by a  1 92473 effective oct 1 1973 chief and jail officers to take bond from persons arrested editors note was derived from laws of fla 1925 ch 111  46 it assumed ordinance status pursuant to fs ch 166 and has been deleted as obsolete composition  chief to control force the police force of the city of st augustine shall consist of a chief of police and as many subordinate officers policemen and employees employed on a full time basis as the city commission shall by ordinance determine is reasonably required to enforce the law the chief of police shall have exclusive control of the stationing and transfer of all patrolmen and other officers and employees constituting the police force subject to the approval of the city manager and under such rules and regulations as the city commission may prescribe or as may be prescribed by the ordinances of the city laws of fla 1925 ch 111  54   8888 additional policemen during emergencies in case of riot or other grave emergency and during elections or similar occasions the city manager may appoint additional patrolmen and officers for temporary service no person shall act as a special policeman special detective or other special police officer for any purpose whatsoever except on written authority of the city manager such authority shall be exercised only under the direction and control of the chief of police for a specified time laws of fla 1925 ch 111  55 powers and duties generally of chief the chief of police shall attend all meetings of the city commission and aid in the enforcement of order under the direction of the presiding officer he shall execute the commands of the city commission and all processes issued by authority thereof which shall be issued to him by the mayor he shall perform such other duties appropriate to his office as may be imposed upon him by law the ordinances of the city and by direction of the city manager consistent with this act he shall have the right to suspend any officer or employee of the police force because of incompetency neglect of duty immorality drunkenness failure to obey orders given by proper authority or for any other just and reasonable cause and he shall immediately report the fact of such suspension to the city manager for final action laws of fla 1925 ch 111  56 editors note language in the third sentence dealing with the chief of polices duties relative to the municipal court have been deleted as a  1 92473 abolished the municipal court effective oct 1 1973 abandoned or unclaimed propertysale the police department of the city of st augustine florida is hereby authorized to sell at public auction all lost abandoned or unclaimed property now in its possession or which shall in the future come into its possession such sales to be held at such time and at such place as shall be determined from time to time laws of fla 1951 ch 278  1 sameto be retained for six months no property as set forth in the preceding section shall be sold until after the expiration of six months from the time that such lost abandoned or unclaimed property shall come into the possession of the police department of the city of st augustine florida laws of fla 1951 ch 278  2 samenotice of sale public notice of the time and place of such sale with a description of the property shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation published in the city of st augustine florida ten 10 days prior to the date of such sale one insertion of such notice of sale being sufficient laws of fla 1951 ch 278  3 samedisposition of funds from sale all funds derived from the sale of such lost abandoned or unclaimed property shall be paid to the st augustine police benevolent association inc a corporation not for profit and be disbursed for the uses and purposes provided by such corporation laws of fla 1951 ch 278  4 secs 911 912  reserved article x  police officers retirement system system and fund created 1 there is hereby created and established a a retirement system for police officers of the city of st augustine florida to be known as the st augustine police officers retirement system by and in which name it shall pursuant to this act transact all of its business and shall have the powers and privileges of a corporation the same to be a department or instrumentality of such city b a special fund to be known as the st augustine police officers retirement fund said fund to be used for the exclusive benefit of plan members and beneficiaries any diversion of fund assets prior to the satisfaction of all liabilities related to the system shall be prohibited the fund shall be collected administered and disbursed according to the provisions of this act actuarial deficits if any arising in the fund created under this act shall be the obligation of the city of st augustine except as provided herein 2 the fund and the system hereby created shall be in substitution for the st augustine police officers retirement fund and the retirement system thereunder now and heretofore existing in the city of st augustine in pursuance of the provisions of fs ch 185  and said police officers retirement fund and the system thereunder now and heretofore existing in said city under the provisions of said shall on the effective date of this act stand abolished  102599 definitions 1 accrued benefit shall mean the total monthly benefit which shall have been earned by each member for all years of creditable service of said member as follows a a member who terminates city employment with ten 10 or more years of creditable service shall earn a benefit at the rate of two percent 20% of the members average final salary for each year of creditable service b a member who terminates city employment on or after  with ten 10 or more years of creditable service may elect a benefit at the rate of two and onehalf percent 25% of the members average final salary for each year of creditable service subject to the early retirement provisions of 5 c a member who terminates city employment after  with ten 10 or more years of creditable service shall earn a benefit at the rate of three percent 3% of the members average final salary for each year of creditable service earned after  the three percent 3% multiplier may apply to creditable service earned prior to  subject to the provisions of 7 2 accumulated contributions shall mean the sum of all amounts deducted from the salary of a member and contributed to the fund 3 actuarial equivalent shall mean a benefit of equivalent value to that which would otherwise have been provided to the member computed as follows a for benefits payable in the form of a life annuity a benefit equal to one hundred two 102 percent of that otherwise payable as tenyear certainandlife annuity if the member is age fiftyfive 55 or younger if the member is older than fiftyfive 55 05 percent will be added to the one hundred two 102 percent for each year older not to exceed one hundred eight 108 percent  b for benefits payable in the form of a fifty 50 percent jointandsurvivor annuity a benefit equal to ninetyfour 94 percent of that otherwise payable as a tenyear certainandlife annuity if the beneficiary is the same age as the member if the beneficiary is younger than the member 05 percent will be subtracted from the ninetyfour 94 percent for each year younger if the beneficiary is older than the member 05 percent will be added to the ninetyfour 94 percent for each year older not to exceed one hundred 100 percent  c for benefits payable in the form of a fifty 50 percent jointandlastsurvivor annuity a benefit equal to ninetyseven 97 percent of that otherwise payable as a tenyear certainandlife annuity if the beneficiary is the same age as the member if the beneficiary is younger than the member 05 percent will be subtracted from the ninetyseven 97 percent for each year younger if the beneficiary is older than the member 05 percent will be added to the ninetyseven 97 percent for each year older not to exceed one hundred 100 percent  d for benefits payable in the form of a sixtysix and twothirds 66 23  percent jointandlastsurvivor annuity a benefit equal to ninetythree 93 percent of that otherwise payable as a tenyear certainandlife annuity if the beneficiary is the same age as the member if the beneficiary is younger than the member 05 percent will be subtracted from the ninetythree 93 percent for each year younger if the beneficiary is older than the member 05 percent will be added to the ninetythree 93 percent for each year older not to exceed one hundred 100 percent  e for benefits payable in the form of a one hundred 100 percent jointandlastsurvivor annuity a benefit equal to eightyseven 87 percent of that otherwise payable as a tenyear certainandlife annuity if the beneficiary is the same age as the member if the beneficiary is younger than the member 05 percent will be subtracted from the eightyseven 87 percent for each year younger if the beneficiary is older than the member 05 percent will be added to the eightyseven 87 percent for each year older not to exceed one hundred 100 percent f for benefits payable in any other form actuarial equivalence means the same actuarial present value as the normal form of payment on any single measurement date the determination of the actuarial present value of any form of benefit including lump sum distributions shall be based on the rp2000 static mortality table h unisex 5050 for healthy lives projected to 2010 for healthy members and the rp2000 static mortality table d unisex 5050 projected to 2010 for disabled members  and an interest discount rate of 8% per annum compounded annually this definition may be amended by the city pursuant to the recommendation of the board with the advice of the plans actuary and the citys actuary such that the actuarial assumptions are not subject solely to city discretion 4 average final compensation means onetwelfth of the average annual compensation of the five 5 best years of the last ten 10 years of creditable service prior to retirement termination or death 5 beneficiary shall mean any person so designated by a member as provided in section 11 1011 in the event no designation is made the beneficiary of said member shall be his estate 6 board shall mean the board of trustees as provided in this act 7 city shall mean the city of st augustine florida 8  creditable service for the purpose of this act shall mean the total number of years and fractional parts of years of service of any police officer as follows a periods of service as a police officer with the city prior to  during which the police officer shall have contributed to this system or any predecessor retirement systems other than the federal social security system for police officers of the city of st augustine in determining the aggregate number of years of creditable service of any police officer periods of absence for service in the armed forces after initial employment as a police officer or any leaves of absence authorized by the city shall be added to the years of service as a police officer with the city provided that credit for such military leave or authorized leave of absence shall not exceed five 5 years creditable service shall be granted to any member who is legally entitled to reemployment under the provisions of the uniformed services employment and reemployment rights act without such member making the contributions required under 2 otherwise the aggregate number of years of creditable service shall mean the total number of years and fractional parts of years of service of any police officer omitting intervening years and fractional parts of years when such police officer is not employed by the city b for members who retire or terminate city employment on or after  creditable service shall also include up to three 3 years of active duty in the us armed forces or fulltime employment as a law enforcement officer with another governmental entity prior to employment by the city purchased by the member in accordance with this paragraph  provided the member has not received and will not receive a benefit from another retirement plan based on such prior employment as a police officer such purchased service may not be used for vesting purposes an eligible member may purchase creditable service under the system for such prior employment by paying into the fund the full actuarial cost of such creditable service as determined by the plan actuary such payment must be made in full prior to entering the drop or separation from city employment whichever occurs earlier in the event full payment is not made prior to such date the member shall receive only the amount of creditable service as determined by the actuary for which the payment made excluding interest is the full actuarial cost a member purchasing such additional creditable service must also pay the full cost of any actuarial calculations required payment for the purchase of creditable service pursuant to this paragraph may be made using any one or a combination of the following options 1 cash lump sum payment 2 installment payments plus simple interest at the rate of four 4 percent per annum deducted from the members city salary over a period not to exceed five 5 years 3 direct transfer or rollover of an eligible rollover distribution from a qualified or eligible plan in accordance with c for members who retire or terminate city employment on or after  creditable service shall also include the years or fractional years that a member performs qualified military service including voluntary or involuntary service in the armed forces of the united states as defined in the uniformed services employment and reemployment rights act userra pl 103353 as amended or has served in the national guard or reserve military service of the armed forces of the united states prior to or while in the employ of the city purchased by the member in accordance with this paragraph  provided the member has not received and will not receive a benefit from another retirement plan based on such prior service such purchased service may not be used for vesting purposes the member must contribute the full actuarial cost of all such creditable service creditable service for national guard or military reserve service shall be calculated by dividing the total number of official military reserve points by 365 to determine the equivalent years of fractional parts thereof to be credited the combined total of all creditable service purchased pursuant to this paragraph and paragraph b of this subsection shall not exceed three 3 years payment for the purchase of national guard or reserve military service shall be made in the same manner as provided in paragraph b of this subsection d this section is intended to satisfy the minimum requirements of userra as may be amended from time to time to the extent that this section does not meet the minimum requirements of userra the provisions of userra shall govern 9 contributions shall mean the amounts deducted from the salary as a member as provided in section 7 1007 10 disability retirement shall mean retirement upon the disability retirement rate as provided in section 10 1010 11 fund shall mean the st augustine police officers retirement fund as provided in this act 12 member shall mean any police officer entitled to participate in the system and fund as provided in this act 13 past service liability shall mean the liability attributable to all accrued benefits which shall have been earned by members prior to  14 police officer means any person who is elected appointed or employed full time by any municipality who is certified or required to be certified as a law enforcement officer in compliance with fs  94314 who is vested with authority to bear arms and make arrests and whose primary responsibility is the prevention and detection of crime or the enforcement of the penal criminal traffic or highway laws of the state this definition includes all certified supervisory and command personnel whose duties include in whole or in part the supervision training guidance and management responsibilities of fulltime law enforcement officers parttime law enforcement officers or auxiliary law enforcement officers but does not include parttime law enforcement officers or auxiliary law enforcement officers as the same are defined in fs  943105 and 7 respectively police officer also shall include a public safety officer who is responsible for performing both police and fire services 15 salary shall mean the total cash or remuneration paid to a police officer for services rendered during a particular year it shall include base salary overtime special incentive pay and sick leave or vacation leave taken during the year salary shall not include lumpsum checks for leave pay accrued but never taken only fiftytwo 52 weeks of salary may be credited in any year for years beginning on and after  salary in excess of $150000 shall be disregarded for all purposes of the system as of october 1 of each calendar year thereafter the dollar limitation as determined by the commissioner of internal revenue for that calendar year will become effective for that plan year in lieu of the dollar limitation provided in the preceding sentence for an employee who became a member prior to  this limitation shall not apply to the extent that salary allowed to be taken into account under the plan would be reduced below the amount allowed to be taken into account under the plan in effect on  salary in excess of the limitations set forth in a17 of the of the first day of the plan year shall be disregarded for any purpose including employee contributions or any benefit calculations the annual compensation of each member taken into account in determining benefits or employee contributions for any plan year beginning on or after  may not exceed $200000 as adjusted for costofliving increases in accordance with a17b of the 16 service retirement shall mean retirement upon the normal service consist of moneys and assets derived from the following sources 1 from moneys and other assets of the police officers retirement fund held by the board of trustees of said fund on the effective date of hereof in pursuance of fs ch 185 the board of trustees of said fund shall take such action as may be required on the effective date of this act to transfer to the trustees of the fund under the system hereby created such moneys and assets 2 from the net proceeds of the point eightyfive 85 percent excise or license tax which may be imposed by ordinance of the city upon those casualty insurance companies to the extent and as described and permitted in fs  18508 3 effective  from a contribution of five and onehalf 55 percent of the salary of each member which shall be deducted by the city from each salary payment to the member and paid over to the board effective  the contributions made by each member to the fund shall be designated as city contributions in accordance with h of the internal revenue shall be excluded from the members gross income for federal income tax purposes for all other purposes of the system such contributions shall be considered member contributions in addition the city shall make a contribution of one percent of salary of each member which shall be paid over to the board 4 from the funds of the st augustine police benevolent association at such time as hereof shall become operative and from time to time thereafter there shall be transferred from the funds of the st augustine police benevolent association such amounts as shall be agreed upon by the officers of said association and the board 5 from all gifts bequests and devises when donated for the fund 6 from accretions to the fund by way of interest on bank deposits or otherwise 7 from all other sources of income now or hereafter authorized by law for the augmentation of such fund 8 the city shall contribute to the plan annually an amount which together with the contributions from police officers the amount derived from the premium tax provided in fs  18508 and other income sources will be sufficient to meet the normal cost of the plan and to fund the actuarial deficiency over a period of not longer than forty 40 years the city contributions shall be deposited on at least a quarterly basis if the required city contributions for any plan year should exceed five 5 percent of the combined salaries of contributing plan members the cost of living adjustment provided in 10 shall not be accrued until the required city contribution for a subsequent plan year equals five 5 percent or less 9 the cost shall be determined by an actuarial valuation of the retirement plan which must be made at least every three 3 years commencing from the last actuarial report of the plan pursuant to fs  185351h such valuation shall be prepared by an enrolled actuary  102599   12306 board of trustees 1 in the municipality of st augustine florida there is hereby created a board of trustees of the st augustine police officers retirement trust fund which shall be solely responsible for administering the trust fund effective as of the effective date of this act and thereafter the board of trustees shall consist of five 5 members two 2 of whom unless otherwise prohibited by law shall be legal residents of st augustine florida who shall be appointed by the st augustine city commission and two 2 of whom shall be police officers as defined in fs  185021 who shall be elected by a majority of the police officers who are members of such plan the fifth member shall be chosen by a majority of the previous four 4 members and such persons name shall be submitted to the st augustine city commission upon receipt of the fifth persons name said city commission shall as a ministerial duty appoint such person to the board of trustees as its member the fifth member shall have the same rights as each of the other four 4 members appointed or elected as herein provided and may succeed himself in office each resident member shall serve as trustee for a period of two 2 years unless sooner replaced by the city commission at whose pleasure he shall serve and may succeed himself as a trustee however the terms of the mayor or corresponding chief executive officer of the municipality and the chief of the police department as members of the board of trustees as provided in laws of fla 1953 ch 282 as amended together with any city manager and member of the city commission of st augustine florida as members of the board of trustees shall terminate on the effective date of this act each police officer member shall serve as trustee for a period of two 2 years unless he sooner leaves the employment of the municipality as a police officer whereupon the city commission of st augustine florida shall choose his successor in the same manner as an original appointment each police officer may succeed himself in office the board of trustees shall meet at least quarterly each year each board of trustees shall be a legal entity with in addition to other powers and responsibilities contained herein the power to bring and defend lawsuits of every kind nature and description 2 the trustees shall by majority vote elect from its members a chairman and a secretary the board of trustees may by majority vote also elect from its members a vice chairman the secretary of the board shall keep a complete minute book of the actions proceedings or hearings of the board the trustees shall not receive any compensation as such but may receive expenses and per diem as provided by law the elected trustees shall be elected by the members of the system at an election held in the following manner a by per capita vote of all the members at a meeting of which all members shall be notified in person or by mail five 5 days in advance elected trustees shall begin their term of office on the first monday after election to said office an election shall be compulsory every year b the first election of the elected trustees shall be held within thirty 30 days after the effective date of this act the members of the board of trustees other than the elected trustees shall appoint the judges and clerks for the election of the elected trustees and shall establish such rules and procedures as may be necessary to conduct the election in an orderly and equitable manner the time for said election shall be set by the two 2 trustees first appointed to the board and thereafter said election shall be held on that date each year or such date as may be designated by the board the votes shall be counted immediately following the election and the member receiving the greatest number of votes shall be declared elected 3 if a vacancy occurs in an elective office of trustee the vacancy shall be filled within thirty 30 days after the date of the vacancy for the unexpired term in the same manner as the office was previously filled 4 each trustee shall within ten 10 days after his appointment or election take an oath of office before the city chief accountant or a notary public that so far as it devolves upon him he will diligently and honestly administer the affairs of the said board and that he will not knowingly violate or willingly permit to be violated any of the provisions of the law applicable to this system such oath shall be subscribed to by the trustee making it and certified by the said city chief accountant or notary public and retained as a permanent record in the files of the board 5 in addition to its quarterly meetings the board shall hold special meetings at any time requested by the chairman or any three 3 trustees the chairman shall designate the time and place of each meeting by written notice to the trustees and members such notice to be delivered or placed in the mail to said trustees and members at least twentyfour 24 hours prior to the convening of said meeting all meetings of the board shall be open to the members of the system and to the public 6 three 3 trustees shall constitute a quorum at any meeting of the board each trustee shall be entitled to one vote in the meetings of the board at least three 3 concurring votes shall be necessary for a decision by the board the board shall have the right to dismiss any elected trustee if after hearing before the members of the system it is found that the said trustee has failed to comply with any of the stipulations of hereof involving moral turpitude as defined by florida law 7 the board of trustees subject to the limitations of this act and within the standards and purposes of this act shall make such rules and regulations as are necessary for the effective administration of the system and fund created by this act and for transaction of its business the board shall keep records of all its proceedings and such records on each member as it may deem necessary and proper in its administration of this act said board shall make investigations concerning the enforcement and effect of this act and its adopted rules and regulations it shall make an annual report to the members of the system which shall include a financial report of the receipts disbursements assets and liabilities of the fund 8 the board shall engage such actuarial legal or other services as shall be required to transact the business of the fund the compensation of all persons engaged by the board and all expenses necessary for the operation of the system shall be paid by said system at such rates and in such amounts as the board shall agree 9 the secretary of the board shall execute bonds in such amounts as may from time to time be fixed by the board for the faithful performance of his duties the board shall establish a system of accounting and do all things take all actions and make all rules and regulations not inconsistent with the provisions of this act that it deems necessary and proper to safeguard the funds placed in its custody and to carry out the provisions of this act 10 the secretary of the board shall be the custodian of all records maintained by the board the secretary shall permit inspection of all records held in his custody by any trustee or member of the system the secretary shall keep a record of all persons receiving retirement payments under this system in which it shall be noted the time when the pension begins and when the pension shall cease to be paid in this record the secretary shall keep a list of all police officers employed by the city including the name address and dates of employment of each police officer 11 in the absence of the chairman of the board at any meeting of the trustees the vice chairman shall serve as chairman and in the absence of both the chairman and the vice chairman at any meeting of the trustees the secretary shall serve as chairman 12 at least once every three 3 years the board of trustees shall retain an independent consultant professional qualified to evaluate the performance of professional money managers the independent consultant shall make recommendations to the board of trustees regarding the selection of money managers for the next investment term these recommendations shall be considered by the board of trustees at its next regularly scheduled meeting the date time place and subject of this meeting shall be advertised in a newspaper of general circulation in the municipality at least ten 10 days prior to the date of the hearing 13 in connection with the administration of the fund the board of trustees is authorized and empowered to institute proceedings in court and be sued in the name of the system  102599   62600 city attorney to represent board of trustees the city attorney shall give advice to said board of trustees in all matters pertaining to their duties in the administration of said municipal police officers retirement trust fund whenever requested  and he shall represent and defend said board as its attorney in all suits and actions at law or in equity that may be brought against it and bring all suits and actions in its behalf that may be required or determined upon by said board  provided however that if the board of trustees so elects it may employ independent legal counsel at the pension funds expense for the purposes contained herein together with such other professional technical or other advisers as the board deems necessary  102599 management of the funds 1 the board is solely responsible for administering the trust and shall be responsible for investing the assets of the system in accordance with this section the board shall exercise its duties with respect to the system for the exclusive purpose of providing benefits to members and their beneficiaries and defraying the reasonable expenses of administering the system the board shall exercise its investment authority with the care skill prudence and diligence under the circumstances then prevailing that a prudent person in a like capacity and familiar with such matters would use in the conduct of an enterprise with like character and like aims and by diversifying the investments of the system so as to reduce the risk of large losses unless under the circumstances it is clearly prudent not to do so the board shall have full power to hold purchase sell assign transfer and dispose of any of the securities and investments in which any of the assets of the system have been invested as well as the proceeds of such investments and any moneys belonging to the fund in accordance with this section the board may employ outside investment counsel to advise the board in the making and disposition of investments 2 the board shall adopt and periodically update a written investment policy in accordance with florida statutes incorporating the following requirements for specific investments a the board may invest in money market instruments stocks corporate bonds bonds or other obligations of the united states of america either directly or or commingled funds b the board may make direct investment in bonds notes or obligations of any municipality or political subdivision or any agency or authority of the state of florida if the obligations are rated investment grade by at least one nationally recognized rating organization c the board may invest up to fifteen 15 percent of its assets in real estate only in commingled funds or insurance company group annuity separate accounts holding diversified real properties insurance companies must be licensed to do business in the state of florida and commingled funds and insurance companies must be rated investment grade by at least one nationally recognized rating organization any commingled or pooled vehicles used by the board should have investment guidelines that are materially consistent with the guidelines herein d the board may invest up to fifteen 15 percent of its assets in mortgage loan securities secured by real property only in commingled funds or insurance company separate accounts holding diversified mortgage securities insurance companies must be licensed to do business in the state of florida and commingled funds and insurance companies must be rated investment grade by at least one nationally recognized rating organization any commingled or pooled vehicles used by the board should have investment guidelines that are materially consistent with the guidelines herein mortgage securities of commingled funds must be issued by an agency of or enterprise sponsored by the united states government including but not limited to the government national mortgage association the federal national mortgage association and the federal home loan mortgage corporation e the board may invest up to five 5 percent of its assets in stock and corporate bonds of any one 1 issuing company either directly or or commingled funds f the aggregate investment in stock either directly or or commingled funds shall not exceed seventy 70 percent at cost of the assets of the fund g the average credit quality of the fixed income portfolio shall be rated a or higher no more than 15% of the fixed income portfolio may be rated lower than bbb the duration of the fixed income portfolio shall remain within 35% of the duration of a market index selected by the board if there is no index selected the default index shall be the lehman aggregate bond index h the board may invest up to twentyfive percent 25% of the assets of the fund in corporate obligations andor securities of a foreign corporation or a foreign commercial entity that are not subject to united states securities laws united states dollardenominated securities listed and traded on a united states exchange would not be included in this limitation 3 the board shall deposit the funds and securities of the city police officers retirement trust fund in a qualified public depository as defined in section 2800226 florida statutes which depository with regard to such funds and securities shall conform to and be bound by all of the provisions of florida statutes 4 the board may issue drafts upon the city police officers retirement trust fund pursuant to hereof and rules and regulations prescribed by the board all such drafts shall be consecutively numbered be signed by the chairman and secretary and state upon their faces the purposes for which the drafts are drawn the city director of financial services shall retain such drafts when paid as permanent vouchers for disbursements made and no other money shall otherwise be drawn from the fund 5 no trustee shall have any interest direct or indirect in the gains or profits of any investment made by the board save insofar as such trustee may be a member or beneficiary of the system no trustee shall in any manner directly or indirectly for himself or as an agent use the funds or deposits of the system except to make such payments therefrom as are authorized by the board nor shall any member of the board become an endorser or surety or in any manner an obligor for moneys loaned by or borrowed from the fund 6 the board shall have the right to purchase an individual annuity from an insurance company when a member becomes eligible for service retirement in an amount sufficient to pay the retired member his earned monthly pension of retirement 7 notwithstanding any provision of this section to the contrary the board shall identify and publicly report any direct or indirect holdings it may have in any scrutinized company as defined in section  florida statutes and proceed to sell redeem divest or withdraw all publicly traded securities it may have in that company beginning  the divestiture of any such security must be completed by  the board and its named officers or investment advisors may not be deemed to have breached their fiduciary duty in any action taken to dispose of any such security and the board shall have satisfactorily discharged the fiduciary duties of loyalty prudence and sole and exclusive benefit to the members of the pension fund and their beneficiaries if the actions it takes are consistent with the duties imposed by section  florida statutes and the manner of the disposition if any is reasonable as to the means chosen for the purposes of effecting compliance with that section the pension fund shall designate terrorfree plans that allocate their funds among securities not subject to divestiture no person may bring any civil criminal or administrative action against the board of trustees or any employee officer director or advisor of such pension fund based upon the divestiture of any security pursuant to this paragraph  102599   22800   62600   11209   101110 participation in the system 1 all fulltime police officers employed by the city of st augustine shall be members of this system 2 the membership of any police officer in this system shall cease upon the payment from the fund of his accumulated contributions 3 the contributions required of a member under this act shall cease upon service retirement disability retirement death or other termination of employment except as hereinafter provided 4 should a member be involuntarily laid off suspended or discharged or voluntarily terminate his employment as a police officer with the city and withdraw his accumulated contributions from the fund he shall for the purposes of this act be deemed to be a new employee as of his date of reinstatement or reemployment and his creditable service shall commence as of such date provided that in the event that such members accumulated contributions are left in the fund and he is reinstated or reemployed within five years of the termination of his last period of employment the police officer may have his creditable service credit restored for membership under the system during his last period of employment  provided however that if said member shall not reenter employment by the end of five years following his involuntary layoff suspension discharge or termination his accumulated contribution shall be paid to him and he shall thereafter receive no creditable service credit for such prior employment 5 reserved 6 members entitled to a service retirement pension under this system shall not forfeit the same upon dismissal as a police officer but shall be retired as hereinafter provided  102599   62600 contributions to the fund 1 effective  each member shall contribute to the fund for each pay period at the rate of five and onehalf 55 percent of salary the city shall deduct such contribution from the salary of each member for every payroll period and shall immediate pay said contribution to the board effective  each member may be required to contribute to the fund an amount up to an additional three percent 3% of salary above the five and onehalf 55 percent of salary amount specified in subsection 1 for the period necessary to meet plan contribution requirements however before there is any increase in the member contribution rate the prefunded future cost of living adjustment provided in 10 shall be reduced in whole or part for members who have not retired prior to the time additional contributions are otherwise required for as long as necessary to meet the funding requirements of the plan in the event the additional member contributions specified in this subsection 2 are not sufficient to meet the minimum contribution requirements for the plan then future cost of living adjustments will be reduced in whole or part for those members who retire on or after  and are retired at the time additional contributions are otherwise required for as long as necessary to meet the funding requirements of the plan once the suspension of cost of living adjustments is no longer necessary to meet minimum plan funding requirements such adjustments will be restored in reverse order of their suspension no member shall have any entitlement to cost of living adjustments that are suspended pursuant to this agreement in the event that shortfalls in funding still exist after the above contribution increases and benefit adjustments are implemented additional future benefits will be reduced to meet plan funding requirements  102599   22800   62600   12306 service retirement 1 each member may become eligible for service retirement on his normal service retirement date which shall be the first day of the calendar month next following the date on which said member shall have either completed ten 10 years of creditable service and attained at least his fiftyfifth birthday or completed twentyfive 25 years of creditable service and attained at least his fiftysecond birthday  provided however should such member continue employment beyond his normal service requirement date such member may retire on the first day of any calendar month thereafter which date shall be the delayed service retirement date for members who retire or terminate city employment on or after  the normal service retirement date shall be upon attaining twentyfive 25 years of creditable service regardless of age effective  a member who terminates city employment with more than ten 10 but less than twentyfive 25 years of creditable service shall be eligible for a normal service retirement benefit upon reaching age 55 2 each member who shall become eligible for service retirement as hereinabove provided shall receive a monthly pension which shall commence on his normal service retirement date or delayed service retirement date and except as provided in section 9 1009 shall continue to be paid each month thereafter to the member or his beneficiary for ten 10 years and to the member for his remaining lifetime thereafter the amount of such monthly pension shall be the accrued benefit as of his date of retirement 3 from a contribution of four 4 percent of the salary of each member which shall be deducted by the city from each salary payment to the member and paid over to the board effective  the contributions made by each member to the fund including installment payments deducted from a members salary to purchase additional creditable service pursuant to b and c shall be designated as city contributions in accordance with h of the internal revenue shall be excluded from the members gross income for federal income tax purposes for all other purposes of the system such contributions shall be considered member contributions in addition the city shall make a contribution of one 1 percent of the salary of each member which shall be paid over to the board effective  the city shall make a total contribution of two and onehalf 25 percent of the salary of each member which shall be paid over to the board 4 if a member recovers from disability and reenters the service of the city as a police officer his service will be deemed to have been continuous but the period beginning with the first month for which he received a disability retirement income payment and ending with the date he reentered the service of the city will not be considered as credited service for the purposes of the plan 5 for members who retire from active employment and begin receiving benefits prior to  a temporary supplemental retirement allowance shall be paid the retirant if his date of retirement precedes his sixtyfifth birth date the amount of temporary supplemental retirement allowance shall be equal to the retirants credited service multiplied by onehalf of one 050 percent of his average final compensation the temporary supplemental retirement allowance terminates upon the retirants attainment of age sixtyfive 65 years or his prior death 6 a member who terminates employment on or after  may elect one of the following early retirement options based on age and years of creditable service at retirement a a member with at least 10 years of creditable service who has reached age 50 may retire with an early retirement benefit equal to 20% of average final compensation multiplied by years of creditable service with a reduction of three percent 3% for each year by which the members age at early retirement precedes the normal service retirement date 7 a member with ten 10 or more years of creditable service who terminates employment on or after  shall earn a retirement benefit equal to three percent 3% of average final salary for each year of creditable service worked after  notwithstanding any provision of this section to the contrary the three percent 3% multiplier shall also apply to creditable service earned by such members prior to  as follows a for members with less than twenty 20 years of creditable service on  the three percent 3% multiplier shall apply to two 2 years of creditable service earned prior to  for each one 1 year of creditable service worked after  up to the members total number of years of creditable service or the maximum number of years of creditable service if any allowed by the plan whichever is less b for members with twenty 20 or more years of creditable service on  the three percent 3% multiplier shall apply to four 4 years of creditable service earned prior to  for each of the first two years of creditable service worked after   and the three percent 3% multiplier shall apply to two 2 years of creditable service earned prior to  for each year worked thereafter up to the members total number of years of creditable service or the maximum number of years of creditable service if any allowed by the plan whichever is less 8 distribution of a members benefit under this plan must commence no later than april 1 of the calendar year following the later of the calendar year during which the member attains age seventy and onehalf 7012 or the calendar year in which the member terminates employment with the employer  102599   22800   102504   12306   101110 optional modes of pension 1 each member shall have the right at any time at least two 2 years prior to actual retirement to elect to have his pension payable under any one of the options set forth in this section in lieu of the pension otherwise payable to him upon service retirement under any of the provisions of this act the amount of any such optional pension shall be the actuarial equivalent of the amount of such pension otherwise payable to him the member shall make such an election by written request to the board and this election shall be subject to the approval of the board option a straight life option a member may elect to receive an increased pension with such pension payments terminating immediately upon the death of the member option b joint and last survivor option a member may elect to receive a modified pension payable to the member during the joint lifetime of the member and a joint pensioner designated by the member and following the death of either of them one hundred 100 percent sixtysix and twothirds 66 23  percent or fifty 50 percent of such monthly amount payable to the survivor for the lifetime of the survivor option c such other amount and form of retirement payments of benefit as in the opinion of the board of trustees will best meet the circumstances of the retiring member 2 the election by a member of any one of the options stated in this section 9 1009 shall be null and void if the member dies prior to retirement  provided however that option a and option b above shall not be voided in event a member continues in employment subsequent to becoming eligible for service retirement and dies prior to actual retirement the election by a member of option b above shall be null and void if the person designated to receive last survivor benefits by the member dies before the members actual retirement 3 a member who has elected any one of the options stated in this section 9 1009 may at any time within the period provided for such election revoke any election by written notification to the board 4 this subsection 4 applies to distributions made on or after  notwithstanding any provision to the contrary that would otherwise limit a distributees election under this subsection a distributee may elect at the time and in the manner prescribed by the board to have any portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee in a direct rollover a for a member eligible for service retirement who elects to receive a singlesum payment or equal installments over a period of less than ten 10 years an eligible rollover distribution is that portion of the single sum or installment that represents city contributions under h of the internal revenue to the extent that it exceeds the required minimum distribution if applicable under a9 of the internal revenue b for a member or surviving spouse who receives a refund of accumulated contributions under section 10114 hereof an eligible rollover contribution is that portion of the accumulated contributions that represents the city contributions under h of the internal revenue c an eligible retirement plan is an individual retirement account described in a of the an individual retirement annuity described in b of the an annuity plan described in a of the or a qualified trust described in a of the that accepts the distributees eligible rollover distribution however in the case of an eligible rollover distribution to the surviving spouse an eligible retirement plan is an individual retirement account or individual retirement annuity d a distributee includes a member or former member or a members or former members surviving spouse e a direct rollover is a payment by the system to the eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee 5 if a member elects an option with a joint pensioner and the members retirement benefits have commenced the member may thereafter change the designated joint pensioner up to two times the consent of a members joint pensioner or of the board of trustees to any such change shall not be required the amount of the retirement income payable to the member upon designation of a new joint pensioner shall be actuarially redetermined by the application of actuarial tables and calculations to ensure that the benefit paid is the actuarial equivalent of the present value of the members current benefit and that there is no impact to the plan each such designation will be made in writing on a form prepared by the board of trustees and on completion will be filed with the board of trustees in the event that no joint pensioner survives the member such benefits as are payable in the event of the death of the member subsequent to his or her retirement shall be paid to the members estate  102599   101110 disability retirement 1 a police officer will be considered totally disabled if in the opinion of the board of trustees he is wholly prevented from rendering useful and efficient service as a police officer a member may become eligible for disability retirement on his disability retirement date provided such eligibility is approved by resolution of the board such member may retire from the service of the city under the plan if he becomes totally and permanently disabled as defined in subsection 2 by reason of any cause other than a cause set out in subsection 3 on or after the effective date of the plan such retirement shall herein be referred to as disability retirement 2 the benefit payable to a police officer who retires from the service of the city with a total and permanent disability as a result of a disability commencing prior to his normal retirement date is the monthly income payable for ten 10 years certain and life for which if the police officers disability occurred in the line of duty his monthly benefit shall be the accrued retirement benefit but shall not be less than fortytwo 42 percent of his average monthly compensation as of his disability retirement date if the disability is other than in the line of duty the police officers monthly benefit shall be the accrued normal retirement benefit but shall not be less than twentyfive 25 percent of his average monthly compensation as of his disability retirement date 3 the monthly retirement income to which a police officer is entitled in the event of his disability retirement shall be payable on the first day of the first month after the board of trustees determines such entitlement however the monthly retirement income shall be payable as of the date the board determines such entitlement the disability retirement date and any portion due for a partial month shall be paid together with the first payment 4 upon termination of a members monthly disability pension because of recovery from such disability and provided he reenters active employment as a police officer one year after such recovery he shall continue to be a member of the system and shall thereafter make his required contributions to the fund in such event the members creditable service credit for service as a police officer prior to his disability retirement shall be restored but he shall not receive creditable service credit for the period of his disability nor for any periods for which he did not make regular contributions should the member fail to reenter active employment as a police officer within one year after recovery from disability his membership under this system shall terminate 5 once each year following the disability retirement of a member who is receiving a monthly disability pension the board may require such member to undergo a medical examination conducted by a duly qualified physician appointed by the board following such medical examination the board may determine whether the member is capable of performing useful and efficient service as a police officer and if he is the board shall order his disability pension discontinued should the member refuse to submit to any medical examination required by the board his monthly disability pension shall be discontinued until his withdrawal of such refusal and should such refusal continue for one year all his rights to any further disability pension shall cease and his membership under the system shall thereupon terminate 6 no member shall be eligible for disability retirement whose disability was incurred while committing a felony 7 disability in the line of duty any condition or impairment of health of any and all police officers employed in the city caused by hypertension heart disease hardening of the arteries or any condition set forth in section  florida statutes resulting in total or partial disability or death shall be presumed to be accidental and suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary be shown by competent evidence any condition or impairment of health caused directly or proximately by exposure which exposure occurred in the active performance of duty at some definite time or place without willful negligence on the part of the police officer resulting in total or partial disability shall be presumed to be accidental and suffered in the line of duty  provided however that such police officer shall have successfully passed a physical examination upon entering such service which physical examination including electrocardiogram failed to reveal any evidence of such condition  provided further that such presumption shall not apply to benefits payable under or granted in a policy of life insurance or disability insurance this section shall be applicable to all police officers employed in the city only with reference to pension and retirement benefits under this system  102599   62600 benefits upon death or termination 1 each member shall name a beneficiary to receive any benefits payable upon the members death such designation to be made on a form provided by the board a member may change his designation of the beneficiary from time to time in the same manner 2 in event a member who has elected option b under section 9 1009 dies subsequent to his normal service retirement date but while still employed as a police officer in lieu of any other benefit payable hereunder by reason of death there shall be payable to his beneficiary the same monthly pension that would otherwise have been payable under option b if the member had retired on his normal service retirement date 3 should a members death occur prior to his normal service retirement date or after his normal service retirement date and before reaching his delayed service retirement death unless such death occurs following disability retirement as provided in section 10 1010 there shall be paid to his beneficiary a monthly pension which shall commence on the first day of the calendar month next following the death of the member and shall continue to be paid each month thereafter for a period equal to the lesser of one hundred twenty 120 months or the life expectancy of the beneficiary the amount of such monthly pension shall be the accrued benefit of the member as of the date of death in the event of the members death following disability retirement the provisions of section 10 1010 shall be operative 4 if the employment of any member who has not completed ten 10 years of creditable service is terminated other than by service retirement or death such member shall be entitled to a refund of one hundred 100 percent of his accumulated contribution made to the fund without interest any such terminated member may leave his accumulated contributions in the fund for a period not exceeding five 5 years pending reemployment and upon reemployment as a police officer within said five 5 years all creditable service credit under the system for his last period of employment shall be restored any such member who fails to be reemployed as a police officer within five 5 years shall be refunded one hundred percent of his contributions to the fund without interest and all prior creditable service credit shall be forfeited should he be reemployed at a later date upon payment of the accumulated contributions as herein provided the membership of such terminated member shall thereupon cease and no further benefits shall be payable under the system that portion of a terminated members benefit that is not vested shall be forfeited and used only to reduce future costs of the system 5 any other provision of the act notwithstanding any member who has completed ten 10 years of creditable service at such time as employment as a police officer is terminated shall be entitled to a monthly pension provided such member shall not withdraw his accumulated contributions such monthly pension shall commence on the first day of any calendar month coinciding with or following the members otherwise early or normal service retirement date and shall continue to be paid each month thereafter as though the member had retired under the provisions of section 1008 of this act benefits shall be distributed or shall commence to the member not later than april 1 of the calendar year following the later of the calendar year in which the member attains age seventy and onehalf 7012 or the calendar year in which the member terminates employment and shall be paid a over the lifetime of the member or the lifetimes of the member and beneficiary  or b over a period not exceeding the joint life expectancy of the member and beneficiary 6 notwithstanding the provisions of this section a retiree may change his or her designation of beneficiary up to two times without the approval of the board or the current beneficiary 7 if a member dies on or after  while performing qualified military service as defined by userra the members beneficiaries shall be entitled to any benefits the member would have been entitled to had he or she resumed employment and then died while employed  102599   101110 miscellaneous 1 the authority having the power to hire the services of a police officer shall prepare such records and from time to time shall furnish such information concerning a member as the board may require in the discharge of its duties upon the employment of a police officer the authority shall inform the police officer of his duties and obligations in connection with the system as a condition of employment 2 should any change or error in records result in any member or beneficiary receiving from the system more or less than he would have been entitled to receive had the records been correct than on discovery of any such error the board shall correct the same and as far as practicable shall adjust the payments in such manner that the actuarial equivalent of the benefit to which the member or beneficiary was correctly entitled shall be paid 3 all pensions and other benefits accrued or accruing to any person under the provisions of this act and the accumulated contributions and cash securities in the funds created under this act are hereby exempted from any state county or municipal tax and shall not be subject to execution attachment garnishment or any other process whatever nor shall any assignment thereof be enforceable in any court 4 all provisions of any ordinance of the city inconsistent with the provisions of hereof are hereby repealed to the extent of such inconsistencies 5 if this act shall later be amended or repealed in its application to any person benefitting hereunder the amount of benefits which at the time of any such alteration amendment or repeal shall have accrued to the member or beneficiary shall not be affected thereby 6 in the event of a complete discontinuance of contributions to the fund or upon termination of the system the interest of each member in the system to the extent then funded shall become one hundred 100 percent nonforfeitable and the assets of the system shall be apportioned and distributed in accordance with the provisions of fs  18537 as amended 7 if any clause section or provision of this act shall be declared to be unconstitutional or invalid for any cause or reason the same shall be eliminated from this act and the remaining portion of said act shall be in force and effect and shall be as valid as if such invalid portion had not been incorporated 8 vested rights which may exist on the effective date of this act in favor of any member of the existing retirement system under fs ch 185 shall not be impaired  provided that any person who may claim that the abolishment of the retirement system under said fs ch 185 violates a claimed vested right thereunder shall within one year of the effective date of this act notify the board in writing of such claim upon receipt of such claim the board shall without delay in an appropriate proceeding and forum obtain a judicial construction with respect to the question of such claim of violated vested rights should the final judgment or decree in said proceeding sustain the claim of any such person the board shall conform its administration of the fund in relation to such person to meet with the requirements of any such decree or judgment 9 any person who shall knowingly make any false statement or shall falsify or permit to be falsified any record or records of the system in any attempt to defraud the system shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree and be subject to punishment as provided by law 10 the board of trustees is hereby authorized to grant periodic costofliving adjustments to benefits payable to all retired members including members who are participating in the deferred retirement option program in accordance with section 1013 during the continuation of benefits being payable under this plan  however such adjustment shall not be made more frequently than on an annual basis the conditions for granting such adjustments are as follows a the granting of same is actuarially sound and will not substantially affect the financial stability of the plan and will not require additional funding of the plan from any city funds from any source apart from funds received as tax levy proceeds authorized by fs ch 18508 b the board shall formally approve the adjustments based on data contained in the current actuarial evaluation c the adjustment shall be divided into a prefunded component and an ad hoc component such that once approved and for the purpose of the actuarial evaluations the prefunded percentage increase will be assumed to be repeated on an annual basis for future years and the ad hoc increase will not be assumed to be repeated on an annual basis for future years future actuarial evaluations may determine that a modification to the assumed future prefunded increases will be necessary d prefunded adjustments shall be based upon the monthly benefit being paid to a retirant on the month preceding the adjustment date but excluding any temporary supplemental retirement allowances paid according to section 10085 the average costofliving index as determined by the bureau of labor statistics of the us department of labor relative to the united states as a whole shall be consideration for such adjustments however in no event shall the percentage for the prefunded component of the annual costofliving adjustment exceed two 2 percent for any annual adjustment date nor shall any retirees benefit be reduced below any benefit being received on  e the ad hoc component of the costofliving adjustment may be granted only when surplus funds are available within the plan and only if all other provisions of this section are satisfied this portion of the adjustment shall be based upon the monthly benefit being paid to a retirant on the month preceding the adjustment date but excluding any temporary supplemental and retirement allowances paid according to section 10085 the sum of the prefunded and ad hoc portions of the adjustment shall not exceed either three 3 percent or the average costofliving index as determined by the bureau of labor statistics of the us department of labor relative to the united states as a whole whichever is the lesser amount f notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of 10 paragraphs a e members who retire before  shall receive an annual cost of living adjustment of up to three 3 percent up to two 2 percent of this cost of living adjustment will be part of the fixed benefit structure of the plan the remaining amount up to one percent annually will be granted pursuant to the ad hoc adjustment provisions of this subsection members who retire on or after  will be eligible for a cost of living adjustment in accordance with the foregoing provisions of 10 paragraphs a e cost of living adjustments may be adjusted in accordance with 1 11 maximum benefit limitation a the maximum annual benefit or ii amounts received as a result of an employees death by the employees beneficiaries survivors or estate  102599   22800   3909   101110 deferred retirement option program for police officers drop 1 a deferred retirement option plan drop is hereby established for eligible police officers effective  2 eligibility and participation a a police officer who is actively employed by the city and reaches the normal service retirement date shall be eligible to participate in the drop b a members election to participate in the drop shall be irrevocable c an eligible member may participate in the drop for a maximum of sixty 60 months from the date the drop plan takes effect if the member is eligible at that time or for a maximum of sixty 60 months from the date the member reaches his or her earliest normal service retirement date whichever occurs first an eligible member may elect to participate in the drop with thirty 30 days advance written notice to the city an eligible member may defer entry into drop beyond the date the member is first eligible to enter the drop if a member defers entry into the drop the maximum drop period will be reduced for each month of deferred entry in no event will the maximum drop period be extended beyond sixty 60 months from the date the member is first eligible to participate example a member is eligible to participate in drop for a maximum sixty 60 months from the date the member is first eligible to participate  however if the member defers entry into the drop for twelve months after reaching the earliest normal service retirement age or if the member has already reached the earliest normal service retirement age at the time the drop takes effect twelve months after that date the member will be able to participate in the drop for a maximum of fortyeight 48 months notwithstanding any provision to the contrary any member who completes twentyfive 25 years of service before age fiftytwo 52 may defer entry into the drop until age 52 with no reduction in the drop period a member who elects to participate in the drop can elect to terminate drop participation and city employment sooner than the maximum drop period with thirty 30 days advance written notice to the city 3 drop plan features a an eligible member who elects to participate in the drop will be considered to have retired for purposes of the pension plan the members monthly retirement benefit determined in accordance with the plan based on years of creditable service and average final compensation at the time the member enters the drop will be paid into his or her drop account every month during the drop period no member or city contributions shall be required after a member enters the drop and the member will not accrue any additional creditable service or any additional benefits under the pension plan after entering the drop b a member who elects to participate in the drop shall not be eligible for disability or preretirement death benefits under the pension plan c as a condition of participating in the drop the member must agree to resign from city employment at the conclusion of the drop period and must submit an irrevocable letter of resignation prior to entering the drop d participation in the drop is not a guarantee of employment and drop participants will be subject to the same employment standards and policies that are applicable to employees who are not drop participants e the members drop account will earn interest at an annual rate of six and onehalf percent 65% compounded monthly f within thirty 30 days following a drop participants termination of city employment or death the members entire drop account balance shall be distributed to the member or in the event of the members death to the members designated beneficiary or estate in accordance with paragraph g below in a cash lump sum unless the member elects to have all or any portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the member in a direct rollover any such direct rollover will be accomplished in accordance with section 1009 4 of the pension plan g if a drop participant dies before his or her drop account is distributed the participants designated beneficiary shall have the same rights as the participant with respect to the distribution of the drop account if the member has not designated a beneficiary the drop account balance shall be paid to the members estate h the pension board shall adopt any necessary rules for administering the drop  102504   12306 rollovers or transfers into the fund effective  the fund will accept member rollover cash contributions andor direct cash rollovers of distributions for the purchase of creditable service pursuant to 8 as receive only by making a voluntary additional contribution in an amount determined under the system which does not exceed the amount necessary to fund the benefit attributable to such service credit employer is required to furnish the employee a written statement under d 6051a3 and 6052 and will be determined without regard to any rules under a that limit the remuneration included in wages based or other similar payments and absent a severance from employment the payments would have been paid to the employee which the employee continued in employment with the employer  or b the payment is for treated as compensation for the limitation year to which the back pay relates to the extent the back pay represents wages and compensation that would otherwise be included under this definition d
