commission created  1501 rules etc  chairman  meetings  quorum  compensation  members not to hold other city office editors note was derived from laws of fla ch 571775  2 it has been deleted as obsolete capacity and duties editors note was derived from laws of fla ch 571775  3 it has been deleted as obsolete article xx  pensions ratification required the powers and authority herein granted shall become effective only upon ratification and approval of an ordinance or ordinances adopted pursuant to the provisions of this act  by a majority of the electors voting thereon at any general or special election in the city of st augustine florida laws of fla 1947 ch 248  4 editors note while sections 20012003 are valid existing law the provisions have not been activated by ordinance fund for permanent city employees authorized  commission may receive gifts etc make rules etc the city of st augustine florida shall have the power and is hereby authorized by and city commission to establish a fund or funds for the relief or pensions of persons in the permanent employment of said city and it is further authorized and empowered to receive gifts devises bequests of money or property for the benefits of such fund or funds  to make contribution of public moneys thereto on such terms and conditions as it may see fit  and to make such rules and regulations for the management enforcement and administration of such fund or funds as may be necessary laws of fla 1947 ch 248  1 commission may contract with insurance pension etc companies  appropriations from treasury the city of st augustine shall have the power and is hereby authorized by and city commission to make contracts of insurance with any insurance company or companies authorized to transact business in the state of florida insuring its employees or any class or classes thereof under a policy or policies of group insurance covering life or health or accident insurance and may contract with any company granting annuities or pensions and authorized to transact business in the state of florida for the pensioning of such employees or any class or classes thereof  and for any and all such purposes may appropriate out of its treasury any money necessary to pay premiums or charges incident to the carrying on of such policies or contracts laws of fla 1947 ch 248  2 employees pension fund created  activated by ordinance a created  trustee there is hereby created a pension fund for all of the employees of the city of st augustine florida which shall be known as the employees pension fund of the city of st augustine florida this fund shall be set up and administered by three 3 trustees  one to be appointed by the city commission one by the employee members of the fund and the third to be selected by these two members all under the direction and supervision of the city commission of the city of st augustine florida under terms and provisions of an ordinance which the city commission is hereby authorized to pass at such time as they find that activation and operation of such fund is desirable expedient practicable and feasible b activation of provisions such ordinance activating such pension fund shall contain any and all provisions and requirements for the activation operation and maintenance of the fund and the financing thereof  and shall provide for deductions from employees salaries c authority of commission the city commission of the city of st augustine florida shall have full authority and complete discretion in setting up terms conditions and requirements of the employees pension fund of the city of st augustine florida and benefits thereof and the contributions to be required from the city and from the employees in the financing of said fund d construction this act section shall be liberally construed to give the city commission of the city of st augustine florida necessary legislative authority and power to effectuate the purposes of this act and provide a pension plan for all city employees laws of fla ch 652163  14 article xxi  st augustine st johns county airport authority editors note consisting of sections 21012112 has been deleted as not a part of the citys charter it was derived from laws of fla ch 631853 laws of fla ch 652169 laws of fla ch 67198 laws of fla ch 691535 and laws of fla ch 89496 article xxii  miscellaneous editors note was derived from laws of fla 108rrrr 1713 71017 1 added 1016 1716 81417 2exh a added 108ssss 1805 22218 1 203 1813 111318 1 204 1814 111318 1 502 2 504 1818 12819 1 2 added 108tttt general provisions how cited the ordinances embraced in the following chapters and sections shall constitute and be designated the the city of st augustine florida and may be so cited  definitions and rules of construction in the interpretation and construction of this of all ordinances of the city the following definitions and rules of construction shall be observed unless they are inconsistent with the manifest intent of the commission or the context clearly requires otherwise generally this minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety and welfare if provisions of this the following rules of interpretation apply 1 except as provided in subsection 2 the specific controls over the general 2 the most restrictive or stringent provision controls 3 the latest enactment controls city the term city means the city of st augustine st johns county florida term  means the the city of st augustine as designated in section 11 commission the term city commission or commission means the city commission of the city of st augustine florida computation of time in computing any period of time prescribed or allowed by ordinance the day of the act event or default from which the designated period of time begins to run shall not be included the last day of the period so computed shall be included unless it is a saturday sunday or legal holiday in which event the period shall run until the end of the next day which is neither a saturday sunday or legal holiday when the period of time prescribed or allowed is less than seven 7 days intermediate saturdays sundays and legal holidays shall be excluded in the computation state law reference similar provisions rcp a county the term county means st johns county florida gender words importing the masculine gender include the feminine and neuter genders health officer the terms chief sanitary officer and city health officer mean the county health officer and his delegates in the city the phrase in the city means any territory jurisdiction of which for the exercise of its regulatory power has been conferred on the city by law may the term may is to be construed as being permissive may not the phrase may not has a prohibitory effect and states a prohibition must the term must is to be construed as being mandatory number a word importing the singular number only may extend and be applied to several persons and things as well as to one 1 person and thing oath the term oath includes an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the terms swear and sworn are equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed occupant the term occupant as applied to a building or land means any person who holds a written or oral lease of or actually occupies the whole or part of the building or land either alone or with others officer agent etc whenever the term city manager or the title or designation of any other officer of the city is used it shall include his authorized representative person the term person includes individual natural persons partnerships joint adventurers societies associations clubs trustees trusts or corporations  and any officers agents employees factors or any kind of personal representatives of any thereof in any capacity acting either for himself or for any other person under either personal appointment or pursuant to law preceding following the terms preceding and following mean next before and next after respectively property the term property means real personal or mixed property public grounds the term public grounds means the parks and all public lands owned or leased by the city and those parts of public places which do not form traveled parts of streets shall the term shall is to be construed as being mandatory sidewalk the term sidewalk means any portion of a street between the curbline or the lateral lines of a roadway where there is no curb and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians signature subscription the terms signature and subscription include a mark when the person cannot write his name being written near it and being witnessed by a person who writes his own name as a witness state the term state means the state of florida street the term street includes avenues boulevards highways roads alleys lanes viaducts bridges and the approaches thereto and all other public thoroughfares in the city and means the entire width thereof between abutting property lines street includes a sidewalk or footpath unless the contrary is expressed or unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city commission tense words used in the past or present tense include the future as well as the past and present written in writing the terms written and in writing include typewriting printing on paper and any other mode of representing words and letters year the term year means a calendar year unless a fiscal year is indicated  143 catchlines of sections  effect of history notes cross references etc  references to a the catchlines of the several sections of this in boldface type are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and are not to be deemed or taken to be titles of such sections or part of the section nor unless expressly so provided shall they be so deemed when any section including the catchline is amended or reenacted b all cross references state law references and other editorial notes printed in eightpoint type are intended for the convenience of the user of this are not substantive parts of this c all references to ordinances appearing in parenthetical form following sections of this not substantive parts of this d all references in this chapters articles divisions or sections are to chapters articles divisions or sections of this provided otherwise  effect of repeal of ordinances a the repeal or amendment of an ordinance shall not revive any ordinances in force before or at the time the ordinance repealed took effect b the repeal or amendment of an ordinance shall not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal or amendment took effect nor any suit prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the repeal or amendment for any offense committed under the ordinance repealed or amended  severability if any portion of this any ordinance is held or declared to be unconstitutional inoperative or void such holding or invalidity does not affect the remaining portions of this any ordinance and it shall be construed to have been the legislative intent to pass this the ordinance without such unconstitutional invalid or inoperative part therein and the remainder of this the ordinance after the exclusion of such part or parts are to be deemed and held to be valid as if the unconstitutional portion had not been included if this any ordinance is held inapplicable to any person group of persons property or kind of property or circumstances or set of circumstances such holding shall not affect applicability to other persons property or circumstances  altering shall be unlawful for any person in the city to change or amend by additions or deletions any part or portion of this or to insert or delete pages or portions thereof or to alter or tamper with such any manner whatsoever except by ordinance or resolution or other official act of the city council which will cause the law of the city to be misrepresented thereby any person violating this section shall be punished as provided in section 18 hereof  state law reference altering public records fs  83101 amendments to   effect of new ordinances  amendatory language a all ordinances passed subsequent to this amend repeal or in any way affect this be numbered in accordance with the numbering system of this printed for inclusions herein in the case of repealed chapters sections and subsections or any part thereof by subsequent ordinances such repealed portions may be excluded from the omission from reprinted pages affected thereby the subsequent ordinances as numbered and printed or omitted in the case of repeal shall be prima facie evidence of such subsequent ordinances until such time that this subsequent ordinances numbered or omitted are readopted as a new the city commission b amendments to any of the provisions of this be made by amending such provisions by specific reference to the section number of this the following language of the the city of st augustine florida is amended to read as follows  the new provisions should then be set out in full as desired c if a new section is to be added the following language may be used the the city of st augustine florida is amended by adding section or article or chapter _____ to read as follows  the new section should then be set out in full as desired d all sections articles chapters or provisions desired to be repealed should be specifically repealed by section article or chapter number as the case may be  general penalty  continuing violations a in this section violation of this  means 1 doing an acting that is prohibited or made or declared unlawful an offense or a misdemeanor by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance 2 failure to perform an act that is required to be performed by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance 3 failure to perform an act if the failure is declared a misdemeanor or an offense or unlawful by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance b in this section violation of this  does not include the failure of a city officer or city employee to perform an official duty unless it is provided that failure to perform the duty is to be punished as provided in this section c except as otherwise provided a person convicted of a violation of this be punished by a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment for a term not exceeding sixty 60 days or any combination thereof with respect to violations of this are continuous with respect to time each day the violation continues is a separate offense d the imposition of a penalty does not prevent revocation or suspension of a license permit or franchise e violations of this are continuous with respect to time may be abated by injunctive or other equitable relief the imposition of a penalty does not prevent equitable relief f the imposition of a penalty does not prevent code enforcement board proceeding or the imposition of a civil fine or civil penalty  proration of fine and imprisonment any person serving a jail sentence in lieu of paying a fine may at any time obtain his release by paying an amount equal to the prorated amount of his fine plus court costs the prorated fine is determined by multiplying the number of days remaining unserved by the daily rate of fine the daily rate of fine is determined by dividing the amount of the original fine by the number of days of the original sentence it is intended that this section shall apply only to such cases where it is optional with the convicted person to pay either the fine or to serve the jail sentence  assessment of court costs the county court in and for the county shall assess two dollars $200 as a court cost against every person convicted for violation of a municipal ordinance of the city committed within the city limits within the territorial jurisdiction of the county court including violations of the florida uniform traffic control law fs ch 316 previously adopted by the city and including violations of any offenses previously triable in the municipal court for law enforcement education expenditures for the city law enforcement officers in addition two dollars $200 from every bond estreature or forfeited bail bond related to such penal ordinances shall be assessed for the aforesaid purpose no such assessment shall be made against any person convicted for a violation of any municipal ordinance related to the parking of vehicles all such costs collected by the county court in and for the county shall be deposited and disbursed according to law  state law reference authority to so provide fs  94325 ordinances not affected by a nothing in this the ordinance adopting this affect any ordinance 1 promising or guaranteeing the payment of money for the city or authorizing the issuance of any bonds of the city or any evidence of the citys indebtedness or any contract or obligation assumed by the city 2 establishing positions classifying employees and setting salaries or providing employee benefits that is not codified in this 3 any right of franchise granted by any ordinance to any person 4 dedicating naming establishing locating relocating opening paving widening vacating etc any street or public way that is not codified in this 5 dealing with appropriations or the budget that is not codified in this 6 levying or imposing taxes not inconsistent with this 7 rezoning specific property 8 published in the charter compilation accompanying this 9 establishing and prescribing the street grades of any street in the city 10 providing for local improvements and assessments taxes therefor 11 dedicating or accepting any plat or subdivision in the city 12 extending or contracting or otherwise relating to the boundaries of the city 13 adopted for purposes which have been consummated 14 which is temporary although general in effect 15 which is special although permanent in effect b such ordinances are hereby recognized as continuing in full force and effect to the same extent as if set out at length in this   provisions considered as continuation of existing ordinances the provisions appearing in this and the following chapters and sections so far as they are the same as those of ordinances existing at the time of the adoption of this shall be considered as a continuation thereof and not as new enactments not affect prior offenses rights etc a nothing in this the ordinance adopting this affect any offense or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of this b the adoption of this not be interpreted as authorizing or permitting any use or the continuance of any use of a structure or premises in violation of any ordinance of the city in effect on the date of adoption of this  administration footnotes  1  state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166 article i  in general city seal a there is hereby adopted as an official seal of the city that certain coat of arms a copy of which is appended to the ordinance from which this section derives and as filed with the city clerk b it shall be unlawful and the city hereby adopts the provisions of ch 9159 laws of florida for any person to utilize any image or impression of the city seal without the consent in writing of the city commission as provided in ch 9159 laws of florida and violation hereof shall be punished as a second degree misdemeanor as provided in ch 9159 laws of florida c any existing seal of the city may continue to be utilized by the city clerk as an official seal of the city  12991 editors note  adopted dec 9 199 not specifically amendatory of this has been codified as  21 at the discretion of the editor secs 22225  reserved article ii  city commission footnotes  2  charter reference city commission  201 et seq  election of mayor  409 cross reference elections ch 10 salary of commissioners each member of the city commission other than the mayorcommissioner shall receive a salary of twelve thousand dollars $1200000 per year and the mayorcommissioner shall receive a salary of sixteen thousand dollars $1600000 per year each successive year on october 1 the salaries of each member of the city commission and the mayorcommissioner shall be increased by the average general wage increase for all employees of the city 1964 charter laws  4071   11876   5977   51479   10879   122782   22299   6903 secs 227250  reserved article iii  officers and employees footnotes  3  charter reference city officers generally  201 et seq  401 et seq  civil service   et seq cross reference pensions and retirement ch 20 state law reference public officers and employees generally fs ch 112 oath of officers every officer of the city shall before entering upon the duties of his office take and subscribe to an oath or affirmation to be filed and kept in the office of the city clerk  which oath shall be in the form prescribed for state officers by the constitution of the state 1964 charter laws  403  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  184 state law reference official oath fla const art ii  5b conflicts of interest a for the purposes of this article the following words shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section conflict of interest means the having of a direct financial interest of any kind in the outcome of any act taken by a person connected with the operation of the city which will aid or benefit that person members of any board commission council or agency means each and every person appointed by the city commission to any board commission council or agency whether compensated for services or not officers and officials  employees means each and every person employed by the city in any capacity b any individuals referred to in subsection a above who shall have a direct financial interest in any matter or transaction affecting the city government shall state the nature of such interest recordably at the commencement of such transaction and shall thereafter refrain from all participation therein c should any such person participate in any such action that fact alone shall render the matter or transaction voidable by the city commission d any person found guilty of the willful violation of this section shall be punished as provided in section 18 18   82718 state law reference conflicts of interest and financial disclosure fs   et seq per diem rates and subsistence allowance for authorized travelers a as used herein all words and phrases shall have the same meaning as provided by general law b in lieu of the per diem rate established by general law authorized travelers may be allowed subsistence when traveling away from the travelers official headquarters ie actual expenses for meals including gratuities plus actual expenses for lodging at single occupancy rate such expenses for lodging to be substantiated with paid bills therefor  however in lieu of reimbursement for such subsistence and lodging the city manager is authorized to cause to be issued by a reputable credit card company upon such terms and conditions as he deems reasonable credit cards to such regularly employed employees of the city including the city manager as he shall deem appropriate to be used by such employee or employees for the sole purpose of paying for such actual expenses for meals including gratuities and actual expenses for lodging at single occupancy rates as herein provided  provided that in the event of the use of such credit card all receipts shall be accounted for by the authorized traveler  and provided further that in the event of resignation or other departure from city service of such employee such employees final pay shall be withheld until the return of any such credit card c the following incidental traveling expenses of the traveler may be reimbursed 1 taxi fare including gratuities 2 ferry fares and bridge road and tunnel tolls 3 storage and parking fees including gratuities 4 communication expenses incurred in pursuit of municipal business 5 luggage handling and maid service including gratuities 6 convention registration fee while attending a convention or conference which will serve a direct public service with relation to the public agency served by the person attending such meeting however any meals and lodging included in the registration fee will be deducted in accordance with the provisions of general law 7 actual expenses incurred for meals and gratuities of persons engaged in municipal business with the authorized traveler  however such expenses of third persons shall be documented by the authorized traveler by providing on his reimbursement voucher the name affiliation and municipal business discussed with such third person  filling of vacancies  chief of police or fire chief at the time of any vacancy for the position of chief of police or fire chief of the city the civil service board or its examiner subject to its approval shall provide examinations and maintain a list of eligibles to appointment of chief of either the police or fire department and shall certify such list to the city manager and such vacancy shall be filled only from such list of eligibles in the event that the city manager shall determine that no one on the list of eligibles shall be qualified to serve as chief of the fire or police department then such civil service board shall prepare an additional list of eligibles for certification to the city manager from which such appointment shall be made  secs 255270  reserved article iv  finance footnotes  4  charter reference civil service board   cross reference licenses taxation and miscellaneous business regulations ch 17 state law reference municipal finance generally fs   et seq  local government finance fs ch 218 division 1  generally fiscal year the fiscal year of the city shall begin on the first day of october and end on the thirtieth day of september of each year 1964 charter laws  1401  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  93  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  15 state law reference fiscal year fs   21833 transfer of funds no transfer of the money or any part thereof from one 1 fund to another fund or the payment from one 1 fund of expenditures legally payable from another fund shall be lawful except by a duly adopted resolution of the city commission concurred in by not less than a majority of commissioners and the director of financial services shall not make any transfers of moneys from one 1 fund to another except upon a resolution duly adopted as provided for above 1964 charter laws  1407  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  97  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  18   42384 money drawn from treasury  issuance of warrants no money shall be drawn from the treasury of the city nor shall any obligation for the expenditure of money be incurred except pursuant to the appropriations made by the city commission no warrant for the payment of any account or claim shall be issued by the director of financial services until such account or claim shall have been approved by the city manager the director of financial services under the supervision and advice of the city manager shall prescribe the method and forms of accounting in the city and make all necessary rules and regulations to make such method and forms of accounting effective 1964 charter laws  1409  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  99  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  19   42384 city manager authorized to determine fees for administrative services the city manager is hereby authorized from time to time to determine the cost of copying inspections and other administrative services performed by the city and where no charge is otherwise provided for such services to promulgate fees in accordance with such costs to be charged for the rendering of such services such fees shall become effective thirty 30 days after a copy thereof has been furnished to the city commission unless the city commission shall by ordinance provide some other fee or charge for such services or direct that no fee be charged  state law reference user fees authorized fs   law enforcement trust fund a created there is hereby created in the city treasury a special law enforcement trust fund pursuant to the provisions of the florida contraband forfeiture act into which shall be deposited from time to time proceeds from the sale of seized contraband articles such as vessels motor vehicles aircraft and other personal property the funds contained in this special law enforcement trust fund may be expended only upon approval of the city commission and may be used only to defray costs of protracted or complex investigations  provide additional technical equipment or expertise to the police department of the city  provide matching funds to obtain federal grants  or such other law enforcement purposes as the city commission deems appropriate  but in no event shall such funds be utilized to meet normal operating needs b report the chief of police shall submit to the city commission a quarterly report specifying for the preceding quarter the type and approximate value of the property received and the amount of any proceeds received the amounts contained in the trust fund established by subsection a hereof shall not be included in the adoption or approval of any budget for the police department  state law reference law enforcement trust fund fs  3a road and bridge fund established  purposes  deposit of monies  unexpended monies a there is hereby established a fund to be known and designated as the road and bridge fund b all monies deposited in the road and bridge fund shall be kept separate and apart from all other municipal funds monies from the road and bridge fund shall not be expended for any other purposes than for work on the public roads and bridges in the city  for the payment of the salaries of employees engaged in road and bridge work  for providing the necessary tools materials implements and equipment for repairing and maintaining the roads and bridges of the city c the monies to be deposited in the road and bridge fund shall be 1 all monies received from the board of county commissioners as the citys share of the county levy of taxes for road and bridge purposes in accordance with law 2 all monies appropriated by the city commission to the road and bridge fund in the citys annual budget 3 all monies received by the city from state or federal grants or matching funds for the purpose of repairing and maintaining the citys roads streets and bridges d all unexpended monies in the road and bridge fund at the end of any fiscal year of the city shall be carried over and appropriated to the road and bridge fund in the next ensuing city budget such unexpended monies in the road and bridge fund shall not be placed in the general fund or any other fund of the city  competitive bids competitive formal bids should be solicited for any single item which exceeds the purchase cost of five thousand dollars $500000 1964 charter laws  413  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  34  laws of fla 1955 ch 312  1   112282 accounting procedure  accounting reports the accounting procedure established in the office of the director of financial services shall be adequate to provide a record in detail of all transactions affecting the acquisition custodianship and disposition of value including cash receipts and disbursements and such facts shall be so presented in the reports which the director of financial services is required to render periodically and shall be supported with such summaries and analytical schedules as may be necessary to show in detail the full account of such transactions for each fiscal year upon the finances of the city and relation to each department of the city government including district summaries and schedules for each public utility owned and operated 1964 charter laws  434   42384 determination of indigent status a application to the clerk a person seeking relief from payment of administrative fees based upon an inability to pay must apply to the office of the city clerk for a determination of indigent status using the application form provided for that purpose the application must include at a minimum the following financial information 1 net income consisting of total salary and wages minus deductions required by law including courtordered support payments 2 other income including but not limited to social security benefits union funds veterans benefits workers compensation other regular support from absent family members public or private employee pensions reemployment assistance or unemployment compensation dividends interest rent trusts and gifts 3 assets including but not limited to cash savings accounts bank accounts stocks bonds certificates of deposit equity in real estate and equity in a boat or a motor vehicle or in other tangible property 4 all liabilities and debts b the application must be substantiated by proof of income documentation that verifies the financial information alleged by the applicant such documentation including but not limited to pay stubs bank statements and proof of benefits must be provided for all applicable income information entered on the application c the application must include a signature by the applicant which attests under penalty of perjury to the truthfulness of the information provided d the city clerk shall accept any application and supporting proof of income documentation including an application that is signed by the applicant and submitted on his or her behalf by a private attorney who is representing the applicant in the applicable matter e determination by the clerk the city clerk shall determine whether an applicant seeking such designation is indigent based upon the information provided in the application supporting proof of income documentation and the criteria prescribed in this subsection 1 an applicant including an applicant who is a minor or an adult taxdependent person is indigent if the applicants income is equal to or below two hundred 200 percent of the thencurrent federal poverty guidelines prescribed for the size of the household of the applicant as published in the federal register by the united states department of health and human services 2 there is a presumption that the applicant is not indigent if the applicant owns or has equity in any intangible or tangible personal property or real property or the expectancy of an interest in any such property having a net equity value of two thousand five hundred dollars $250000 or more excluding the value of the persons homestead and one vehicle having a net value not exceeding five thousand dollars $500000 f based upon its review the city clerk shall make one of the following determinations 1 the applicant is not indigent 2 the applicant is indigent g if the city clerk determines that the applicant is indigent the clerk shall immediately issue a certified letter of determination of indigency h the duty of the city clerk in determining whether an applicant is indigent is limited to receiving the application and comparing the information provided in the application to the criteria prescribed in this subsection the determination of indigent status is a ministerial act of the city clerk and may not be based on further investigation or the exercise of independent judgment by the city clerk i appeals the applicant may seek review of the city clerks determination that the applicant is not indigent by filing a petition to review the city clerks determination of nonindigent status with the city managers office within ten 10 days of the determination the city manager shall make a final determination of indigent status by reviewing the information provided in the application against the criteria prescribed in subsection d and by considering any further mitigating factors as presented by the applicant  22317 secs 280295  reserved division 2  director of financial services generally there shall be a director of financial services who shall be appointed by and serve during the pleasure of the city manager under the supervision of the city manager he shall be director of the financial services department he shall be the custodian of all moneys of the municipality and shall keep and preserve the same in such manner and in such place or places as shall be determined by the city commission he shall issue all warrants for payment of money by the city and shall keep an accurate account of all taxes and assessments all moneys due to and of all receipts and disbursements by the city of all of its assets and liabilities and all of the appropriations made by the city commission he shall submit to the city manager each month a report covering the next preceding month of receipts and expenditures and of the financial condition of the city he shall make and keep a list of the outstanding city bonds to whom issued for what purpose when and where payable and the rate of interest they respectively bear he shall furnish the city manager at any time such reports data and information as may be necessary to fully inform the latter as to the financial affairs of the city furnishing him such estimates of the expense of the city government as may be necessary to form the basis of the annual budget and to determine the revenues necessary to be raised each year 1964 charter laws  432   42384 city indebtedness  records of lands subject to city assessment  tax levy the director of financial services shall keep regular books of account in which shall be entered all indebtedness of the city and which shall at all times show the financial condition of the city the amount of bonds orders certificates or other evidence of indebtedness which have been redeemed  he shall keep account with all disbursing officers and employees of the city showing the amounts they have received from different sources of revenue and the amount they have disbursed as authorized under the ordinances of the city the director of financial services shall keep a list of all certificates issued for work or for any other purpose and before the levy by the city commission of any special tax upon any property in the city or any part thereof the director of financial services shall furnish to the city manager for the information of the city commission a schedule of all lots or parcels of land which may be subject to the proposed tax or assessment and which it may be necessary to levy on which such schedule shall be certified by his affidavit and shall be prima facie evidence of the facts stated therein in all cases wherein the validity of such tax or assessment shall come in question acting upon such schedule the city commission may if it deems such special tax or assessment legal and just cause the same to be levied 1964 charter laws  433   42384 audit of accounts of officers removed from office  report of indebtedness upon the death resignation removal or expiration of the term of any officer the director of financial services shall audit such officers accounts  and if such officer shall be found to be indebted to the city the director shall at once give notice thereof city manager to the city commission and to the city attorney and the latter shall forthwith proceed to collect the sum of such indebtedness 1964 charter laws  435   42384 duty to collect interest on investments etc  hold bonds securities etc all moneys due as interest upon investments or deposits except investments or deposits of sinking fund assets shall be collected by the director of financial services and placed to the credit of the general fund of the city any and all bonds and securities taken for investments and deposits shall be held by the director for safekeeping for the benefits of the city 1964 charter laws  436   42384 collection of city moneys  account the director of financial services shall receive and collect all moneys belonging to the city including taxes license moneys fines and income from all other sources the director of financial services shall collect all special assessments as provided for under the charter and keep an accurate account thereof 1964 charter laws  437   42384 money to be paid on warrants only  exceptions the director of financial services shall pay out moneys only on warrants countersigned by the city manager except bonds and interestbearing coupons which when due may be paid upon presentation or in case the same are payable in some other place other than the city the money for their redemption shall be sent to the place of payment 1964 charter laws  438   42384 secs 21022120  reserved division 3  budget preparation footnotes  5  state law reference budget preparation generally fs   responsibility of city manager a at such time as required by general law and by the city charter the city manager shall prepare and file with the city commission a full and complete budget of all anticipated expenditures for administration and maintenance of the city for the next ensuing fiscal year giving details as required by the city charter and general law as to the number and amounts of paid employees and for necessary regular administration and maintenance expenditures and capitol outlays in the preparation of the tentative budget the city manager shall first ascertain the estimated revenues and receipts by source anticipated to be available during the ensuing year for which the budget is prepared estimated revenues derived from ad valorem taxation shall be based on the estimated rolled back millage as determined by general law the receipt side of the budget shall set forth all anticipated fund balances to be brought forward at the beginning of the budget year in the preparation of estimated expenditures the city manager shall first set forth all amounts required or estimated to be required for fire protection police protection solid waste disposal water utility and sanitary sewer utility there shall be set aside sufficient estimated receipts to provide for such services and the moneys thus set aside in the tentative budget shall be used for no other purpose b he shall set forth all amounts required or estimated to be required for accounting payroll utility billing and collecting vehicle maintenance purchasing and stores and administration there shall be set aside sufficient estimated receipts to provide for such services and the moneys thus set aside in the tentative budget shall be used for no other purpose c if there shall be any revenues remaining he shall set forth all amounts required or estimated to be required for street and drainage maintenance building and zoning code enforcement and building and structure maintenance d there shall be budgeted from the remaining tax revenues the following services advertising and promotion historic preservation parking enforcement dog control recreation parks and yacht pier  budget to conform to state law in the preparation of the tentative and final budget no moneys shall be allocated or budgeted to aid any corporation association partnership or person in violation of fla const art vii  7  city manager to submit budget to commission  information required prior to the making of the levy for taxes for each year the city manager shall prepare and submit to the commission a budget estimate of the necessary and ordinary and of all special and extraordinary expenditures contemplated and the anticipated revenues and receipts of all city departments divisions and offices for the ensuing fiscal year the estimate shall be compiled from detailed information obtained from the several departments divisions and offices on uniform blanks furnished by the city manager the classification of the estimates shall be as nearly uniform as possible for the main functional divisions of such departments divisions and offices and these shall give in parallel columns the following information 1 a detailed estimate of the expenses of conducting each department division or office 2 expenditures for corresponding items for the last two 2 fiscal years 3 expenditures for corresponding items for the current fiscal year including adjustment due to transfers between appropriations plus an estimate of the expenditures necessary to complete the current fiscal year 4 the value of supplies and material on hand at the date of the preparation of the estimate 5 increases or decreases requested compared with corresponding appropriation for the current year with reasons for such increases or decreases 6 the total probable income of the city from taxes for the period covered by the estimate 7 an itemization of anticipated revenues from other sources 8 the total amount of the outstanding city debt with a schedule of maturities of bond issues and other indebtedness 9 the amount required for interest on the city debt for sinking funds and for maturing bonds 10 such other information as may be required by the commission 11 the information and estimate so given and constituting the recommendation of the city manager as to the amounts necessary to be appropriated for the ensuing fiscal year shall be supported with information giving the reasons therefor in such detail as may be necessary to afford the city commission a comprehensive understanding of the needs and requirements of the various divisions of the city government for the ensuing period 12 the city commission may in its discretion create a special fund which shall be designated as reserve fund into which shall be payable all revenues arising from sources other than taxes license fees rentals and endowments in the event such a reserve fund shall be established the city manager in preparing the budget shall exclude from his estimate of the income of the city all revenues for the year for which such budget estimate is prepared which shall be payable to such reserve fund but he shall include in the budget as available revenue subject to appropriation the amount of all moneys in such reserve fund at the commencement of the year for which such budget estimate is prepared 1964 charter laws  1402  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  94  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  16 budget estimate to be filed with director of financial services copies of the budget estimate of the city manager shall be on file in the office of the director of financial services and open for inspection by the public 1964 charter laws  1403  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  94  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  16   42384 budget estimate to be basis for tax levies and appropriations the budget estimate of expenditures and revenues shall form the basis for all tax levies and appropriations made by the city commission for the year for which such budget estimate is prepared 1964 charter laws  1404  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  94  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  16 budget estimate to show expenditures contemplated  notice and hearing  adoption  certification  disposition of unexpended funds the estimates herein provided after being completed shall be published in summary form one 1 time in a newspaper published in the city  together with a notice to the taxpayers of the city stating the time and place when objections thereto will be heard  such publication and the notice shall be made within one 1 week from the making of such estimates  and at the next regular meeting of the city commission after such publication or at a special meeting of the city commission after such publication or at a special meeting called for the purpose not less than two 2 weeks after such publication such estimates and objections if any shall be considered and acted upon and as adopted the estimates shall be spread in full upon the minutes of the city commission the adoption of such estimates by the commission shall give such estimates the force and effect of fixed appropriations and the same shall not be altered or amended or exceeded nor shall the expenses estimated under one 1 head be paid out of the estimate for any other expense the city commission shall certify the total millage to the county property appraiser as soon after the adoption of the budget as possible all unexpended balances to the credit of any account at the end of the fiscal year shall revert to the fund from which the appropriation was made but nothing herein shall be construed as prohibiting the reserving in the estimates of a reasonable sum for contingencies and emergencies and the appropriation of any part of such sum so reserved for any expense of the city authorized by law or by the charter 1964 charter laws  1406  laws of fla 1929 ch 111  95  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  17  laws of fla 1933 ch 166  2  laws of fla 1937 ch 188  4   9974 pursuant to this section is not intended to be a legal notice nor should it be relied upon to provide affected party status or standing if more specific notice is required for any particular assessments for local improvements the city commission shall have power by ordinance or resolution as authorized by state law to provide for the construction reconstruction repair and maintenance by contract or directly by the employment of labor of all things in the nature of local improvements and to provide for the payment of any part of the cost of any local improvement by levying and collecting special assessments upon abutting adjoining contiguous or other specially benefited property the amount assessed against any abutting adjoining contiguous or other specially benefited property shall not exceed the amount of the estimated benefits accruing to such properties the city commission may use the authority and method of making local municipal improvements pursuant to florida statutes the city commission may elect to use the uniform method of collecting nonad valorem assessments pursuant to florida statutes or may use any other legally available method of collection any existing nonad valorem assessment imposed by the city commission shall remain in full force and effect and amendments thereto may be authorized pursuant to this section 1964 charter laws  1209  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  132  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  48   71414 secs 21532165  reserved editors note  adopted  repealed  21532165 which pertained to public improvements and special assessments see table for complete derivation reassessments if any special assessment made under this division to defray the whole or part of the cost of any local improvement shall be either in whole or in part annulled vacated or set aside by the judgment of any court or if the city commission shall be satisfied that any such assessment is so irregular or defective that the same cannot be enforced and collected or if the city commission shall have omitted to make such assessment when it might have done so it is hereby authorized to take all steps to cause a new assessment for the whole or any part of any improvement or against any property benefited by any improvement following as near as may be the provisions of this act and in case such second assessment shall be annulled the city commission may obtain and make other assessments until a valid assessment shall be made no omission informality or irregularity in the proceedings or preliminary to the making of any special assessment shall affect the validity of the same where the assessment roll has been confirmed by the city commission and the assessment roll and the record thereof kept by the director of financial services shall be competent and sufficient evidence that the assessment was duly levied and the assessment roll duly made and adopted and that all other proceedings adequate to the adoption of such assessment roll were duly had taken and performed as required by law no variance from the directions herein contained as to the form and manner of any of the proceedings shall be held material unless it is clearly shown that the party objecting was materially injured thereby 1964 charter laws  1223  laws of fla 1925 ch 111  142  laws of fla 1929 ch 143  58 owner may pay assessment at any time  no installments plus interest thereon at the rate of eight 8 percent per annum to the date when the next installment shall become due but such payment shall not bar the levy of a supplemental assessment
