in the community are open to serve customers in all cases normal business hours for the catv system also must include some evening hours at least one night per week andor some weekend hours 9 normal operating conditions the term normal operating conditions means those service conditions which are within the control of the operator those conditions which are not within the control of the cable operator include but are not limited to natural disasters civil disturbances power outages telephone network outages and severe or unusual weather conditions force majeure those conditions which are ordinarily within the control of the cable operator include but are not limited to special promotions payperview events rate increases regular peak or seasonal demand periods and ongoing maintenance programming carried on the cable system can be originated by the cable operator  by local institutions  by those using leased channels  by the public  or by other entities or persons 9 outage  malfunction an equipment or facility failure that results in the loss of satisfactory service on one or more channels a malfunction or outage is major if it affects five 5 or more subscribers in the same area 9 outlet a catv connection terminal or wallplate in the building structure which is used for the purpose of connecting a television receiver or other subscriber terminal to the catv system 9 overbuild to construct and operate a second competing catv system to serve an area already served by another catv system 9 parent when used in reference to grantee any person or group of persons company organization or other business entity 9 personal communications system pcs  personal communications network pcn provision of telephone video data and other services to individuals of cable microcellular fiber and other technologies 9 picture signal that portion of the composite video signal which lies above the blanking level and contains picture brightness gray scale information 9 the operation of the system 9 pole attachment right the right to attach hardware and equipment to poles owned by utility companies or others 9 premium service optional additional programming provided to subscribers at an additional monthly charge for each channel carrying such programming 9 principal headend 1 the headend in the case of a cable system with a single headend or 2 in the case of a cable system with more than one headend the principal headend designated by the cable operator except that such designation shall not undermine or evade the requirements of the fcc and this chapter usually supplies signals to all hubs in the system 9 proof test 1 action undertaken to prove or demonstrate that a system fulfills agreed upon criteriafor example that the processing of specified input yields specified output  2 a test to demonstrate that the system meets minimum technical standards 9 public access channel see section 9 hereof 9 public notice an announcement to the community of some planned action by the franchise authority grantor or its designate in respect to cable service or the cable television franchise may be accomplished by bulletin newspaper radio or tv broadcast andor other means including announcements on the catv local origination channel to insure that all community members can be made aware of the event 9 rebuild to replace a catv system in its entirety with another system that may provide for a higher level of performance and usually will provide more channels 9 request for proposal rfp a formal document issued by a franchising authority and inviting proposals applications from prospective operators to submit applications for a franchise provides guidelines and requirements that must be met by prospective franchisees 9 satellite broadcast terminals 9 service area see area served by cable system 9 service call ratio the number of problems which require a truck trip to a customers home per one hundred 100 subscribers per month  number of truck rolls per one hundred 100 subscribers per month 9 service interruption the loss of any signal at one or more subscriberuser locations 9 shall is always mandatory 9 signaltonoise ratio snr the aural carrier 9 spin a term often used to describe and measure subscriber changes adding or removing between tiers andor premium channels and not including disconnects andor reconnects see also churn 9 standard radio station a radio am or fm station licensed by the fcc 9 standard television station see television station 9 state of the art that level of technical performance or capacity or service households the sum of all dwelling units in the territorial limits 9 transfer the disposal directly or indirectly voluntarily or involuntarily by any method including gift assignment sale merger consolidation acquisition bankruptcy receivership or otherwise of the ownership or control of grantee the physicalsystem plant or the franchise in whole or in part 9 trunk or trunkline the primary cable subsystem leading from the headend of the cable tv system to the various points where feeders or feeder lines are tapped off to distribute signals to drops can be a metallic or b glass fiber 9 twoway activation the condition existing when the amplifiers and other technical components of the system have the requisite equipment in place to pass video audio voice analog andor data signals upstream and downstream simultaneously 9 twoway capability the condition existing when the amplifiers and other technical components of the cable system have been designed and installed to be easily upgraded to activate twoway transmission of information over the cable system ie if all that is required for twoway activation is the insertion and alignment of additional standard plugin modules into the amplifiers 9 upgrade 1 the addition by a subscriber of a premium program or other service or product to the existing level of catv service provided to that subscriber  2 a major improvement to the cable system that usually includes a major increase in number of channels available andor a major improvement in performance this usually includes replacing some or all active components eg modules passive components some cable etc an upgrade utilizes major parts of the original system  a rebuild does not 9 unit a building or facility occupied by one or more persons as a dwelling or such business professional or institutional entities as shall subscribe to cable television 9 upstream in the direction from any designed point in the system toward the hub or headend 9 upstream transmissions signals traveling in the direction from origination points in the cable system toward a headend or hub ie in the opposite direction from subscriber channels 9 usable activated channels see also activated channels 1 those activated channels of a cable system except those channels whose use for the distribution of broadcast signals would conflict with technical and safety regulations see subpart k of the fcc rules 2 channels which are available for immediate use without system modification 9 vertical wiring multipleoutlet internal wiring in a multipledwelling or multipleuse building may include amplifiers does not normally include internal wiring on a subscribers premises these are drops vertical wiring is considered to be part of the cable television plant as compared to subscriber drop plant 9 video visual electronic information  a picture signal 9 video signal the baseband monochrome video or picture signal amplified as appropriate and provided to a monitor for combination with the synchronization signal and as applicable the chroma signal 9 will is always mandatory  a commitment 9 other definitions any term defined in fcc andor other applicable government rules and regulations as of the effective date of the franchise but not included in the foregoing list shall be incorporated herein by reference as if set forth in full and shall be defined as it appears in such rules andor regulations if not so defined or not defined herein words and terms shall be given their ordinary and usual meanings as defined in standard reference works 9 precedence in the event of conflict between any of the definitions herein and any definitions contained in any applicable stategovernment fcc or federalgovernment statutes such state fcc and federalgovernment definitions shall take first precedence the definitions herein shall take next precedence  101094 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12   grant of authority 921 unlawful to operate without a franchise it shall be unlawful to commence or engage in the construction operation or maintenance of a cable television system or to provide cabletelevision service within any of the incorporated areas of st augustine florida without a franchise from the city 922 franchise the franchise the franchise granted by grantor and accepted by grantee pursuant to this chapter shall be nonexclusive and shall provide to grantee the right privilege and authority to construct operate and maintain a cable tv system in the territorial limits for the term specified in the franchise a similar grant or grants may be made to competing providers under proportionately comparable conditions and in accordance with state and federal law the franchising procedure shall comply with federal and state law federal law shall take precedence in the event of conflict 923 grantee authority grantee shall have the authority to promulgate such rules regulations terms and conditions governing the conduct of its business as shall be reasonably necessary to enable grantee to exercise its rights and to perform its obligations under this article and to assure uninterrupted service to each and all of its customers however such rules regulations terms and conditions shall not be in conflict with the provisions of this chapter and shall be filed with grantor 924 franchise application any applicant under this chapter shall file ten 10 copies of the application for a new cable television franchise or for the transfer of an existing cable television franchise with grantors city manager the applications shall be reviewed by grantor and the applicants afforded proper time during a public proceeding before the city commission to explain their application grantor may utilize outside professionals who are knowledgeable in the field of cable television for analysis of the applicants proposals additionally grantor may utilize other expertise within the city government for purposes of making recommendations the commission may by resolution authorize implementation of the catv resolution adoption procedure for the cable television franchise if the applicant satisfies the criteria herein established and grantor tentatively determines that the grant of application may serve the public convenience safety and general welfare  such tentative determination to be conclusively evidenced by the scheduling of a public hearing to consider passage of a proposed cabletelevision franchise ordinance andor resolutions concerning the application 925 presentations by existing franchisees grantor shall at or before the public hearing on the proposed franchise ordinance or resolution allow all existing grantees an opportunity to submit objections or requests for clarification on an application which affects such existing grantees and shall allow them to be heard and to make public presentations pertaining to such application 926 filing fees 9 payment to compensate grantor for processing and related expenses each application for a new or geographicallyexpanded cable television franchise an extension of an existing franchise a transfer or a modification shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable filing fee as follows a for a new franchise $10000 b for a renewal of a franchise $5000 c for a transfer see section 927 below d for a modification pursuant to 47 usc  545 five thousand dollars $500000 except for rate changes 9 costs to be paid by applicant in the event such nonrefundable filing fee is not sufficient to pay all related costs the applicant shall pay the balance of such costs to grantor within thirty 30 days of the mailing of an invoice for such balance by grantor to the applicant at its address as listed in its application failure to make such payment shall be cause for refusal or revocation of the franchise 927 transfer fee in order that grantor may share in the value that the franchise adds to grantees operations and in further consideration of grantors administrative expenses incurred any sale transfer assignment or lease by grantee of rights under the franchise requiring consent of grantor shall require the payment to grantor of a transfer fee the transfer fee shall be in amount equal to one thousand five hundred dollars $150000 for each remaining year of the franchise term but not less than four thousand five hundred dollars $450000 such transfer fee shall be paid within thirty 30 days after the effective date of sale transfer assignment or lease such transfer fee shall not be recovered from the subscribers or by itemized surcharge or excluded from gross income 928 street and rightofway use not exclusive for the purpose of constructing operating and maintaining a system in the territorial limits grantee except as specifically required now or in the fixture by grantor may erect install construct repair replace relocate reconstruct remove and retain in on over under upon across and along the streets within the territorial limits such lines cables conductors ducts conduits false manholes amplifiers appliances pedestals attachments and other property and equipment as are necessary and appurtenant to the operation of the cable system provided that all applicable permits are applied for and granted all fees paid and all codes and ordinances are complied with the authority to use and occupy the streets and rightsofway for the purpose set forth herein is not exclusive  grantor reserves the right to grant one or more additional franchises or other authorizations for similar use to any other persons at any time 929 ownership of cable system acquisition 9 grantee to own grantee shall at all times during the term of the franchise be the sole owner of and have full possessory rights to all facilities and property real and personal of the cable system whether by ownership lease license or otherwise grantee may discard or replace any property real or personal so long as grantee continues to satisfy its obligations hereunder 9 sale or transfer of franchise or change of control of grantee the franchise or the system hereunder neither shall be transferred nor shall title thereto either legal or equitable or any right interest or property therein pass to or vest in any entity without full compliance with the procedures set forth in this section the provisions of this section shall apply to the transfer of all or a majority of grantees assets merger excluding its parent and any affiliated corporation consolidation or sale or transfer of stock of grantee or of its parent so as to effect change in control of the system nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent grantee from pledging physical assets of the system to a bona fide lending institution as security and collateral the franchise itself may not be used for such security or collateral 91 the parties to the transfer shall make a written request to grantor for its approval of a transfer both onehundredtwenty 120 days prior notice to grantor and prior written approval by grantor shall be required for any transfer which changes effective control of grantee or a parent 92 grantor shall reply to the parties in writing within one hundred twenty 120 days of the request and shall indicate whether the requested transfer is approved 93 grantee shall within sixty 60 days of transfer file with grantor a copy of the deed agreement lien lease or other written instrument evidencing such transfer certified and sworn to as correct by grantee or its successor 94 in reviewing a request for transfer pursuant to section 91 above grantor may inquire into the technical legal and financial qualifications of the prospective controlling party and grantee shall assist grantor in so inquiring grantor may condition said transfer upon such terms and conditions as it deems reasonably appropriate grantor shall not unreasonably withhold its approval in no event shall a transfer of ownership or control be approved without the new owner becoming a party to the franchise a new owner grantee shall execute a franchise amendment to perfect such ownership as required by grantor 95 grantor shall not sell any interest to or acquire any interest from any competing video service provider or other cable tv system operating in the territorial limits during the term of the franchise issued pursuant to this chapter or any extension thereof 96 upon approval of the transfer regulated under this section grantee shall pay to grantor the transfer fee as provided in sections 9126 and 9127 within ten 10 days after the transfer is consummated 9 effect of unauthorized action any transfer described in section 9 above that is made without prior consent of grantor shall be null and void and shall be deemed a substantial breach of the franchise such action shall be subject to a forfeiture of five hundred dollars $50000 per day until approved or if not approved until prior ownership and control is restored if grantor legally denies consent to any action after it has been taken grantor may revoke the franchise without further process unless the action is reversed within ninety 90 days by grantee 9 foreclosure upon notice of the foreclosure or other judicial sale of the system grantee shall notify grantor of such notification within ten 10 days an actual foreclosure or judicial sale shall be treated as a change in control of grantee and the provisions of this chapter governing the consent to a transfer or change in ownership shall apply without regard to how such transfer or change in ownership occurred 9 receivership or bankruptcy in the event of the appointment of a receiver or trustee for grantee whether in receivership reorganization bankruptcy or other such action or proceeding grantee shall notify grantor within ten 10 days this shall be treated as a notification that a change in control of grantee has taken place the term bankruptcy as used herein shall include any assignment for the benefit of creditors andor petition for reorganization under the federal bankruptcy or state insolvency laws or other similar procedure 9 grantor to assume control in the event of receivership or bankruptcy as in section 9 above grantor shall have the right to assume temporary control and management of the cable system by satisfying the creditors and the courts in order to assure continued acceptable quality of service to subscribers 9 anticompetitive action grantor may disapprove any sale transfer or change of control that would reduce or tend to reduce competition in the area such as but not limited to sale of one competitive system or video provider to the other 9210 police power grantee acknowledges that its rights hereunder are subject to grantors police powers to amend adopt and enforce ordinances pertaining to the public health safety and morals grantor acknowledges that grantee has contractual rights under the franchise agreement and the parties acknowledge that contractual rights and obligations may be modified only by mutual consent both parties acknowledge that some rights or interests of grantee may be altered without compensation to grantee by the exercise of police power laws or regulations when necessary in the interests of the public health safety welfare and morals while other rights or interests may be taken only with compensation pursuant to eminent domain provisions under the constitutions of the united states and the state of florida nothing in this chapter or the franchise agreement issued pursuant hereto shall be construed as a waiver of any such rights by either party 9211 public works the rights and privileges granted hereby shall not be in preference or hindrance to the rights of grantor and other lawful government authorities having jurisdiction to perform or carry out any public works or public improvements should the cable system interfere with the construction maintenance or repair of such public works or improvements grantee at its own expense shall protect andor relocate the cable system or the applicable part thereof as directed by grantor or other government authorities having jurisdiction 9212 extension policy subject to the provisions of the franchise granted pursuant to this chapter grantee shall offer full cable service to all occupants of any areas annexed to the territorial limits with a density of twenty 20 units or more per mile served by aerial plant grantee shall offer cable service to all occupants of any area within the annexed territorial limits with a density of twentyfive 25 units households and establishments or more per mile served by underground plant the rights and privileges awarded pursuant to the franchise and this chapter shall relate to and cover the entire territorial limits and any areas annexed thereto the annexed areas during the term of the franchise and extensions if any in the event that any annexed areas are builtup areas areas having a density of twenty 20 or more units per aerial mile or twentyfive 25 or more units per underground mile grantee shall provide cable service to such builtup areas within nine 9 months after notification by grantor to do so provided that if the annexed area is served by another cable operator grantee shall not be required to provide cable services to that area computations of density shall take into account any connecting lines required to serve such areas if not contiguous to the existing cable distribution plant as well as any units passed by such connecting lines 9213 extended service areas grantee may utilize any available technologies within the stateoftheart for the purpose of serving subscribers grantee may but shall not be required to provide cable service in annexed areas which do not have a density of twenty 20 units or more per mile aerial or twentyfive 25 units or more per mile underground the provision of limited cable services in such areas is to be encouraged 9214 provision of service in territorial limits beginning with the effective date of the franchise subject to the terms hereof and continuing for the term of the franchise and any extension thereto grantee shall make available upon request of the owner tenant or lessee of any improved property unit in the territorial limits the full range of cable services available to other subscribers or users of like class at the same standard charges and rates and under the terms of this chapterexcept for such area as may be described in exhibit a of the franchise granted pursuant hereto which shall be treated as an annexed area 9215 extension of franchise term by grantor 9 revocation  extension notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter grantor may nevertheless extend the term of the franchise beyond the termination or expiration date for such period of time as grantor may specify not to exceed two 2 years by giving grantee such notice as is reasonable in the circumstances in the event of such extension grantee shall continue to operate the cable system in accordance with all of the provisions of this chapter and the franchise during any extension of the term grantor may terminate the franchise as to any area or areas within the franchise territorial limits effective not less than thirty 30 days from the date of such notice 9 renewal upon the expiration of the term for which the franchise is granted grantor may renew the franchise for an additional term in accordance with federal law the florida statutes and the requirements of this chapter 9216 business office  telephone 9 telephone number grantee shall provide a tollfree number for service calls accessible at no charge from any subscriber location twentyfour 24 hours per day 9 office locations grantee shall provide for an office located within the territorial limits city of st augustine and open during normal business hours where granteeowned equipment may be dropped off by subscribers or others and for business transactions 9217 written notice all notices reports or demands required to be given to grantor and to grantee shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given when delivered personally hand delivered to the persons designated in the franchise granted pursuant to this chapter or when seventytwo 72 hours have elapsed after being deposited in the united states mail in a sealed envelope with registered or certified mail postage prepaid thereon or on the next business day if sent by express mail or overnight air courier addressed to the party to which notice is being given as listed in the franchise pursuant to this chapter addresses may be changed by either party upon written notice to the other party  certified mail or hand delivery return receipt requested 9218 certification grantee by accepting the franchise certifies that it has investigated its supply sources  is familiar with the community  has examined the cable system and operations  has reviewed its own financial condition  and has the capacity and resources to carry out its obligations to the community 9219 consent by grantor whenever under the terms of the franchise or of this chapter grantors consent or approval is required it shall not be unreasonably withheld this provision however shall not necessarily impose upon grantor a for cause standard of discretion 9220 imposition of requirements on grantee  not unreasonable to the extent that the franchise or this chapter gives grantor or its agents authority a to require tests andor witnessing of the system b to inspect or audit grantees books and records relating to the system  c to impose on or collect from grantee any fee penalty or other sum  d to require grantee to take or cease any action  or e any other right or authority such authority shall be coordinated by the governing bodies and shall not be used unreasonably or to harass grantee  101094   service provisions 931 performance the cable system shall be engineered installed equipped maintained and operated such as to meet fcc rules subpart k and technical standards in shall comply with all applicable federal state and local codes rules regulations and technical standards 932 itemized bills grantor shall provide all subscribers with itemized monthly bills listing each tier or level of service and its price each addon or markup and any addon taxes such as sales tax together with the total franchise fees may be listed separately and shall be included in gross receipts 933 change in channel array grantee shall provide thirty 30 days written advance notice to grantor and subscribers of any changes of channels provided or of tiering unless the schedule of such changes is beyond the control of grantee in such case grantee shall provide notification and explanation immediately by cable channel and within ten 10 days in writing to grantor and thirty 30 days to subscribers 934 rate changes 9 notice grantee shall give grantor and all subscribers at least thirty 30 days notice of any change in subscriber rates if grantor is certified by the fcc to regulate basic rates grantor may toll require additional time from the operator as provided by fcc rules subpart n 9 right to regulate grantor reserves the right to regulate rates and services as permitted by state and federal law and fcc regulations such rate regulation and administration of rate changes shall follow guidelines established by the federal communications commission and the franchise issued pursuant hereto 935 reconnection charge in the event that cable tv bills are not paid within thirty 30 days grantee shall have the right to discontinue cable tv service to the customer following thirty 30 days notice such service shall not be restored until after all pastdue bills have been paid and reimbursed to grantee including extra expenses such as special trips inspections disconnecting and reconnecting service additional clerical expenses etc incurred by grantee on account of any delinquent bills or on account of such subscribers violation of the contract for cabletv services 936 rate or service discrimination  special classifications grantee shall not subject any person or group of persons to any prejudice or disadvantage preference or advantage in connection with rates charges service facilities rules or regulations except as provided by fcc rules nothing herein shall prohibit the establishment of a graduated scale of rates for classified schedules to which any subscriber within such classification shall be entitled or the provision of free service to government institutional or school buildings or the provision of free service to employees special bulkbill rates may be applied to multipledwelling units mdus notwithstanding the foregoing grantee may negotiate bulk or special rates for businesses hospitals nursing homes multiple dwelling units and other nonsingle family residential users and may offer special rates to senior citizens and other capability challenged individuals nothing herein shall prohibit grantee from offering special promotions to attract customers if such promotions are offered uniformly and without discrimination throughout the entire territorial limits specifically grantee shall not charge different rates or provide services to subscribers in any area served by one or more competitors 937 free basic service grantee shall provide basic service without charge to each grantor government building fire station police station library school or college building and other grantorowned or grantoroccupied buildings excluding housing buildings and facilities owned by grantor but not used for government or educational instruction and administrative purposes within the territorial limits as requested by grantor one drop and one converter if needed per building shall constitute compliance any attached identified structures shall be treated as separate buildings 938 emergency power the cable distribution system shall be equipped with batterybackup power supplies capable of powering the system throughout for a period of not less than two 2 hours and the headend shall be provided with full emergencybackup power capable of powering the headend continuously in the event of power outages in the cabledistribution system beyond two 2 hours grantee shall provide for special auxiliary emergency power as required 939 emergency alert system emergency broadcast system 9 emergency alert grantee shall at grantees expense provide and install an emergency alert system for the purpose of permitting designated government officials to provide emergency information and warnings to cable subscribers the system shall provide for full audio override on all channels access to the emergency alert control shall be possible from any telephone by dialing a specific code number a codetoneoperated relay will limit access to authorized individuals emergency notification shall be supplemented with audio and visual transmission on the access and localorigination channels 9 ebs grantee shall at grantees expense provide ebs emergency broadcast system facilities and services in accordance with such rules as may be promulgated therefor by the fcc and within six 6 months after promulgation of such rules by the fcc 9310 state of the art throughout the term of the franchise grantee shall maintain and upgrade the system and the technical performance of the system so as to keep pace with developments in the stateoftheart as defined herein grantee may on its initiative participate in or undertake experiments tests and other activities to determine the stateoftheart of cable communications technology currently in use grantor may require that grantee undertake such tests to the extent grantor and grantee mutually determine that it is economically viable and feasible to do so and provided that such experiments tests and other activities are technically sound and undertaken in response to a mutuallydefined market demand grantee shall provide grantor with written reports of the results of all significant tests conducted by or in cooperation with grantee at the request of grantor as described this section 9311 subscriber antennas  ab switches notwithstanding any disconnection of subscribers existing antennas and downleads to receivers connected to the cable system the cable system shall be so designed that physical removal of such antennas and downleads will not be required and so that the subscriber may utilize such antennas at any time in place of the cable system service an antenna ab switch may be installed at the option and expense of the subscriber and shall not noticeably degrade cable system performance 9312 drops in areas where the cable distribution system is located underground drops to the structure shall be underground buried to a standard depth of twelve 12 to eighteen 18 inches in other areas drops may be aerial unless the subscriber elects to pay the cost of underground installation insofar as practicable grantee shall adhere to each subscribers desire with regard to point of entry of the drop connection into each structure insofar as practical within the subscribers structure drop cable runs shall be made as unobtrusively as possible all drops shall be grounded at the building entry in accordance with local nesc and nec requirements 9313 installation time within grantors territorial limits except as provided in section 9214 herein service to all subscribers requiring an aerial installation shall be provided within five 5 business days after receipt of the request for service and service to subscribers requiring an underground installation shall be provided within seven 7 business days after such request unless later installation is requested or agreed to by the subscriber standard installation time shall be specified and published by grantee 9314 parental guidance control grantee shall make available to any subscriber so requesting at reasonable cost a parental guidance control or lockout key which will permit the subscriber to eliminate intelligible audio and video reception of any channels as provided for and defined by the fcc grantee shall notify all subscribers of the availability of such parentalcontrol devices 9315 complaint policy grantee shall promulgate written policy statements procedures and schedules for reporting and resolving subscriber complaints and shall finnish a copy thereof to each new subscriber and to grantor and thereafter to all subscribers at least annually and to grantor and all subscribers at such time as there is any change in such policy 9316 complaint services 9 local business office grantee shall maintain a local business office or representative which subscribers may telephone during regular business hours and talk to live employees without unreasonable delay and without resorting to answering services recorded messages added message or toll charges so that catv maintenance service shall be promptly available in addition provisions shall be made by grantee for receiving and responding to service calls at all other times as used herein the words regular business hours shall be from  am to  pm on mondays tuesdays wednesdays thursdays and fridays and from  am to  pm on saturdays or some evening hours andor such other reasonable hours as may be set by grantor by future resolutions of the city commission 9 service technician availability at least one 1 service technician shall be based in the city of st augustine and all service calls shall be responded to within twentyfour 24 hours 9 subscriber awareness of procedures grantee shall inform all subscribers of its complaint procedure including telephone numbers for registering such complaints and request to make all complaints to grantee first if a complaint is made to grantor and referred from grantor to grantee grantee shall respond in writing to grantor within five 5 working days concerning the disposition of the complaint 9317 call recordlog of service calls grantee shall log all service calls and complaints received and record all telephone activity grantee shall retain all such records for a minimum of twelve 12 months such records shall be made available to grantor at any time upon request and five 5 working days notice 9318 emergency communications at least one person in responsible charge of grantees operations in the territorial limits shall be available by local telephone during such hours as grantees business office is closed and the telephone numbers of such persons shall be supplied in advance to the mayor city manager the police and fire departments 9319 reports and records 9 annual report within three 3 months of the close of its fiscal year upon written request of grantor grantee shall provide to grantor an annual report that includes the following information a a summary of the previous calendar years activities in development of the system including but not limited to services begun or dropped number of subscribers including gains and losses homes passed and miles of cable distribution plant fiber and metallic in service the summary also shall include a comparison of any construction including system upgrades during the year with any projections previously provided to grantor b a certified financial statement including a statement of income and where grantee is in a significant construction phase a statement of sources and applications of funds the statement shall include notes that specify all significant accounting policies and practices upon which it is based a summary shall be provided comparing the current year with previous years since the beginning of the franchise c a copy of updated maps depicting the location of all plant where there was construction in the year of the report d a summary of subscriber or consumer complaints identifying the number and nature of complaints and their disposition where complaints involve one or more recurrent system problems the nature of each problem and what steps have been taken to correct it shall be identified when available more detailed information on complaints shall be submitted upon request of grantor e if grantee is a corporation a list of officers and members of the board and the local officers and board members of any parent corporation  and where a parent corporations stock is publicly traded a copy of its most recent annual report f a list of all partners or known stockholders holding five 5 percent or more ownership interest in grantor andor any parent corporation  provided however when any such entity has fewer than ten 10 persons holding five 5 percent ownership interest the ten 10 largest such holders alternatively the annual ownership information required by the fcc for cable systems may be supplied g a copy of all of grantees published rules and regulations applicable to subscribers and users of the cable system h a report on the number of elderly handicapped and other subscribers receiving any rate discounts and the amount of the discounts 9 grantee books and records grantee must maintain a complete set of books and records available for inspection and audit by grantor upon reasonable notice for purposes of ascertaining compliance with requirements of this chapter and the franchise agreement such inspection and audit shall be upon reasonable notice and during normal business hours and may be undertaken for the limited purpose of ascertaining compliance with requirements of this ordinance and the franchise agreement 9 proprietary interests of grantee upon written request by grantee and to the extent allowed by applicable law information of a proprietary nature submitted to grantor pursuant to this chapter or the franchise agreement shall not be made available for public inspection if grantor finds that making public the information may cause injury to grantees business  101094   system installation conditions 941 reservation of grantors rights in public rightsofway  easements nothing in this chapter shall be construed to prevent grantor from constructing maintaining repairing or relocating sewers  grading paving maintaining repairing relocating andor altering any street  constructing laying down repairing maintaining or relocating any water mains or other facilities  or constructing maintaining relocating or repairing any sidewalk or other public work grantee shall at grantees expense move and restore or relocate its plant in time to accommodate such work and upon thirty 30 days notice by grantor all easements and rightsofway granted to or obtained by franchisees within the territorial limits andor service areas shall be nonexclusive and fully accessible by and assignable to grantor and its assigns 942 system construction  maintenance in the use of grantors streets and rightsofway the following conditions shall apply 9 plans  written notice before any construction is commenced grantee shall submit plans to grantors building officials and receive a written notice to proceed at least ten 10 days prior to such construction the building officials shall have the right to inspect all construction or installation work performed by grantee in the streets and to make such periodic inspections as grantor deems necessary to ensure compliance with the terms of the franchise granted pursuant to this chapter and other pertinent provisions of the law 9 wires cables amplifiers etc all wires cables amplifiers and other property shall be constructed and installed in an orderly and workmanlike manner all cables and wires shall be installed parallel with existing telephone and electric wires wherever possible nothing in this article or any franchise granted hereunder shall authorize grantee to erect and maintain in the territorial limits new poles where existing poles are servicing the area grantee shall obtain permission from grantor before erecting any new poles or underground conduit before grantee seeks to install any lines all installations shall be underground in those sections of the territorial limits where both telephone and electric utility service are underground at the time of installation or where subdivision or deed restrictions require utilities to be underground in sections where either telephone or electric utility facilities are aboveground at the time of installation grantee may install its service aboveground with the understanding that at such time as those facilities are required to be placed underground by grantor grantee shall likewise place its services underground without additional cost to the residents of grantor or the remainder of the franchise area it shall be the policy of grantor that underground installation even when not required is preferable to the placing of additional poles a grantee shall submit to grantor a copy of asbuilt maps at the completion of construction of the new system such maps shall be updated at least once each year thereafter b grantee shall in addition to complying with all terms and provisions of this article comply with all technical standards concerning cable tv promulgated by the federal communications commission 9 reasonable notice of plans for street improvements shall be given to grantee by grantor when paving resurfacing or repairs are involved the notice shall contain the nature and character of the improvements streets upon which the improvements are to be made the extent of the improvements and the work schedule for the project the notice shall give grantee sufficient reasonable time to make any additions alterations or repairs to its facilities as are necessary in advance of the actual commencement of the work any relocation required by grantor under this paragraph shall be at the expense of grantee 9 vacated abandoned closed discontinued etc streets and rightsofway if all or part of a street road highway or rightofway within the territorial limits is vacated abandoned closed reconstructed or discontinued the rights and privileges contained within this article with respect to streets roads or highways or any part thereof so closed or discontinued etc shall automatically cease and grantee shall not be entitled to damages from grantor due to vacating closing or discontinuance of such street road or highway or for any injury to any part of the system in the street or for the removal or relocation of lines and cables 9 buildingmoving permit grantee shall on the request of any person holding a building moving permit temporarily raise or lower its wires to permit moving of such building the expense of such temporary removal raising or lowering of wires shall be paid by the person requesting these services grantee shall have the authority to require such payment in advance grantee shall be given not less than five 5 business days advance notice of any move contemplated in order to arrange for temporary wire changes 9 tree trimming grantee shall have the responsibility to trim trees upon or overhanging streets alleys sidewalks and other public places within the territorial limits so as to prevent the branches of such trees from coming in contact with the wires and cables of grantee all trimming is to be done under the explicit prior written notification and approval of grantors building officials and be at the expense of grantee all trimming shall be performed in a safe and orderly manner and in compliance with the pruning standards of the national arborists association as amended and any applicable provisions of local codes and ordinances 9 reasonablecare disclaimer nothing contained in this section shall relieve any private person company or corporation from liability arising out of failure to exercise reasonable care to avoid injuring grantees facilities while performing any work connection with grading regrading or changing the line of any street or public place or with the construction or reconstruction of any sewer water electric or telephone system 943 underground  easements 9 underground preferred in areas having telephone and electric utility lines now or at any time hereafter underground whether required by ordinance or not all of grantees distribution system shall be underground underground installation even if not required is preferable to the placing of additional poles in the instance of underground installations made after the effective date of the franchise drop lines shall be placed at least twelve 12 inches deep and cable distribution lines shall be placed at least twentyfour 24 inches deep this minimum depth also applies to all replacement drop and distribution lines underground cable distribution plant in areas exposed to damage shall be installed in conduit or shall be of armored cable construction underwater crossings shall utilize sealed armored cable or sealed cable in conduit as specified for underwater use 9 private easements grantee shall have the responsibility for obtaining easements from property owners as needed if grantee is unable to obtain such easements at a reasonable cost and therefore cannot extend its system economically grantee will be relieved of the extension policy requiring such easements until such time that such easements can be obtained at a reasonable cost grantor shall be named in all easements and shall have the option of sharing same for purposes not competitive with grantees business 944 installation and construction rules  construction approval 9 construction approval by city engineer  correction of defects except for individual service drops grantee shall not erect any pole run any line make any attachment or commence any construction of any kind without the prior approval of the city engineer the approval as referenced herein shall be in the form of a permit issued by the city engineer upon approval of a layout maps of the system authorized by this franchise showing plant routing utility company poles to which the system facilities are to be attached and location of all trunk and distribution line amplifiers b true copies of all attachment requests by grantee and c subsequent approval by southern bell telephone and telegraph company and florida power and light company grantor shall have and maintain the right to inspect the construction operation and maintenance of the system by grantee to ensure the proper performance of the terms of this franchise or any of the rules and regulations as may be from time to time lawfully adopted grantor may immediately give to grantee thirty 30 days written notice to correct such violations and in the event grantee does not make such correction within thirty 30 days from the receipt of such written notice grantor may make such correction itself and recover the cost of same from grantee in no event shall grantee create any obstructions or conditions which are or may become dangerous to the traveling public all work of such kind shall be subject to inspection and approval by grantor in accordance with applicable codes and regulations 9 emergency repairs in cases of emergency grantee may make whatever repairs are necessary to maintain the operation of the cable system at required levels provided however that all emergency work shall comply with all applicable ordinances and regulations of grantor and grantee shall notify grantor of such work immediately upon commencement of the emergency work grantee shall be responsible for any damages resulting from temporary repairs within two 2 working days of the commencement of the emergency work grantee shall request any applicable permits for such repairs in accordance with the rules for such permits work shall be subject to inspection and approval by grantor 9 barriers  lighting  traffic control any openings or obstructions in streets caused by grantee shall be guarded and protected by grantee and its contractors at all times by placing adequate barriers fences boarding or other protective devices at the sole expense of grantee during periods of dusk and darkness protective devices and protected areas shall be designated by warning lights grantee shall provide for and pay for traffic control in construction areas as required by local ordinance 945 relocations 9 temporary relocation grantees cable distribution plant shall be located relocated erected andor maintained so as 1 not to interfere with the lives or safety of persons or with any improvements grantor deems proper to make and of which grantee has received reasonable notice and 2 not to hinder or obstruct the free use of the streets by the public removal of poles and other structures to avoid such interference shall be at grantees expense raising or lowering or moving of grantees plant to permit moving of buildings and other structures and equipment shall be done by grantee within ten 10 business days of previous notice and at movers expense subject to receipt of all required permits 9 permanent relocation if grantor shall elect to alter or change the grade or location of any street or shall engage in any construction or other public works in on or under the streets grantee upon at least sixty 60 days written notice by grantor shall relocate its cable distribution plant at its own expense and in each instance shall comply with all ordinances codes and regulations of grantor 946 installation and construction compliance with codes grantee shall comply with all applicable local state and federal rules and regulations now in force or which may be put into force hereafter grantee shall comply also with city state and national electric and safety codes in its installations and operations the right to change and adopt new rules regulations and codes for future construction from time to time is reserved to grantor such changes may become effective immediately upon adoption by grantor and notification to grantee but shall not supersede federal or state codes and regulations 947 joint use of grantee facilities  safety rules insofar as such work may be done without interfering with the free use and enjoyment of grantees own facilities wires and fixtures and when requested in writing by grantor grantee shall provide suitable space equivalent to one 1 crossarm in vertical and horizontal spacing on each pole erected by grantee in grantees riser conduits and in grantees control cabinets equivalent to one 1 duct in each of the conduits constructed by grantee and if direct burial is used shall provide one 1 grantor cable or tubing free of charge and for the purpose of carrying wires of grantors noncompetitive data alarm signal radio or other communications system provided said wires facilities or fixtures are placed and maintained in such a manner as may be reasonably prescribed by grantee and in no case used to carry electric light or highvoltage power whenever its becomes necessary for grantee to move grantors said wires for grantees own purposes such removal shall be at the cost of grantee and under supervision of the director of public works and such wires shall be promptly replaced by grantee at grantees expense 948 interconnect within six 6 months after receipt of written request from grantor and agreement by any neighboring cable operator in a contiguous or adjacent franchise area territorial limits grantee shall provide for bidirectional interconnection with such neighboring cable operator such interconnection shall be accomplished at reasonable expense to grantee including design installation and all necessary equipment hardware and accessories or shall be shared by grantee and such neighboring cable operator if reasonable terms of interconnection can not be reached between grantee and such adjacent operator within six 6 months after grantees original request then grantor shall be permitted to mediate the terms of the interconnect agreement 949 identification vehicles including all trailers and mobile tools owned or leased by grantee and used in the operation installation construction or repair of the cable system shall be identified by name address and phone number of grantee all employees of grantee and of grantees contractors and subcontractors shall wear identification badges and carry adequate identification as to their names local business addresses and local business phone numbers grantee and its contractors shall clearly identify all of its vehicles employees agents and equipment by decals badges signs and as otherwise appropriate 9410 restoration repair grantee shall repair promptly and at grantees expense all damage caused by grantee its agents contractors and subcontractors in the construction rebuild upgrade operation maintenance and repair of the cable system and shall restore all property both public and private to its original condition or as nearly so as possible such restoration and repair shall be made as soon as practicable after such damage and in accordance with applicable codes and not later than ten 10 business days after grantees receipt of written notification from grantor or the owner of the property so damaged unless otherwise mutually agreed by grantee and grantor or property owner if any damage involves pavements sidewalks driveways water mains storm or sanitary sewers streets roads or other public facilities or is deemed by grantor to be a threat to public safety such damage shall be repaired to grantors satisfaction commencing within one 1 day after grantees receipt of written notification from grantor 9411 obstruction prohibited grantee shall prevent the creation of any obstructions or conditions which are or may become dangerous to the public  101094   consumer service and repair standards 951 general grantee shall maintain and operate the system and render efficient service in compliance with such rules and regulations as are or may be set forth by the city commission the state of florida andor the fcc however grantee shall operate the system so that there will be no interference with television reception radio reception telephone communications or other installations which are now or may hereafter be installed or in use by grantor or any persons in the service area 952 maintenance and operation grantee shall promulgate and adhere to a preventive maintenance policy directed toward maximizing the reliability and maintainability of the cable system with respect to its delivery of cable service to subscribers at or above the performance standards set forth herein when it is necessary to interrupt cable service for the purpose of making repairs adjustments installations or other maintenance activities grantee shall do so at such times as will cause the least inconvenience to its subscribers generally between the hours of  pm and  am the next morning 953 office hours and telephone availability 9 the cable operator shall maintain a local tollfree or collectcall telephone line which shall be available to its subscribers twentyfour 24 hours per day seven 7 days per week office hours and telephone availability shall be provided as a minimum in accordance with fcc rules   9 grantee shall maintain an office within the city open to the public during all reasonable business hours for so long as it continues to operate the system all complaints against the company relating to its performance under the agreement including but not limited to those concerning quality of service equipment malfunction and billing disputes shall be received at the companys office by duly authorized employees the company shall endeavor to respond and satisfy any complaints within thirtysix 36 hours 9 the city manager or another official duly designated by grantor shall receive any complaints which have not been satisfied by the company and shall establish procedures for the speedy resolution of such complaints 9 trained cableoperator representatives shall be available to respond to customer telephone inquiries during normal business hours 9 after normal business hours the access line may be answered by a service person or an automated response system including an answering machine inquiries received after normal business hours must be responded to by a trained company representative on the next business day and must be listed in grantees service records and logs 9 under normal operating conditions telephone answer time by a customer representative including wait time shall not exceed thirty 30 seconds when the connection is made if the call needs to be transferred transfer time shall not exceed thirty 30 seconds these standards shall be met on no fewer than ninety 90 percent of such occasions under normal operating conditions measured on a quarterly basis 9 under normal operating conditions customers shall receive a busy signal response to less than three 3 percent of the total number of calls over any oneweek period 954 notice of repairs except in an emergency grantee shall give affected subscribers at least twentyfour 24 hours notice of any interruption of cable service for purposes of maintenance or repair in an emergency grantee shall give such notice as is reasonable in the circumstances notice given on the alphanumeric channels shall be considered sufficient when fee or more subscribers service is to be interrupted for repairs for more than three 3 hours normal scheduled service and repair shall be performed between the hours of  pm and  am the next morning 955 installations outages and service calls under normal operating conditions each of the following four 4 standards shall be met on no fewer than ninety five 95 percent of such conditions measured on a quarterly basis 9 standard installation standard aerial installation will be performed within seven 7 business days after an order has been placed standard underground installation will be performed within ten 10 business days after an order has been placed standard installations are those that are located within the territorial limits of the city of st augustine except as provided herein section 9214 9 major malfunctions  area outages grantee shall commence repairs of any major malfunctions area outages within onehalf hour after grantees discovery of such conditions 9 service interruptions excluding conditions beyond the control of grantee grantee shall begin working on service interruptions promptly and in no event later than twentyfour 24 hours after the interruption becomes known to grantee grantee must begin actions to correct other service problems the next business day after notification of the service problem 9 the appointment window alternatives for installations service calls and other installation activities shall be either a specific time or at maximum a fourhour time window during normal business hours 9 appointment cancellation grantee shall not cancel an appointment with a customer after the close of business on the business day holiday or weekend prior to the scheduled appointment 9 service calls cleared if a cable operator representative is running late for an appointment with a customer and will not be able to keep the appointment as scheduled the customer will be contacted the appointment will be rescheduled as necessary at a time which is convenient for the customer fewer than five 5 percent of such appointments shall be so delayed 9 service calls repairs cleared seventy 70 percent of all service calls shall be cleared on the same day  ninety 90 percent within three 3 working days all service calls shall be cleared within five 5 working days unless good and sufficient cause exists and is documented by grantee any service call not cleared within five 5 working days shall be reported in writing to grantor or its designated agent by grantee within two 2 working days thereafter 9 servicecall ratio as defined in section 9 shall not exceed two 2 percent or two 2 service calls truck rolls per one hundred 100 subscribers per month averaged over any threemonth period 956 communications between grantee and cable subscribers 9 notification to subscribers a grantee shall provide written information on each of the following areas at the time of installation of services at least annually to all subscribers and at any time upon request 1 products and services offered  2 prices and options for programming services and conditions of subscription to programming and other services  3 installation and service maintenance policies  4 instructions on how to use the cable service  5 channel positions of programming carried on the system  and 6 billing and complaint procedures including the address and telephone number of the local franchise authoritys cable regulation office b customers shall be notified of any change in rates programming services or channel positions as soon as possible on the cable system and in writing notice must be given to subscribers a minimum of thirty 30 days in advance of such changes if the change is within the control of grantee in addition grantee shall notify subscribers thirty 30 days in advance of any significant changes in the other information required by the preceding paragraph unless insufficient time is available to grantee to do so 9 billing bills shall be clear concise and understandable bills must be fully itemized with itemizations including but not limited to basic premium and event charges and equipment charges bills shall also clearly delineate all activity during the billing period including optional charges rebates and credits in case of a billing dispute grantee shall respond to a written complaint from a subscriber within thirty 30 days 9 refunds refund checks shall be issued promptly but no later than either a the customers next billing cycle following resolution of the request or thirtyone 31 days whichever is earlier  or b within ten 10 days of the return of the equipment supplied by grantee if service is terminated 9 credits credits for service shall be issued no later than the customers next billing cycle following the determination that a credit is warranted 957 reports to grantor grantee shall provide written notice detailing resolution of complaints within five 5 business days from written or telephone notification by grantor to grantee grantee shall provide servicecall and outage reports for time periods up to sixty 60 days to grantor upon request and five 5 business days notice 958 refund for subscriber service interruptions for any continuous service interruption or loss of service in excess of twentyfour 24 hours one day on a calendar basis grantee shall make a prorated refund of such subscribers regular monthly charge to each subscriber so affected upon written request of such subscriber the twentyfourhour period shall commence when grantee learns of such subscriber outage whether telephone oral or written notification including notification by grantees personnel such refunds shall be prorated by multiplying the applicable monthly service rate by a fraction whose numerator equals the number of days of the outage and whose denominator equals the number of days in the month of the outage grantee shall not be required to grant a refund for a subscriber outage caused by any subscriber 959 termination  prorated service in the event a subscribers service is terminated for any reason monthly charges for service shall be prorated on a daily basis where advance payment has been made by a subscriber the appropriate refund shall be made by grantee to the subscriber within thirty 30 days of such termination or in the next subscribers billing cycle unless the amount is less than five dollars $500 refund shall be made only upon return of grantors equipment 9510 disconnection for nonpayment grantee shall have the right to disconnect a subscriber for failure to pay an overdue account provided that 9 grantees billing practices and policy statements have set forth the conditions under which the account would be considered overdue and subscriber has not complied therewith  and 9 grantee mails written notice of intent to disconnect at least fifteen 15 days prior to the intended disconnection  and 9 the subscriber account is at least thirty 30 days delinquent computed from the first day of service for which payment was due 9511 records grantee shall maintain records of all service complaints by subscribers showing the date of receipt of all written complaints and identifying the subscriber the nature of the complaint and the date action was taken by grantee in response thereto together with a description of such action such records shall be kept available at grantees local office for at least one year for inspection by grantor as it may at any time and from time to time reasonably request during business hours and upon five 5 days notice grantor shall be advised of complaints which remain unresolved for a period of five 5 working days or more a monthly log of complaints and resolutions by category shall be provided upon request to grantor or its representative by grantee 9512 precedence in the event of conflict between this section 950 of this chapter and   of the fcc rules related to customerservice standards the requirements of this chapter shall take precedence  101094   privacy grantee shall comply fully with the letter and spirit of of the cable act with regard to the right of privacy of any subscriber if any device or signal associated with the cable system interferes with the right of privacy of any third party grantee shall terminate any such abuse 961 installation of equipment grantee shall install no plant on private property without first securing written permission of the owner or tenant in possession of such property or the written permission of the holder of any easement for utility lines or similar purposes and in accordance with law upon request grantee shall inform owners and tenants of the functions of all equipment installed on private property 962 monitoring neither grantee nor any of its officers employees or agents shall tap monitor or arrange for the tapping or monitoring of any drop outlet or receiver for any purpose whatsoever other than legitimate technical performance testing of the cable system or the monitoring of subscriber cable service or monitoring to prevent theft of service without prior written consent of all affected parties 963 subscriber lists or information grantee shall not sell disclose or otherwise make available or permit the use of lists of the names or addresses of its subscribers or any list or other information which identifies subscribers or subscriber viewing habits to any person or entity for any purpose whatsoever without the consent of each subscriber all in accordance with and subject to the provisions of the cable act and applicable law this provision shall not prevent grantee from performing such acts as may be necessary for the purpose of servicerelated activities including surveys and grantee promotionalmarketing activities this provision shall not prevent grantee from providing such subscriber information to grantor in confidence as required for purposes of auditing franchise fees in accordance with applicable law 964 protection of privacy grantee shall not transmit any audio video or digital signal including polling channel selections from any subscribers premises without first obtaining the written consent of that subscriber this provision is not intended to prohibit the use of transmission signals useful only for the control or measurement of signal performance and programming eg status monitoring or reception of premium programming provided that such information shall not be used except for those basic purposes grantee shall not permit the installation of any special terminal equipment in any subscribers premises which will permit transmission from subscribers premises of twoway services utilizing audio video or digital signals without first obtaining written permission from the subscriber  101094   obscenity the transmission of obscene programming is prohibited conviction of any grantee under federal or state or county or city ordinance of transmitting obscene programming will be grounds for revocation of the franchise alternatively and should such obscene video andor audio programming be permitted under the first amendment grantee shall confine such obscene programming to one or more specified channels  provide notice to all subscribers and to grantor of such program  and delete such obscene programming from a subscribers home within five 5 working days after written request by such subscriber  101094   technical requirements the signal of any broadcast television or radio station retransmitted on the cable system shall be carried without material degradation and with a quality no less than that prescribed by rules of any local federal or state regulatory agencies having jurisdiction and as specified herein the technical specifications operation and performance of the cable system shall conform at all times to the specifications established by any federal or state regulatory agencies having jurisdiction and existing on the effective date hereof or to the standards specified below whichever is of the higher quality the system shall comply fully with fcc rules subas amended grantee and grantor agree that the following minimum technical standards shall be maintained by grantees system at all times over the annual ambient temperature range normally experienced in the area notwithstanding the provisions of the cable act of 199 all specifications shall become effective immediately upon completion of rebuild of the system which will fulfill all fcc requirements and the following requirements as of the last date deadline for compliance with fcc rules or 1995 981 technical standards the system shall comply with the fcc technical standards suball technical requirements to be effective immediately as of the date of the franchise grantee shall perform yearly fccmandated testing and shall provide two 2 copies of its test reports to grantor upon request grantees system shall at all times comply with all fcc technical standards to become in effect by 199 but such to be effective immediately 982 construction standards all construction practices shall be in accordance with federal state and local statutes ordinances and regulations and in accordance with grantees construction and installation standards 9 all installation of electronic equipment shall be of a permanent nature durable and installed in accordance with the current provisions of the national electrical safety national bureau of standards and national electrical national bureau of fire underwriters as amended and as applicable to cable television 9 antenna supporting structures shall be designed for proper loading as specified by electronics industry association specification rs 222e or current version 9 antenna supporting structures shall be painted lighted erected and maintained to comply with all applicable rules and regulations of the federal aviation administration and all other applicable federal state and local codes and regulations 9 grantees cable system shall be installed located erected constructed reconstructed replaced removed repaired maintained and operated in accordance with good engineering practices work shall be performed by experienced maintenance and construction personnel grantee shall preserve and protect plants shrubbery and trees and any improvements in the tree belts and rightsofway grantee shall not interfere in any manner with the rights of any property owner or unnecessarily hinder or obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic grantee shall exercise special care in the installation construction operation maintenance modification and repair of all portions of the system located within the historical area as defined by grantor 9 grantee shall exercise reasonable care and shall adhere to industry standards in the construction operation maintenance and repair of the cable television system  101094   testing  repairs 991 test equipment  proof testing by grantee grantee shall provide and keep on hand at all times or have available within not less than ten 10 business days notice from grantor accuratelycalibrated test equipment for testing to such technical standards as set forth in section 980 above and as may be modified by the fcc or other authorized agency in the future and shall conduct proof tests to said standards as from time to time may be reasonably requested by grantor in order to determine the level of performance of the cable system grantor may provide a technical representative to witness and report on such tests as provided in section 993 below 992 reports upon request grantee shall provide copies to grantor of all testing and evaluation reports as filed with the fcc and any other government agencies 993 added proof testing should there be extended and continued evidence of substandard performance of the system proof testing for compliance with technical standards may be required by grantor who may for good cause retain an independent engineer acceptable to grantee to conduct technical performance tests of the system in addition to those conducted by grantee or to witness such tests as performed by grantee 994 failure  reimbursement if the system substantially fails to meet one or more of the technical standards during any grantorrequired test grantee shall reimburse grantor for all related costs and shall investigate and correct the cause of said failure 995 time to cure grantee shall be given a period of up to sixty 60 days to correct technicalstandard deficiencies performance testing shall be repeated upon completion of necessary repair or adjustment and a report of the second test submitted to grantor all at the expense of grantee such testing may be witnessed by grantors agent at grantees expense 996 substantial failure  breach substantial failure to comply with technical standards or repeated failure to take corrective action in the event of such failures shall constitute a substantial breach of this chapter and section 9c shall apply 997 test procedures test procedures shall generally follow the guidelines of the ncta recommended practices for measurements on cable television systems subject to fcc rules and regulations  101094   insurance  bonding 9101 insurance coverage grantee shall at its expense prior to any use of or entry upon grantors streets or property and at all times during the term of the franchise issued pursuant to this chapter maintain and provide grantor with suitable evidence of both 1 broad form contractual liability insurance coverage including indemnification obligation set forth here and 2 comprehensive general public liability insurance coverage including but not limited to motor vehicle liability coverage naming grantee its employees and affiliates as insureds and naming grantor its officers officials agents and employees as additional insureds while acting in the scope of their employment insuring against on an occurrence basis all claims loss cost damage expense and liability from loss of life or damage or injury to persons or property arising out of grantees use of grantors streets or property said policies shall have limits of not less than two million dollars $200000000 combined single limit with a fourmilliondollar $400000000 umbrella for loss of life and injury to one or more persons and for property damage as a result of one incident 9102 additional indemnification grantee shall require substantially identical indemnification and insurance coverages as set forth in sections 9101 and 9110 hereof in favor of grantor its officials officers agents and employees from any independent contractor or other entity working on its behalf in grantors rightsofway such coverages shall be in the amount of two million dollars $200000000 combined single limit with a fourmilliondollar $400000000 umbrella naming grantee grantor and their officers agents and employees as additional insureds 9103 workers compensation coverage grantee shall also maintain in full force and effect throughout the duration of this franchise sufficient workers compensation insurance coverage to protect its agents and employees as required by law 9104 construction bond grantee shall post and maintain a construction bond in favor of grantor in the amount of two million dollars $200000000 by a bonding company licensed to do business in the state of florida such construction bond shall be forfeited in proportion to the cost of the rebuild that remains incomplete as determined by an independent engineer selected and mutually agreed upon by grantor and grantee if grantee has not completed such rebuild of the system within the time permitted by the franchise and enabling documents such construction bond shall remain in effect until the system rebuild is completed and the system is satisfactorily prooftested and accepted by grantor 9105 performance bond  indemnity 9 performance bond no later than the date of execution of the franchise or enabling document pursuant to this chapter  grantee shall post and maintain at its sole cost and expense a corporate surety bond issued by a surety company authorized to do business in the state of florida and reasonably acceptable to grantor as security for the faithful performance by grantee in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and the franchise issued pursuant hereto said bond shall assure grantor of recovery of any and all liability damages losses costs and expenses sustained or suffered by grantor as the result of without limitation grantees failure to properly construct operate or maintain the cable television system as required under this chapter and the franchise
