7907 immunity from prosecution the city and any and all of its officers departments or agents and any law enforcement officer shall be immune from prosecution civil or criminal for the reasonable goodfaith trespass upon an adult entertainment establishment or sexuallyoriented business while acting within the scope of the authority set forth in this chapter i46 7907 human rights footnotes  1  state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166  discrimination fs ch 760 article i  in general secs 1611625  reserved article ii  housing discrimination footnotes  2  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 8  licenses taxation and miscellaneous business regulations ch 17  subdivisions ch 23 state law reference fair housing act fs  76020 et seq declaration of policy it is hereby declared to be the policy of the city in the exercise of its police power for the public safety public health and general welfare to assure equal opportunity to obtain adequate housing by all persons regardless of race color religion ancestry sex place of birth handicap familial status national origin or sexual orientation and to that end to eliminate discrimination in housing 416   31395   121012 definitions a the city hereby adopts by reference the intent and meaning of terms as defined by the state of florida commission on human relations and the united states department of housing and urban development regarding housing discrimination any terms found in this article that do not have a regulatory meaning pursuant to state or federal housing law shall be given the definition provided herein b the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning discriminatory housing practice means an act that is unlawful under sections 1629 1630 or 1631 dwelling means any building structure or portion thereof which is occupied as or designated or intended for occupancy as a residence by one 1 or more families and any vacant land which is offered for sale or lease for the construction or location thereon of any such building structure or portion thereof family includes a single individual handicap means that a person has a physical impairment which substantially limits one or more major life activities or that he has a record of having or is regarded as having such physical impairment person includes one or more individuals corporations partnerships associations labor organizations legal representatives mutual companies jointstock companies trusts unincorporated organizations trustees trustees in bankruptcy receivers and fiduciaries to rent includes to lease to sublease to let and otherwise to grant for a consideration the right to occupy premises not owned by the occupant sexual orientation means the inclination of an individual with respect to heterosexual homosexual and bisexual behavior 417   121012 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 exemptions a nothing in section 1629 other than protected classes as defined pursuant to state and federal law in subsection 3 shall apply to 1 any singlefamily house sold or rented by an owner provided that such private individual owner does not own more than three 3 such singlefamily houses at any one 1 time  provided further that in the case of the sale of any such singlefamily house by a private individual owner not residing in such house at the time of such sale or who was not the most recent resident of such house prior to such sale the exemption granted by this subsection shall apply only with respect to one 1 such sale within any twentyfourmonth period  provided further that such bona fide private individual owner does not own any interest in nor is there owned or reserved on his behalf under any express or voluntary agreement title to any right to all or a portion of the proceeds from the sale or rental of more than three 3 such singlefamily houses at any one 1 time  provided further that after  the sale or rental of any such singlefamily house shall be excepted from the application of this article only if such house is sold or rented a without the use of any manner of sales or rental facilities or the sales or rental services of any real estate broker agent or salesman or of such prohibit the use of attorneys escrow agents abstractors title companies and other such professional assistance as necessary to perfect or transfer the title  or 2 rooms or units in dwellings containing living quarters occupied or intended to be occupied by no more than four 4 families living independently of each other if the owner actually maintains and occupies one 1 of such living participated as principal in three 3 or more transactions involving the sale or rental of any dwelling or any interest therein  or 2 he has within the preceding twelve 12 months participated as agent other than in the sale of his personal residence in providing sales or rental facilities or sales or rental services in two 2 or more transactions involving the sale or rental of any dwelling or any association or society or any nonprofit institution or organization operated supervised or controlled by or in conjunction with a religious organization association or society from limiting the sale giving preference to its members 418   31395   121012 discrimination in the sale or rental of housing as made applicable by section 1628 and except as exempted by sections 1628a and 1632 it shall be attempt to induce any person to sell or rent any dwelling by representations regarding the entry or prospective entry into the neighborhood of a person or persons of a particular race color religion responsibility for administering this article shall be with the city commission b the city commission may delegate its functions duties and powers to an appointed board including functions duties and powers with respect to investigating conciliating hearing determining ordering certifying reporting or otherwise acting as to any work business or matter under this article c the city commission or its appointed board shall 1 implement the provisions of this article and rules and regulations promulgated hereunder and all ordinances codes rules and regulations pertaining to housing discrimination 2 receive initiate and investigate any and all complaints alleging violations of this article and take appropriate action to eliminate conciliate prevent andor initiate prosecution of any such violations 3 provide assistance in all matters relating to equal housing opportunity 4 publish and disseminate public information and educational materials relating to housing discrimination 5 enter into written working agreements as may be necessary to effectuate the purposes of this article with federal state and county agencies involved in reducing housing discrimination 6 administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of evidence before it by subpoenas issued by the mayor or chairman of its appointed board 7 take other informational educational or persuasive actions to implement the purposes of this article 422   121012 procedure a any person aggrieved by an unlawful practice prohibited by this article must file a written complaint with the city commission or its appointed board within fortyfive 45 days after the alleged unlawful practice occurs b upon receipt of a complaint the city commission or its appointed board shall serve upon the individual charged with a violation hereinafter referred to as the respondent the complaint and a written resume setting forth the rights of the parties including but not limited to the right of the respondent to a hearing on the matter before adjudication by the city commission or its appointed board c the city commission or its appointed board shall immediately investigate the complaint within sixty 60 days from the date of the receipt of the complaint the city commission or its appointed board shall establish written report with findings of fact d copies of the city commission or its appointed boards report shall be sent to the complainant and the respondent either may within ten 10 days after such service request a hearing before the city commission e when the complainant or the respondent requests a hearing by the city commission or its appointed board or when the commission or its appointed board itself determines that a hearing is desirable the commission or its appointed board shall call and conduct such hearing in accordance with subsection i below f the city commission or its appointed board shall carry into execution the actions specified in its report or if a hearing is held shall carry into execution the actions determined upon by the commission or its appointed board in the hearing g the city commission or its appointed board in its review or its hearing may determine 1 that the complaint lacks ground upon which to base action for violation of this article  or 2 that the complaint has been adequately dealt with by conciliation of the parties  or 3 that the complainant may pursue a private cause of action against the offending party in the appropriate court  or 4 that the complaint should be referred to the state of florida commission on human relations and the united states department of housing and urban development for agency review and potential enforcement action in some cases both conciliation and adjudicative orders or both adjudicative orders and initiation of court action may be indicated h if the city commission or its appointed board issues an adjudicative order to correct adjust conciliate prevent or prohibit any unlawful act prohibited by this article and the respondent refuses or fails to comply with or obey such adjudication the commission or its appointed board shall forthwith notify the complainant of his or her right to pursue a private cause of action or refer the complaint to the state of florida commission on human relations and the united states department of housing and urban development for agency review and potential enforcement action the city commission or its appointed board shall at all times provide the complainant with full and timely information as to all the alternatives available to him or her under local state and federal law including assistance to initiate judicial action if desired under the circumstances i the provisions of rule  florida rules of civil procedure shall govern the computation of any period of time prescribed by this article j all papers or pleadings required by this article to be served may be served by certified mail or in accordance with the provisions of rule b florida rules of civil procedure k notwithstanding any provisions to the contrary the following procedures shall apply to complaints alleging discrimination based on sexual orientation 1 until such time as the state of florida or united states government include sexual orientation within protected classes of individuals for the purpose of housing discrimination the sole local government remedy available to the complainant shall be a conciliation agreement or private cause of action against the offending party in the appropriate court 2 the complainant or respondent may request a voluntary administrative meeting with the city manager and city attorney or their designees as an alternative procedure to the city commission hearing provided for in sections 1633 and 1634 such administrative meeting may result in a voluntary conciliation agreement between the parties in lieu of a local conciliation order 423   121012 hearings before the city commission a when a hearing is required before the commission or its appointed board as specified in section 1633e above the commission or its appointed board shall schedule the hearing and serve upon all interested parties a notice of time and place of the hearing the hearing shall be held promptly but not less than fifteen 15 days after service of such notice and of the commission or its appointed boards written report section 1633d above b the parties or their authorized counsel may file such statements with the city commission or its appointed board prior to the hearing date as they deem necessary in support of their positions the parties may appear before the commission or its appointed board in person or by duly constituted representative and may have the assistance of attorneys the parties may present testimony and evidence and the right to cross examine witnesses shall be preserved all testimony shall be given under oath or by affirmation the commission or its appointed board shall not be bound by strict rules of evidence prevailing in courts of law or equity but due process shall be observed the commission or its appointed board shall keep a full record of the hearing which records shall be public and open to inspection by any person  and upon request by any principal party to the proceedings the commission or its appointed board shall furnish such party a copy of the hearing record at cost the constitutional rights of the respondent not to incriminate himself shall be scrupulously observed c the city commission or its appointed board shall make a finding of fact and a determination of action to be taken section 1633g above d the city commission or its appointed board may issue subpoenas to compel access to or the production or appearance of premises records documents individuals and other evidence or possible sources of evidence relative to the complaint at issue e upon written application to the city commission or its appointed board a respondent shall be entitled to the issuance of a reasonable number of subpoenas by and in the name of the commission or to the same extent and subject to the same limitations as subpoenas issued by the commission or its appointed board itself subpoenas issued at the request of a respondent shall show on their face the name and address of such respondent and shall state that they were issued at his request f witnesses summoned by subpoena of the city commission or its appointed board shall be entitled to the same witness and mileage fees as are witnesses in proceedings in the state courts fees payable to a witness summoned by a subpoena issued at the request of a respondent shall be paid by him unless he is indigent in which case the city shall bear the cost of the fees g within ten 10 days after service of a subpoena upon any person such person may petition the city commission or its appointed board to revoke or modify the subpoena the commission or its appointed board shall grant the petition if it finds that the subpoena requires appearance or attendance at an unreasonable time or place that it requires production of evidence which does not relate to any matter under investigation that it does not describe with sufficient particularity the evidence to be produced that compliance would be unduly onerous or for other good reason h in case of refusal to obey a subpoena the city commission or its appointed board or the person at whose request it was issued may petition for its enforcement in the appropriate court 424   121012 other remedies nothing in this article shall prevent any person from exercising any right or seeking any remedy to which he might otherwise be entitled or from filing of any complaint with any other agency or any court having jurisdiction 425   121012 report to real estate commission if a real estate broker a real estate salesman or an employee thereof has been found to have committed an unlawful practice in violation of this article or has failed to comply with an order issued by the city commission or its appointed board the commission or its appointed board shall in addition to the other procedures set forth herein report the facts to the state real estate commission 426   121012 licenses taxation and miscellaneous business regulations footnotes  1  cross reference finance  271 et seq  advertising and signs ch 3  alcoholic beverages ch 4  contractors plumbers and electricians  8381 et seq  cable television ch 9  franchises ch 14  housing discrimination  1626 et seq  vehicles for hire ch 27 state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166 article i  in general determination of good moral character a when used as a requirement to obtain a business or occupation license or permit the phrase good moral character shall be construed to mean the propensity on the part of the person to serve the public in the licensed area in a fair honest and open manner b a judgment of guilt in a criminal prosecution or a judgment in a civil action shall not be used in and of itself as proof of a persons lack of good moral character it may be used as evidence in the determination and when so used the person shall be notified and shall be permitted to rebut the evidence by showing that at the current time he has the ability to and is likely to serve the public in a fair honest and open manner  that he is rehabilitated or that the substance of the former offense is not reasonably related to the occupation or profession for which he seeks to be licensed c the following criminal records shall not be used by the city in a determination of good moral character 1 records of and arrest not followed by a conviction 2 records of a conviction which has been reversed or vacated including the arrest records relevant to that conviction the term vacated does not include expungement 3 records of an arrest or conviction for a misdemeanor or a felony unrelated to the persons likelihood to serve the public in a fair honest and open manner d when a person is found to be unqualified for a license or permit because of a lack of good moral character or similar criteria the person shall be furnished by the city clerk with a statement to this effect the statement shall contain a summary of the evidence upon which the determination was based the person shall be entitled as of right to a rehearing on the issue before the city clerk if he has relevant evidence not previously considered regarding his qualifications property insurance premiums tax a there is hereby assessed and imposed on every insurance company corporation or other insurer now engaged in carrying on or who shall hereafter engage in or carry on the business of insuring property against loss or damage by fire or tornado an excise or license tax amounting to one and eightyfive hundredths 185 percent of the gross amount of receipts of premium from policyholders on all premiums collected on fire and tornado insurance policies covering property within the corporate limits of the city the definition of property insurance in section 20192 applies to this section b the excise taxes herein assessed and imposed shall be in addition to any other license taxes now levied by the city c the excise tax herein provided for shall be payable and collected in the manner provided for by law 2015 2017 2018 121487   111488 state who shall hereafter engage in or carry on the business of casualty insurance as defined in fs  18502 as shown by the records of the state treasurer in his capacity as state insurance commissioner an excise or license tax in addition to any license or excise tax now levied by the city amounting to 085 percent of receipts of premiums from policyholders on all premiums collected on casualty insurance policies covering property within the corporate limits of the city 2024 111488 state law reference local tax authorized fs  18508 regulatory licenses a definition as used herein the term regulatory license shall refer to any license or permit issued pursuant to the provisions of chapter 8 25 or 27 or article v or vi of this chapter b violation of shall be grounds for revocation or suspension of a regulatory license for a person holding such a license to violate any provisions of this to the duties or responsibilities of a person holding such a regulatory license in the event the city manager shall determine that any person holding a regulatory license shall have violated any of the provisions of this to the duties or responsibilities of a person holding such a license the city manager shall furnish by certified or registered mail the license holder with a notice of violation the notice shall specify the violation believed by the city manager to have occurred and shall provide that unless the holder of such license shall request in writing a hearing before the city manager within ten 10 days from receipt of such notice that the license of such individual shall be suspended or revoked as hereinafter provided in the event the license holder requests a hearing before the city manager within ten 10 days any suspension or revocation shall be stayed pending final determination at the end of such hearing or such other appeal to the city commission which may be taken c hearing procedure at any hearing herein provided a license holder shall have the right to produce witnesses crossexamine witnesses and be represented by counsel in the event of an adverse decision by the city manager the license holder shall have the right to an appeal to the city commission provided such an appeal is filed with the city manager within thirty 30 days of the action which is the subject of such appeal such appeal shall stay all administrative proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed until such time as a final determination has been made by the city commission on such appeal the city commission shall within fifteen 15 days after receipt of such appeal set a reasonable time for a public hearing the city commission shall find whether in its opinion an error was made within the terms of this section and may affirm reverse or modify the action appealed as it deems just and equitable d penalties for the first violation of this a regulatory license may be suspended for a period not to exceed thirty 30 days  for a second such offense such regulatory license may be suspended for a period not to exceed sixty 60 days  and for a third such offense such regulatory license shall be revoked a new license may not be applied for a period of one 1 year from the date of such revocation at which time the license holder must comply with all requirements for the issuance of a license including any applicable examinations if any 5 state law reference regulatory fees authorized fs   secs 1751730  reserved article ii  public service tax footnotes  2  state law reference public service tax authorized fs   et seq fuel oil and kerosene subject to tax a it is hereby found and determined by the city commission that any sale made within the corporate limits of the city of fuel oil and kerosene used for the purpose of heating as compared with the sale of gas or electricity used for the purpose of heating is a competitive utility service and is subject to the tax on public services b for the purposes of this article ii public service tax the following definitions shall apply 1 heating shall mean and encompass the increase of energy and temperature applied to any material or object including but not limited to gases fluids and solids 2 purchase shall mean a transaction whereby a vendor of electricity metered or bottled gas fuel oil or kerosene delivers to a customer a defined quantity of the purchased quantity for a defined price each transaction of the sale and delivery of a stated quantity shall be considered a separate purchase for the purposes of calculating the public service tax    62209 levy of tax  manner of payment a there is hereby imposed and levied by the city on each and every purchase of fuel oil and kerosene used for the purpose of heating electricity and metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured within the corporate limits of the city a tax based upon the charge made by the seller of such utility services as follows 1 on each purchase of electricity ten 10 percent of all charges 2 on each such purchase of metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured a ten 10 percent on the first one hundred dollars $10000 or fraction thereof b one 1 percent on the balance of all charges over one hundred dollars $10000 in amount 3 on each such purchase of fuel oil and kerosene used for the purpose of heating a four cents $004 per gallon on the first two hundred thirty 230 gallons sold or fraction thereof b fourtenths of one cent $ per gallon on the balance of all gallons sold over two hundred thirty 230 gallons in amount b such taxes shall in every case be collected from the purchaser of such utility services and paid by such purchaser for the use of the city to the seller of such electricity gas or fuel oil or kerosene for heating at the time of the purchaser paying the charge therefor to the seller thereof but not less often than monthly    62209   82409   92815 duty of seller as to collection of taxes  liability for failure to collect  proceedings to collect tax each and every seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured or fuel oil or kerosene used for the purpose of heating in the city is hereby designated as the tax collection medium or agency for the city for the collection reporting and paying over to the city of the taxes hereby imposed and levied it shall be the duty of every such seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured or fuel oil or kerosene used for the purpose of heating in acting as the tax collection medium or agency for the city to collect from the purchaser for the use of the city the tax hereby imposed and levied at the time of collecting the sellers charges from the purchaser for such commodities or utility services and to report and pay over on or before the fifteenth day of each calendar month to the city director of financial services all such taxes collected during the preceding calendar month it shall be unlawful for any seller to collect the price of any sale of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured or fuel oil or kerosene used for the purpose of heating in the city without at the same time collecting the tax hereby imposed and levied in respect to such sale any seller failing to collect such tax at the time of collecting the sellers charges from the purchaser for such commodities or utility services shall be liable to the city for the amount of the tax hereby imposed and levied in like manner as if the same had been actually paid to the seller the city manager shall bring all suits and actions and take all such proceedings in the name of the city as may be necessary for the recovery of the tax  provided however that the seller shall not be liable for the payment of such tax upon uncollected bills  discontinuance of service for failure to pay bill if any purchaser shall fail neglect or refuse to pay to the seller the sellers charge and the tax hereby imposed as required or either the seller shall have the right power and authority to immediately discontinue further service to such purchaser until such tax and the sellers charge shall have been paid in full  records to be kept by seller  inspection  transcripts each and every seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured and fuel oil and kerosene used for the purpose of heating in the city shall keep complete records showing all purchases in the city of such commodities or utility services which records shall show the price charged upon each sale the date thereof and the date of payment thereof and such records shall be kept open for inspection by the director of financial services and any duly authorized agent or agents of the city during business hours on all business days the city officials and duly authorized agents of the city and each of them shall have the right power and authority to make such transcripts thereof during such times as they may desire  exemptions  governmental agencies federal state county and municipal governments and their commissions and agencies and other taxsupported bodies public corporations authorities boards and commissions are hereby exempted from the payment of the taxes imposed and levied by this article  computation of tax where seller collects at monthly periods in all cases where the seller of electricity metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured or fuel oil or kerosene used for the purpose of heating collects the price thereof at monthly periods the tax imposed and levied by this article may be computed on the aggregate amount of purchases during such period  provided that the amount of tax to be collected shall be the nearest whole cent to the amount computed  local communications services tax rate a intent 1 it is the intent of the city commission of the city to increase its local communications services tax rate as provided in section 13 enrolled cscssb 1878 by the 2001 florida legislature enrolled cscssb 1878 provides that notwithstanding any provision of fs chapter 202 to the contrary any municipality that has a local communications services tax conversion rate established under fs  20220 which is less than the maximum rate established under fs  20219 may by resolution or ordinance increase its rate up to the maximum rate established under fs  20219 with such increased rate to be effective  for the period beginning on  and ending  the maximum rate established under fs  20219 is deemed to be the sum of such maximum rate plus the difference between the conversion rates set forth in paragraphs a and b of fs  202201 the municipality must notify the department of revenue of such increased rate by certified mail postmarked on or before  2 it is the further intent of the city commission of the city to increase its local communications services tax rate effective  as provided in fs  202192a to the maximum tax rate of up to five and onetenth 51 percent for municipalities that choose not to levy permit fees b increased local communications services tax rate 1 the local communications services tax conversion rate established under fs  202201a for the city is four and eighttenths 48 percent which is less than the maximum rate of five and fourtenths 54 percent as determined under the provisions of section 13 enrolled cscssb 1878 the local communications services tax rate for the city is increased to five and fourtenths 54 percent during the period beginning on  and ending  as provided in section 13 enrolled cscssb 187 this increased rate is to be effective  2 the local communications services tax conversion rate established under fs  202201b for the city is four and fivetenths 45 percent which is less than the maximum rate of five and onetenth 51 percent as established in fs  202192a the local communications services tax rate for the city is increased to five and onetenth 51 percent this increased rate is to be effective     2 62501 permit fees from providers of communications services a intent it is the intent of the city commission of the city to make an election under fs 3c1 2000 as amended by section 34 enrolled cscssb 1878 by the 2001 florida legislature regarding whether to require and collect permit fees from any providers of communications services that use or occupy municipal roads or rightsofway for the provision of communications services b election not to require and collect permit fees the city commission of the city hereby elects not to require and collect permit fees from any provider of communications services that uses or occupies municipal roads or rightsofway for the provision of as amended by an amount of twelveone hundredths 012 percent and this election shall take effect   62501 secs 17401760  reserved article iii  business taxes footnotes  3  editors note the effective date for this article is  state law reference local business tax act fs ch 205 definitions for the purpose of this article the following words shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this section unless the context requires otherwise business tax means the fees charged and the method by which the city grants the privilege of engaging in or managing any business profession or occupation within its jurisdiction it does not mean any fees or taxes paid to any board commission or officer for permits registration examination or inspection unless otherwise provided by law these are deemed to be regulatory and in addition to but not in lieu of any business tax imposed under the provisions of this chapter merchandise means any goods wares commodities and items more specifically enumerated hereinbelow bought or sold in the usual course of business or trade merchants means any person engaged in the business of selling merchandise at retail or wholesale and when used in this article shall include manufacturers and distributors of ice cream bakery products artificial stone manufacturers marble granite or stone works or stone cutters coffee roasters or job printers it shall include restaurants or persons selling food it shall also include manufacturers and distributors not otherwise specifically provided for in this article it shall also include undertakers and other service establishments including professions it shall also include processors such as blenders of feed or flour planers or shapers of lumber and other persons who do not create an entirely new or different article person means any individual firm partnership joint adventure syndicate or other group or combination acting as a unit association corporation estate trust business trust trustee executor administrator receiver or other fiduciary and includes the plural as well as the singular receipt means the document that is issued by the city which bears the words business tax receipt and evidences that the person in whose name the document is issued has complied with the provisions of this chapter relating to the business tax retail merchant means any merchant who sells to the consumer for any purpose other than resale except that sales to manufacturers and sales to the united states government state or any political subdivision of either of them shall be considered wholesale sales sale means the transfer of ownership title or possession transfer exchange or barter whether conditional or otherwise for a consideration wholesale merchant means any merchant who sells to another for the purpose of resale  121106 tax levied a a business tax is levied upon 1 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any business within its jurisdiction 2 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any profession or occupation within its jurisdiction 3 any person who does not qualify under the provisions of subsection 1 or subsection 2 and who transacts any business or engages in any occupation or profession in interstate commerce if such business tax is not prohibited by us const art i  8 b each of such amounts unless otherwise specifically stated shall be the amounts payable as a business tax for exercising such privilege or carrying on or engaging in such business profession or occupation mentioned for the year beginning october 1 it shall be unlawful for any person to carry on or engage in any business profession or occupation herein prescribed and designated without having first paid the business tax as provided in section 1773 and complied with the terms of this article no receipt shall be issued for more than one 1 year and all receipts shall expire on october 1 of each year  121106 state law reference levy of business tax authorized fs   owner of regularly established place of business may classify self any person specifically classified in this article and having a fixed flat business tax fee imposed who maintains a regularly established place of business in the city and who keeps complete records of all business transacted and which business by the nature thereof is capable for the purpose of this article of being classed as a merchant may elect to classify himself as a retail or wholesale merchant as the case may be by complying with the requirements of this article for merchants and pay on the basis of the merchants rate in lieu of the fixed or flat rate  provided however that in the event of such election the election provided for in this section shall not apply to or be exercised by any dealer or handler of alcoholic beverages  121106 when tax due and payable  quarter and half year receipts the business taxes required by this article shall be due and payable on the first day of october of each year unless otherwise provided herein  except a business that shall begin between april 1 and september 30 may secure a receipt of onehalf of the amount provided unless otherwise provided for herein if such business begins before july 1 and onequarter of the amount provided if such business begins on or after july 1  121106 state law reference due date of business tax and provisions for proration authorized fs   report of taxpayer  inspection and investigation by city finance director each person required to pay a business tax required by this article shall report to the city comptroller giving all the information necessary for a proper determination therein of the amount of business tax due the city comptroller is authorized to propound interrogatories and to furnish forms for the filing of the returns and to require the giving of any information necessary to enable him or his authorized deputy to determine the proper amount of business tax due the city comptroller or his authorized deputy is authorized upon motion of the city commission to make such investigation and inspection of the place of business and records of the persons required to pay a business tax as he may determine necessary in order to verify any return or determine the proper business tax amount  121106 separate receipt required for each location when any person operates any of the businesses provided for in this article at more than one 1 location each location shall be considered a separate business and a separate receipt therefor shall be required unless otherwise provided for herein all receipts may be transferred to new owners when there is a bona fide sale of the business upon payment of a transfer fee of three dollars $300 and presentation of evidence of the sale and the original receipt upon written request and presentation of the original receipt any receipt may be transferred from one location to another location upon payment of a transfer fee of three dollars $300  121106 state law reference receipt transfer fs  2 3 use permit and certificate of occupancy required notwithstanding any other provision of this article no business tax receipt shall be issued for any location unless and until a use permit has been issued by the planning and building department pursuant to chapter 28 and a certificate of occupancy has been issued pursuant to section 865  121106 powers of city commission the adoption of this article and schedule of business taxes shall not abridge the right of the city commission to change alter increase decrease or revoke any of the business taxes provided for herein at any time  or to pass other ordinances provided for excise or business taxes or other liens or assessments whether pertaining to any of the subjects contained or provided for in this not and the same shall not affect any of the matters or provisions of this specifically so stated  121106 business tax not to affect other tax levies business taxes imposed and collected by this article shall not be construed to exempt from other forms of taxation the property used in the licensed business or occupation  121106 delinquent payments  penalty all receipts under this article shall be sold beginning september 1 of each year and shall be due and payable on october 1 of each year and shall expire on september 30 of the succeeding year those receipts not renewed by october 1 shall be considered delinquent and subject to a delinquency penalty of ten 10 percent for the month of october plus an additional five 5 percent penalty for each month of delinquency thereafter until paid  provided that the total delinquency penalty shall not exceed twentyfive 25 percent of the business tax fee for the delinquent establishment nothing in this section however shall be construed as being a bar or waiver of the right of prosecution or enforcing any other penalty provided by this article or otherwise provided by law any person owing a delinquent business tax shall be required to pay such business tax before being issued a new receipt  121106 state law reference similar provisions fs   liability of corporate officers or agents and firms it shall be the duty of all officers and agents of corporations to see that all such corporations comply with the provisions of this article all officers or agents of any corporation required by this article to pay a business tax which shall carry on or conduct any business without having made the payments and otherwise complied with the terms of this article shall be subject to the same penalty imposed upon persons violating the provisions of this article members of any firm who neglect to comply with the provisions of this article shall likewise be subject to the same penalty imposed upon persons violating the provisions hereof in the absence of any owner proprietor manager or agent any person operating or in charge of any business being conducted without the requirements of this article having been complied with shall be subject to the same penalty imposed upon persons violating the provisions of this article  121106 engaging in business without a receipt  failure to comply it shall be unlawful for any person to exercise any of the privileges or to carry on engage in or conduct any of the businesses occupations or professions specifically enumerated in section 1773 without paying a business tax at the time and in the manner herein provided or fail to make reports to the city comptroller as provided herein or to violate any other provision of this article  121106 business tax schedule a a business tax is hereby levied per collector the city commission may by resolution designate the tax collector of the county as the city tax collector for the purposes of this article and in such event all references herein to the city comptroller shall apply to and mean the county tax collector  121106 penalty a any person engaged in or conducting a business profession or occupation subject to the provisions of this article failing or refusing to make any report as herein required to be made or failing or refusing to furnish a supplemental report or other data required by the city comptroller or who shall violate any provision of this article or fail to pay the business taxes due by such person under the provisions of this article or shall secure any business tax receipt as herein provided for upon false or fraudulent application or who shall conduct a business profession or occupation without first obtaining the business tax receipt herein provided shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided in section 18  provided that furnishing false information shall be considered a separate offense  and that each day any person shall fail to report  or each day failing to make payment of any business tax due and payable hereunder  or each day failing or refusing to furnish information requested by the city comptroller  or each day failing or refusing to permit inspection of his place of business or records shall be considered separate offenses and violations of this article and subject to the penalties herein provided b any person engaging in or managing any business occupation or profession without first obtaining a business tax receipt required herein shall be subject to penalty of twentyfive 25 percent of the business tax determined to be due in addition to any other penalty provided herein  121106 secs 17761795  reserved article iv  auctions and auctioneers footnotes  4  state law reference auctioneers fs   et seq business license required  fee  etc no person shall offer for sale or sell at public auction or sales wherein competitive bidding is used any goods wares or merchandise without first having obtained from the city a license to engage in such business profession or occupation such license tax is hereby fixed in the amount of three hundred seventyfive dollars $37500 such license tax shall be payable at the time and in the manner of other licenses generally and such license shall be subject to the provisions applicable to other licenses generally as provided by the ordinances of the city except that same shall be issued for the full year only and shall not be prorated or transferred  auctioneer license  fee  etc no person shall engage in or manage the business profession or occupation of auctioneer by offering to sell or selling at public auction or sales wherein competitive bidding is used any goods wares or merchandise for his own gain or profit or for a fee or commission for his services without first having obtained from the city finance director a license to engage in or manage the business profession or occupation of auctioneer the license tax to be paid for engaging in the business profession or occupation of auctioneer is hereby fixed in the amount of one hundred dollars $10000 such license tax shall be payable at the time and in the manner of other licenses except that same shall be issued for the full year only and shall not be prorated or transferred  judicial livestock produce etc sales excepted the provisions of this article shall not extend or apply to sales of livestock or farm produce or to judicial sales sales under executions executors or administrators sales or sales to satisfy liens as provided for under the law of the state or any sales conducted pursuant to the order of any court  sales included the provisions of this article shall extend and apply to all auction sales and all sales wherein competitive bidding is used notwithstanding the fact that the purchaser may be entitled to a refund  penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided by section 18  secs 1710117120  reserved article v  guides footnotes  5  cross construction generally  12 examinationrules governing the city manager of the city shall have authority to promulgate rules governing the examination of applicants for license as guides the and their licenses are not revoked    4896 license and identification badge required no person shall accept compensation for performing the duties of a guide as defined within this chapter without augustine    4896 issuance of license  fee the license required by this article shall be issued annually by the city director of financial services upon payment in advance into the city treasury by record of licenses issued under this article by name and number shall be kept by the city director of financial services  conviction of felony or crime of moral turpitude any person applying for a license as a guide under this chapter shall consent to a criminal records search by the city of st augustine police department for the purpose of determining whether or not such person has been convicted of a felony or a crime of moral turpitude for the purpose of this section a crime of moral turpitude shall include any crime involving sexual offenses theft burglary perjury or other crime involving dishonest or deceit the city commission may after notice and hearing revoke the license of or deny the issuance of a license to any person who is convicted of a crime described in this section  4896 secs 1713017150  reserved article vi  pawnbrokers junk dealers and secondhand dealers footnotes  6  state law reference pawnbrokers secondhand dealers etc fs ch 538 compliance all persons managing owning maintaining or doing a pawnbroking salvage and wrecking business operating a secondhand store or operating a junk business in the city shall comply with the terms of this article  license requiredjunk gatherers every junk gatherer for each wagon or other vehicle used in gathering junk or any person where no vehicle is used shall be required to obtain a regulatory license  samejunk dealers it shall be unlawful for any junk dealer to take buy or in any manner receive any junk from any person engaged in the business of gathering junk unless such person is a licensed junk gatherer  responsibility of owners etc for employees or agents any owner manager or operator of the businesses herein regulated whose employees or agents fail to observe any of the provisions of this article shall be equally guilty with the offender and subject to the same penalties  effect of noncompliance refusal to keep records etc any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this article or fail or refuse to keep the books and records in connection with his business as provided for herein or who shall make false entries concerning the transactions named or who shall fail or refuse to permit an inspection and examination of such books of the property pledged with or sold to him by any police officer as provided shall upon conviction be punished as provided in section 18 of this  records to be kept all pawnbrokers salvage and wrecking dealers secondhand dealers and junk dealers shall keep books in connection with their business wherein shall be entered an accurate description of all property pledged or sold to them giving the name and address of the person pledging or selling same and the place where the same occurs and in the case of watches motors and other articles having identification letter or number the name of the maker and the number of the piece and in all cases all property shall be as accurately and fully described as the nature of the article permits and in such books there shall also be entered a general description of the person by whom same is deposited or sold and the time when the same was done and the explanation given by the person as to the source of such articles these entries shall be made as soon after any transaction as possible in no event allowing more than one 1 hour to elapse after such transaction before the above provided entry is made concerning the same  inspection of records and articles the records required by section 17156 and the articles themselves so pledged or sold shall at all reasonable times be subject to inspection and examination by the police officers of the city or the county sheriff and his deputies or any other law enforcement officer in the city all pawnbrokers salvage and wrecking dealers secondhand dealers and junk dealers shall have their goods arranged in stock so as to enable the same to be inspected by the law enforcement officials and those in their company it shall be unlawful for any such dealer to refuse to admit such officer to such place of business to inspect such property  daily list of purchases to be furnished to police all pawnbrokers salvage and wrecking dealers secondhand dealers and junk dealers shall furnish to the chief of police a full and complete list each day of every article taken in pawn or bought by such dealers giving a full description of same maker marks number brand monogram or letter of any kind on such articles so pawned or brought by such dealer together with the name and address of the person from whom such article was secured any such dealer refusing or failing to furnish such list shall be deemed guilty of a violation of this section  retention period all property shall be held in an unaltered condition in the local store or warehouse for a period of at least ten 10 days before it is sold or disposed of or moved out of the city  order stopping sale etc of property any law enforcement official shall have the right upon written order addressed to a particular pawnbroker or dealer to stop the sale or removal or redelivery of any property for a stated period of time or until the property is released by such officer after receipt of such order it shall be unlawful for a pawnbroker or dealer to sell dispose of remove or redeliver such property until the property is released by the officer issuing the order  dealing with minorsjunk dealers it shall be unlawful for any junk dealer or any person who manages superintends or is in charge of any business conducted by a junk dealer in the city or for any agent or employee clerk or other person employed by any junk dealer in the city or for any person who drives and operates any vehicle engaged in or used by any junk dealer in any junk business in the city to take buy or in any manner receive or come into the possession of any kind of junk within the corporate limits of the city from any person who is under the age of eighteen 18 years  sameother licensees it shall be unlawful for any owner manager or employee of any of the businesses regulated hereby except junk dealers provision for which has been made in section 17161 to buy or receive from any person under eighteen 18 years of age any goods chattels or other property unless such person shall have in his possession the written consent of his parent or guardian provided that this provision shall not apply to any person under eighteen 18 years of age who is married or who has had the disabilities of nonage removed  secs 1716317185  reserved article vii  reserved footnotes  7  editors note  adopted  repealed  1718617210 which pertained to peddlers see table for complete derivation secs 1718617230  reserved article viii  solicitors and canvassers division 1  generally definition for the purposes of this article a solicitor or canvasser is defined as any person traveling either by foot wagon automobile motor truck or any other type of conveyance from place to place from house to house or from street to street within the city taking or attempting to take orders for sale of goods wares merchandise and personal property of any nature whatsoever for future delivery or for services to be furnished or performed in the future and who receives or attempts to receive money for same whether or not such individual has carries or exposes for sale a sample of such subject for sale or whether he is collecting in advance payments on such sales or not provided that such definition shall include any person who for himself or for another person hires leases uses or occupies any building structure tent house trailer hotel room lodging room apartment shop or other place within the city for the sole purpose of exhibiting samples and taking orders for future delivery excepting therefrom any person operating installment purchase plans or layaway plans who maintains an inventory of goods wares merchandise or other personal property in the city and who immediately delivers same to the purchaser upon receipt of the full purchase price  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 relation of article to license taxes this article is not intended to and shall not be so construed as to in any manner affect change modify or amend any ordinance of the city relating to occupational licenses  penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided in section 18 and shall be subject to revocation of any license issued to such person under this article  itinerant solicitors etc going on premises uninvitednuisance the practice of going in and upon private residences in the city by itinerant solicitors itinerant peddlers itinerant hawkers itinerant merchants and transient vendors of merchandise not having been requested or invited to do so by the owners or occupants of such private residence for the purpose of soliciting orders for the sale of goods wares and merchandise or for the purpose of disposing of or peddling or hawking the same is hereby declared to be a nuisance and shall be punishable as provided in section 18 of this  sameexception does not apply to solicitors in interstate commerce nor does it apply to soliciting by duly licensed merchants firms or persons within the corporate limits of the city nor does it apply to farmers and truck growers within the state  secs 1723617245  reserved division 2  permit required it shall be unlawful for any solicitors and canvassers to engage in such business within the city without first obtaining a permit therefor in compliance with the provisions of this division  secs 1724717265  reserved article ix  reserved footnotes  8  editors note  repealed  1726617271 in their entirety formerly said sections pertained to street entertainer regulations see the table secs 1726617299  reserved article x  vending machines placement of newspaper vending machines on public property the city hereby adopts rules for the placement of newspaper vending machines and similar machines designed to dispense advertising papers brochures or magazines hereinafter referred to as vending machines on public property within the historic districts of the city as follows 1 prior to placement of any vending machine on public property an applicant requesting placement of such equipment in the historic districts shall apply to the city manager who shall review the proposed locations of the vending machines in determining the permitted placement of such vending machines the city manager shall determine that the placement shall not unduly interfere with pedestrian or vehicular traffic nor shall the placement of the vending machines on city property interfere with access to businesses or residences wherever practical the vending machines shall be placed in clusters of other similar machines rather than individual randomly placed machines the request for permit will indicate the size of the vending machine and the type of material from which the vending machine is constructed 2 the vending machines permitted under this section shall be modular units manufactured by shorack models k100 or k4916 or equivalent machines similar in design construction and appearance the total size of a machine shall not exceed sixty 60 inches high and seventyfive 75 inches wide such machine shall be firmly attached to the sidewalk or ground in the manner set forth on the permit application 3 the vending machines permitted under this section shall not be decorated with words letters decals or logos of any nature whatsoever but shall have clear windows made of plexiglas or other transparent material in which the cover of the publication shall be prominently and visibly displayed 4 all vending machines shall be painted brown color as required by the city on the permit and shall be maintained to ensure that the paint is not chipped damaged or faded and the machines remain undamaged and in proper working condition 5 in the event that the application for placement of vending machines in the historic districts is denied by the city manager the applicant may appeal to the city commission which shall place the matter on the next available city commission agenda for consideration and hearing no more than twenty 20 days from the date that the appeal is filed 6 there shall be no fees assessed for applying for placement of newspaper vending machines within the historic districts nor shall there be any fees or costs attached to the appeal of any determination of the city manager or the historic architectural review board  72897   92898 secs 1730117399  reserved article xi  fortunetellers clairvoyants and similar occupations legislative purpose  findings of fact a the purpose and intent of the city commission of the city of st augustine in enacting this ordinance is to protect the health welfare and safety of the public at large and patrons of fortunetelling establishments by ensuring that the services provided by those establishments are to the greatest extent possible free from fraud corruption vice trickery and other criminal influences b the city commission finds that there have been recent and serious cases of fraud involving fortunetellers in florida and nationwide the city commission further finds that it is in the public interest to regulate fortunetelling in a manner consistent with adequately protecting the public while allowing fortunetelling to exist in the city of st augustine  42798 definitions for the purposes of this article the following words and phrases shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section applicant means a person who is required to file an application for a permit under this article including a fortuneteller individual owner managing partner managing officer of a corporation or any other operator manager or employee of a fortunetelling establishment for pay means a fee reward donation loan barter or receipt of anything of value fortuneteller means any person who for pay engages in the practice of fortunetelling as herein defined unless otherwise excepted fortunetelling includes but is not limited to telling of fortunes forecasting of fortunes or furnishing of any information not otherwise obtainable by the ordinary process of knowledge by means of any occult psychic power faculty force clairvoyance clairaudience cartomancy hypnosis intuition psychology psychometry phrenology spirits tea leaves or other such reading mediumship seership prophecy augury astrology palmistry necromancy mindreading telepathy or other craft art science cards talisman charm potion magnetism magnetized article or substance intuitive cunning or foresight crystal gazing cultural mysteries or magic of any kind or nature for pay fortunetelling establishment means any business establishment having a fixed place of business where any person firm association or corporation engages in or carries on or permits to be engaged in or carried on any of the activities defined in this section the term fortunetelling establishment means a single business entity license shall mean an occupational license issued by the city finance director for fortunetelling licensee shall mean the holder of a current license for fortunetelling person means any individual partnership copartnership firm association joint stock company corporation or combination of the above in whatever form or character zoning or zoning approval shall mean written zoning approval from the department or division of the city of st augustine responsible for reviewing and approving zoning  42798 license permit required it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in business as a fortuneteller as defined in this article or other similar occupation within the city of st augustine without a permit or license as provided in this article such permit when issued shall be renewed annually as provided in this chapter  42798 form of application any applicant for a license or renewal of license under this article shall make application therefor on a form prescribed by the city manager containing the information as required by this article  42798 requirements for license any person applying for a license or permit under this section shall provide 1 his or her legal name and if changed the name by which he or she was formerly known  date of birth  social security number  and residence address for the past two 2 years 2 no less than five 5 written references from residents of the city having personal knowledge of the applicant 3 the address where the proposed business shall operate said location shall be only within a zoning district where such business is permitted prior to commencing operation of the business the applicant shall obtain such permits or zoning approvals necessary to achieve compliance with zoning district regulations  42798 investigation of applicant upon receipt of the application under this article the same shall be referred to the chief of police who shall cause an investigation to be made as set forth in section 17406 of this after completion of the investigation it is determined that the applicant meets the criteria set forth in this article and has obtained the proper building and zoning approval the license or permit shall be issued upon the payment by the applicant of a license fee as provided in section 1773a58  42798 issuance refusal or revocation of license  appeals a if an applicant or license holder has not been convicted of any felony or of any misdemeanor which may involve fraud or moral turpitude the chief of police shall report that status to the city finance director if any applicant or license holder has been convicted of any felony or of any misdemeanor which may involve fraud or moral turpitude the chief of police shall refer the matter to the city manager who shall cause a hearing to be held within five 5 days to determine whether the misdemeanors involved fraud or moral turpitude and should be the basis for denial or revocation of the license the city manager may refuse or revoke a license for a fortunetelling establishment or fortuneteller if the applicant or license holder has been convicted of any felony or any misdemeanor involving fraud or moral turpitude or such other circumstances exist which present a possible danger to the health and welfare of the public any such refusal or revocation pertaining to any applicant or licensee shall set forth the reasons for such action which shall be set forth fully in writing and mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the applicant or licensee at the address listed in the permit application within three 3 days from the date of hearing for the purposes of this section if the last day of the time for response falls on a weekend or holiday the time of response shall be extended to the next business day b the applicant or licensee shall be notified that he or she shall have ten 10 days from the date of such notice to request in writing a hearing before the city commission to appeal the license denial or revocation if the applicant or licensee fails to request in writing such hearing before the city commission within said time period the application will be deemed denied or the license may be revoked  42798 exceptions a the provisions of this article shall not apply to any person solely by reason of the fact that he or she is engaged in the business of entertaining the public by demonstrations of mindreading mental telepathy thought conveyance or the giving of horoscopic readings at public places and in the presence of and within the hearing of other persons and at which no questions are answered as part of such entertainment except in a manner to permit all persons present at such public place to hear such answers for the purposes of this section public shall mean the immediate presence of at least ten 10 people not associated with the entertainer or hosting establishment b the provisions of this article shall not apply to any person who is a practitioner of the healing arts as defined by florida statute 45632 or has a state of florida license or permit for the specific type of activity the person is engaging in c the provisions of this article shall not apply to any person who practices hypnosis under the supervision direction prescription and responsibility of a practitioner of the healing arts as defined by fs 45632 d nothing in this article shall be construed to require a license for practicing the religious tenets of any religious institution as defined by fs   42798 employment of persons without licenses unlawful it shall be unlawful for any owner operator manager or licensee in charge of or in control of a fortunetelling establishment to employ any person who is not in possession of a valid unrevoked license to practice fortunetelling within a fortunetelling establishment  42798 secs 1740917499  reserved article xii  mobile vendors title this article shall be cited as the city of st augustine mobile vendors   62413 eff 8113 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning business means any commercial activity in which any goods are offered for sale as a means of livelihood but not including occasional sale of household goods by the owneruser goods means any tangible item offered for sale mobile vendor means a natural person or business entity selling goods from a nonpermanent table box cart trailer or vehicle a mobile vending conveyance at a fixed location this definition also includes the seller of goods placed on the ground on an outdoor portion of a structure or on or in vegetation sale means any trade or offer of trade for currency credit or goods vending booth means a temporary cartmounted or portable retail establishment including boxes tables spreads or any other method or facility set on the ground and located on public property a vending booth cannot be propelled by an internal combustion engine electric motor or other similar mechanical device a vending booth must be capable of being moved from place to place but may be stationary during the business day examples of vending booths are but are not limited to the following stands or carts selling retail items or souvenirs  62413 eff 8113 license required a no person shall conduct any business sale or offer to conduct any business sale from any public road other public thoroughfare sidewalk public parking lot or any public property whatsoever unless the person holds a valid mobile vendors license and fully conforms to the terms of this article b licensing under this section does not grant the licensee the right to vend in prohibited public areas as defined in chapter 22 of this to otherwise violate the provisions of said chapter 22 c licensing under this section does not otherwise grant the licensee the right to vend in the market in the plaza as defined in section 226 of this d nothing in this article shall serve to repeal or sever the provisions of section 226 of this the issuance and use of permits for the sale of merchandise and services in the market in the plaza as defined in section 226 of this e street artists as defined in section 2210 of the city hereby exempt from the requirements of chapter 17 sections 17500  62413 eff 8113   10917 license as local business tax receipt a valid mobile vendors license shall be construed as satisfying for the named holder of same and for the uses provided in this article the local business tax receipt requirements of section 1761 et seq of this  62413 eff 8113 application  license fee a upon application and upon expiration of a reasonable time not to exceed thirty 30 days for administrative processing and review or if no determination is made the city manager shall issue a mobile vendors license only to any applicant who 1 is eighteen 18 years of age or older  2 submits one 1 photo identification card issued by a state or federal agency and two 2 photographs which have been taken within thirty 30 days of the application and which are three 3 inches by five 5 inches in size  3 provides on a form provided by the city manager all of the following information regarding the applicant a name home address local address telephone number  b age height weight color of eyes and hair  c date of birth  d valid drivers license or government issued identification card  and e state sales tax number  4 provides on a form provided by the city manager a description of the business including specification of the goods offered for sale and the expected locations from which sales will be offered  5 provides proof of insurance required by section 17505  6 provides a mailing address at which notice of any pertinent city information shall be considered received and binding upon the applicant or mobile vendors license holder on the fifth day after first class mail is posted to the address  7 provides a statement regarding compliance with these regulations and affirmatively states they have not previously violated the terms of licensing as provided in this article  8 pays fees including twentyfive dollars $2500 per month for city administrative processing costs b an applicant who misrepresents information provided under this section shall not be issued a mobile vendors license or if issued shall suffer revocation of the mobile vendors license  62413 eff 8113   10917 insurance a no person shall offer for business sale any goods pursuant to a mobile vendors license unless the business is covered by a comprehensive liability insurance policy in a form and content satisfactory to the city insuring the public against injury or damage occasioned by negligence arising from or incidental to the business activity at a minimum the policy shall provide coverage of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 per person and three hundred thousand dollars $30000000 per incident the policy shall list the city as a coinsured and shall provide that coverage shall not be cancelled or materially altered except after thirty 30 days written notice has been received by the city b proof that the insurance policy remains in full force and effect shall be provided upon the city managers request given on reasonable notice at any time that the mobile vendors license is valid and outstanding any failure to provide such proof shall render the mobile vendors license revoked null and void and of no further use or effect the holders subsequent application for a new mobile vendors license shall be entitled to no special priority  62413 eff 8113 term  identity of licensee a mobile vendors licenses shall be issued monthly on a priority based on the time of receipt of application by the city and shall be effective on the first day of each month b each mobile vendors license shall be issued in the name of the individual applicant only and shall not be issued in the name of any corporation partnership or business  62413 eff 8113 renewal a upon application the city manager shall renew on a monthly basis effective the first day of each month the mobile vendors license of any applicant who 1 held a valid mobile or itinerant vendors license which expired not more than thirty 30 calendar days prior to filing of a complete application for renewal  2 has provided the city with new or updated information documents and fees listed in section 17504 and continues to meet all requirements of such section  and 3 pays a late processing fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 for any renewal application filed after the first of any month 4 has not been found in violation of this article b any mobile vendors license not renewed within thirty 30 days of its expiration shall be revoked void and of no further use or effect whatsoever  62413 eff 8113 license display any person offering goods for business sale pursuant to a mobile vendors license shall wear and display the mobile vendors license including a threeinch by fiveinch photograph of the licensee on the person named on the mobile vendors license in a manner always visible to persons visiting the sales site  62413 eff 8113
