any street alley or other public way within the city for the purpose of soliciting or canvassing for a commercial purpose including the soliciting or extending of invitations for persons to attend sales presentations sales demonstrations or displays for the sale of either real or personal property a violation of this section shall be punishable as provided in section 18 of this 5 utility placement permit a definitions in this section 1 facilities means poles conduits wires cables electrical conductors fiber optics digital technology fixtures manholes sewer lines water lines and other fixtures intended to be placed within the public rightofway or in actuality placed within the public rightofway belonging to a utility 2 utility means any utility which is subject to the jurisdiction of the state public service commission except for such utilities which shall have entered into and have in force a current franchise agreement with the city providing for permission to use public rightsofway and setting the terms and conditions of such use b no utility shall have the right or privilege to construct erect operate own or maintain in upon along across above over or under the streets alleys public ways and public places not laid out or dedicated or any extensions thereof or any additions thereto in the city any facilities within the corporate limits of the city as it now exists or as it may hereafter be extended or contracted unless or until such utility shall have obtained a permit therefor issued by the city manager or his or her designee upon the terms and conditions hereinafter contained each violation of the provisions of this section shall be as punishable as provided by law and shall be enforceable by the municipal code enforcement board with each day of violation being considered a separate violation and each pole conduit wire cable electrical conductor manholes water line sewer line or other fixtures being regarded as a separate violation c upon application by any utility the city manager or his or her designee shall issue a permit to the utility upon the following terms and conditions 1 the permit shall be nonexclusive and shall be conditioned upon the payment by the utility to the city of the maximum amount permitted to be charged by the city and as allowed by law as a franchise fee for the use of its streets alleys public ways and public places for the placement of the fixtures belonging to the utility if the maximum amount authorized to be charged by the city to the utility for such franchise fee is expressed as a percentage of gross receipts and local service revenues then in that event the utility shall pay upon application for the permit such percentage and will provide a statement of its gross revenues for the preceding year sworn to by an authorized official of the utility in such reasonable form and detail as the citys auditor may from time to time prescribe and sufficient to show the source and method of computation of such gross revenues the utility shall in the application as a condition thereof agree that it will provide within ninety 90 days from the end of the utilitys fiscal year a statement of its gross revenues for the period in which the permit is issued and shall pay any deficiency or deficit from that which was previously paid upon application the utility shall maintain books and records to confirm the dollar amount owed to the city the city staff or an authorized cpa may examine as the condition of the issuance of the permit upon reasonable notice to the utility and during normal business hours those records located in utility facilities where they are maintained the records shall not be taken from the utility premises 2 permits and revocable licenses required a any person or entity desiring to install place construct or replace any improvement in a city public rightofway shall obtain prior to commencement of any work a permit for such activity issued by the city manager or his or her designee on terms and conditions as defined below b fees for permits shall be determined as allowed by law and by resolution of the city commission c no use of or construction in a public rightofway shall be permitted or licensed if that use or construction creates an obstruction barrier or safety hazard as defined by generally accepted engineering practices d time limitations 1 in no case shall construction commence on any improvement within any public rightofway or within any easement owned or controlled by the city before a permit is issued a permit issued by the city shall be valid for a period of one hundred twenty 120 days from the date of issuance if a period in excess of one hundred twenty 120 days is required because of the scope of work approval shall be obtained in advance of the issuance of the permit and the permit validation period shall reflect such extension a permit shall not be extended more than three 3 times or for more than one 1 year from the date of issuance 2 after issuance of the permit the permittee shall notify the city public works department a minimum of two 2 business days prior to commencing construction this notification will allow for scheduling of inspections if a road closure is required the permittee shall submit with the permit application a maintenance of traffic mot plan to include all proposed road closures and an expected time duration for each closing road closures shall require separate approval by the public works department and a minimum of three 3 business days prior notification before the commencement or construction road closures of fewer than fifteen 15 minutes shall not require notification e it shall be the duty and responsibility of each applicant for a permit under this article to 1 make a written application for permit with the public works department on such forms as the city shall prescribe no work shall commence until the engineer has approved the application and plan and the applicant has paid and provided all fees deposits and certificates required by this article the engineer shall review the application and issue a decision or comments for revision and will issue permit providing all conditions of the permit application have been met and all required fees deposits and certificates from the applicant have been received 2 include in the application information stating the kind character and purpose of the proposed excavation or opening and such other information which may be reasonably required to fulfill the requirements of this article 3 furnish in triplicate and if desired by the applicant in electronic format a detailed plan with dimensions showing the location of the work to be performed under such permit if approved by the engineer one copy of such plan shall be returned to the applicant at the time the permit is granted 4 obtain a permit for each and every project notwithstanding this requirement the utility provider may proceed to perform only such work as required to address emergency situations defined as circumstances creating an outofservice or imminent outofservice condition the applicant must notify the city of such work on the first business day following the commencement of the work and must submit an application for a permit for such work within a time designated by the city manager or his or her designee 5 save the city its officers employees and agents harmless from any and all costs damages and liabilities which may accrue or be claimed to accrue by reason of any work performed under such permit to the extent allowed by law the acceptance of any permit under this article shall constitute such an agreement by the applicant whether such acceptance is expressed or not 6 to the extent allowed by law pay a permit and engineering review fee and security deposit developers of major subdivisions may request to pledge assurances to the city in lieu of cash or check and the city in the sole exercise of the citys judgment and discretion may accept or reject such assurances 7 furnish a certificate of insurance or selfinsurance 8 keep the original copy of the permit and an approved copy of the plan in the possession of the party actually doing the work and when required exhibit such copy to the engineer duly authorized inspectors or in the instances of county and state roads to the respective inspectors representing these authorities 9 perform the work in accord with the permit conditions the regulations established under this article and such further conditions as may be imposed by the engineer f bond a performance bond or other financial security in form content and execution approved by the city attorney may be required to ensure financial responsibility for completion of specified work not completed or for repair of damages to the rightofway or any public property occurring and not repaired in accord with good engineering practices or for events where the work is nonconforming as determined by the public works department in addition to paying the permit and inspection fees established by resolution of the city commission a performance bond or other security approved by the city attorney shall be in the amount of one hundred dollars $10000 for a nonrefundable processing fee plus two thousand dollars $200000 as a retainer refundable within thirty 30 days after completion of specified work if the work in question exceeds a value of two thousand dollars $2000 the bond amount shall be increased by the difference between two thousand dollars $2000 and the increased value of the work plus ten 10 percent of that difference in the alternative the performance bond may be in the form of a blanket bond approved by the city attorney in form content and execution and which satisfies the financial protection requirements of this section if said work remains incomplete after thirty 30 days the bond will be forfeited such forms shall prescribe the manner in which noncompliance with the provisions of a permit or this subchapter shall be remedied and shall provide the necessary financial assurances to remedy any noncompliance 3 the utility shall continue to be subject to public utility taxes ad valorem taxes and such other taxes charges or fees as may be lawfully authorized by the state construction and the general laws of the state 4 the issuance of the permit shall not restrict the right of the city which is hereby expressly reserved to adopt in addition to the provisions herein contained and existing applicable ordinances such additional regulations as the city shall find necessary in the exercise of police power provided that such regulations by ordinance or otherwise shall be reasonable and not in conflict with the rights granted by such permit and shall not be in conflict with the laws of the state and the lawful regulations of any state agency possessing the power to regulate the activities of the utility 5 the permit granted by the city to the utility shall not be transferable to another without the citys prior approval no such sale or transfer shall be effective until the vendee assignee or lessee has filed with the city an instrument duly executed reciting the fact of such sale assignment or lease  accepting the terms of the permit  and agreeing to perform all the conditions thereof the city will not unreasonably withhold its consent to the transfer of the permit 6 any violation by the utility its vendee lessee or successor to the provisions of any permit issued hereunder or any material portions thereof shall be cause for the forfeiture of the permit and all rights thereunder if such violation failure or default without agreement of the city continues for a period of thirty 30 days after written notice by the city to the utility thereof 7 the utility shall at all times during the life of any permit issued pursuant to this section be subject to all lawful exercise of the police power by the city and such reasonable regulations as the city shall hereafter by resolution or ordinance provide the rights and privileges granted to the utility pursuant to any such permit shall at all times be subordinate and inferior to the rights of the public in and to the ordinary use of the city streets and rightsofway and nothing in any permit shall be construed as a surrender by the city of its right and power to use and regulate the use of its streets and rightsofway the utility shall obtain the permit provided for in this section before commencing any work requiring a permit and shall obtain such other permits as may be required and shall provide for the following a all transmission distribution collection and other structures lines conduits pipes and equipment erected by the utility within the limits of the city shall be so located as to cause minimum interference with the proper use of streets alleys and other public ways and places and to cause minimum interference with the rights of reasonable conveyance of property owners who would join any of such streets alleys or other public ways and places b in case of any disturbance of pavement sidewalk driveway or the surfacing or damage to city structures and facilities caused by the utilitys operations and activities the utility shall commence at its own cost and expense and in the manner approved by the city replace and restore all paving sidewalk driveway or surface of any street or alley disturbed in as good or better condition as before such work was commenced and shall maintain the restoration in approved condition for a period of five 5 years should the utility fail to commence restoration after seven 7 days notice in writing to such utility by the city the city may make such repair and restoration and the cost of the same shall be paid by the utility in the event the utility shall fail to pay for such repair and restoration no additional permit will be issued while the utility is in default thereof c if at any time during the period of any such permit the city shall lawfully elect to alter or change the grade of any street sidewalk driveway alley or other public way or alter or move any structural facility of the city the utility upon reasonable notice by the city shall remove relay and relocate its poles wires cable underground conduits water or sewer lines manholes or other fixtures at its own expense d the utility shall not place poles or other fixtures where the same will interfere with any gas lamp electric light water hydrant water main or sewage line and all such poles and other fixtures placed in the streets shall be placed at the outer edge of the sidewalk and inside the curbline or such other place designated by the city and those placed in alleys shall be placed close to the line of the lot abutting on such alley and in such a manner as not to interfere with the usual travel on such streets alleys and public ways e utilities shall on the request of any person holding a building permit issued by the city temporarily raise or lower their wires to permit the moving of buildings the expense of such temporary removal raising or lowering of wires shall be paid by the person requesting the same and the utility shall have the authority to require such payment in advance the utility shall be given notice not less than fortyeight 48 hours to arrange for such temporary wire changes f as a further condition of the issuance of any permit the utility shall agree to provide the city with records of its underground installation as built on sheets provided by the utility within sixty 60 days of the completion of the installation 8 the permit shall be issued upon the express understanding and agreement by the utility that the utility shall save the city harmless for loss sustained by the city on account of any suit judgement execution claim or demand whatsoever resulting from the negligence default or misconduct on the part of the utility its agents servants employees or independent contractors in the construction operation or maintenance of its facilities in the area of the permit issued d this section shall not effect or invalidate any valid franchise right of any public service company having an existing franchise with the city e the issuance of a permit pursuant to this section shall not authorize or permit distribution facilities for a utility in competition or providing essentially the same service as that provided by a public service company regulated by the state public service commission which has a valid franchise agreement with the city it being understood and it being the intent of this section that the operation of a competing system shall require the issuance of a franchise agreement upon the same terms and conditions and under such circumstances as deemed advisable by the city as required for the public service company having a valid franchise agreement with the city  1890   101011 placement of monuments plaques and memorials on city property it shall be unlawful for any person to place a plaque memorial or monument on any city rightofway or city owned property except in conformity with the following requirements a approval of city commission no plaque memorial or monument may be placed upon any city property without the approval of the city commission first obtained b application an application for placement of a plaque memorial or monument shall be filed with the city manager on a form as designated by him which shall require the following information to be provided i a statement of significant historical cultural or civic contributions to or acts of patriotism and bravery relating to the city of st augustine ii agreement by the applicant to pay the cost of construction placement and any repairs required for the plaque memorial or monument c review by city manager the city manager will review the application and provide his recommendation to the city commission as to the suitability of placement of the plaque memorial or monument no plaque monument or memorial is to be recommended to the city commission by the city manager for placement in the city commons otherwise known as plaza de la constitucion unless the plaque monument or memorial commemorates a significant activity or event which occurred prior to  or unless the plaque monument or memorial commemorates the service to the city of citizens leading and participating in the civil rights movement in st augustine absent unusual circumstances which shall be set forth in the recommendation any other recommendation shall be for placement of a plaque meeting uniform standards promulgated by the city manager on the interior loggia columns of the alcazar hotel building  11292   42709 regulation of street artist a intent the city commission of the city of st augustine hereby ratifies approves and adopts all of the foregoing predicate whereas clauses the city commission of the city of st augustine finds that the existence in the city of street artists and the street vendors as hereinafter defined in the prohibited public area as hereinafter defined would interfere with the public health safety and welfare of the pedestrian traffic including residents and tourists by among other things attracting audiences which congest the prohibited public area the city finds that the existence of the street artists and the street vendors in the prohibited public area further would adversely affect the citys interests in the aesthetics incident to the oldest city in the united states and would adversely affect the interest of residents and the regulated code compliant businesses and museums in the enjoyment of peace and quiet in their homes businesses and museums also the city finds that the existence of the street artists and street vendors in the prohibited public area would pose a safety risk to the public and passersby by congestion and clutter in this area of st augustine therefore it is the intent of the city to prohibit the street artists from performing in the prohibited public area of the city of st augustine and the street vendors from vending in the prohibited public area but to permit them to have access to reasonable alternative avenues of communication throughout the city b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 expressive speech includes by way of example and not limited to creating visual art and wares such as paintings drawings prints photographs and sculptures expressive speech also includes by way of example and not limited to acting singing orating playing musical instruments performing pantomime mime magic and dance juggling and performance artistry to the extent the forgoing list is viewed not as intended to be exemplary guidance but as exclusive expressive speech also includes other activities recognized by courts as predominantly speech rather than any other purpose expressive speech does not include making or selling items which are intended to serve any functional or utilitarian use or purpose or otherwise contain no first amendment expressive content even if the item is decorative 2 prohibited activity means any activity involving the use of fire aerosol or spray paint 3 prohibited public area means the pedestrian accessed public areas of st george street from cathedral place north to orange street and within fifty 50 feet of that section of st george street on the intersecting public lanes streets or thoroughfares 4 street artist means individuals who engage in expressive speech as defined herein on the property of the city of st augustine 5 street vendors means individuals who sell or offer for sale compensation or donation or rent or offer for rent goods wares merchandise food stuffs refreshments or other kinds of property or services on property of the city of st augustine 6 other public areas means public streets rightsofway sidewalks parks playgrounds and all public ways except those portions of the streets and roadways intended for use by vehicular traffic within the city of st augustine 7 vending means to sell or offer for sale compensation or donation or rent or offer for rent goods wares merchandise food stuffs refreshments or other kinds of property or services c prohibition no street artist may perform expressive speech in a prohibited public area no street vendors may vend in a prohibited public area no street artist or street vendor may perform a prohibited activity anywhere in the city of st augustine d exceptions a street artist shall not perform in a manner that interferes with the visibility of any motorist or at or near intersections or passages in a manner which interferes with the sight distance of any motorist traveling on or entering any thoroughfare in the city e penalties offenses under this section shall be punishable as provided in section 18 of this  31300   112900   22403   91409   10917 regulation of walking tours utilizing public rightsofway after sunset a limits on size  additional tour guides all walking tours conducted on the public rightofway after sunset shall consist of no more than twentyfive 25 persons per group excluding the tour guide a walking tour conducted on the public rightofway consisting of more than twentyfive 25 persons shall be divided into more than one group and shall be accompanied by an additional tour guide and shall maintain a sufficient distance between any other group so as not to impede pedestrian traffic and vehicular traffic b lantern or flashlight required the licensed tour guide accompanying such group shall carry a lantern or flashlight of sufficient intensity to be seen clearly and shall supervise the members of the tour group in a manner which will ensure that the group will not obstruct the portions of the rightofway used for vehicular traffic for any reason except to cross the street and the guide shall not allow members of the group to walk or stand in the vehicular traffic lanes for any other purpose c exclusion for licensed tour vehicles the provisions of this section relating to tour sizes shall not apply to groups which are transported on the rightsofway on licensed tour vehicles and only use the public sidewalks incidental to loading or unloading licensed tour vehicles  62306 sleeping camping habitation or leaving human waste in public places prohibited a definition as used herein homeless shall refer to an individual or family which has a primary nighttime residence that is 1 a supervised publicly or privately operated shelter designed to provide temporary living accommodations including welfare hotels congregate shelters and transitional housing for persons with mental illness  2 an institution that provides a temporary residence for individuals intended to be institutionalized  or 3 a public or private place not designed for or ordinarily used as regular sleeping accommodations for human beings the term does not include any individual imprisoned or otherwise detained b prohibition on sleeping camping habitation or leaving human waste no person shall sleep camp or inhabit or deposit or leave any human waste or excrement including urine and feces under or on any public street sidewalk alleyway park plaza or other municipal place or under on or over any furniture vehicle step curb fixture monument sign landscaping or any other item or personal property located under on or over any public street sidewalk alleyway park plaza or any other public place located within the municipal borders of the city of st augustine florida the prohibition on sleeping camping or habitation shall be effective from the hours of  pm until  am daily the prohibition on leaving or depositing human waste or excrement shall be effective at all hours of the day or night the city manager may post signs on public property advising the public of the prohibitions set forth in this subsection b c enforcement this section shall not be enforced against persons defined as homeless unless such homeless persons have access to a public or private facility for their use in safely eliminating their excrement or unless such homeless persons have access to a supervised publicly or privately operated shelter designed to provide temporary living accommodations including welfare hotels congregate shelters and transitional housing for persons with mental illness or an institution which provides a temporary residence for individuals intended to be institutionalized d penalty for violating section the penalty for each violation of the provisions of this ordinance shall be as prescribed by section 18 of this  31207 prohibiting the vending and sale of foodstuffs beverages and refreshments on the public streets sidewalks alleyways and rightsofway of the pedestrian vehicular and emergency access traffic including traffic by residents and tourists by blocking and congesting the said public streets sidewalks alleyways and rightsofway  would damage the rightsofway a definitions in this section 1 construction means any activity or installation other than the placement of utilities governed by section 228 of this performed within the boundaries of any activities 2 rightsofway means any opened or unopened city street roadway or alleyway or any easement or any real property owned by the city b activities in city rightsofway without permits 1 the following construction andor use activities are prohibited within the boundaries of all city rightsofway unless permitted in accord with the provisions of this article a installation of mailboxes other than units prescribed by us postal service standards and florida department of transportation parking and traffic design standards b decorative walls c retaining walls d buildings or structures of any kind e barriers or obstructions of any kind f basketball goals g skateboard ramps h recreational structures of any kind whether temporary or permanent i fences j swimming pools k parking lots l landscaping of any kind m any other facility object or item requiring a permanent foundation or which cannot be removed readily n any facility object or item designed and intended for personal or as defined below and in certain instances the issuance of a revocable license approved by the city commission 2 fees for permits and revocable licenses shall be determined by resolution of the city commission 3 no use of or construction in a public rightofway shall be permitted or licensed if that use or construction creates an obstruction barrier or safety hazard as defined by generally accepted engineering practices 4 all requested uses of or construction in a public rightofway shall be evaluated for the benefit of said use or construction to the general public or for whether the benefit to and convenience gained by a private property owner conflicts with the benefit to the general public for the use of the rightofway affected 5 revocable licenses are required for all improvements in the public rightofway which are not accepted for maintenance by the city such improvements are for the benefit and pleasure of the property owner license fees shall be adopted by of inspections if a road closure is required the permittee shall submit with the permit application a maintenance of traffic mot plan to include all proposed road closures and an expected time of south castillo drive c exemption for newspaper vending machines the provisions of this section shall not apply to the sale or offer for sale of newspapers machines of general circulation for the purposes of this section newspapers of general circulation means a publication published at regular intervals primarily for the dissemination of news intelligence and opinions on recent events or newsworthy items of a general character and reaching all classes of the public d regulatory penalties violations under this section shall be penalized as provided in section 18 of this  32612 provision for street artist activity at the historic downtown parking facility east loggia  establishment of a random lottery for space at the historic downtown parking facility east loggia for street artist activity  provision for the procedures for said lottery  providing penalties a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning 1 historic downtown parking facility east loggia east loggia means the covered exterior adjacent to the parking garage structure known as the historic downtown parking facility from the northeast corner of the parking garage structure extending south to the southeast corner of the parking garage structure as shall be demarcated from time to time by the city manager 2 street artist means those individuals as defined in section 2210 of the city b absolute prohibition of vending of certain goods notwithstanding any other provision in this section the following goods and services shall not be offered for sale or donation anywhere in the east loggia food beverages housewares appliances sunglasses auto parts oils incense perfume lotions candles and clothing and accessories including handbags and shoes jewelry toys and stuffed animals flashlights or glow sticks and items intended to serve any functional or utilitarian purpose containing no first amendment expressive content c unlawful to engage in street artist activity other than as defined other than as provided for herein it is unlawful for any person to engage in any street artist activity in the area known as the st augustinest johns county visitor information center the parking facility and grounds surrounding the visitor information center or the promenade in violation of city resolution no 200938 d lottery the east loggia shall be subdivided into twelve 12 spaces of approximately 8  10 in size that have been delineated with pins five 5 spaces will exist to the north of the pedestrian entrance to the parking garage seven 7 spaces to the south of the pedestrian entrance to the parking garage these twelve 12 spaces shall be available for street artists on a monthly basis e procedure for lottery  applications 1 applications for spaces in the east loggia shall be available at the customer service division and shall provide for the following information name  address  street artist activity  and printed name and signature 2 completed applications must be submitted back to the customer service division by  pm on the 20th day of the month prior to the month the applicant desires to engage in street artist activity in the east loggia in the event that the 20th day of the month falls on a weekend or a holiday completed applications must be submitted back to the customer service division by  pm on the last day of normal business for the city of st augustine before the 20th day of the month prior to the month the applicant desires to engage in street artist activity in the east loggia f procedure for lottery drawing for space in the east loggia 1 on the next business day following the deadline for applications to be received the city comptroller or his or her designee shall randomly draw twelve 12 street artist applications from all applications received 2 the use of the twelve 12 spots by a permit holder is on a daily firstcome firstserved basis no street artist shall make efforts to reserve a location  and each permit holder shall abandon a location at the end of his or her working day including the removal of all personal property 3 any unallotted spaces may be assigned by the city comptroller or his or her designee on a first come first serve basis for payment of the administrative processing fee in the amount of twentyfive dollars $2500 after the drawing for space in the east loggia is complete for any given month 4 applicants that are assigned a space in the east loggia shall be required to pay an administrative processing fee in the amount of twentyfive dollars $2500 within five 5 business days of the drawing and to prominently display a photo id and permit provided by the city identifying the month of the drawing spaces assigned via the lottery shall not be transferable and shall only be for use by the applicant with photo id provided by the city 5 upon notification to the customer service division of space not utilized for seven 7 consecutive days the customer service division shall contact the individual street artist not present and utilizing assigned space for confirmation of intent to abandon the space for the assigned month if confirmation cannot be made the space will remain assigned as drawn for the month if the assigned street artist confirms their intent to abandon the space for the month the customer service division shall contact the next available applicant from the list of applicants received for the given months drawing upon payment of the twentyfive dollar $2500 administrative fee an id badge and permit will be assigned for use of the abandoned space g description of street artist activity space within the designated area in the east loggia all activities including equipment and personnel and signage must be confined to the designated space demarcated by the metal pins referenced in subparagraph e hereinabove street artist shall not obstruct vehicular or pedestrian traffic entrance to buildings bicycle racks handicapped access or vehicular parking vehicular loading zones taxi stands or franchised vehicles for hire stands h penalties offenses under this section shall be punishable as provided in section 18 of this i indigency waiver street artists as defined in section 2210 of the city relief from payment of fees based upon an inability to pay must apply to the city clerk for a determination of indigent status using the form provided and provide the required information for such determination as required by section 279 of the city  10917 secs 22202230  reserved article ii  sidewalk construction permit required for private construction no person shall be permitted or authorized to build a sidewalk or foot pavement within the city unless the owner or the agent of the property shall make application to the city manager in writing for authority so to do and shall have first received the written permission of the city manager so to do  provided however that no permission is necessary when the sidewalk is ordered constructed repaired or aligned according to the provisions of section 2233  owners required to construct upon notice each owner of real estate within the corporate limits of the city whenever required by the city commission so to do shall construct and place a sidewalk or foot pavement in front of his lot where the same fronts on any traveled street of the city to the full extent of the frontage of such lot on such traveled street owners of lots shall also repair rebuild or establish the grade on any sidewalk or foot pavements already built whenever required by the city commission and notice given to that effect owners of such lots are hereby required in constructing or placing such sidewalks or foot pavements to finish and complete the same with a curb of concrete along the whole length of the sidewalk or foot pavement  resolution requiring construction  notice to owner the city commission may by resolution declare that certain specified sidewalks and curbing shall be constructed or repaired rebuilt or grade established upon passage of such resolution the city manager shall cause written notice of the passage thereof to be served upon the owner or agent of each parcel of land abutting upon such sidewalk who may be a resident of the city in the manner provided by law for the service of summons in civil actions he shall return a copy of the notice with the time and manner of service endorsed thereon signed by the person serving it to the city director of financial services who shall file and preserve such return for the purpose of such service if the owner of such property is not a resident of the city any person charged with the collections of rents or payment of taxes on the property or having control thereof in any way shall be regarded as the agent of the owner and service upon such person shall have the like force and effect as though personal service were made upon the owner thereof if it appears in any such return however that the owner is a nonresident or that neither such owner or agent could be found one 1 publication of a copy of the resolution in a daily newspaper of general circulation in the city shall be deemed sufficient notice to such owner  failure of owner to construct after noticework to be done by city  report of costs if sidewalks or curbing are not constructed or repaired within sixty 60 days of the service of the notice provided for in section 2233 or the publication thereof the city manager may proceed by direct employment of labor or by contract to carry out such construction or repairs at the expense of the owner as in the case of other improvements and all such expenses shall be reported by the city manager to the city commission  sameassessment of costs  collection  penalty and interest upon the report of the expenses of construction of sidewalks under the provisions of section 2234 the city commission shall thereupon by ordinance assess the costs and expenses thereof upon the owners of all the property bounding and abutting thereon such assessment shall be collected in the same manner as other assessments with a penalty of five 5 percent and interest for failure to pay at the time fixed by the assessment resolution  samelien to be placed upon property the city shall declare and place a lien upon each piece of property so paved under the provisions of this article in the event that the owner of such property shall fail and refuse to pay his assessment  to be built of concrete  specifications all sidewalks or foot pavements constructed or required to be constructed and all sidewalks rebuilt or aligned to new grade within the corporate limits of the city shall be built erected and repaired of concrete the mixture of which is contained in a specification on file in the office of the city manager and known and described as concrete mixture for sidewalks  width and grade on all streets in the city the sidewalks or foot pavements on each side of each street shall be of such width as may be determined by resolution of the city commission the grade of all sidewalks or foot pavements in the city shall also be determined by resolution of the city commission  secs 22392260  reserved article iii  building numbering posting of numbers each building in the incorporated area of the city shall have its assigned building number properly displayed in accordance with and conformity to the requirements of this section whether or not mail is delivered to such building or property it shall be the duty of the owners and occupants of each building in the incorporated areas of the city to post the assigned building number on the property in conformity with this section as follows 1 the building number shall be made of a durable weather resistant material and shall be permanently affixed to the building front or to a separate structure such as a mailbox post wall fence or other visible and commonly used area in such a manner so as to be clearly visible from both directions and legible and without obstruction from the street on which the building fronts 2 the numerals shall be of a contrasting color with the immediate background of the building or structure on which such numerals are affixed and shall be not less than three 3 inches in height and onehalf 12 inch in width    2 82492 procedure generally house numbering shall be done in the following manner a eastwest streets lying south of orange street shall be commenced at the extreme east ends and numbered continuously to the western extremity with the even numbers on the north side and the odd numbers on the south side eastwest streets lying north of orange street shall be numbered from san marcos avenue in each direction b the numbering of all streets except malaga street markland place and south castillo drive lying west of the matanzas river or bay and east of ponce de leon boulevard and running north and south south of orange street shall begin at orange street or at a point near that street and be numbered continuously to the south extremity with the even numbers on the west side and the odd numbers on the east side all streets running north and south north of orange street shall be numbered in a similar manner beginning at a point nearest orange street c the numbering of all northsouth streets lying west of ponce de leon boulevard including ponce de leon boulevard and lying south of king street shall begin at king street and be numbered continuously to the south extremity with the even numbers on the west side and the odd numbers on the east side d the numbering of all northsouth streets lying west of malaga street and ponce de leon boulevard including malaga street and ponce de leon boulevard lying north of king street shall begin at king street and be numbered continuously to the north extremity e all northsouth streets lying west of malaga street crossing king street shall be designated south south of king street and north north of king street f castillo drive lying west of its intersection with san marco avenue shall be designated as west castillo drive castillo drive lying to the south of its intersection with san marco avenue shall be designated south castillo drive and numbering in each case shall be from the intersection with san marcos avenue    102494 allotting of numbers when subdivisions have been regularly platted and recorded the numbering shall be made to conform thereto when no regular subdivision exists thirty 30 feet shall be assigned to each number in the city  secs 22642285  reserved article iv  naming and renaming streets aiken street renamed gaspar street aiken petition for vacation abandonment of street alley or other public way there is hereby levied and assessed a charge of a nonrefundable fee of four hundred dollars $40000 to be paid to the city upon the filing with the city commission of any petition for the vacation or abandonment of any street alley or other public way no petition for the vacation or abandonment of any street alley or other public way will be placed by the city manager on the agenda of the city commission unless and until such fee shall have been paid    51407 editors note the effective date for this section is  state law reference user fees authorized fs   waiting period established for petitions previously denied by the city commission whenever the city commission has denied a petition for a vacating or abolishing of a street alley or rightofway no further application shall be filed for the same street alley or rightofway for a period of one 1 year from the date of such action in the event that two 2 or more petitions for the same street alley or rightofway or any part or all of the same has been denied no further petition shall be filed for the same property for a period of two 2 years from the date of
