article vi  outdoor cafes on aviles street and artillery lane footnotes  2  editors note  adopted  amended article vi in its entirety to read as herein set out former article vi  2250022509 pertained to outdoor cafes on aviles street see table for complete derivation definitions when used in this article the following words shall have the following meanings caf means a use located adjacent to a public sidewalk on aviles street and artillery lane which is associated with bars and restaurants where food and beverages are prepared served and sold and are delivered for consumption only in the caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane caf service area on artillery lane means that area of artillery lane between aviles street on the west and charlotte street on the east extending east to include artillery lane from charlotte street on the west to the rightofway intersection of marine street and avenida menendez on the east the described area encompasses only the pedestrian alley or rightofway caf service area on aviles street means that area between the easterly boundary of the west sidewalk located on aviles street south of king street and north of artillery lane and the easterly boundary of vehicular parking spaces located on the westerly boundary of the rightofway of aviles street south of king street and north of artillery lane the described area encompasses only the vehicular parking spaces located on the westerly rightofway of aviles street south of king street and north of artillery lane caf site map means a cityapproved map detailing the location of the caf service area on aviles street and artillery lane and of the pedestrian and vehicular pathway as they relate to a caf located on aviles street and artillery lane the caf site map shall be available for viewing in the planning and building department license means the recipient of a sidewalk caf use license under the terms and provisions of this article and as provided for in the license agreement sign or signs shall have the same meaning as provided for in section 322 of the the city of st augustine and any amendments thereto  102615 license required a it shall be unlawful for any person to operate an outdoor caf on any sidewalk or public rightofway within the city it shall be unlawful for any person to operate a caf in the caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane without obtaining a license as required by this article cafs shall only be located in the caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane b the city manager or his designee shall have the right to remove after twentyfour 24 hours notice any tables chairs and other objects on any public rightofway sidewalk or property which are used in connection with a caf which does not have a valid license  102615 license fee  renewal fee  and penalties for late payments a the annual license fee for establishing or maintaining a caf shall be five dollars $500 per square foot of usable caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane including the area between the tables and chairs as determined by the city manager or his designee b the city manager or his designee may suspend or prorate the annual license fee in cases of public construction or emergency situations c the license fee shall be paid on or before october 1 and shall cover the time period from october 1 of the following calendar year no license shall be issued for any portion of a year but any person or entity operating a caf for a period beginning after may 1 of any year may obtain a license for the remaining portion of the fiscal year upon payment of onehalf of the license fee required by this article except as provided in this article no refund of the fees shall be granted d late payments for license renewal fees shall accrue interest at the rate of ten 10 percent per annum for the first thirty 30 days if the license renewal fee is not paid within sixty 60 days after it is due the license shall terminate automatically any continued operation of the caf after termination shall be construed as operating a caf without a license to use city rightofway  102615 license application a a caf is characterized by tables and chairs and may be shaded by awnings canopies or umbrellas if development permits for same have been obtained application for a license to use city rightofway for a caf shall include but not be limited to the following information 1 name address and telephone number of applicant  2 name and address of the bar or restaurant  3 a copy of a valid city of st augustine business license tax receipt to operate a bar or restaurant fronting the location of the proposed caf the number of chairs proposed for the caf must be included in the number of chairs authorized by the business license tax receipt  4 a copy of a valid use permit for the bar or restaurant fronting the proposed caf  5 a copy of the receipt for payment of all utility connection fees due for the proposed caf seating  6 a copy of a current certificate of insurance in the amounts and categories required by section 22505 of this article  7 a drawing to scale showing the layout and dimensions of the portion of the caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane proposed for use and of the adjacent private property public rightofway and public sidewalk  the proposed location of the caf  the size and number of tables chairs steps planters and umbrellas  the location of doorways trees parking meters bus shelters sidewalk benches trash receptacles and any other sidewalk obstruction either existing or proposed within the pedestrian area serving the site of the proposed caf  8 photographs drawings or manufacturers brochures fully describing the appearance of all proposed tables chairs umbrellas or other objects related to the caf  and 9 an affidavit from the owners of the propertyies fronting the proposed caf consenting to the operation of the caf at that location b an application shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable base application fee of one hundred fifty dollars $15000 c applications shall be reviewed for compliance with city ordinances and must be approved by the following departments or divisions public works planning and building heritage tourism fire code enforcement and financial services  102615 standards criteria and conditions for license a cafs on aviles street are restricted to the portion of the caf service area on aviles street frontage directly across from a licensed bar or restaurant located on the west side of aviles street to which the license is issued or within the frontage of the building located on the west side of aviles street where the licensed bar or restaurant is located provided that written approval for use as a caf is supplied to the city by the building owner the area of the license may also be extended by a maximum total of fifty 50 feet on either side or on both sides of the licensees business subject to the provisions of subsection b below b in the event the subject area of the license extends to a portion of the caf service area on aviles street in front of an adjacent owners property the licensee must obtain written permission for use of such area from the adjacent property owner the revocation or suspension of such permission shall operate to grant the licensee a prorated refund of the annual license fee paid to the city of st augustine for the operation of a caf but shall not operate to grant the licensee a refund of any other fees paid to the city of st augustine for the operation of a caf as required by this article c cafes on artillery lane are restricted to the portion of the caf service areas on artillery lane so that a clear threefoot or thirtysixinch pedestrian walkway shall be maintained length of the rightofway the caf must be associated with a licensed bar or restaurant operating adjacent to the rightofway of the caf service areas on artillery lane provided that written approval for use as a caf is supplied to the city by the building owners d in the event the subject area of the license extends to a portion of the caf service area on artillery lane in front of an adjacent owners property the licensee must obtain written permission for use of such area from the adjacent property owner the revocation or suspension of such permission shall operate to grant the licensee a prorated refund of the annual license fee paid to the city of st augustine for the operation of a caf but shall not operate to grant the licensee a refund of any other fees paid to the city of st augustine for the operation of a caf as required by this article e licenses shall not be issued where the tables and chairs would be placed within five 5 feet of fire hydrants alleys or intersections f no tables chairs umbrellas or other fixtures shall be allowed within five 5 feet of a pedestrian crosswalk or handicap corner curb cut g a caf may serve any alcoholic beverages which they are entitled to serve and sell under that cafs state beverage license no such service shall commence unless the operation of the caf has procured all necessary licenses for the sale and service of beer and wine has provided copies of said licenses to the city manager or his designee has acquired insurance covering the sale and service of alcoholic beverages to which the city is named as an additional insured and has provided a copy of said insurance and endorsements naming the city as an additional insured to the city manager or his designee h no outside service or consumption of alcoholic beverages shall be allowed except within the boundaries of the area described in the caf license and only during the regular hours of operation of the licensees business provided such hours of operation do not violate the provisions of this the hours for sale service and consumption of alcoholic beverages i no object shall be allowed around the perimeter of an area occupied by tables and chairs which would have the affect of forming a physical or visual barrier discouraging the use of the tables and chairs or which would have the affect of obstructing the pedestrian use of the sidewalk alley or the vehicular rightofway located on aviles street or artillery lane except that the city manager or his designee may allow the use of planters j tables chairs umbrellas and other objects incorporated into the use of the caf shall be of quality design materials size elevation and workmanship to ensure the safety and convenience of users and to enhance the visual quality of the urban environment design materials and colors shall be approved by the director of planning and building for appropriateness within the historic district prior to the issuance of the caf license k umbrellas and other decorative material shall be fireretardant pressuretreated or manufactured of fireresistant material signs lettering and images of any type are prohibited on umbrellas chairs tables and other permissible fixtures which are located on the public rightofway l prior to issuance or renewal of a caf license the citys finance director shall certify that there are no outstanding fines monies fees taxes or other charges owed to the city by the person or entity requesting a caf license a caf license will not be issued until all outstanding debts to the city are paid in full m only one 1 sign shall be allowed per caf for every fifty 50 feet of frontage the location size design materials and color of the sign shall be approved by the director of planning and building prior to the issuance of a caf license and the sign location shall be shown on the permit exhibit the sign shall not be a sandwich board or aframe sign n the license issued may be transferred to a new owner only for the location and area listed on the license the transferred license shall be valid only for the remainder of the period for which it was originally issued o the city manager or his designee may require the temporary removal of cafs when street sidewalk or utility repairs necessitate such action if such temporary removal exceeds fifteen 15 days the city manager or his designee shall prorate the remaining license fee for each additional day the caf is removed and apply a credit toward the following years license fee or if requested to do so by the licensee refund the remaining fee to the licensee p the city manager or his designee may cause the immediate removal or relocation of all or parts of the caf in emergency situations or for safety considerations q the city and its officers and employees shall not be responsible for caf fixtures relocated during emergencies nor shall the city and its officers and employees be responsible for lost business ie meals drinks or restaurant events during emergencies r the license shall be specifically limited to the area shown on the exhibit attached to and made a part of the license s the licensee shall use positive action to assure that the operation of a caf in no way interferes with sidewalk users or limits their free unobstructed passage t a caf license shall be issued only to bars where food is prepared and served and to restaurants u tables chairs umbrellas and other allowable objects provided with a caf shall be maintained with a clean and attractive appearance and shall be in good repair at all times v the area covered by the license and the sidewalk and roadway or alley immediately adjacent to it shall be maintained in a neat and orderly appearance at all times by the licensee and the area shall be cleared of all debris as needed during the day again at the close of each business day and as determined by the city manager or his designee licensee shall also be responsible to clean the floor surface on which the caf is located w no commercial signs shall be permitted except as provided for in this article and in the license agreement x no tables chairs or any other parts of cafs shall be attached chained or in any manner affixed to any tree post sign or other fixture curb or sidewalk in or near the caf area y no additional outdoor seating authorized herein shall be used for calculating seating requirements pertaining to the location of applications for or issuance of a liquor license for any establishment  nor shall the outdoor seating be used as the basis for computing required seating for restaurants and dining rooms or as grounds for claiming exemption from such requirements under the provisions of any city ordinance or state law z no food preparation fire or fire apparatus shall be allowed on the caf service area on aviles street or artillery lane the public sidewalk on aviles street or artillery lane or the public rightofway on aviles street or artillery lane whether or not such area is covered by this license aa upon the issuance of a hurricane warning by st johns county the licensee shall forthwith place indoors all tables chairs and other equipment located on the sidewalk or in the public rightofway the issuance of such hurricane warning shall constitute an emergency situation as referenced herein bb only the caf equipment specifically shown on the approved diagram and not otherwise prohibited shall be allowed in the license area the estimated chair count per table may vary within the prescribed area provided that the chairs remain within the approved caf area no storage of chairs tables dishes flatware or other caf equipment shall be allowed in the license area in any portion of the public rightofway or outside the structural confines of the building in which the restaurant is located  however the licensee may maintain such nonpermanent structures as rolling service stations in the licensed area during hours of operation cc there shall be no live entertainment amplifiers or speakers placed in the licensed area unless allowed as a special event which shall not exceed two 2 days in length conditions such as hours and days of operation and audio levels will be regulated by the office of public affairs and these conditions may vary during the year dd the licensee shall comply with the following design requirements regarding outdoor seating clear knee space under tables 27 height 30 width 19 depth and 34 maximum table height to the top of the table alternatively equivalent accessible seating may be provided an acceptable example of equivalent seating would be a round table of 36 diameter 4 stem and base with individual supports the pedestal and base of the table shall not encroach in the clear floor area ee the licensee shall allow no lighting in the caf service area except for lighting on each table which lighting shall have a selfcontained power source ff the licensee shall comply with the florida accessibility building construction gg the licensee shall be responsible for obtaining applicable state permits  102615 liability and insurance a the licensee agrees to indemnify defend save and hold harmless the city its officers and employees from any and all claims liability lawsuits damages and causes of action which may arise out of the license or the licensees activity on the demised premises b the licensee agrees to meet and maintain for the entire license period at its own expense the following requirements 1 commercial general liability insurance in the amount of one million dollars $100000000 per occurrence for bodily injury and property damage the city must be named as an additional insured on the policy and an endorsement must be issued as part of the policy reflecting compliance with this requirement 2 cafs are prohibited from selling or serving alcoholic beverages other than beer and wine and are not required to maintain additional liability insurance for such purpose 3 workers compensation and employers liability as required by the state of florida 4 all policies must be issued by companies authorized to do business in the state of florida 5 the city must receive thirty 30 days written notice prior to any cancellation nonrenewal or material change in the coverage provided 6 the licensee must provide and have approved by the city an original certificate of insurance as evidence that the above requirements have been met prior to commencing operations failure to comply with these requirements shall cause a suspension or revocation of the license  102615 revocation or suspension of license  emergencies a the approval of a caf license is conditional at all times a caf license may be revoked or suspended if it is found that 1 any necessary business or health permit has been suspended revoked or canceled 2 the licensee does not have policies of insurance which are correct and effective in the minimum coverages and amounts described in this article 3 the licensee exceeds the approved square footage by placing any additional tables chairs or other equipment beyond the approved area 4 the licensee has failed to correct violations of this article or conditions of their license agreement within seventytwo 72 hours of receipt of the city managers or his designees notice of same delivered in writing to the licensee b in the event the licensee fails to remove any tables chairs and other objects related to the caf within seventytwo 72 hours of receipt of the city managers or his designees final notice of revocation or suspension the city manager or his designee shall have the right to remove said objects  102615 removal and storage fees if the city removes under any section herein tables chairs or other objects related to a caf the licensee or caf operator shall be responsible for the reasonable expenses incurred by the city for the removal and storage of said objects the city manager or his designee shall promulgate and review as needed regulations regarding such storage and the disposition of property under this article  102615 enforcement  notice of violation a or law enforcement officers shall issue twentyfour 24 hour warning notices for all nonlife safety violations of this article lifesafety violations are defined as those conditions which exist involving serious danger to public health safety or welfare including violations of the florida accessibility building construction in which case the aforesaid notice shall not be required b if a code inspector or law enforcement officer finds a violation of this article said inspector shall follow the procedures of sections 2318 of the  102615 fine for violators a fine of one hundred dollars $10000 per day for each day the violation exists shall be imposed for violators of this article  102615 subdivisions footnotes  1  cross reference archaeological preservation ch 6  buildings and building regulations ch 8  housing discrimination  1626 et seq  planning and development ch 21  trees and landscaping ch 25  zoning ch 28 state law reference municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166  subdivision regulations required fs  2  adoption of land development regulations fs    platting fs   et seq article i  in general short title this chapter shall be known as the residential subdivision regulations of st augustine florida art i 41183   71183   51093 definition of terms a the definition of the following terms given in fs   are incorporated herein by reference 1 alley 2 block 3 board 4 culdesac 5 developer 6 easement 7 governing body 8 improvements 9 land surveyor 10 lot 11 municipality 12 prm 13 pcp 14 plat 15 point of compound curvature 16 point of curvature 17 point of reserve curvature 18 point of tangency 19 public utility 20 rightofway 21 state plane coordinates 22 street 23 survey date b all other terms used herein except as the context indicates otherwise shall have the same meanings and definitions as those provided by section 282 c certain words in these regulations are defined for the purpose hereof as follows division of real property as used in the definition of subdivision includes division by sale or transfer of land includes division by survey and includes division by use of a drawing map or plat subdivider means any person who undertakes the subdivision of land subdivision means the division of real property in the city into two 2 or more contiguous lots parcels tracts tiers blocks sites units or any other division of land designated by reference to the number or symbol of the lot parcel or such units contained in the plat or drawing of such subdivision for the purpose whether immediate or future of transfer of ownership or if the establishment of a new street is involved any division of such parcel the work includes establishment of new rightsofway and alleys and additions when they result in the division of real property when appropriate to the context the word also includes resubdivision and relates to the process of subdividing or to lands or areas subdivided this shall not apply to gifts or devises within a family unit nor to any approved pud subdivision as defined in the citys zoning ordinance the following shall be exempt and not subject to the regulations prescribed by this chapter 1 the combination or recombination of portions of previously platted lots where the total number of lots in the previously recorded plat is not increased and the resultant lots comply with the standards of this chapter and the zoning code 2 the division of land into parcels where each and every parcel therein is more than five 5 acres and where such division does not involve the creation addition or deletion of or change in public or private street lines or public or private easements for ingress and egress of whatsoever kind 3 the public acquisition by purchase acceptance of deed of dedication  or exercise of the right of eminent domain of strips of land for the widening or opening of streets the word subdivision shall and does include the division of real property contained in existing platted lots regardless of whether or not such division creates less than two 2 additional lots when the effect of such division is to increase the total number of lots or parcels in the previously recorded plat or when the effect is to add delete establish create change or alter street lines or public or private easements of whatsoever kind within the boundaries of the previously recorded plat the word subdivision shall not include the vacation of roads pursuant to fs  33610 the word subdivision shall not apply to the division of real property contained in an existing platted lot that is part of a subdivision that was recorded prior to the effective date of the legislation from which this chapter is derived provided that 1 no parcel lot or portion will be created whose lot area is less than one 1 acre 2 the lots as divided meet the standards set by the citys zoning ordinance 3 no previously existing lot line is moved altered or changed 4 no street lines or public or private easements are created added changed or deleted this shall not apply to the addition of a private driveway this limited exemption shall not effect or alter the zoning ordinances that pertain to the subject property title certification means every plat of a subdivision submitted to the city commission must be accompanied by a title opinion of an attorney at law licensed in the state or a title insurance company policy confirming that the lands as described and shown on the plat are titled in the name of the person executing the dedication as it is shown on the plat and that the developer has title to the lands the title opinion or policy shall also show all liens mortgages and other encumbrances on the land to be platted transfer or sale means the change in ownership of either legal title an equitable interest or the beneficial interest of a lot or parcel within a subdivision and includes but is not limited to contracts for sale and agreements for deeds  provided however it shall not include any contract for sale that specifically provides in bold print that the sale is contingent upon the recordation of a subdivision plat pursuant to this chapter art v 41183   71183 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 application of chapter  conflicts the regulations set forth in this chapter shall be applicable to all subdivisions of land as defined herein in the incorporated areas of the city in the event of conflict with zoning ordinances in existence on the effective date of the legislation from which this section is derived the aforesaid zoning ordinances shall prevail art iii 41183   71183 purpose the purpose of this chapter is to establish procedures and standards for the development and subdivision of real estate within the city in an effort to among other things insure proper legal description identification monumentation and recording of real estate boundaries  further orderly layout and appropriate use of land  provide safe convenient and economic circulation of vehicular traffic  provide safe and suitable building sites which drain properly and are readily accessible to emergency vehicles  assure proper installation of water and sewer improvements  help conserve and protect the physical economic and scenic resources of st augustine and promote the public health safety and general welfare art iv 41183   71183 amendments the city commission may from time to time adopt amendments to the rules and regulations herein in order to effectuate fully the provisions and purposes of this chapter art xv 41183   71183 grandfather clause this chapter shall not apply to subdivisions that have been approved by the city commission and recorded prior to the effective date of the legislation from which this chapter is derived this chapter shall not apply to real property located in recorded or unrecorded subdivisions that are in actual existence on the effective date of the legislation from which this chapter is derived provided that such subdivisions meet the following criteria 1 there has been an actual sale or conveyance of a lot or parcel within such subdivision by the original subdivider to another person or entity prior to the effective date of this chapter 2 the sale or conveyance referred to in subsection 1 above was not made with the intent to place such subdivision within the exemption created by this grandfather clause art xvi 41183   71183 waivers and variations after a report from the planning agency and appropriate city personnel the city commission may waive the requirements of these regulations where compliance would be a practical impossibility or would cause unnecessary hardship andor where the owner proposes an alternative which conforms to the general intent and spirit of these regulations art xi 41183   71183 enforcement penalties and remedies a any person who commits an unlawful act as described herein or who shall violate any of the codes regulations restrictions and limitations promulgated under the authority of this chapter is guilty of an offense punishable as provided in section 18 b any unlawful act or violation of any of the codes restrictions and limitations promulgated under the provisions of this chapter may be restricted by injunction including a mandatory injunction and otherwise abated in any manner provided by law and such suit or action may be instituted and maintained by the city commission or by any person affected by the violation of any such regulations restrictions or limitations c a purchaser of land sold in violation of this section may within one 1 year from the date of purchase thereof be entitled to bring an appropriate action to avoid such sale or to bring action against the seller for any damages which he suffers as a result of the sellers unlawful act or both this section specifically authorizes a remedy consisting of setting aside such unlawful sales this section shall not be construed to limit civil or criminal actions otherwise permitted nor to reduce the time periods allowed by other statutes or laws of limitations art xiii 41183   71183 prohibited activity a it shall be unlawful for anyone who is the owner or agent of the owner of any subdivided land in the city to transfer sell agree to sell or lease any part or portion of such land by reference to exhibition of or other use of a plat map or drawing of a subdivision of such land without having submitted a plat of such subdivision to the city commission for approval as required by this chapter and without having recorded the approved subdivision plat in the official records of the county penalties for the commission of such unlawful acts shall be provided in section 238 it is the specific intent of the city that the adoption of this chapter shall not create any penalty by the city or state for the sole act of negotiating to sell unrecorded subdivision parcels b no street storm sewer water or sanitary facilities in connection with a subdivision shall be laid out constructed opened or dedicated for public use and travel or for the common use of occupants of buildings or lots abutting thereon unless described on a subdivision plat approved and recorded in accordance with the provisions of this chapter public utilities may be recorded on a supplemental plat and may be referred to on the subdivision plat c see section 231 concerning building construction and building permit restrictions art vi 41183   71183 building construction and building restrictions all lots or parcels of land within a subdivided area shall have access to either a public street which has been accepted by the city commission as shown on a recorded subdivision plat or to a public street which has otherwise received the legal status of a public street or a private street dedicated for the use of such lot or parcel but not accepted for maintenance by the city but for which appropriate arrangements have been made for maintenance privately art xii 41183   71183 bonding a the bonds referred to in this section may be in the form of a certified or cashiers check irrevocable letter of credit escrow agreement or surety bond the terms of which shall be subject to the approval of the city commission b surety bonds shall be with a bonding company doing business in the state and acceptable to the city commission c the owner shall file a surety bond with the director of financial services at the time the subdivision plat is finally approved by the city commission conditioned upon the faithful performance and completion of all construction within one 1 year after the date the bond is received and approved by the city commission of all improvements required under these subdivision regulations enforceable by or payable to the city in a sum at least equal to the cost of constructing the roadway and drainage improvements as estimated by the subdividers engineer and further conditioned upon the payment of contractors subcontractors suppliers and materialmen providing labor or materials for the construction of such improvements such a bond shall be hereinafter referred to as a construction bond if at the end of one 1 year following receipt and approval of the construction bond by the city commission the subdivider has not substantially completed the improvements required or requested of and received from the city commission an extension not to exceed one 1 additional year per extension the city commission may after notice to the subdivider hold a hearing and require the subdivider to show cause why the construction permit should not be revoked and why the construction bond should not be forfeited the subdivider shall have an opportunity to present evidence justifying the delay in completion at the time and place of the hearing so established and at the conclusion of the hearing the city commission shall determine whether to grant an additional extension of time for the completion or to revoke the construction permit and forfeit the construction bond in lieu of providing for a construction bond and upon compliance with all other requirements of this chapter for final subdivision plat approval the owner may request from the city commission approval for construction of the required roadway and drainage improvements prior to final plat approval the city commission may upon application by the owner approve construction of such improvements provided as follows 1 such improvements are completed within one year of approval by the city commission  and 2 the subdividerowner shall provide an engineers certificate that all improvements are complete in accordance with city requirements and city staff has inspected such improvements upon completion certification by an engineer and final inspection by the city of all improvements the city shall approve the final plat for recording and the owner may proceed to sell property within such subdivsion in compliance with this chapter d upon completion of all required improvements the subdivider may after inspection and approval of the city engineer submit a letter to the city requesting that the city commission release the construction bond or if aplicable final plat approval the request shall be in the city office fourteen 14 days preceding the date that the commission action is requested upon receipt of notice of action by the commission the city shall in writing advise the subdivider of the action taken e where request is made for acceptance of subdivision units or for release of the construction bond the person seeking such acceptance or release shall first furnish a good and sufficient bond on a bonding company acceptable to the city in the amount of four dollars $400 per running foot of road length contained within the subdivision unit to secure the maintenance of the roads and dedicated improvements this bond is to be furnished as a guarantee against faulty workmanship construction and materials such bond shall be submitted by the owner to the city commission and shall remain in force for a minimum of one 1 year following date of such release or acceptance and such warranty bond shall insure the city commission for the maintenance of the dedicated facilities f one 1 year after date of acceptance of the warranty bond by the city commission the owner may submit a request to the city for release of the warranty bond the city shall again review the subdivision unit in question for appropriate commission action art x 41183   71183   12698 secs 23122335  reserved article ii  plat approval procedures generally the following procedures for securing subdivision plat approval shall be followed in submitting reviewing and acting upon all subdivision plats within the city the subdivider andor his surveyor engineer or land planner is encouraged but not required to discuss informally his preliminary studies and sketches for any subdivision of land with the city offices listed in section 2338 as well as those of other offices such as the county health department or county community development department many times these discussions may lead to a more complete preliminary plan or plat as hereinafter set forth during the review process the subdivider or his agent may be called upon for consultation each preliminary plan or plat for a subdivision shall be presented for review prior to detailed development of the plat this preliminary plan will benefit the subdivider in accordance with the degree of completeness of the plan such preliminary plan shall be accompanied by a written statement describing the proposed subdivision such preliminary plan and statement shall be reviewed by the city planning and building department public works department fire department and police department and shall be submitted to the city planning and zoning board for preliminary approval subject to such revision as may be deemed necessary art vii 41183   71183   51093 master plan where the subdivision of a tract of land is to be carried out in one 1 or more stages a subdivision master plan of the tentative future lot layout street system water system sewer system and storm drainage system for the entire tract shall be prepared and filed with the planning and building department 0 41183   71183   51093 preliminary plat a all of the following city departments must approve preliminary plats prior to submitting to the planning and zoning board a preliminary plat submittal meeting is recommended involving the appropriate city departments and the agents of the developer 1 planning and building department 2 public works department 3 city manager 4 city attorney 5 city fire department 6 city police department b the city manager shall receive two 2 copies and each of the remaining offices shall be provided with one 1 legible reproduced copy of the proposed preliminary plat a minimum of three 3 weeks prior to submittal to the planning and zoning board for approval should any of these city offices decide that other offices or utility companies need to be involved they may make necessary contacts andor request additional reproduced copies for these offices andor companies c this preliminary plat shall be prepared on sheet sizes of twentyfour 24 inches by thirtysix 36 inches with at least a oneinch margin on three 3 sides with a threeinch margin on the left side of the plat for binding purposes and shall be in conformance with fs   d the plat will be reviewed by the city offices during the threeweek period prior to submittal of the preliminary plat to the city planning and zoning board the developer or his agent will be contacted during this period of time should any discrepancies be apparent that would affect preliminary approval however the reviewing offices agreement as to acceptability of format and content is not to be construed as assurance of final acceptance by the city 0 711 41183   71183   51093 construction drawings construction drawings of street storm sewer water or sanitary facilities as appropriate will be reviewed by the city public works director prior to submission of the final plat to the city commission the developer or his agent will be contacted during that period of time should any discrepancies be apparent in such construction drawings that might affect approval however the city public works directors agreement as to the acceptability of such construction drawings is not to be construed as an assurance of final acceptance of the plat by the city 2 41183   71183   51093 final plat a the final plat approval can only be granted by the city commission in an open public meeting after review and recommendation by the planning and zoning board b the final plat shall be prepared by a currently registered surveyor or engineer of the state of florida the submittal must be one 1 original drawing and one 1 copy made in conformance with fs   the city commission may grant approval of plats with slight variations provided that the variations do not conflict with the requirements of fs ch 177 c in addition a drawing prepared on the same material as the final plat must be submitted for the property appraiser showing only dimensions of lots rightsofway and easements this drawing must be to a scale of one 1 inch equals two hundred 200 feet and the sheet size must be twentytwo 22 inches by thirtytwo 32 inches or smaller with a onehalfinch margin all around 0 41183   71183   51093 required documentation prior to recording a plat the following is required 1 surveyors or engineers certificates on the plat 2 construction plans for roadway design approved by the city 3 drainage design plans approved by the city and the county health department 4 certification of title or title opinion addressed to and in favor of the city 5 dedications by owners on the plat 6 dedications by mortgagees and lienors if applicable on the plat 7 construction bond andor warranty bonds as required under section 2311 8 signature of approval on the plat from a city manager b city finance director c city attorney d planning and building department e city public works director 1 41183   71183   51093 dedication and adoption every plat of a subdivision filed for record must contain a dedication by the developer the dedication shall be executed by all developers owners mortgagees lienors and other persons having a record interest in the lands subdivided in the same manner in which deeds are required to be executed when a tract or parcel of land has been subdivided and a part thereof bearing the dedication executed by the developers or mortgagees having a record interest in the lands subdivided and the approval of the city commission has been secured and recorded in compliance with this act all streets alleys easements rightsofway and public areas shown on such plat unless otherwise stated shall be deemed to have been dedicated to the public for the uses and purposes thereon stated however nothing herein shall be construed as creating an obligation upon the city commission to perform any act of construction or maintenance within such dedicated areas except wherein the obligation is voluntarily assumed by the city commission 2 41183   71183 required fees an application fee of two hundred seventyfive dollars $27500 which shall be nonrefundable shall be paid by the developer prior to submitting for preliminary plan review in addition all expenses incurred by the city shall be paid by the developer prior to city commission approval additional fees shall be determined at a flat rate per hour as determined by the city manager in accordance with section 274 of the the city of st augustine required fees will include all costs incurred by the city which may include private consultants necessary to complete plan review 3 41183   71183   51093 final plat approval approval of the final plat by the city commission shall be deemed only an acceptance on behalf of the public of the dedication of the streets and other public land as shown upon such plat unless otherwise provided and shall not be deemed an acceptance for maintenance of the roads streets drainage water and sewer systems and appurtenances installed by the subdivider or developer 0 41183   71183 suitability of land the city commission need not approve any subdivision plan and plat unless the land included within the subdivision is suitable for the various purposes proposed in the request for subdivision approval 1 41183   71183 prerequisites to recordation a before any plat of a subdivision can be recorded the owner or developer must comply with fs ch 177 in addition to the requirements of fs ch 177 all existing streets must be paved to city specifications or paving performance or construction bond posted b lot size must conform to zoning regulations and ordinances pertaining to the property as currently zoned c the plat must be reviewed and approved by the city public works director city planning and building department and city planning and zoning board and the city attorney before presenting to the city commission 2 41183   71183   10 51093 secs 23472365  reserved article iii  design and construction standards division 1  generally suitability conformity of land the land proposed for a subdivision shall be suitable for development and upon completion of the drainage construction described in the drainage design plans shall not be subject to flooding poor drainage erosion or other conditions detrimental to the health safety and general welfare of the public to the fullest extent subdivisions shall be designed so as to conform to and take advantage of the topographic and other natural features of the land including the preservation of existing trees and watercourses all proposed subdivisions shall comply fully with the existing zoning regulations applicable to the land all roadway and drainage plans and construction shall conform to the requirements of this article 0 41183   71183 data submittal and inspection the city shall be notified in advance of the beginning of construction on subdivision streets drainage sewer and water facilities drainage and roadway construction shall be in conformance with the plans submitted under section 2341 1 test reports prepared by a qualified competent testing laboratory shall be furnished prior to requesting city acceptance of streets for maintenance on the following a florida bearing value tests on subgrade b compaction tests on subgrade and base 2 the city shall be notified of the completion of the following items of work and shall make an inspection of this work within two 2 working days after notification a storm sewers prior to backfilling including underdrains b stabilized subgrade c curb and concrete work d roadway base e surface course should the city be unable to perform the inspection within the twoworkingday period the developer may elect to proceed with construction by providing certification by a registered engineer that work is performed in compliance with the specifications 3 a qualified city representative will periodically visit the project site to make a visual inspection of the progress of work and to assure compliance with the specifications 4 the city shall be notified when the project is complete upon receiving a written request for final inspection of the completed work the city shall within two 2 weeks perform the final inspection and shall notify the developer of the results of the inspection 5 41183   71183 a lot arrangement and design shall be such that all lots will provide satisfactory and desirable division for the type of development and use contemplated lot sizes shall conform to the citys zoning regulations b where possible lot lines shall intersect streets and each other at right angles and in no case shall a lot have an interior angle of less than sixty 60 degrees unless approved by the planning and building department 4 41183   71183   51093 utility and drainage easements utility and drainage easements if any shall front along public streets and rightsofway drainage easements only may be located along rear or side lot lines provided that the easement is enclosed with fencing which separates dedicated easements along easement line and provides access gates at each rightofway intersection fronting a public street fencing and gates shall be chain link type with a minimum height of four 4 feet from adjacent grade easements shall be a minimum of fifteen 15 feet in width or thirty 30 feet if an open ditch where utility and drainage easements are planned adjacent to the subdivision boundary such easements must lie within the subdivision proper where required front lot easements will be ten 10 feet minimum although the use of open ditches and swales is discouraged due to the difficulty involved with maintenance an acceptable design preventing future congestion and erosion along swale and ditch bottoms and banks may be approved 5 41183   71183   51093 secs 23702380  reserved division 2  streets footnotes  2  state law reference minimum construction standards for streets fs   access to public streets every subdivision shall have adequate access to a publicly maintained road or street dedicated to public use which has been accepted for maintenance by the city county or state department of transportation where a proposed subdivision does not immediately adjoin such a road or street the subdivider shall provide access from the subdivision to a dedicated road or street in accordance with the requirements set forth within these regulations or as otherwise may be specified by the city all lots within a proposed subdivision shall have direct access to a street or road dedicated to public use or approved private road 1 41183   71183 street names a new streets shall be appropriately marked at each intersection new streets which are extensions of existing streets shall bear the name of the existing street all streets shall be named in the following manner or in a manner acceptable to the city commission direction long short less than 1000 feet  east and west streets places north and south avenues court diagonal roads ways curving drives lanes or circles b in no case shall a name for a proposed street duplicate an existing street name irrespective of whether the street is further described as an avenue boulevard drive way place or court the commission reserves the right to approve andor reject any proposed street name 2 41183   71183 blocks a residential blocks shall be not more than one thousand eight hundred 1800 feet in length the width of any residential block shall be sufficient to allow two 2 tiers of appropriate depth except where lots abut directly upon an expressway major arterial lake waterway or a land use other than residential in the latter case consideration shall be given in the subdivision design to the proper buffering of the residential lots b in a block over one thousand two hundred 1200 feet in length or where otherwise deemed necessary to give pedestrian access to schools local shopping centers or parks the city may require rightofway and pavement for pedestrian ways rightofway for pedestrian ways shall have a minimum width of ten 10 feet 3 41183   71183 roadway design all roadway design construction plans submitted to the city for review and approval shall bear the seal and signature of a stateregistered professional engineer responsible for the project and shall equal or exceed the following design standards roadway sections shall clearly show the type and depth of subgrade proposed bearing value of subgrade the thickness and density of the base course and the thickness and type of surface course typical cross sections are provided in exhibits d to the legislation from which this chapter is derived 0 41183   71183 minimum rightofway width rightofway shall be as listed below or of sufficient width to provide for adequate drainage facilities and utilities whichever is greater the city commission may allow limited lesser width under circumstances wherein the city determines the public interest would be better served by such exception road classification row width feet marginal access 50 minor street 60 collector street 80 1 41183   71183 minimum pavement width the minimum width of street pavement in subdivisions shall be as indicated below type of development street classification pavement width feet residential no onstreet parking marginal access minor street collector street 20 20 24 industrial no onstreet parking marginal access minor street collector street 20 24 28 estatetype no onstreet parking minor street collector street 20 24 2 41183   71183 pavement requirements a stabilized subgrade the requirements for stabilized subgrade for streets are as follows 1 requirements all roadway subgrades shall have a minimum depth and bearing value based on the following type of development compacted stabilized subgrade depth florida bearing value fbv residential 6 inch  or more depending on soil conditions 40 industrial arterial collector 12 inch  60 where the existing soils to be used in the roadway subgrade have the required bearing value no additional stabilizing material need be added or mixed in the width of the stabilized subgrade shall be a minimum of two 2 feet greater than the finished surface course 2 stabilizing materials the stabilizing material if any is required shall be highbearing value soil sandclay limerock shell or other material approved by the city 3 construction the construction of the stabilized roadbed including compaction shall conform to the dot standard specifications latest edition 4 testing tests for the subgrade bearing capacity and compaction shall be located no more than five hundred 500 feet apart and shall be staggered to the left right and on the centerline of the roadway when in the judgment of the city conditions warrant additional testing to assure compliance with the specifications the developers engineer will be advised in writing that additional tests will be required and the extent of such additional tests b base courses the base courses for streets shall be as follows 1 requirements subject to the recommendation of the city base course materials may be either limerock coquina shell soilcement or suitablelocal materials with a minimum thickness and density as follows type development minimum thickness minimum density residential 6 inch  95% modified proctor industrial arterial collector 8 inch  95% modified proctor 2 materials and construction the width shall be a minimum of one 1 foot greater than the finished surface course limerock and coquina shell shall conform to the dot standard specifications latest edition for base course materials including construction methods soilcement bases shall conform to the portland cement association specifications latest edition for materials and construction methods 3 prime and tack coats all bases shall be primed in accordance with the dot standard specifications latest edition tack coat shall not be required on primed bases except on areas which have become excessively dirty and cannot be cleaned or in areas where the prime has cured and lost all bonding effect if required tack coat material and construction methods shall conform to dot standard specifications latest edition 4 testing tests for base thickness and compaction shall be located no more than five hundred 500 feet apart and shall be staggered to the left right and on the centerline of the roadway when conditions warrant additional testing to assure compliance with the specifications the developers engineer will be advised in writing that additional tests will be required and the extent of such additional tests c surface course for flexible pavements the surface course for flexible street pavements shall be as follows 1 requirements surface covers for flexible pavements shall be type s or type ii asphaltic concrete and shall meet the following minimum thickness requirements type of development roadway classification minimum surface course thickness inches residential marginal access 1 minor street 1 collector street 114 industrial marginal access 114 minor street 114 collector street 112 2 materials and construction asphaltic concrete type s or type ii including prime and tack coats shall conform to the dot standard specifications latest edition for materials and method of construction d portland cement concrete pavement the requirements for portland cement concrete street pavement shall be as follows 1 stabilized subgrade thickness requirements stabilized subgrade requirements for portland cement concrete pavements shall be the same as those for flexible pavements 2 pavement minimum pavement thickness requirements are as follows type of development minimum thickness inches residential 6 industrial arterial collector 8 3 materials and construction portland cement concrete pavement including joints shall conform to the dot standard specifications latest edition for materials and method of construction e test results contractors must provide certified test results of the degrees of compaction of the subgrade and the base from an independent qualified test laboratory f protection against erosion grassing and mulching will be included on the subdivision roadside as deemed necessary by the developer to protect his oneyear warranty bond against erosion and rivulets caused by surface runoff from the road surface 3 41183   71183   51093 secs 23882395  reserved division 3  drainage design generally the drainage design plan for the subdivision shall equal or exceed design standards set forth hereinafter and the policies and procedures established in the drainage manual of the florida department of transportation and the design criteria contained therein unstable and highly erosive soil conditions prevalent in the city indicate that design velocity is critical the maximum allowable velocity shall be in conformance with the values stated in the drainage manual but not in excess of five 5 feet per second 4 41183   71183 drainage map the subdivision engineer or surveyor shall include in the construction plans a master drainage map showing all existing and proposed features the map shall be prepared on a scale not to exceed one 1 inch equals two hundred 200 feet 41 41183   71183 roadway ditch gradient a minimum gradient shall be onetenth 01 percent or the minimum required to provide for the design flow whichever is greater b maximum gradients shall be determined from soil characteristics in unstable and highly erosive soil conditions the maximum allowable gradient shall be that which will produce allowable velocities consistent with the provisions of the dot drainage manual c unless otherwise required by the county the following will be standard ditch protection ditch gradient protection required less than 10% grassing and mulching 10%  199% sodding 20%  greater ditch paving 42 41183   71183 sidedrains for roadway ditches a placement sidedrain pipe shall be placed in the ditch line of the proposed roadway ditch with an invert elevation threetenths 03 of a foot below the proposed ditch grade b construction details a schedule showing the size and type sidedrain needed to gain entrance to each subdivision lot shall appear in the subdivision construction plan 43 41183   71183 minimum pipe size the minimum pipe size for culverts shall be as follows type culvert minimum size crossdrains 15 inch  or equivalent sidedrains 15 inch  or equivalent 44 41183   71183 materials the following pipe materials are acceptable 1 reinforced concrete pipe 2 corrugated steel pipe and pipe arch asphalt coated in noncorrosive areas only 3 city manager and chief of police relative to traffic generally a the city manager and chief of police of the city except as otherwise directed by this chapter and except as otherwise directed from time to time by the city commission shall have power and they are hereby authorized to regulate the operation and parking of vehicles within the corporate limits of the city by the erection or placing of proper signs or markers indicating prohibited or limited parking restricted speed areas oneway streets arterial streets stop streets uturns play streets school zones hospital zones loading and unloading zones quiet zones and other signs or markers indicating the place and manner of operating or parking vehicles within the corporate limits of the city the city manager and chief of police shall also have power and they are hereby authorized to designate bus stops and taxicab stands and to erect signs prohibiting the parking of vehicles other than buses and taxicabs in such stands the city manager and chief of police shall also have power and they are hereby authorized to designate truck routes and to regulate the parking of vehicles of various sizes and weights the city manager and chief of police shall further have power and they are hereby authorized to cause all such necessary signs or markers to be erected or placed on any street or part of a street when they deem such action necessary b the city manager and chief of police shall also have power and they are hereby authorized to fix the speed limit on streets which are narrow or winding or where special hazards exist with respect to pedestrians or other traffic or by reason of street conditions c the city manager and chief of police are further empowered and authorized to mark off traffic lanes on streets and parts of streets indicating and directing the flow of traffic when in their judgment such action is necessary d the existence of such signs or markers at any place within the corporate limits of the city shall be prima facie evidence that such signs or markers were erected or placed by and at the direction of the city manager and chief of police and in accordance with the provisions of this section e any person failing or refusing to comply with the directions indicated on any sign or marker erected or placed in accordance with the provisions of this section when so placed or erected shall be guilty of a violation of this chapter  permits for oversize overweight etc vehicles the city manager is authorized to issue permits pursuant to fs   when the same will not endanger the public constitute in evidence a prima facie presumption that the registered owner of such vehicle was the person who stopped parked or operated such vehicle at the point where and for the time during which  repealed  2436 which pertained to exemption for juror parking and derived from  291281 of the 1964   immobilizing of vehicles a authorization to immobilize the chief of police or his authorized representative is authorized to attach a device that is capable of immobilizing a motor vehicle so that it cannot be moved under its own power without damage to the vehicle when notified by the city finance management and budget department that one 1 or more citations for unlawful or illegal parking involving city parking violations is on file with the finance management and budget department b procedure the immobilizing device shall be attached to the motor vehicle at the place where it is found except that no motor vehicle shall be immobilized within the traveled portion of any street or on any portion of a street where immobilization at such place would create a hazard to the public or to traffic on the street at the time the immobilizing device is attached to the motor vehicle a notice shall be affixed to the windshield or other prominent place on the motor vehicle stating that the immobilizing device has been so attached cautioning the operator not to attempt to operate the motor vehicle while the immobilizing device is still attached and informing the owner or operator of the motor vehicle of the total fines and charges assessable under the citations for which the motor vehicle is immobilized including the charge for removal of the immobilizing device of fifty dollars $5000 and where the operator must go in order to pay the fines and charges and have the immobilizing device removed from the motor vehicle c removal the immobilizing device shall be removed from the motor vehicle upon payment to the city finance budget and management department of the total fines and charges assessed in the above section for which the motor vehicle is immobilized the city comptroller or his authorized representative may approve the removal of the immobilizing device upon obtaining satisfactory arrangements for payment of the abovestated fines and charges the city comptroller shall also authorize the removal of the immobilizing device upon the request for a trial by the owner of the motor vehicle and the posting of either a cash bond or surety bond signed by a good and sufficient surety in an amount sufficient to pay all outstanding fines and charges that may be assessed in the event at the conclusion of such trial before a county court judge it is determined that the owner of the motor vehicle is guilty of the offenses charged d towing and impounding the police department may tow or cause to be towed and impound any motor vehicle immobilized under this section if payment for fines and charges have not been paid or obtained within twentyfour 24 hours of the attaching of the immobilization device all expenses for towing or impounding shall be borne by the owner of the motor vehicle all towing or impounding hereunder shall be done in accordance with section 2438    92106 impounding vehicles illegally parked members of the police department shall be vested with the authority and it shall be their duty to impound any unoccupied vehicle parked in violation of any of the parking regulations of the city and to release such vehicle to the duly identified owner thereof subject however to the payment of a court fine and to the payment of storage towing and other impounding charges  noparking zones authorized the city manager with respect to city streets avenues alleys and ways under the jurisdiction of the city may prescribe noparking zones on any such streets avenues and alleys whenever in his judgment such regulations or prohibitions are necessary to provide for public safety and convenience on such streets avenues alleys and ways by reason of traffic density intensive use thereof by the traveling public or other reason or public safety or convenience such noparking zones shall be established and marked in conformity with the manual on uniform traffic control devices for streets and highways as from time to time promulgated and authorized by the state department of transportation it shall be unlawful for any person to cause allow permit or suffer any vehicle registered in the name of or operated by such person to be parked in a noparking zone    81318 onstreet parking zones the city manager is hereby authorized to parking zone  manner of parking it shall be unlawful for any person to park a vehicle in a street of the city other than parallel with the edge of the curb or paved roadway headed in the direction of lawful traffic movement unless otherwise provided and with the curbside wheels of the vehicle within six 6 inches of the curb or paved edge of the roadways except as provided in the following paragraphs 1 upon those portions of streets which have been marked or signed for angle parking vehicles shall be parked at the angle to the curb indicated by such mark or signs with the right front wheel against the curb or the right front end of the bumper of such vehicle over the curb or the right front end of the bumper of such vehicle against the curb 2 in places where stopping for the loading or unloading of merchandise or material is permitted in zones to be designated for the purpose a commercial vehicles properly marked with business name or displaying the business name on a placard may be parked for the expeditious unloading and delivery or pickup and loading of materials in no case shall the period for loading and unloading of materials exceed thirty 30 minutes b the driver of a vehicle may stop temporarily at a place marked as a loading zone for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers when such stopping does not interfere with any commercial motor vehicles used for the transportation of materials which is waiting to enter or about to enter such zone c it shall be unlawful for the driver of any vehicle having a passenger capacity of nine 9 or more to stop at a place marked as a loading zone for any purpose  parking for periods greater than marked prohibited it shall be unlawful for the operator of a vehicle to park such vehicle continuously or to cause such vehicle to be continuously parked for a period greater in time than that marked on an official sign or marker establishing a time limit at such place 1 is not otherwise designated  parking in bus stops and taxicab stands it shall be unlawful for any person to stop stand or park a vehicle in any officially designated and appropriately marked bus stop owner agent operator or person in charge of a heavy commercial vehicle recreational vehicle as defined in fs  320011b as amended from time to time boat or trailer to park store or keep such vehicle boat or trailer on the pavement or swale of any public street or on any public rightofway within any residentially zoned district in the city to include streets abutting property residentially zoned for the purposes of this section heavy commercial vehicle shall be defined as any truck bus tractor trailer or semitrailer having a gross vehicle weight rating gvwr in excess of twelve thousand 12000 pounds 2 the prohibitions in this section shall not apply to a deliveries by tradesmen or the use of heavy commercial vehicles or trailers in making service calls  b the emergency parking of a disabled heavy commercial vehicle recreational vehicle boat or trailer however any such heavy commercial vehicle recreational vehicle boat or trailer shall be removed from the residential district within twentyfour 24 hours by wrecker towing or other available means regardless of the nature of the emergency  c the active loading or unloading of a recreational vehicle or trailer preparatory for or following an offpremises trip but in no case shall this loading or unloading period exceed twentyfour 24 hours in any sevenday period b exemptions 1 exempt from the provisions of this division are heavy commercial vehicles or trailers in actual use or moving directly to or from the location of actual use which are owned or leased by a the city for the accomplishment of a municipal purpose  b a contractor or subcontractor under agreement with the city to accomplish a municipal purpose  or c a public utility operating within the city or a contractor or subcontractor under agreement with such public utility for the installation maintenance adjustment or repair of or to a public utility facility 2 however no towing company or other business entity or any of its officers employees and agents shall be exempt from the provisions of this division solely because the towing company or other business entity has been employed by the city to provide towing or other services c commercial activity in residential districts nothing contained in this division shall be construed to permit any type of commercial activity not otherwise permitted in this chapter at any location within a residential district d provisions cumulative  conflicting provisions 1 this division is primarily for the purpose of protecting residential zoning therefore any ordinances of this city or laws of this state regulating motor vehicles are in addition to this section wherever any provision of some other ordinance of the city or applicable statute whether primarily for the regulation of motor vehicles or for purposes of zoning imposes more stringent requirements or limitations than are imposed or required by the provisions of this section then the more stringent requirements or limitations shall apply 2 this division shall not be construed to limit any deed restrictions condominium regulations or similar private limitations on land use imposing more stringent requirements or limitations than are provided herein this division shall not be construed as creating an obligation on the city to enforce private limitations on land use e penalty 1 any person who violates any provision of this division shall be punished by a fine not in excess of one hundred dollars $10000 2 for purposes of this section it shall be presumed that a heavy commercial vehicle recreational vehicle boat or trailer is parked continuously from the time the vehicle boat or trailer is first observed to the time of last observation provided there is at least one 1 additional observation not less than two 2 hours from the first and last observation    102395   2 2810 secs 24482465  reserved division 2  metered parking authority to establish or change the city manager subject to the approval of the city commission provide for the installation regulation control operation and use of parking meters in the parking meter zones established under this division and shall cause such meters to be maintained in good operating condition  placing meters on curb parking meters installed in the parking meter zones established as provided in section 2466 shall be placed upon the curb immediately adjacent to the individual parking places described in section 2470  what parking meter to display each parking meter shall be placed or set in such manner as to show or display by a signal that the parking space adjacent to such meter is or is not legally in use and shall indicate by a proper legend the legal parking time and rates and charges as set forth in this division and the proper coin to be deposited therein and when operated by the deposit of the proper coin shall indicate on and by its dial and pointer the duration of the period of legal parking and on the expiration of such period shall indicate illegal or overtime parking  designation of space and required parking therein the city manager is hereby instructed to have lines or markings painted or placed upon the curb or upon the street adjacent to such parking meter for the purpose of designating the parking space for which such meter is to be used and each vehicle parking alongside of or next to any parking meter shall park within the lines or markings so established it shall be unlawful and a violation of this division to park any vehicle across any such line or marking or to park any vehicle in such position that the same shall not be entirely within the area so designated by such lines or markings  manner of parking in spaces when a parking space in any parking meter zone is parallel with the adjacent curb or sidewalk any vehicle parked in such parking space shall be parked so that the foremost part of such vehicle shall be alongside of and nearest to the parking meter  when a parking space in any parking meter zone is diagonal to the curb or sidewalk any vehicle parking in such space shall be parked with the foremost part of such vehicle directed at and nearest to such meter  secs 24722474  reserved
