wastewater flow in excess of established flows in the event that the city manager determines the water or wastewater flow to be in excess of the flow established above based on billing history of similar uses or other data submitted by the applicants architect landscape architect or engineer then the flow proportional connection charges shall be based on the greater flow amount c changes of use in the case of changes in use or increases in intensity of use of an existing building which is served by city water andor sewer the applicant must pay the flow proportional connection charges established in this chapter based on the difference in flow between the existing use or intensity and the new use or intensity in the case that the existing flow is not higher than the new flow the applicant must pay the flow proportional connection charges established in this chapter based on the difference in flow between the highest ever flow and the flow based on the new use or intensity the burden for documenting the highest ever flow if the highest flow is not the current flow rests with the applicant d demolition and new construction in the case of a new building to be constructed on the site of a building which was served by city water andor sewer prior to being demolished the applicant must pay the flow proportional connection charges established in this chapter based on the increase in flow between the building which was demolished and the new building the burden for documenting the previous use of the building and the associated flow rests with the applicant in the event that the previous building was demolished in excess of ten 10 years from the date the new building is built the connection charges established in this article will be based on the new building e review of account billing history and flows the city manager has the right to determine whether or not actual water or wastewater usage is in excess of the flow established above based on the billing history of the account over a twelvemonth period in the event that the actual water or wastewater usage is greater than the flow allocated to the account then the customer must pay additional flow proportional connection charges based on the difference in flows f flow determinations based on persons or occupant load flow determinations based on persons or occupant load shall be based on the maximum occupancy permitted by the current city building and life safety codes g estimated water or wastewater flow deficient of established flows in the event that the city manager determines the longterm impact of water or wastewater flow to the citys utility system to be deficient of the flow established above based on billing history of similar uses or other data submitted by the applicants architect landscape architect engineer or other professional consultant then the flow proportional connection charges may be based on the lesser flow amount this provision is intended for specially engineered systems outside of conventional water or wastewater plumbing h abandoned or inactive service in the case where utility service to a property has been inactive abandoned or otherwise unused without payment of service or flow service either water or sewer in excess of ten 10 years from the last known paid utility bill the property is considered abandoned and carries no credit for flow based fees for the property to reestablish service the application is treated as new service whereby new taps service line laterals and payment of the flow proportional connection charges shall be required in accordance with this chapter as if a new property i alternative fee calculation 1 in the event an applicant or owner believes that the connection to the water system the sewer system or both necessitated by the owners development justifies a fee that is less than the fee calculated in this article such applicant or owner may submit a calculation of an alternative water system andor alternative sewer system connection fee to the city manager pursuant to the provisions of this section the decision of the city manager shall serve as the final administrative appeal 2 in the case of new construction any right to submit an alternative water system connection fee calculation andor alternative sewer system connection fee calculation shall be deemed to have been waived and expired and such calculation shall not be considered by the city commission if not properly and timely made in accordance with this ordinance prior to the issuance of a building permit 3 in the case of existing buildings structures or applicable improvements which are required to connect to the potable water system sewer system or both systems any right to submit an alternative water system connection fee calculation andor alternative sewer system connection fee calculation shall be deemed to have been waived and expired and such calculation shall not be considered by the city commission if within thirty 30 calendar days from the effective date of issuance of the letter of availability under this article the owner does not notify the city manager in writing of the owners intention to submit an alternative water system connection fee calculation andor alternative sewer system connection fee calculation 4 notification and submission of an alternative water andor wastewater system connection fee calculation any owner who wishes to submit an alternative water system connection fee calculation andor an alternative sewer system connection fee calculation must timely submit to the city manager the applicable calculation along with an administrative review fee of two hundred and fifty dollars $25000 for each alternative connection fee if a combined alternative water and sewer connection fee calculation is submitted the administrative review fee shall be five hundred dollars $50000 in order to be deemed timely submitted all necessary documents and fees must be submitted to the city manager or hisher designee no later than ninety 90 days from the date of issuance of the letter of availability any late filed submittal shall be deemed to have been waived and expired and such alternative calculation shall not be considered by the city commission 5 upon timely submission of an alternative water system connection fee calculation andor alternative sewer system connection fee calculation the basis for it and receipt of the alternative water system connection fee calculation andor alternative sewer system connection fee calculation the city manager shall review the alternative water system connection fee calculation andor the alternative sewer system connection fee calculation and shall make final determination of the alternative fee calculation 6 the alternative water system connection fee calculation andor the alternative sewer system connection fee calculation shall be based on data information or assumptions contained in this article as amended from time to time or an alternative water system connection fee study andor an alternative sewer system connection fee study based upon a calculation prepared by a florida professional engineer who certifies that the flows and corresponding ercs are reasonable relative to the development any such florida professional engineer must include a local study supported by data adequate for the conclusions contained in such study performed according to a generally accepted methodology and based upon generally accepted standard sources of information relating to facilities planning cost analysis and demographics the florida professional engineer must provide competent substantial evidence that the alternative water system connection fee andor alternative sewer system connection fee represent an equitable determination of the water andor sewer flow demand requirements in order to determine the amount of gallons to be allocated to the applicant to determine the number of ercs and the pro rata share of the cost of capital improvements and additions to the water system andor sewer system necessitated by the subject development 7 if during a prior alternative fee calculation process an acceptable alternative water system connection fee study andor alternative sewer system connection fee study substantially consistent with the criteria required by this article have been accepted by the city manager and if any such study is determined by the city manager to be then current no greater than two years old and applicable the connection of such previously approved development shall be presumed to be as described in the prior study in such circumstances an alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee shall be established reflecting the connection described in the prior study there shall be a presumption that such a connection study based upon an independent source conducted and accepted by the city manager more than two 2 years earlier is no longer current and not applicable 8 if the city manager determines that the data information and assumptions utilized by the applicant to calculate the alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee complies with the requirements of this article and that the alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee were calculated by the use of a generally accepted methodology then the alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee shall be paid in lieu of the fee set forth in this article 9 if the city manager determines that the data information and assumptions utilized by the applicant to calculate the alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee do not comply with the requirements of this article or that the alternative water system connection fee andor the alternative sewer system connection fee were not calculated by the use of a generally accepted methodology then the city shall provide to the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested written notification within five 5 business dates of such determination of the rejection of the alternative water system connection fee the alternative sewer system connection fee or both and the reason or reasons for the rejection 10 the final decision of the city manager shall be in writing and issued within sixty 60 calendar days receipt of complete and sufficient application per these articles 11 any applicant or owner who or which has submitted a proposed alternative water system connection fee andor alternative sewer system connection fee pursuant to this article and desires the immediate issuance of a building permit shall pay the required fees prior to or at the time of submittal of the proposed alternative fees such payment shall be deemed paid under protest and shall not be construed as a waiver of any right of review any difference between the amount paid and the amount due as determined by the city manager shall be refunded to the applicant or owner or paid to the city as applicable 12 if an applicant has paid the water andor sewer connection fees in accordance with an approved alternative water andor sewer connection fee request respectively and after connection to the utility the applicant incurs an average daily flow for a connection during an consecutive twelvemonth periods in an amount greater than the average daily flow for which the connections fees have been paid an additional capacity fee shall be assessed for the excess flow based on the connection fee in effect at the time of determination if the average daily flow during any consecutive threemonth period is more than fifteen 15 percent greater than the average daily flow for which connection fees have been paid an additional connection fee shall be assessed for the excess flow  31102   92503   93004   92012   92815 deposits a deposit required  conditions prior to initiating utility service the city shall except as otherwise provided herein require a deposit from all utility service consumers application for service by whatever means written verbal telephonic electronic or otherwise and the payment of the deposit by the consumer shall constitute the consumers agreement that the deposit is advance payment for future utility services which may be applied as otherwise provided in this section 1 residential service all residential utility service consumers shall pay a deposit per residential dwelling unit whether or not each dwelling unit has a separate water meter  except however that no deposit for residential utility service shall be required from a an existing utility consumer who has an active residential utility service account with the city and who has not had a termination of service for nonpayment within the twentyfour 24 months immediately preceding application for new residential utility service  or b a new residential utility service consumer providing proof of good credit good credit being defined as 1 no termination of utility service by any provider of such services to the consumer for nonpayment no returned checks and no delinquent payments within the two 2 years immediately preceding application for new residential utility service and the receipt by the city of evidence of good credit in satisfactory form from another utility  2 receipt by the city of satisfactory consumer payment history from a reputable credit reporting agency of the citys designation 2 nonresidential service for all nonresidential consumers the required deposit shall be an amount two 2 times the estimated average monthly combined utility bill of the consumer as determined by the financial services director or hisher designee 3 residential and nonresidential service all residential and nonresidential consumers without a deposit will be required to pay a utility deposit equal to the amount required by ordinance upon the second notice of disconnect of utility service for nonpayment within a twentyfourmonth period b incremental deposits an additional deposit shall be required for unsatisfactory payment history as determined by the financial services director or hisher designee the amount of such deposit shall be that necessary to yield no more than a total deposit of two 2 times the estimated average monthly combined utility bill of the consumer written notice of the additional deposit requirement shall be provided to the consumer by certified mail return receipt requested at the address shown on the application for service the consumer may appeal such requirement in an informal hearing with the financial services director or hisher designee c interest  unclaimed deposits except as provided below the deposit shall be held by the city until final settlement of the consumers account at which time the deposit shall be applied against any utility bill due the city for such service any unused balance shall be refunded when the account is settled and closed all deposits shall earn simple interest accrued from the date tendered and calculated to the nearest day interest shall accrue at a rate of the utilitys interest earnings for the period and shall be credited to the consumer annually in the event any deposit is unclaimed for a period of twelve 12 months after the service is discontinued such unclaimed deposit and any accrued interest thereon shall be turned over to the state department of banking and finance in accordance with florida law following thirty 30 days written notice to such consumer mailed to the address shown on the application for service d refund of deposit  release of other financial assurance deposits for residential or nonresidential service shall be credited to the consumer at the end of twentyfour 24 months provided that the consumer has not experienced a termination of service for nonpayment within the previous twentyfour 24 months e exemptions the united states of america the state of florida and all political subdivisions agencies boards commissions and instrumentalities thereof are exempt from any deposit requirements under this section f shortterm service no deposit shall be required for utility service for shortterm service herein defined as service not to exceed seven 7 days provided the applicant is the owner of the property or the authorized property management agency g bond in lieu of deposit if a nonresidential consumer required to make a deposit so elects heshe may post a surety bond or other financial assurance in lieu of the cash deposit such bond or financial assurance shall be issued by a surety authorized to do business in the state of florida in an amount approved by the financial services director or hisher designee and shall be on a form approved by the city which shall fully protect the city against any loss as a result of any nonpayment of utility bills rendered by the city to the consumer  31102   2 6903   92106   92012 monthly usage and rates a usage the number of gallons of water used is determined by the water meter reading the number of gallons of sewer used is the same as the number of gallons of water used however for an individually metered singlefamily dwelling unit no sewer charge will be applied to water billed in excess of ten thousand 10000 gallons in any single billing period b rates for customers for water and sewer rates are effective beginning october 1 and ending september 30 of each respective fiscal year rates shall be established and adjusted from time to time by resolution of the city commission c service charge for accounts that are temporarily disconnected there is a minimum charge for availability of water and sewer service to all accounts that are temporarily disconnected this service charge must be paid prior to reconnecting service d notice required to discontinue the use or close account customers wishing to temporarily or permanently discontinue the use of water or close the account must notify the city manager failure to do so will render the customer liable for the monthly service charges until such notice has been given e commercial accounts on turnoff list customers with commercial accounts on the turnoff list for nonpayment will be called when the account appears on the turnoff list however an individual customer will not be called more than three 3 times over the duration of the account following the third such call the city manager will send the customer via certified mailreturn receipt a notice stating that the customer will not receive any future courtesy phone call and that the account will be turned off when it appears on the turnoff list f consumer price index adjustment  all rates for water and sewer service provided by this article may be adjusted annually by the city manager with the percentage change in the consumer price index as published by the us department of labor cpiu class d south region class d  nonmet less than 50000 population from may 1 of the preceding calendar year until april 30 of the present calendar year such adjusted rates shall supersede the rates set forth in this article 1 the adjusted rate will be applied to all billings dated on or after october 1 of each year 2 the percentage change in the consumer price index will be applied to the rates as follows a multiply the percentage change in the consumer price index from may 1 of the preceding calendar year of the present calendar year times the existing rates b add the product to the existing rates and round to the nearest cent  31102   92503   93004   92205   92106   91808   91709   92310   92211   92012 billing a monthly bill charges established by this chapter are billed and collected for the billing period as established by this chapter such charges are due and payable on the bill date shown on the bill the customer must pay all charges at the same time b unpaid charges in the event that any charges remain due and unpaid on or after the due date stated on such bill which date will be twentyfive 25 days after the bill date a delinquent late fee of one and onehalf 15 percent of the outstanding balance or five dollars $500 whichever is greater shall be charged to the customer if any bill remains due and unpaid on and after the due date stated on the bill issued to the customer for the next billing cycle the account may be placed on the turnoff list any account on the turnoff list is subject to disconnection if disconnected the water service will not be restored until all charges and penalties due have been paid c refund of deposits no deposits made with the city by any customer will be refunded unless all charges and penalties have been paid in full however if charges and penalties total less than one dollar $100 no bill will be rendered likewise no deposits will be refunded in an amount less than one dollar $100 except upon the customers written request  31102   92310   92012 miscellaneous service charges a service charges service charges related to miscellaneous services rendered may be adjusted from time to time and are established and adjusted by resolution of the city commission after public hearing b requests for meter tests all requests for meter tests must be made on a form supplied by the city manager and must be signed by the customer c adjustments resulting from meter tests in the event that a water meter test indicates that the meter is producing a customer overcharge an adjustment will be made to bills of the account in question for the past three 3 months to the degree that they exceed the bills for the same three 3 months of the prior year in the event that the account has no prior year history the threemonth adjustment will be the percentage that the degree of error of the meter exceeds two 2 percent of awwa specifications  31102   6903   92503   41006   92012 discontinuing service for nonuse the city manager may discontinue water and sewer service to any customer for nonuse the city manager will only restore services to such a customer following the payment of all applicable charges and penalties  31102 property owner liability in the event that a customer fails to pay the charges established by this chapter the property owner becomes liable and responsible for the payment of such charges  31102 relief from sewer service charges a conditions for requesting relief a sewer customer may seek relief from sewer service charges in the following cases 1 in the event that the customer anticipates significant water use of a nonrecurring nature where the water will not enter the potw the request for relief must be submitted in writing to the city manager not less than three 3 days prior to such water use the request for relief must clearly indicate that the proposed water use is not wasteful or unreasonable such uses may include but are not limited to filling swimming pools and pressure washing such uses specifically do not include irrigation gardening and car washing 2 in the event that the customer has experienced significant water leakage on the customers side of the water meter and that the water did not enter the potw the request for relief must be submitted in writing to the city manager not more than three 3 days following discovery of the leak the request for relief must include either a a statement from a master plumber certified by the state of florida or licensed by the city or st johns county that a sewer customer has experienced material water leakage on the customers side of the water meter  or b a customers receipt for materials or labor related to repairing the leak 3 in the event that the customer has experienced vandalism resulting in significant water leakage on the customers side of the water meter and that the water did not enter the potw the request for relief must be submitted in writing to the city manager not more than three 3 days following the discovery of the vandalism and must be accompanied by a copy of the police report related to the vandalism 4 the city manager shall determine whether or not the customers water use or leakage is significant b conditions for granting relief in the cases established in subsection a above the city manager is authorized to adjust the sewer service charges as follows 1 the period of time of the adjustment must be requested in writing by the customer and be approved by the city manager 2 in the event that the customers account has been active for twelve 12 months or more the adjustment will equal the average sewer service charge for the account for the previous twelve 12 months 3 in the event that the customers account has been active for more than three 3 months but fewer than twelve 12 months the adjustment will equal the average sewer service charge for the life of the account 4 in the event that the customers account has been active for less than three 3 months the sewer service charge will be reduced by fifteen 15 percent 5 in no case will the adjustment result in a sewer service charge below the minimum service charge established by this chapter 6 customer sewer charges will not be adjusted more than one 1 time in any twelvemonth period except in the case of a leak discovered by a master plumber pursuant to subsection a2 above or in the case of vandalism pursuant to subsection a3 above  31102 care and share account a care and share account established there is in the general ledger a special account known as the care and share account the purpose of this account is to provide a means for city utility customers to contribute money to help indigent city utility customers pay their monthly utility bills the city manager shall transfer to this account monthly an amount equal to the sums of the amounts designated to the account by customers under subsection c below funds on deposit in the care and share account are deemed appropriated for each fiscal year as they are collected but remain available for disbursement as designated without fiscal year limitation b a notforprofit agency selected by the city commission shall review applications for expenditures from the care and share account the notforprofit agency shall apply the standards and procedures adopted by the city manager or his or her designee for reviewing applications from customers who desire to have their water sewer or garbage bills paid out of the care and share account the notforprofit agency may issue a voucher to the customer to be redeemed at the citys financial services department for complete or partial payment of the customers unpaid utility bill when a voucher is presented the city manager may pay the customers water sewer and garbage bill to the extent that funds are available in the account the city reserves the right to audit all documentation and accounts submitted by the notforprofit agency and customer for issuance of vouchers pursuant to this section c customer contribution voluntary city utility customers may authorize the city manager to add a sum voluntarily designated and paid by the customer to the care and share account the city manager shall provide a method for designating contributions to the care and share account on the customers monthly utility bill  31102   102714 secs 26622675  reserved article iv  wastewater pretreatment purpose and policy this article sets forth uniform requirements for users of the publicly owned treatment works potw for the city and enables the city to comply with all applicable state and federal laws including the clean water act 33 united states et seq the general pretreatment regulations 40 cfr 403 and fac pretreatment requirements for existing and new sources of pollution this article applies to all users of the potw it authorizes the issuance of wastewater discharge permits  provides for monitoring compliance and enforcement activities  requires user reporting  and provides for the setting of fees for the equitable distribution of costs resulting from the program established herein the objectives of this article are 1 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the potw that will interfere with its operation  2 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the potw that will pass potw inadequately treated into receiving waters or will otherwise be incompatible with the potw  3 to protect both potw personnel who may be affected by wastewater and sludge in the course of their employment and the general public  4 to provide for fees for the equitable distribution of the cost of operation maintenance and improvement of the potw  and 5 to enable the city to comply with its national pollutant discharge elimination system permit conditions sludge use and disposal requirements and any other federal or state laws to which the potw is subject 6 to promote reuse and recycling of industrial wastewater and residuals from the potw  31102   52305 approval authority the florida department of environmental protection fdep is the approval authority  31102 prohibited discharge standards a general prohibitions no user shall introduce or cause to be introduced into the potw any pollutant or wastewater which causes passinterference these prohibitions apply to all users of the potw whether or not they are subject to categorical pretreatment standards or any other national state or local pretreatment standards or requirements b specific prohibitions no user is allowed to introduce or cause to be introduced into the potw the following pollutants substances or wastewater 1 pollutants which create a fire or explosive hazard in the potw including but not limited to waste streams with a closedcup flash point of less than one hundred forty 140 degrees f sixty 60 c using the test methods specified in 40 cfr 26121  2 wastewater having a ph less than five 50 or more than nine 90 or otherwise causing corrosive structural damage to the potw or equipment  3 solid or viscous substances in amounts which may obstruct the flow in the potw resulting in interference but in no case solids greater than two 2 inches in any dimension  4 pollutants including oxygendemanding pollutants cbod etc released in a discharge at a flow rate andor pollutant concentration which either singly or by interaction with other pollutants will cause interference with the potw  5 wastewater having a temperature greater than one hundred fifty 150 degrees f sixtyfive and onehalf 655 c which will inhibit biological activity in the treatment plant resulting in interference but in no case wastewater which causes the temperature at the introduction into the treatment plant to exceed one hundred four 104 degrees f forty 40 c  6 petroleum oil nonbiodegradable cutting oil or products of mineral oil origin in amounts that will cause interference or pass  7 pollutants which result in the presence of toxic gases vapors or fumes within the potw in a quantity that may cause acute worker health and safety problems  8 hauled waste or pollutants except at discharge points specifically designated by the city manager according to section 2684 of this   9 noxious or malodorous liquids gases solids or other wastewater which either singly or by interaction with other wastes are sufficient to create a public nuisance or a hazard to life or to prevent entry into the sewers for maintenance or repair  10 wastewater imparting color that cannot be removed by the treatment process including dye wastes and vegetable tanning solutions  11 wastewater containing radioactive wastes or isotopes except in compliance with applicable federal or state regulations  12 stormwater surface water ground water artesian well water roof runoff subsurface drainage swimming pool drainage condensate deionized water noncontact cooling water and wastewater unless specifically authorized by the city manager  13 sludge screenings or other residues from the pretreatment of industrial wastes  14 medical wastes except as specifically authorized by the city manager in a wastewater discharge permit  15 wastewater that alone or in conjunction with other sources causes the potw effluent to fail a toxicity test  16 detergents surfaceactive agents or other substances that may cause excessive foaming in the potw  17 fats oils or greases of animal or vegetable origin in concentrations greater than the established local limit or any grease trap or grease interceptor waste  18 hazardous wastes as defined in 40 cfr 261 c processing and storage restrictions no user shall process or store pollutants substances or wastewater prohibited by this article in such a manner that they could enter the potw d notification of the discharge of hazardous waste any user who commences the discharge of hazardous waste must notify the city manager the epa regional waste management division director and the florida department of environmental protection hazardous waste and pretreatment authorities in writing of any discharge into the potw of a substance which if otherwise disposed of would be a hazardous waste under 40 cfr such notification must include the name of the hazardous waste as set forth in 40 cfr the epa hazardous waste number and the type of discharge continuous batch or other if the user discharges more than one hundred 100 kilograms of such waste per calendar month to the potw the notification must also contain the following information to the extent such information is known and readily available to the user an identification of the hazardous constituents contained in the wastes an estimation of the mass and concentration of such constituents in the waste stream discharged during that calendar month and an estimate of the mass of constituents in the waste stream expected to be discharged during the following twelve 12 months all notifications must take place within one hundred and eighty 180 days after the discharge commences any notification under this subsection need be submitted only once for each hazardous waste discharged however notifications of changed conditions must be submitted as required by section 26100 of this notification requirement in this section does not apply to pollutants already reported by users subject to categorical pretreatment standards under the selfmonitoring requirements of this chapter e exemptions users are exempt from the requirements of subsection d above during a calendar month in which they discharge no more than fifteen 15 kilograms of hazardous wastes unless the wastes are acute hazardous wastes as specified in 40 cfr 26130d and 26133e discharge of more than fifteen 15 kilograms of nonacute hazardous wastes in a calendar month or of any quantity of acute hazardous wastes as specified in 40 cfr 26130d and 26133e requires a onetime notification following the onetime notification users discharging more than these quantities of any hazardous waste are not required to additionally notify the city manager f impact of new regulations in the case of any new regulation under section 3001 of rcra identifying additional characteristics of hazardous waste or listing any additional substance as a hazardous waste the user must notify the city manager the epa regional waste management waste division director and state hazardous waste authorities of the discharge of such substance within ninety 90 days of the effective date of the new regulation g reduction of hazardous wastes in the case of any notification made under this section the user must certify that it has a program in place to reduce the volume and toxicity of hazardous wastes generated to the degree the user has determined it to be economically practical h rights of discharge limited this section does not create a right to discharge any substance not otherwise permitted to be discharged by this by any wastewater discharge permit issued hereunder or by any applicable federal or state law  31102   102411 national categorical pretreatment standards the categorical pretreatment standards found in 40 cfr subchapter n parts 405471 are hereby incorporated 1 where a categorical pretreatment standard is expressed only in terms of either the mass or the concentration of a pollutant in wastewater the city manager may impose equivalent concentration or mass limits in accordance with rule 624 fac 2 when wastewater subject to a categorical pretreatment standard is mixed with wastewater not regulated by the same standard the city manager shall impose an alternate limit using the combined waste stream formula in rule 626 fac 3 a user may obtain a variance from a categorical pretreatment standard if the user can prove pursuant to the procedural and substantive provisions in rule 62 fac that factors relating to its discharge are fundamentally different from the factors considered by epa when developing the categorical pretreatment standard 4 a user may obtain a net gross adjustment to a categorical standard according to rule 62 fac  31102   52305   62308   102411 local limits and right of revision a local limits the city hereby adopts the standards and requirements established by the applicable parts of title 40 federal regulations 40 cfr 400699 in industrial user permits as appropriate local limits governing discharges to the potw user permits will be developed by the city and approved by florida department of environmental protection fdep the local limits governing discharges to the potw effective on  are hereby adopted ratified and implemented into the city reference the city manager is granted the authority to make amendments to said local limits as the city manager finds necessary b no person shall discharge wastewater containing pollutants in excess of the local limits for those pollutants which limits have been established for the city of st augustines wwtp using standard procedures calculations and methods acceptable to the fdep to protect against pass interference protection of wwtp employees and adverse affects on wastewater residuals disposal no industrial user shall discharge process waste streams or unregulated waste streams or shall dilute waste streams in excess of the concentrations set forth by the city manager local limits shall be included as permit conditions and attached to each siu wastewater permit issued c the established local limits are subject to change and shall be modified as needed based on regulatory requirements and standards wwtp operation performance and processes the industrial user base potable water quality and domestic wastewater characteristics modifications to the established local limits must be reviewed and approved by fdep prior to implementation implementation shall be effective thirty 30 days from notice of acceptance of the modified limits by fdep permitted sius shall also be issued an addendum to their wastewater discharge permit containing the new local limits d the established local limits apply at the point where the wastewater is discharged to the potw all concentrations for metallic substances are for total metal unless indicated otherwise at his or her discretion the city manager may impose mass limitations in addition to or in place of the concentrationbased limitations e the city manager may develop best management practices bmps by ordinance or in individual wastewater discharge permits to implement local limits and the requirements of section 2678 f right of revision the city reserves the right to establish by ordinance or in wastewater discharge permits more stringent standards or requirements than those specifically established by 40 cfr or fac on discharges to the potw g a copy of the approved local limits is available upon request at the following location city of st augustine city hall 75 king street st augustine florida 32084  31102   102411 pretreatment measures and facilities a user responsibility users must provide wastewater pretreatment necessary to comply with this chapter and must comply with all categorical pretreatment standards local limits and prohibitions established by this the time limit specified by epa the state or the city manager whichever is more stringent the user must provide operate and maintain any facilities required to meet the requirements of this at the users expense the user must submit detailed plans and operating procedures of such facilities to the city manager the city manager will review and approve such plans and operating procedures in writing before such facilities are constructed the review of such plans and operating procedures in no way relieves the user from the responsibility of modifying such facilities as necessary to produce a discharge meeting the requirements of this chapter b dilution increasing the use of process water or in any way attempting to dilute a discharge as a partial or complete substitute for adequate pretreatment to achieve compliance with a discharge limitation unless specifically authorized by an applicable pretreatment standard or requirement is prohibited the city manager may impose mass limits on users who are using dilution to meet applicable pretreatment standards or requirements or in other cases when the imposition of mass limitations is appropriate c discharge restrictions authorized the city manager may require users to restrict their discharge during peak flow periods to discharge certain wastewater only into specific sewers to relocate andor consolidate points of discharge andor to separate sewage waste streams from industrial waste streams the city manager may also require a user to take any other action necessary to protect the potw and determine the users compliance with the requirements of this chapter d flow equalization the city manager may require any user to install and maintain on the users property and at the users expense a suitable storage and flow control facility to ensure equalization of flow the city manager may issue a wastewater discharge permit solely for flow equalization e combustible gas detection the city manager is authorized to require users with the potential to discharge flammable substances to install and maintain a combustible gas detection meter meeting osha standards f interceptors the city manager is authorized to require users likely to discharge grease oil or sand to the potw to install interceptors  31102 interceptors a users required to install interceptors interceptors as defined in this must be installed as follows prior to any certificate of occupancy being issued 1 for any new source as defined by this likely to discharge oil grease or sand to the potw  2 for any new facility or use likely to discharge oil grease or sand to the potw  3 for any existing facility or use that has been expanded or renovated resulting in the addition of facilities or uses likely to discharge oil grease or sand to the potw where such facilities or uses did not previously exist  4 for any existing facility or use that the city manager determines contributes oil grease or sand to the potw in quantities sufficient to cause line stoppages or necessitate increased maintenance on the collection system  andor 5 for renovation or expansion of any facility or use contributing or likely to contribute oil grease or sand to the potw where such renovation or expansion requires a plumbing permit from the city 6 sources uses and facilities considered likely to discharge oil grease or sand to the potw include restaurants hotel kitchens hospitals school kitchens bars factory cafeterias clubs service stations repair garages factories producing oily or flammable wastes car washes commercial laundries and dry cleaners bottling plants and slaughtering houses b program manual the fats oils and grease program manual promulgated by the city manager as amended from time to time is hereby adopted and incorporated by reference as part of this section copies of the fats oils and grease program manual shall be available upon request c specifications and installation interceptors shall be designed and installed in accordance with the fats oils and grease program manual solely at the users expense plans and specifications for interceptors shall be submitted to the city for approval prior to installation d cleaning and maintenance interceptors shall be cleaned maintained and repaired in accordance with requirements of the fats oils and grease program manual solely by the user and solely at the users expense users shall maintain an onsite record log of all cleaning and maintenance activities for a minimum of three years e inspections the city shall conduct inspections on all facilities with interceptors at a frequency based on the size of the device inspections are conducted to ensure compliance with the requirements of the fats oils and grease program manual and to ensure adherence to proper cleaning and maintenance schedules as established by the program manual f adoption incorporation and amendment of the city of st augustine fats oils and grease program manual the city of st augustine fats oils and grease program manual dated  is hereby adopted ratified and implemented by reference into the city city manager is granted the authority to make amendments to said city of st augustine fats oils and grease program manual as the city manager finds necessary  31102   102411 accidental discharge and slug control plans at least once every two 2 years the city manager will evaluate whether each significant industrial user needs to develop and implement an accidental discharge and slug control plan the city manager may require any user to develop and implement an accidental discharge and slug control plan such a plan must be reviewed and approved by the city manager and must include at a minimum the following 1 description of discharge practices including nonroutine batch discharges  2 description of stored chemicals  3 procedures for immediately notifying the city manager of any accidental or slug discharge as required by section 26101 of this   and 4 procedures to prevent adverse impact from any accidental or slug discharge such procedures include but are not limited to inspecting and maintaining storage areas handling and transfer of materials loading and unloading operations control of plant site stormwater runoff worker training containment structures or equipment containing toxic organic pollutants and solvents andor measures and equipment for emergency response  31102 hauled waste a septic tank waste septic tank waste may only be introduced into the potw at locations and times designated by the city manager such waste must not violate section 2678 of this any other requirements established by the city the city manager may require septic tank waste haulers to obtain wastewater discharge permits b wastewater discharge permits required the city manager requires generators and haulers of industrial waste to obtain wastewater discharge permits the city manager may prohibit the disposal of hauled industrial waste in the potw the discharge of hauled industrial waste is subject to all other requirements of this chapter c discharge of hauled industrial waste industrial waste haulers must not discharge loads at locations other than those specified by the city manager the city manager must give prior consent to any discharge of hauled industrial waste the city manager is authorized to collect samples of each load to ensure compliance with applicable standards the city manager is authorized to require industrial waste generators and haulers to provide a waste analysis of any load prior to discharge d record keeping industrial waste haulers must provide a waste tracking form for every load of waste hauled this form must include at a minimum the name and address of the industrial waste hauler permit number truck identification name and address of each source of the hauled waste volume and characteristics of the waste the form must identify the type of industry generating the waste known or suspected waste constituents and whether or not any wastes are rcra hazardous wastes  31102 wastewater analysis the city manager may require a user to submit information concerning the nature and characteristics of its wastewater when so requested the user must submit the requested information within sixty 60 days of the date of the request the city manager is authorized to prepare a form for this purpose and may periodically require users to update the information submitted  31102 wastewater discharge permits and renewals a permits for significant industrial users significant industrial users must not discharge wastewater to the potw prior to obtaining a wastewater discharge permit from the city manager b permits for other users the city manager may require users other than significant industrial users to obtain wastewater discharge permits to implement the requirements of this chapter c violations any violation of the conditions of a wastewater discharge permit is a violation of this chapter and subjects the wastewater discharge permit holder to the sanctions set forth in this chapter obtaining a wastewater discharge permit does not relieve the permit holder of the obligation to comply with federal and state pretreatment standards and requirements or with any other requirements of federal state and local law d permits for existing connections any user required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit who was discharging wastewater to the potw prior to  and who wishes to continue such discharges in the future must submit an application for a wastewater discharge permit according to section 2687 of this user must not cause or allow discharges to the potw to continue more than sixty 60 days after  except according to a wastewater discharge permit issued by the city manager e permits for new connections any user required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit must obtain such permit prior to beginning such discharge the user must submit an application for this wastewater discharge permit according to section 2687 of this chapter at least sixty 60 days prior to the date upon which any discharge will begin f application fee the city charges an application fee for each wastewater discharge permit application and each wastewater discharge permit renewal the application fee must accompany each application g incomplete applications incomplete or inaccurate applications will not be processed and will be returned to the user for revision  31102 information required on wastewater discharge permit applications renewals and monitoring reports users required to obtain wastewater discharge permits must submit an by or for the facility 3 description of operations description of the nature average rate of production and north american industrial classification system naics codes of the operations carried out by this 6 description of potential discharges description of activities facilities and plant processes on the premises including a list of all raw materials and chemicals used or stored at the facility whether additional pretreatment is required to meet pretreatment standards and requirements 15 signatures and certification a all wastewater discharge permit applications renewals and monitoring who manage the system or those persons directly responsible for gathering the information the information submitted is to the best of my knowledge and belief true accurate and complete i am aware that there are significant penalties for submitting false information including the possibility of fine and imprisonment for knowing violations b if the designation of an authorized representative is no longer accurate because a different individual or position has responsibility for the overall operation of the facility or overall responsibility for environmental matters for the company a new will either issue the wastewater discharge permit or deny the application the city manager may deny any application for a wastewater discharge permit  31102 duration of permit wastewater discharge permits are issued for a period not to exceed five 5 years and include a specific issue date and a specific expiration date a wastewater discharge permit may be issued for a period less than five 5 years at the discretion of the city manager  31102 contents and conditions of permit a general conditions a wastewater discharge permit includes conditions deemed reasonably necessary by the city manager to prevent passinterference protect the water quality of receiving streams protect worker health and safety facilitate sludge management and disposal and prevent damage to the potw b required conditions wastewater discharge permits contain 1 a statement indicating permit duration not to exceed five 5 years a specific issue date and a specific expiration date  2 a statement that the wastewater discharge permit is nontransferable without prior notification to the city manager according to section 2692 of this provisions for furnishing the new owner or operator with a copy of the existing wastewater discharge permit  3 effluent limits including best management practices based on applicable pretreatment standards 4 selfmonitoring sampling reporting notification and record keeping requirements including identification of the pollutants to be monitored sampling types sampling locations and sampling frequency based on the applicable general pretreatment standards in fac categorical pretreatment standards local limits and federal state and local law  and 5 statement of applicable civil and criminal penalties which may be imposed for violating pretreatment standards and requirements or compliance schedules such schedules shall not extend the compliance date beyond applicable state or federal deadlines 6 requirements to control slug discharges in accordance with 2b6 fac if determined by the city manager to be necessary c other conditions wastewater discharge permits may also contain the following conditions 1 limits on the average andor maximum rate of discharge time of discharge andor requirements for flow regulation and equalization  2 requirements to install pretreatment technology pollution control or to construct appropriate containment devices designed to reduce eliminate or prevent the introduction of pollutants into the potw  3 requirements to develop and implement spill control plans or other special conditions including management practices necessary to prevent accidental unanticipated or nonroutine discharges  4 requirements to develop and implement waste minimization plans to reduce the amount of pollutants discharged to the potw  5 the schedule of user charges and fees for managing wastewater discharged to the potw  6 requirements to install and maintain inspection and sampling facilities and equipment  7 a statement that compliance with the wastewater discharge permit does not relieve the permit holder of responsibility for complying with all applicable federal and state pretreatment standards including those which become effective during the term of the wastewater discharge permit  and 8 other conditions deemed appropriate by the city manager to ensure compliance with this chapter and with state and federal laws rules and regulations  31102   102411 appeals a the city manager may provide public notice of the issue of a wastewater discharge permit any person including the user may petition the city manager to reconsider the terms of the wastewater discharge permit within thirty 30 days of notice that the permit has been issued b failure to submit a timely petition for reconsideration shall be deemed a waiver of the administrative appeal c the wastewater discharge permit shall remain in effect pending the appeal d if the city manager fails to act within thirty 30 days of receiving a petition for reconsideration the request for reconsideration shall be deemed to be denied decisions not to reconsider a wastewater discharge permit not to issue a wastewater discharge permit or not to modify a wastewater discharge permit shall be considered final administrative actions for purposes of judicial review e aggrieved persons seeking judicial review of the final administrative wastewater discharge permit decision must do so by filing a complaint with the circuit court of appeals  31102   12516 permit modification transfer and renewal a permit modification the city manager may modify a wastewater discharge permit for good cause including but not limited to the following reasons 1 to incorporate any new or revised federal state or local pretreatment standards or requirements  2 to address significant alterations or additions to the users operations processes or wastewater volume or character since the date the wastewater discharge permit was issued  3 in response to changes to the potw that require either a temporary or permanent reduction or elimination of the permitted discharge  4 in response to information indicating that the permitted discharge poses a threat to the potw city personnel or the receiving waters  5 in response to user violations of any wastewater discharge permit conditions  6 in response to user misrepresentations or failure to fully disclose all relevant facts in either the wastewater discharge permit application or in any required report  7 as a result of a revision of or a grant of variance from categorical pretreatment standards pursuant to 40 cfr 40313  8 to correct typographical or other errors in the wastewater discharge permit  or 9 to transfer the wastewater discharge permit to a new owner or operator b permit transfer wastewater discharge permits may be transferred to a new owner or operator only if the permit holder gives at least fortyfive 45 days advance notice to the city manager and the city manager approves the wastewater discharge permit transfer if the permit holder fails to provide proper advance notice of a proposed transfer the wastewater discharge permit becomes void as of the date of facility transfer the advance notice must include a written certification by the new owner or operator which 1 states that the new owner andor operator has no immediate intent to change the facilitys operations and processes 2 identifies the specific date on which the transfer is to occur  and 3 acknowledges full responsibility for complying with the conditions of the existing wastewater discharge permit c permit renewal a user with an expiring wastewater discharge permit must apply for wastewater discharge permit renewal by submitting a complete permit application according to section 2687 of this a minimum of one hundred eighty 180 days prior to the expiration of the existing wastewater discharge permit  31102 revoking and voiding permits a revoking a permit the city manager may revoke a wastewater discharge permit for good cause including but not limited to the following 1 failing to notify the city manager of significant changes to the wastewater prior to the changed discharge  2 failing to provide prior notification to the city manager of changed conditions pursuant to section 26100 of this   3 misrepresenting facts or failing to fully disclose all relevant facts in a wastewater discharge permit application  4 falsifying selfmonitoring reports  5 tampering with monitoring equipment  6 refusing to allow the city manager timely access to the facility premises and records  7 failing to meet effluent limitations  8 failing to pay fines  9 failing to pay sewer charges  10 failing to meet compliance schedules  11 failing to submit a complete monitoring report or wastewater discharge permit application  12 failing to notify the city manager in advance of the transfer of business ownership of a permitted facility  or 13 violating any provision of this chapter any condition of a wastewater discharge permit any condition of any order issued pursuant to this chapter or any pretreatment standard or requirement b voiding a permit wastewater discharge permits become void upon cessation of operations or transfer of business ownership according to section 2692 of this wastewater discharge permit issued to a user becomes void upon the issuance of a new wastewater discharge permit to that user  31102 wastewater received from other local governments a interlocal agreement required if another local government or a user located within another local government contributes wastewater to the potw continually for a minimum of one hundred twenty 120 consecutive days the city shall enter into an interlocal agreement with the contributing local government b information required prior to entering into the interlocal agreement required by subsection a above the contributing local government must provide the following information 1 a description of the quality and volume of wastewater discharged to the potw by the contributing local government  2 an inventory of all users located within the contributing local government that are discharging to the potw  and 3 other information the city manager deems necessary c conditions of interlocal agreement any interlocal agreement required by subsection a above must contain the following conditions 1 a requirement for the contributing local government to adopt a sewer use ordinance which is at least as stringent as this chapter and local limits which are at least as stringent as those established by section 2680 of this requirement must specify that such ordinance and local limits must be revised as necessary to reflect changes made to the city   2 a requirement for the contributing local government to submit a revised user inventory on at least an annual basis  3 a provision specifying which pretreatment implementation activities including wastewater discharge permitting inspection sampling and enforcement will be conducted by the contributing local government  which of these activities will be conducted by the city manager  and which of these activities will be conducted jointly by the contributing local government and the city manager  4 a requirement that the contributing local government provide the city manager with access to all information that the contributing local government obtains as part of its pretreatment activities  5 limits on the nature quality and volume of the contributing local governments wastewater at the point where it discharges to the potw  6 requirements for monitoring the contributing local governments discharge  7 a provision ensuring the city manager access to the facilities of users located within the contributing local governments jurisdictional boundaries for the purpose of inspection sampling and any other duties deemed necessary by the city manager  and 8 a provision specifying remedies available for breach of the terms of the interlocal agreement d enforcement of pretreatment standards the city has the right to take legal action to enforce the contributing local governments sewer ordinance or to impose and enforce city potw pretreatment standards and requirements directly against noncompliant users in the event that the contributing local government is unable or unwilling to take such action  31102 pretreatment charges surcharges and fees a pretreatment fees fees related to the citys pretreatment program are hereby established as follows these fees relate solely to the citys pretreatment program and are separate from all other fees charges fines and penalties chargeable by the city pretreatment charges surcharges and fees are nonrefundable 1 application for wastewater discharge permit or renewal five hundred dollars $50000  2 annual permit maintenance fee includes monitoring inspecting sampling analysis and reviewing monitoring reports five hundred dollars $50000  3 reviewing and responding to accidental discharge procedures and construction actual cost  4 application to appeal the issue of a wastewater discharge permit or renewal five hundred dollars $50000 b surcharge for exceeding established limits an industrial discharge with concentrations of specified pollutants in excess of established limits which can be treated by conventional processes but at higher cost will be surcharged as follows 1 wastewater with a cbod concentration in excess of two hundred fifty 250 mgl seventyfour cents $074 per pound of cbod 2 wastewater with total ss concentration in excess of two hundred fifty 250 mgl ninetyeight cents $098 per pound of total ss 3 wastewater with a cod concentration exceeding that of the cbod concentration multiplied by one and sixtyseven one hundredths 167 fortyseven cents $047 per pound of cod in excess of permitted limits for cod 4 these surcharges are in addition to any other established rates  31102 baseline monitoring reports a reports from existing users existing categorical users currently discharging to the potw or scheduled to discharge to the potw must submit a report to the city manager containing the information listed in paragraph e below this report must be submitted within one hundred eighty 180 days after the effective date of a categorical pretreatment standard or the final administrative decision on a category determination under rule 622d fac whichever is later b reports from new users new sources and sources that become categorical users following the promulgation of an applicable categorical standard must submit a report to the city manager containing the information listed in paragraph e below the report must be submitted at least ninety 90 days prior to commencement of the discharge a new source shall report the method of pretreatment it intends to use to meet applicable categorical standards a new source also shall give estimates of its anticipated flow and quantity of pollutants to be discharged c reports from nonpermitted users the city manager may require users who are not required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit to provide reports to the city manager d timing of reports written reports will be considered submitted on the date postmarked written reports transmitted by other means will be considered submitted on the date received by the city manager e information required on monitoring reports users described above shall submit the information set forth below 1 all information in section 26871 4 2 measurements of pollutants a the user shall provide the information required in section 26875a 5d  b the user shall take a minimum of one representative sample to compile that data necessary to comply with the requirements of this paragraph  c samples should be taken immediately downstream from pretreatment facilities if such exist or immediately downstream from the regulated process if no pretreatment exists if other wastewaters are mixed with the regulated wastewater prior to pretreatment the user should measure the flows and concentrations necessary to allow use of the combined wastestream formula in 626 fac to evaluate compliance with the pretreatment standards where an alternate concentration or mass limit has been calculated in accordance with 626 fac this adjusted limit along with supporting data shall be submitted to the city  d sampling and analysis shall be performed in accordance with section 26102  e the city manager may allow the submission of a baseline report which used only historical data so long as the data provides information sufficient to determine the need for industrial pretreatment measures  f the baseline report shall indicate the time date and place of sampling and methods of analysis and shall certify that such sampling and analysis is representative of normal work cycles and expected pollutant discharges to the potw 3 compliance certification a statement reviewed by the users authorized representative as defined in section 263 and certified by a qualified professional indicating whether pretreatment standards are being met on a consistent basis and if not whether additional operation and maintenance andor additional pretreatment is required to meet the pretreatment standards and requirements 4 compliance schedule if
