operation and maintenance requirements must be provided the completion date in this schedule shall not be later than the compliance date established for the pretreatment standard a compliance schedule pursuant to this section must meet the requirements set out in section 2697 of this 5 signature and report certification all baseline monitoring reports must be certified in accordance with section 268715 of this signed by an authorized representative as defined in section 263  31102   52305   102511 compliance schedule progress reports a compliance schedule if additional pretreatment is required to meet pretreatment standards the user must implement the shortest schedule by which to provide such additional pretreatment the completion date in this schedule must not be later than the compliance date established for the applicable pretreatment standard the city manager reviews and approves the compliance schedule prior to implementation b milestone dates and progress increments the compliance schedule must list milestone dates which establish progress increments for commencing and completing major events leading to constructing and operating additional pretreatment required to meet applicable pretreatment standards such major events include but are not limited to hiring an engineer completing preliminary and final plans executing contracts for major components commencing and completing construction commencing routine operations and achieving final compliance no increment referred to in this paragraph shall exceed nine 9 months c progress reports the user must submit a progress report to the city manager no later than fourteen 14 days following each milestone date in the schedule the progress report must include at a minimum whether or not major events were completed on schedule the reason for any delay and if appropriate the steps being taken to return to the established schedule in no event shall more than nine 9 months elapse between such progress reports to the city manager d reports on compliance with categorical pretreatment standard deadline within ninety 90 days following the date for final compliance with applicable pretreatment standards or in the case of a new source following commencement of the introduction of wastewater into the potw any user subject to such pretreatment standards and requirements shall submit to the city manager a report containing the information described in sections 26874 and 5 and 2696e2 of this users subject to equivalent mass or concentration limits established in accordance with the procedures in section 2679 this report shall contain a reasonable measure of the users longterm production rate for all other users subject to categorical pretreatment standards expressed in terms or allowable pollutant discharge per unit of production or other method of operation this report shall include the users actual production during the appropriate sampling period all compliance reports must be signed and certified in accordance with section 268715 all sampling will be done in conformance with section 26102 e termination of service nothing in this section prohibits the city manager from terminating service to the user in the event that the potw fails to meet its permit limits during the period of user noncompliance  31102   102411 categorical pretreatment standard compliance reports any user subject to pretreatment standards and requirements must submit a monitoring report to the city manager within sixty 60 days following the date for final compliance with applicable categorical pretreatment standards any user considered to be a new source subject to pretreatment standards and requirements must submit a monitoring report to the city manager following commencement of the introduction of wastewater into the potw for users subject to equivalent mass or concentration limits established in 40 cfr 4036c this report must contain a reasonable measure of the users longterm production rate for all other users subject to categorical pretreatment standards expressed in terms of allowable pollutant discharge per unit of production or other measure of operation this report must include the users actual production during the sampling period reports must include the information required by section 2687 of this  31102 periodic compliance reports a all significant industrial users except a nonsignificant categorical industrial user must submit reports indicating the nature and concentration of pollutants in their discharge limited by pretreatment standards and the measured or estimated average and maximum daily flows for the reporting period in cases where the pretreatment standard requires compliance with a best management practice or pollution prevention alternative the user must submit documentation required by the city manager or the pretreatment standard necessary to determine the compliance status of the user reports must be submitted at a frequency determined by the city manager but in no case less than twice per year june and december all periodic compliance reports must be signed and certified in accordance with section 2687 of this b all wastewater samples must be representative of the users discharge wastewater monitoring and flow measurement facilities must be properly operated kept clean and maintained in good working order at all times failing to keep monitoring facilities in good working order is not grounds for the user to claim that sample results are unrepresentative of the users discharge c if a user subject to the reporting requirements in this section monitors any pollutant more frequently than required by the city manager and using the procedures prescribed in section 26102 of this the user must include the results of this monitoring in the report  31102   102411 reports of changed conditions users must notify the city manager of any planned significant changes to the users operations or system that might alter the nature quality or volume of the users wastewater discharge at least ninety 90 days before the change significant changes include but are not limited to flow increases of twenty 20 percent or greater and the discharge of any previously unreported pollutants 1 the city manager may require the user to submit information necessary to evaluate the proposed changed conditions and may require the user to submit a wastewater discharge permit application 2 the city manager may issue a wastewater discharge permit or modify an existing wastewater discharge permit in response to changed conditions or anticipated changed conditions 3 modifying an existing wastewater discharge permit may require advance approval from epa  31102 reports of discharges causing potential problems a initial notification in the case of any discharge that may cause potential problems for the potw the user must immediately telephone and notify the city manager of the incident such discharges include but are not limited to accidental discharges discharges of a nonroutine or episodic nature noncustomary batch discharges and a slug discharge or slug load notification must include the location of the discharge type of waste concentration and volume if known and corrective actions taken by the user b written notification within five 5 working days following such discharge the user must submit a detailed written report describing the causes of the discharge and the measures to be taken by the user to prevent similar future occurrences notification does not relieve the user of any expense loss damage or other liability which the user incurs as a result of damage to the potw or natural resources or of any other damage to persons or property nor does notification relieve the user of any fines penalties or other liability imposed pursuant to this chapter c posting notification procedures required the user must permanently post a notice on the users bulletin board or other prominent place advising employees whom to call in the event of a discharge described in subsection a above the user must ensure that all employees who may cause such a discharge to occur are advised of emergency notification procedures d notification of changes significant industrial users are required to notify the city manager immediately of any changes at its facility affecting the potential for a slug discharge  31102   102411 sampling and analysis requirements a sample collection samples collected to satisfy reporting requirements must be based on data obtained sampling and analysis performed during the period covered by the report based on data that is representative of conditions occurring during the reporting period b sampling and analysis techniques sampling and analytical method requirements must comply with 40 cfr paragraph 621e fac fac and the department of environmental protection standard operating procedures for field activities depsop00101 depsop001 fs2400 wastewater sampling if 40 cfr does not contain sampling or analytical techniques for the pollutant in question or where epa determines that the sampling and analytical techniques are inappropriate for the pollutant in question the sampling organization with the approval of the industrial user and control authority shall identify and propose a method for use in accordance with rule 62 fac c flow proportional sampling except as specified by subsections d and f below twentyfourhour composite samples must be obtained using flow proportional collection techniques in the event flow proportional sampling is not feasible the city manager may authorize time proportional sampling or a minimum of four 4 grab samples where the user demonstrates that these techniques will provide a representative sample of the effluent being discharged using protocols including appropriate preservation specified in fac and depsop00101 multiple grab samples collected during a twentyfourhour period may be composited prior to analysis as follows for cyanide total phenols and sulfides the samples may be composited in the laboratory or in the field  for volatile organics and oil and grease the samples may be composited in the laboratory composite samples for other parameters unaffected by the compositing procedures as documented in approved dep sampling procedures and laboratory methodologies may be authorized by the city manager as appropriate additionally the city manager may require grab samples to show compliance with instantaneous limits d grab collection sampling samples for oil and grease temperature ph cyanide total phenols sulfides and volatile organic compounds must be obtained using grab collection techniques e oil and grease samples oil and grease samples shall be collected in accordance with paragraphs c and d above unless the sampling location or point cannot be physically accessed to perform a direct collection of a grab sample in these instances the sample shall be pumped from the sampling location or point into the sample container using a peristaltictype pump all pump tubing used for sample collection must be new or precleaned and must be changed between sample containers and sample points the pump tubing shall not be prerinsed or flushed with sample prior to collection of the sample the report of analysis shall indicate that a peristaltic pump was used to collect the oil and grease sample f for sampling required in support of baseline monitoring and ninetyday compliance reports required in sections 2696 and 2697 a minimum of four 4 grab samples must be used for ph cyanide total phenols oil and grease sulfide and volatile organic compounds for facilities for which historical sampling data do not exist  for facilities for which historical sampling data are available the city manager may authorize a lower minimum for the reports required by section 2699 the industrial user is required to collect the number of grab samples necessary to assess and assure compliance by with applicable pretreatment standards and requirements  31102   102411 record keeping users subject to the reporting requirements of this chapter must retain and make available for inspection and copying all records and information related to monitoring activities required by this ordinance any additional records of information obtained pursuant to monitoring activities undertaken by the user independent of such requirements and documentation associated with best management practices established under section 2680 records must include the date exact place method and time of sampling  the names of the persons taking the samples  the dates analyses were performed  names of the persons performing the analyses  the analytical techniques or methods used  and the results of such analyses these records must remain available for a period of at least five 5 years this period shall be automatically extended for the duration of any litigation concerning the user or the city or where the city manager has specifically notified the user of a longer retention period  31102   102411 right of entry for inspection and sampling the city manager has the right to enter the premises of any user to determine whether the user is complying with the provisions of this chapter any wastewater discharge permit or order issued hereunder or any other pretreatment standard or requirement users are required to allow the city manager ready access to all parts of the users premises for inspection sampling examining and copying records and performing any other duties specified by this chapter 1 where a users security system requires identification and clearance of persons before entering the premises the user is required to make all necessary arrangements to allow the city manager upon presenting suitable identification to enter the premises without delay to administer and enforce this chapter 2 the city manager has the right to install sampling or monitoring equipment on the users premises 3 the city manager may require the user to install sampling or monitoring equipment the user at the users expense must maintain all sampling and monitoring equipment in safe and proper operating condition at all times all devices used to measure wastewater flow and quality must be certified as required by the manufacturer but not less than annually and must be calibrated prior to use to ensure accuracy 4 at the written or verbal request of the city manager the user must promptly remove any temporary or permanent obstructions preventing safe and easy access to the premises for inspection or sampling the user cannot thereafter replace any such obstructions the user must bear the costs of removing such obstructions 5 unreasonable delays in allowing the city manager access to the users premises are a violation of this chapter 6 in the event that the city manager is refused access to a users premises or any part thereof as part of administering or enforcing this chapter the city manager may seek a search warrant from a court of competent jurisdiction to allow access  31102 confidential information the city manager shall generally make information and data related to a user obtained by enforcing and implementing this chapter available to the public without restriction however the user may request that certain information and data not be made available to the public because it would divulge trade secrets protected under state law if the user so requests and is able to demonstrate to the city manager that the release of such information and data would divulge trade secrets protected under state law then the portions of a report which might disclose trade secrets will not be made available to the public the user must make such a request in writing at the time the information or data is submitted such information or data will be made available upon request to governmental agencies for uses related to the npdes program or pretreatment program and in enforcement proceedings involving the person furnishing the information or data wastewater constituents and characteristics and other effluent data defined by 40 cfr  are not recognized as confidential information and are available to the public without restriction  31102 publication of users in significant noncompliance the city manager will publish annually in the largest daily newspaper published in the city where the potw is located a list of users who were in significant noncompliance with applicable pretreatment standards and requirements during the previous twelve 12 months  31102 notice of violation repeat sampling and reporting if sampling performed by a user indicates a violation the user must notify the city manager within twentyfour 24 hours of becoming aware of the violation the user must repeat the sampling and analysis and submit the results of the report analysis to the city manager within fourteen 14 calendar days after becoming aware of the violation where the city has performed the sampling and analysis in lieu of the industrial user the city must perform the repeat sampling and analysis unless it notifies the user of the violation and requires the user to perform the repeat analysis  31102   102411 violations and enforcement if a user violates any provision of this chapter any condition of a wastewater discharge permit any condition of any order issued pursuant to this chapter any pretreatment standard or requirement or willfully or negligently introduces any substance into the potw which causes personal injury or property damage then the city manager may take against the user all or any in any combination in any order of the listed enforcement actions taking a single enforcement action does not bar against nor is a prerequisite for taking other enforcement action against the user 1 notice of violation the city manager may issue the user a written notice of violation within ten 10 calendar days of receiving the notice of violation the user must submit to the city manager an explanation for the violation  a plan for correcting the violation  and a plan to prevent future violations including specific required actions submitting this plan does not relieve the user of liability for any violations occurring either before or after receiving the notice of violation 2 consent orders the city manager may enter into a consent order assurances of voluntary compliance or other similar document establishing an agreement with any noncompliant user such documents must include specific action to be taken by the user to correct the violation within a specific time period such documents have the same force and effect as the compliance orders and cease and desist orders issued pursuant to this are judicially enforceable 3 show cause hearing the city manager may order the user to appear before the city manager and show cause why a proposed enforcement action should not be taken notice will be served on the user specifying the time and place for the meeting the proposed enforcement action the reasons for such action and a request that the user show cause why the proposed enforcement action should not be taken the notice of the meeting will be served personally or by certified mail return receipt at least ten 10 calendar days prior to the hearing such notice may be served on any authorized representative of the user 4 compliance orders the city manager may order the noncompliant user to come into compliance within a specified time if the user does not come into compliance within the specified time then sewer service may be discontinued unless adequate treatment facilities devices or other related appurtenances are installed and properly operated compliance orders may also establish other requirements including additional selfmonitoring and management practices designed to minimize the amount of pollutants discharged to the potw a compliance order does not extend the deadline for compliance established for a pretreatment standard or requirement a compliance order does not relieve the user of liability for any violation 5 cease and desist orders the city manager may order the user to cease and desist all violations and direct the user to a immediately comply with all requirements  and b take necessary corrective or preventive action to properly address an existing or threatened violation including halting operations andor terminating the discharge 6 administrative fines and liens the city manager may fine a noncompliant user an amount not to exceed one thousand dollars $100000 per day such fines are assessed on a perviolation perday basis in the case of monthly or other longterm average discharge limits fines will be assessed for each day during the period of violation unpaid fines after ninety 90 calendar days may be recorded as a lien against the users property 7 emergency suspensions the city manager may order a user to immediately suspend its discharge when an actual or threatened discharge reasonably appears to cause imminent or substantial endangerment to the health or welfare of persons interfere with the operation of the potw andor its effluent discharge limitations or endanger the environment if the user fails to immediately comply with the suspension order the city manager may disconnect or plug the users sewer service a noncompliant user responsible in whole or in part for any discharge causing imminent endangerment must submit a detailed written statement to the city manager prior to the date of any show cause or termination hearing describing the causes of the harmful discharge and the measures taken to prevent any future occurrence 8 termination of discharge the city manager may terminate the discharge of any user who does any of the following the city manager will notify such user a maximum of twentyfour 24 hours in advance of the termination a violates wastewater discharge permit conditions  b fails to accurately report wastewater constituents and discharge characteristics  c fails to report significant changes in operations or wastewater volume constituents and characteristics prior to discharge  d refuses to allow the city manager reasonable access to the users premises for inspection monitoring or sampling  or e violates the pretreatment standards established by this 9 injunctive relief the city manager may petition any court of competent jurisdiction to issue a temporary or permanent injunction as appropriate which restrains or compels the specific performance of the wastewater discharge permit order or other requirement imposed by this chapter on activities of the user the city manager may also seek other action appropriate for legal andor equitable relief including a requirement for the user to conduct environmental remediation 10 civil penalties the city manager may file suit in any court of competent jurisdiction to impose a minimum civil penalty of one thousand dollars $100000 per violation per day penalties shall accrue for each day during the period of the violation the city may recover reasonable attorneys fees court costs and other expenses associated with enforcement activities including sampling and monitoring expenses and the cost of any actual damages incurred by the city 11 criminal prosecution the city manager may file criminal charges in any court of competent jurisdiction against the noncompliant user the user shall upon conviction be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by a minimum fine of one thousand $100000 dollars per violation per day or imprisonment for not more than sixty 60 calendar days or both in the case of a user who willfully or negligently introduces any substance into the potw causing personal injury or property damage this penalty shall be in addition to any other action for personal injury or property damage available under state law 12 disconnecting water supply and sewer service the city manager may disconnect the water service andor sewer service to the noncompliant user service will be restored at the users expense only after the user demonstrates the ability to comply with the requirements of this chapter  31102   102411 upset affirmative defense and bypass a upset an upset does not constitute noncompliance to the extent caused by operational error improperly designed treatment facilities inadequate treatment facilities lack of preventative maintenance or careless or improper operation b effect of an upset an upset shall constitute an affirmative defense to an action brought for noncompliance with the categorical pretreatment standards if the requirements of subsection c below are met c conditions necessary for a demonstration of upset an industrial user who wishes to establish the affirmative defense of an upset shall demonstrate signed contemporaneous operating logs or other relevant evidence that 1 an upset occurred and the industrial user can identify the cause of the upset  2 the industrial users facility was at the time of the upset being properly operated  and 3 the industrial user has orally submitted the following information to the control authority within twentyfour 24 hours of becoming aware of the upset with a written submission to be provided within five 5 days a a description of the discharge and cause of noncompliance  b the period of noncompliance including exact dates and times or if not corrected the anticipated time the noncompliance is expected to continue  and c steps being taken or planned to reduce eliminate and prevent recurrence of noncompliance d industrial user responsibility in case of an upset the industrial user shall control production of all discharges to the extent necessary to maintain compliance with categorical pretreatment standards upon reduction loss or failure of its treatment facility until the facility is restored or an alternative method of treatment is provided this requirement applies in the situation where among other things the primary source of power of the treatment facility is reduced lost or fails e affirmative defense a user has an affirmative defense to enforcement action brought against it for violating section 2678 of this the user can prove that it did not know or have reason to know that its discharge alone or in conjunction with discharges from other sources would cause passinterference in the potw and that either 1 a local limit exists for each pollutant discharged and the user was in compliance with each local limit directly prior to and during the passinterference  or 2 no local limit exists but the discharge did not change substantially in nature or constituents from the users prior discharge when the city was regularly in compliance with its npdes permit and in the case of interference was in compliance with applicable sludge use or disposal requirements f bypass not violating applicable pretreatment standards or requirements an industrial user may allow any bypass to occur which does not cause pretreatment standards or the requirements to be violated but only if it is for essential maintenance to assure efficient operation these bypasses are not subject to the provision of g h and i below g notice in the event of anticipated bypass if a user knows in advance of the need for a bypass the user must notify the city manager at least ten 10 calendar days before the date of the bypass if the industrial user does not know of the need for a bypass ten days prior to the bypass then the industrial user shall notify the city manager immediately upon knowledge of the need for a bypass h notice in the event of an unanticipated bypass a user must submit oral notice to the city manager of any unanticipated bypass that exceeds applicable pretreatment standards within twentyfour 24 hours of the time the user becomes aware of the bypass the user must follow up with written notification to the city manager within five 5 calendar days of the date the user became aware of the bypass the written notification must contain a description of the bypass and its cause  the duration of the bypass including exact dates and times and if the bypass has not been corrected how long it is expected to continue  and steps taken or planned to reduce eliminate and prevent recurrence of the bypass i prohibition of bypass bypass is prohibited and the control authority shall take enforcement against an individual for a bypass unless 1 bypass was unavoidable to prevent loss of life personal injury or severe property damage  2 there were no feasible alternatives to the bypass such as the use of auxiliary treatment facilities retention of untreated wastes or maintenance during normal periods of equipment downtime this condition is not satisfied if adequate backup equipment should have been installed in the exercise of reasonable engineering judgment to prevent a bypass which occurred during normal periods of equipment downtime or preventative maintenance  and 3 the user submitted notices as required in this paragraph j anticipated bypass approval the city manager shall approve an anticipated bypass after considering its adverse effects if the city manager determines that it will meet the three conditions listed in paragraph i of this section  62308   102411   12516 article v  water conservation through landscape irrigation footnotes  2  cross reference landscaping  2551 et seq intent and purpose this article implements procedures which promote water conservation more efficient use of landscape irrigation  42709 definitions for the purpose of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivatives shall have the meanings given below when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense shall include the future tense words used in the plural form shall include the singular form and words used in the singular form shall include the plural form address means the house number of a physical location of a specific property the term includes rural route numbers but excludes post office box numbers if a lot number in a mobile home park or similar community is used by the us postal service to determine a delivery location the lot number shall be the propertys address an even numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 0 2 4 6 8 or the letters am an odd numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 1 3 5 7 9 or the letters nz district means the st johns river water management district landscape irrigation means the outside watering of plants in a landscape such as shrubbery trees lawns grass ground covers plants vines gardens and other such flora situated in such diverse locations as residential areas cemeteries public commercial and industrial establishments and public medians and rightsofway landscape irrigation does not include golf course greens tees fairways primary roughs and vegetation associated with intensive recreational areas such as but not limited to playgrounds and football baseball and soccer fields person means any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind nonresidential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape not included within the definition of residential landscape irrigation such as that associated with public commercial and industrial property including commercial or transient housing units hotel and motel units and public medians and rightsofway residential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape associated with any housing unit having sanitary and kitchen facilities designed to accommodate one 1 or more residents including multiple housing units and mobile homes  42709 landscape irrigation schedule a when daylight savings time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule 1 landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or at properties with no addresses may occur only on wednesday and saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 2 landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may occur only on thursday and sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 3 nonresidential landscape irrigation may only occur on tuesday and friday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 4 no more than threefourthinch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one 1 hour per irrigation zone on each day irrigation occurs b when eastern standard time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule 1 landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or at properties with no addresses may occur only on saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 2 landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may only occur on sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm daily  and 3 nonresidential landscape irrigation may occur on tuesday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 4 no more than threefourthinch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one 1 hour per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs c all landscape irrigation shall be limited in amount to only that necessary to meet landscape needs  42709 exceptions to landscape irrigation schedules landscape irrigation shall be subject to the following irrigation schedule exceptions 1 irrigation using a microspray microjet drip or bubbler irrigation system is allowed anytime 2 irrigation of new landscape is allowed at any time of day on any day for the initial thirty 30 days and every other day for the next thirty 30 days for a total of one sixtyday period provided that the irrigation is limited to the minimum amount necessary for such landscape establishment 3 watering in of chemicals including insecticides pesticides fertilizers fungicides and herbicides when required by law the manufacturers product application instructions or best management practices is allowed anytime within twentyfour 24 hours of application of the chemicals watering in of chemicals shall not exceed onefourthinch of water per application except as otherwise required by law the manufacturers product application instructions or best management practices 4 irrigation systems may operate anytime for maintenance and repair purposes not to exceed twenty 20 minutes per hour per zone 5 irrigation using a handheld hose equipped with an automatic shutoff nozzle is allowed anytime 6 discharge of water from a watertoair airconditioning unit or other waterdependent cooling system is not limited 7 the use of water from a reclaimed water system is allowed anytime for the purpose of this paragraph a reclaimed water system includes systems for which the primary water source is reclaimed water and which may or may not be supplemented from another water source during peak demand periods 8 the use of recycled water from wet detention treatment ponds for irrigation is allowed anytime provided the ponds are not augmented from any ground or offsite surface water or public supply sources  42709 additional requirement any person who irrigates landscape with an automatic lawn sprinkler system installed after  shall install maintain and operate a rain sensor device or switch which overrides the irrigation system when adequate rainfall has occurred  42709 variance from specific day of the week limitations the city commission may grant variances to these landscape irrigation schedule provisions under the following conditions 1 the specified day or days for irrigation would lead to unreasonable or unfair results in particular instances provided that the applicant demonstrates with particularity that compliance with the scheduled day or days will result in a substantial economic health or other hardship on the applicant requesting the variance or those served by the applicant where a contiguous property is divided into different zones a variance may be granted hereunder so that each zone may be irrigated on different days than other zones of the property however no single zone may be irrigated more than two 2 days a week during daylight savings time and not more than one 1 day a week during eastern standard time 2 all users or customers requesting a variance as set forth above shall file with the city manager a petition for variance but shall conform to the greatest possible extent to the provisions of this ordinance until such variance is granted 3 a petition for variance shall be in writing and contain at a minimum the following a the petitioners name and address b a detailed statement of the facts which the petitioner believes and demonstrates that the request qualifies for variance c a description of the variance desired d the period of time for which the variance is sought including the reasons and facts in support thereof e other relevant information the petitioner believes supports hisher petition for variance 4 variances granted under the provisions of this section shall be issued in writing  42709 application of ordinance the provisions of this article shall apply to each person located within the city of st augustine  42709 enforcement officials this article may be enforced by the city manager his authorized representatives the city of st augustine police department and any law enforcement officer of the state  42709 penalties a violation of any provision of this article shall be subject to the following penalties first violation written warning second violation fifty dollars $5000 subsequent violations fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 b each day in violation of this article shall constitute a separate offense enforcement officials shall provide violators with no more than one 1 written warning in addition to the civil sanctions contained herein the city may take any other appropriate legal action including but not limited to injunctive action to enforce the provisions of this article  42709 vehicles for hire footnotes  1  cross reference licenses taxation and miscellaneous business regulations ch 17  guides  17121 et seq state law reference municipal home rule or hire  used in connection with a travel bureau  or offered or used to provide transportation for persons solicited contact or advertised on a shareexpense basis b low speed vehicle means any s  as may be amended c pedicab means either 1 a bicycle that has two 2 three 3 or more wheels that transports or is capable of transporting passengers on seats attached to the bicycle that is operated knowledge of the principal streets of the city and all main thoroughfares leading out of the city as well as a thorough knowledge of all the provisions of this other ordinances relative to traffic regulations such examination shall be conducted by the city manager or his designee any person desiring to take such examination shall furnish a sworn written statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of any crime misdemeanor or violation of any municipal ordinance the city manager shall have the right to deny a permit under this section if it is determined that an applicant has been convicted of a felony or a criminal traffic offense as described in section 2751 of this article the applicant shall have the right to appeal such decision to the city commission permanently revoke the permit of any person convicted as provided herein    42296 secs 27522770  reserved article iii  motor vehicles for hire liability insurancerequired  amount  form  conditions  approval etc a it shall be unlawful for any owner operator agent lessee or driver of any for hire passenger transportation vehicle to drive or operate the same or permit the same to be driven or operated on the public streets of this city unless such owner operator agent lessee chauffeur or driver shall have first procured and filed with the city director of financial services at all times while such vehicle is being driven or operated a liability insurance policy issued by a reliable and responsible insurance company authorized to write liability insurance and to do business in the state in amounts of not less than the amounts required by fs   or any amendment thereto as of  the requirements are as follows one hundred twentyfive thousand dollars $12500000 for one 1 person injured or killed and fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for all property damaged or destroyed in any one 1 accident and two hundred fifty thousand dollars $25000000 for more than one 1 person injured or killed in any one 1 accident covering each motordriven passenger vehicle owned operated driven or controlled by such owner operator agent lessee or driver b the policy required by this section may be in the form of a separate policy for each vehicle or may be in the form of a fleet policy covering all vehicles operated by such owner operator agent lessee chauffeur or driver in the latter event such policy shall provide insurance on each vehicle in amounts of not less than the amounts required by fs   or any amendment thereto as of  the requirements are as follows one hundred twentyfive thousand dollars $12500000 for one 1 person injured or killed and fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for all property damaged or destroyed in any one 1 accident and not less than two hundred fifty thousand dollars $25000000 for more than one 1 person injured or killed in any one 1 accident c such policy or policies shall cover 1 all sums which the insured shall become obligated to pay by reason of the liability imposed upon the insured by law for damages including damages for care and loss of services because of bodily injury including death at any time resulting therefrom sustained by any person caused by accident and arising out of the ownership maintenance operation or use of such vehicle 2 all sums which the insured shall become obligated to pay by reason of the liability imposed upon the insured by law for damages because of injury to or destruction of property including the loss of use thereof caused by accident and arising out of the ownership maintenance operation or use of such vehicle such policy or policies shall include an endorsement to the effect that the same cannot be altered modified or cancelled for any cause without notice being served upon the city director of financial services at least fifteen 15 days prior to the date of such alteration modification or cancellation d such policy or policies shall be in the generally accepted form in use in this state by liability insurance companies for such public and property damage liability insurance policies and shall among other things provide that the insolvency or bankruptcy of the insured shall not relieve the insurer from the payment of damages for injuries or death sustained or loss occasioned within the provisions of the policy all such policies before becoming effective under this article shall be approved by the city manager as to sufficiency and the city attorney as to form    121007   92216 sameprerequisite to issuance of license no city license for the operation of any for in whole or in part then at the same time the license of such licensee to drive or operate such vehicle shall ipso facto become null and void    92216 congested areasto be designated by resolution etc the city commission shall by resolution from time to time as in its judgment public necessity safety or convenience may require create define and declare any areas within the city as congested areas when such areas are so created and designated all of the provisions in this article for or relating to congested areas shall be applicable and enforceable as to the congested areas created hereunder any congested area may be enlarged restricted changed relocated or abolished by the city commission by resolution as in its judgment public necessity safety or convenience may require all such resolutions shall be published once before they shall become effective  samevehicles to use taxi stands every taxicab upon entering any congested area created under this article shall proceed directly to an unoccupied taxi stand and shall enter and remain upon such stand until employed by a passenger or until such vehicle is otherwise ready to leave the congested area    92216 rates and chargesto be fixed by resolution the city commission shall by resolution from time to time fix and establish reasonable rates and charges for the transportation of persons and their baggage within the city in for hire passenger transportation vehicles and also in the same manner amend alter change or abolish same all such resolutions shall be published at least once before they shall become effective    92216 sameexceeding amounts fixed it shall be unlawful for the operator or driver of any for hire passenger transportation vehicle to charge or demand of any customer any sum of money in excess of the rates or charges fixed and established by the city commission under the provisions of section 2776    92216 samecruising and solicitation of passengers a cruising or driving on the public streets within any congested area created under section 2774 soliciting prospective passengers for hire is hereby prohibited no driver or other person shall stop or park any for hire passenger transportation vehicle for hire on any street or highway of the city within any such congested area for the purpose of soliciting passengers except at such places designated as forhire or taxi stands no driver of any such vehicle shall solicit any patron to board such vehicle at any public place within any such congested area except at the curb within the boundaries of a forhire or taxi stand no driver of such vehicle shall within any such congested area while such vehicle is not upon a forhire or taxi stand by word sign or other signal solicit any person to become a passenger in such vehicle  provided that no restriction contained herein shall prohibit any such vehicle from proceeding to any designated place 1 to pick up any patron who has prior to the beginning of that journey by telephone or other communication requested such vehicle to meet such patron at such designated place  or 2 to deliver any patron to his requested destination  provided further that no such vehicle shall load or unload passengers with any such congested area except at the curb of the street b it shall be unlawful for any for hire passenger transportation vehicle to park or solicit business on the streets of the city within any such congested area except as hereinabove provided    92216 refusal to pay legal fare it shall be unlawful for any person to refuse to pay the legal fare whether it is fixed by the city commission or a lesser amount agreed to between the parties for the use of for hire passenger transportation vehicles    92216 cards showing schedule of rates photograph and name of operator etc to be posted in vehicle a it shall be the duty of the owner operator agent lessee chauffeur or driver of any for hire passenger transportation vehicle to procure from the city director of financial services suitable cards which shall be in a form prescribed by the city manager and shall show the schedule of the rates and charges for the transportation services furnished by the operator of the vehicle  a photograph of the driver of such vehicle and his name address and city license number  and also the name and address of the owner of such vehicle b such cards shall be posted in a conspicuous place within such vehicle while it is in use as a for hire passenger transportation vehicle so that it may be clearly visible to all passengers in such vehicle    92216 signs or markings required on vehicles every for hire passenger transportation vehicle in the city while on the street shall have placed thereon a sign or painted thereon in letters at least three 3 inches in height and plainly visible and distinguishable from the vehicle the company name phone number and unique vehicle number the company name and phone number will be on both sides of the vehicle the unique number will be displayed on the front back and both sides of the vehicle in addition the unique number will be displayed on the dashboard and back of the front passenger seat of the vehicle and shall be clearly visible from the rear compartment of the vehicle    22894   92216 owner to register vehicle with police every owner of a for hire passenger transportation vehicle in the city shall register such vehicle used for hire with the police department annually on january first of each year    92216 equipment and safety requirements every for hire passenger transportation vehicle under this article shall be at all times in good order and repair in a clean condition and well ventilated when in operation so as to render safe adequate and proper service and so as not to be a menace to the safety of the patron of the vehicle or general public every for hire passenger transportation vehicle shall comply with the equipment and safety standards of this subsection as applicable by type a taxicab 1 taxicabs shall meet the following equipment and safety standards annually i the windshield and all side and rear windows shall provide clear visibility and operate according to the manufacturers specifications the windshield and all windows shall possess no breakage cracks or pits that impair visibility or hinder the safety of passengers all window crankspower window switches shall be complete intact and functioning windows on vehicles for hire shall not be covered by or treated with a material which would cause the vehicle to be in violation of fs   as may be amended ii all standard manufacturers interior equipment shall be complete intact and functioning  including but not limited to interior lights dashboard trim gear shifts and head rests vehicle interiors must not contain loose objects and must be clean sanitary and free of broken seatsprotruding sharp edges or torn or damaged upholstery headliner or floor coverings the vehicles interior must be free of offensive odors the floor board shall be free of rust and holes trunks and luggage compartments must be kept clean and free of debris iii all doors must have operating handles which allow opening from both the inside and outside and door hinges and latches must function properly door locks must be operable by passengers at all times door seals and gaskets must be intactoperating and prevent water odor and fumes from entering the vehicle from outside all door panels must be intact to prevent accidental injuries on door and window mechanisms iv seat belts shall be available for all passengers according to manufacturers specifications and state law seat belts shall be in operating condition easily accessible clean and free of grease and other objectionable substances v all vehicles shall be equipped with a fully functioning heating and air conditioning system the vehicle shall be equipped with a fully functioning windshield defrost or defogging system vi all vehicles shall be equipped with a light capable of illuminating the interior of the vehicle controlled by the operation of the doors or manually controlled by the driver vii the transportation of children shall be in accordance with fs   as may be amended viii those vehicles and operations which are subject to the americans with disabilities act ada shall comply with the applicable provisions of said act ix the vehicles body fenders doors trim grill and paint must be free from cracks breaks rust and body damage that detracts from the overall appearance of the vehicle or could result in harm or injury to the passenger or hisher personal belongings x the vehicle must be equipped with safe tires of the same size no recaps shall be used maximum allowable tread wear shall be where tread is level with the wear bar or twothirtysecondsinch when measured at three 3 random places in the tire tread the tires shall be inflated to manufacturers specifications and free of cuts cracks bulges or exposed belts xi windshield wipers must be operational according to the manufacturers specifications wiper blades shall be in such a condition as to make firm contact with the windshield when operational and shall not be torn or worn xii reflectors and lenses shall not be cracked or missing and must be the correct color and properly positioned xiii low and high beam headlights turn signals brake tail and reverse lights shall be operable as required by state law each vehicle shall have a white light on the vehicle to illuminate the rear license plate so that it is clearly visible xiv steering mechanisms shall not be worn or jammed nor shall there be more than two inches play to the left or right of center measured at the steering wheel rim with the front wheels in a straightahead position power steering units shall not have visible signs of fluid leakage xv the vehicle suspension shall function as designed by the manufacturer xvi the vehicle shall be equipped with an operating horn with the actuating button mounted in the location designated by the vehicle manufacturer and operated in the manner designed and assembled by the vehicle manufacturer xvii each vehicle shall contain an operating parking brake and a primary brake system which acts on all four 4 vehicle wheels there shall be no visible leaks in the brake line hoses wheel cylinders or any part of the brake system and no frayed cables brake linings andor disc pads when measured at the thinnest point shall not be less than onesixteenth  116  of an inch and firmly attached to the brake shoe or disc disc brake rotors and brake drums shall be of a size and type appropriate for the vehicle with no cracks or other damage which change or impair the functional surface all primary brake systems shall demonstrate a reasonable total braking force when conducting a rolling stop xviii there shall be no leakage of exhaust gas from the exhaust manifold muffler or any other point in the exhaust system as determined visual and audible inspection the tail pipe shall discharge exhaust from the rear of the vehicle according to manufacturer specifications xix belts shall show no signs of excessive wear and be free of cracks and frays hoses shall be firm and in good condition free of leaks and cracks xx all fluid levels shall be maintained according to manufacturers specifications xxi vehicles are required to have manufacturer specified spare tires and tire changing equipment unless all wheels are equipped with a run flat tire system xxii vehicles must be equipped with functioning speedometer and odometer xxiii vehicles must receive routine maintenance according to the manufacturers recommendations pertaining to service intervals a record of such routine maintenance must be maintained and is subject to inspection by the division xxiv businesses must ensure that each vehicle or driver has a means of communicating to a central dispatch or to emergency agencies with a twoway radio andor cellular mobile telephone xxv failure to comply with the provisions of this section and applicable sections of fs ch 316 as may be amended may result in denial of a permits revocation or suspension of the permits a denial of renewal of such permits issuance of a civil citation a misdemeanor conviction or other such remedies available to the division by law b pedicab 1 each pedicab must be equipped with the following all of which shall be operational i a headlight capable of projecting a beam of light for a distance of five hundred 500 feet ii a taillight red in color and plainly visible from a distance of six hundred 600 feet to the rear of the pedicab iii a schedule of fare rates iv a signal bell or other warning device except a siren which is prohibited c low speed vehicle 1 a lowspeed vehicle must be equipped with headlamps stop lamps turn signal lamps taillamps reflex reflectors parking brakes rearview mirrors windshields seat belts and vehicle identification numbers    92216 periodic inspection a it shall be unlawful for any owner operator agent lessee or driver of any for hire passenger transportation vehicle to drive or operate the same or permit the same to be driven or operated within the jurisdictional limits of the city of st augustine without current valid numbered medallion issued by the city displayed as required in section 2784e below b prior to receiving a medallion each taxicab shall be inspected by an ase certified mechanic that the vehicle is in compliance with the equipment and safety requirements as listed in section 2783a125 on a form provided by city fleet management the applicant must provide to the citys fleet management the signed checklist from an ase certified mechanic that the vehicle is safe prior to receiving their initial medallion c each year prior to city renewing the medallion each taxicab shall be inspected by an ase certified mechanic that the vehicle is in compliance with a safety checklist as provided by city fleet management the applicant must provide to the citys fleet management the signed checklist from an ase certified mechanic that the vehicle is safe prior to receiving their renewed medallion d the owner of all other for hire passenger transportation vehicles shall at least annually subject the vehicle to a complete and thorough inspection by the citys fleet maintenance staff in accordance with the equipment and safety standards as listed for the vehicle type in subsection 2783 e if upon inspection the vehicle is found to comply with the requirements of section 2783 and there is a current regulatory license on file for the vehicle then a numbered medallion will be issued this medallion will be fixed to the outside left rear of the vehicle in plain view from the rear of the vehicle a vehicle may be inspected and found to comply with requirements  however if there is no current regulatory license on file a numbered medallion will not be issued until a current regulatory license is obtained    51192   102207 imminent danger to the publics safety the suspension shall be effective immediately upon notice to the owner the motor vehicle may not be returned to serve until it has been inspected and found to comply with section 2783  inspection fee a medallions issued are valid from october 1st th of each year all for hire passenger transportation vehicles must be inspected annually as provided in section 2784 and the annual fee will be as set by the city manager pursuant to section 274 b the fee for reinspecting a vehicle that has been determined unsafe by the chief of police will be as set by the city manager pursuant to section 274 c the annual fee collected under this article is a fee paid for the purpose of examination and inspection of vehicles for hire and the administration of this article such fees are declared to be regulatory fees in addition to and not in lieu of the occupational license taxes imposed    51192   92216 presumption of operation any automobile signed marked other than part of the weight of the vehicle and load so drawn trailer means every vehicle with or without motor power designed for carrying persons or property and for being drawn by a motor vehicle 22492   5 51192   12797   6903   101005   102207 cross reference drivers of horsedrawn hacks or carriages required to pay fee of guide  177367  guides  17121 et seq division 1  franchise agreements definitions a definitions except where the context clearly indicates otherwise the following terms and phrases as used in this article shall have the following meanings animal shall mean any horse or mule used for touring purposes and operated under a franchise agreement animaldrawn vehicle shall mean a carriage or vehicle drawn or pulled by an animal used for touring purposes business day shall exclude saturday sunday and any day of the week determined to be a holiday according to the annual city holiday calendar shall mean the director of planning and building or designee driveroperator shall mean the person or persons driving an animaldrawn vehicle fire department shall mean the fire chief or designee franchise agreement shall mean the agreement between the city and a franchisee authorizing the franchisee to operate animaldrawn vehicles on the public streets of the city subject to the terms of this article franchisee shall mean the grantee of authority to operate animaldrawn vehicles under a franchise agreement entered into between the city and franchisee subject to the terms of this article out of service shall mean when the animal is unhitched from an animaldrawn vehicle and out of its harness police department shall mean the chief of police or designee rest shall mean the time when the animal is in service but not actively engaged in the act of pulling an animaldrawn vehicle stable shall mean the barn where the animals are kept stall shall mean individual space within the barn where each animal is kept tour guide shall mean any person who for compensation offers to show and describe the points of interest and historical places in the city tour or touring shall mean the conducting of or the participation in sightseeing in the districts for hire or in exchange for a donation  41111 franchise required  restrictions a no person shall operate or cause to be operated for hire any vehicle of whatever nature drawn by animals for the purpose of conducting tours within the city of st augustine hereafter city without first entering into a franchise agreement with the city b the city manager or designee may enter into a franchise agreement each franchise agreement shall be granted for a period not to exceed twenty 20 years and shall automatically renew upon the expiration of the initial franchise term on a yeartoyear basis so long as the franchisee is in good standing unless either party gives twelve 12 months written notice prior to the expiration of the current term that it does not intend to renew the agreement c a franchisees authorization to use the citys streets alleys public ways and places for the purposes herein shall not be exclusive and the city reserves the authority to grant the use of all streets alleys public ways and places to any person at any time during the period of any franchise granted pursuant to this article d the enjoyment and exercise by a franchisee of any and all rights to use the citys streets alleys public ways and places shall be subject and subordinate to the dominant right of the public to use said streets alleys public ways and places and to the lawful exercise of control by the city over the use thereof  41111   52311 franchise application required the applicant shall submit an application with the city for a franchise agreement with proof of the following 1 documentation demonstrating that the applicant is authorized to legally conduct business within the state of florida pursuant to florida statutes and if applicable a completed application for a business tax receipt for operation of a business within the city limits  2 intended hours of operation  3 location of facilities to be used for the housing of animals  4 name of doctor of veterinary medicine duly licensed in the state for compliance with citys requirement to provide the animals certificate of health  5 applicants previous experience in the operation of animaldrawn vehicles on the public streets  6 number of permits requested subject to the provisions of this article  7 number of carriages to be operated number of carriages shall equal or exceed number of permits requested  8 proof that such animaldrawn vehicles will be insured under a liability insurance policy for personal injury or death and for injury to or destruction of property of one or more persons resulting from any one accident of not less than the minimum dollar amount of liability insurance coverage required by applicable vehicle and traffic statutes and laws to be maintained by owners of vehicles engaged in the business of carrying or transporting passengers for hire  9 acknowledgment by the applicant that any franchise shall be nonexclusive  and 10 acknowledgment by the applicant that upon the violation of any provisions of this article by the applicantfranchisee its agents employees or persons acting on its behalf the applicantfranchisee shall be liable for any penalties prescribed within this article  41111 permits a a fee equal to the greater of two and onehalf 212 percent of the franchisees gross annual revenue or one thousand dollars $100000 times the number of permits issued under the franchise shall be paid in quarterly installments from the date of execution of the franchise agreement on dates specified in the franchise agreement beginning on the fourth year of a franchise and each third year thereafter the city may increase the percent of the franchisees gross annual revenue for purposes of determining the franchise fee by no more than onehalf 12 percent however in no event shall the percentage exceed five 5 percent of the franchisees annual gross revenue b at the end of a franchise year the city shall multiply the number of permits issued under the franchise times the applicable percentage specified in subsection a of the franchisees gross annual revenue for that year if the result of that calculation exceeds the amount paid under subsection a the franchisee shall pay the difference within ninety 90 days c the term gross annual revenue as used in this section for the determination of the franchise fee shall mean the gross amount of revenue collected by the franchisee from sales of passenger tickets less any sales tax admission tax and cost to franchisee for admission tickets to other attractions if any d in order that the city may determine the proper amount of the franchise fee each year the city shall furnish to franchisee the forms and guidelines for a system of accounting records which forms franchisee shall be required to maintain and make available to the city at all times franchisee shall file with the city on a quarterly basis no later than the fifteenth 15 th  day of january april july and october a report on a form provided by the city showing yearly gross sales to the date of filing e the total number of permits issued by the city shall not exceed thirty 30 f except as provided in this subsection the number of permits issued to a single franchise shall not exceed ten 10 any person who on the effective date of this ordinance has in excess of ten 10 permits issued by the city and applies for a franchise shall be entitled to no more than fifteen 15 permits any person who on the effective date of this article has fewer than ten 10 permits issued by the city and applies for a franchise shall be entitled to the number of permits issued to such person and may apply for additional permits  provided that the total number of permits issued to such person shall not exceed ten 10 g all permits granted to a franchisee shall remain with that franchise unsevered and unassigned h franchises are nontransferable i no franchisee no subsidiary of a franchise and no person or entity who holds an ownership interest in a franchise may manage operate or otherwise control directly or indirectly any permits not issued to that franchise  41111 franchisee obligations the franchisee shall comply with the following obligations 1 during the term of the franchise agreement the franchisee shall remain authorized to legally conduct business within the state of florida pursuant to florida statutes  2 the franchisee shall agree to operate its business strictly in accordance with the ordinances of the city applicable thereto as from time to time amended  3 the franchisee shall agree that upon the violation of any provisions of this article by the franchisee its agents employees or persons acting on its behalf the franchisee shall be subject to penalties prescribed within this article  41111 citys audit rights in addition to the accounting system as specified in section 27129d the city shall have access at all reasonable hours to all of each franchisees accounting financial statistical customer and service records relating to the operation of franchisees animaldrawn vehicles the city may conduct an annual audit of any of franchisees records for the purpose of determining the accuracy of the gross sales reported by franchisee the nature and extent of the audit shall be determined by the city manager  41111 division 2  general operation of animaldrawn vehicles loading and unloading a the city manager shall formulate and promulgate reasonable rules and regulations for use of designated loading areas in order to ensure equality of opportunity among operators prevent discrimination among animaldrawn vehicles and prevent unfair practices among the owners operators and drivers of such animaldrawn vehicles for hire b the cost or price of animaldrawn vehicle rides shall be established by resolution of the city commission after public hearing  41111 prescribed routes  restrictions a routes animaldrawn vehicles shall only operate on routes established by resolution of the city commission after public hearing b such routes may be temporarily changed or altered by the city manager if determined to be necessary for public safety reasons with such changes being subject to immediate review of the city commission at the commissions next regularly scheduled meeting c picking up offroute fares an animaldrawn vehicle may leave a prescribed route to pick up a fare so long as the animaldrawn vehicle travels from a prescribed route and directly to the fare pick up location upon picking up an offroute fare an animaldrawn vehicle shall immediately return directly to and remain on a prescribed route d dropping off fares an animaldrawn vehicle may leave a prescribed route to drop off a fare so long as the animaldrawn vehicle travels from a prescribed route and directly to the fare drop off location upon dropping off a route fare an animaldrawn vehicle shall immediately return directly to and remain on a prescribed route  41111   52311 charters a every tuesday or other day determined by the city manager each franchisee shall notify the city manager or designee of any requests for a charter on a route other than a prescribed route to be performed during the next sevenday period the franchisee shall also notify the city manager or designee of any such charter performed by the franchisee during the preceding sevenday period which had not been previously reported the notification shall contain the following information 1 the name of the franchisee  2 the name of the animaldrawn vehicle operator  3 identification of the exact route taken or proposed to be taken  4 the date of the route or proposed route  and 5 the approximate time of day of the charter or proposed charter b upon receipt of a notification the city manager or designee shall notify the franchisee of the approval or disapproval of a charter route and provide the franchisee with a certificate of approval for any approved proposed charter c a preapproved charter shall display the certificate of approval on a plainly visible location on the animaldrawn vehicle during the entire charter d no franchisee shall operate on any route disapproved by the city manager or designee pursuant to this section the city manager or designee shall notify all franchisees of any such disapproved route e notifications by franchisees under this section may be submitted to the city manager or designee via facsimile or electronic mail  41111 drivers it shall be unlawful for any person to drive or operate an animaldrawn vehicle in the city until such person has taken an examination to show a satisfactory knowledge of the principal streets of the city and all main thoroughfares leading out of the city as well as a thorough knowledge of all the provisions of the other ordinances relative to traffic regulations such examination shall be conducted by the city manager or designee any person desiring to take such examination shall furnish to the examining officer his or her name age and address and in addition thereto a sworn written statement as to whether or not the applicant has been either charged or convicted of any crime misdemeanor or violation of any municipal ordinance the nature of the offense and the disposition or penalty assessed therein when such person shall comply with the provisions of this section and show satisfactory evidence of his or her qualifications as provided by this section the chief of police shall issue a certificate as to his or her qualifications embracing the above facts and the driver shall keep such certificate on his or her person and exhibit the same to any passenger when requested to do so  41111 drivers appearance every animaldrawn vehicle driver shall be neat and clean in appearance and while on duty shall wear a badge or nameplate with his or her name thereon on his or her shirt or coat in plain view no driver may smoke while heshe is carrying any passenger  41111 compliance with traffic regulations any person having been issued a permit under this article to engage in the business of operating animaldrawn vehicles shall be subject to all traffic provisions of this other ordinances and regulations now in effect in the city and all traffic ordinances and regulations which may pertain to the operation of animaldrawn vehicles hereinafter enacted or adopted by the city and such rules and regulations formulated and promulgated by the city manager under authority of this article  41111 tour guide required all tours on animaldrawn vehicles must be conducted by a registered or temporary tour guide in accordance with chapter 17 article v of this  41111 equipment and safety requirements a every animaldrawn vehicle in service shall have the following equipment on the vehicle which equipment shall be maintained in good repair 1 body condition 2 reflectors 3 grab handles 4 traces 5 harness 6 seats 7 rubber surfaced wheels 8 top 9 shafts 10 steps 11 lights on any vehicle licensed to operate at night 12 brakes  provided however that brakes shall not be required on any vehicle in operation as of  13 sign located on the rear of the vehicle indicating that the vehicle is slow moving b an animaldrawn vehicle should be maintained in a clean well painted manner so as to provide a generally good appearance c failure to comply with this section of the be considered a violation subject to penalty under this division  41111 animal safety a animals shall not engage in work with harnesses or bits which harm or are unsafe to the animal b harnesses bridles bits and padding shall be properly fitted and kept in clean and good repair c harnesses shall be kept free of makeshifts like wire rope and rusty chain d trace chains shall not put pressure on the collar and shoulders of the animal when it starts pulling the carriage resulting in a jolting start versus a smooth start with a snug collar already in place e breeching shall fit so that it will not rub or hinder the hind leg movement of the animal  41111 weather a franchisees and drivers shall use caution when working animals in adverse weather conditions such as high heat and humidity snow ice heavy rain and other slippery or reduced visibility situations b when either the ambient temperature reaches ninetyfive 95 degrees fahrenheit or the heat index reaches one hundred five 105 degrees fahrenheit as determined by the weather station at the st augustine airport ksgj the franchisees and drivers shall discontinue working their animals and pull them off the street until the temperature decreases below the abovestated temperatures as directed by the city manager city manager designee or the police department c the official thermometer used for determining the temperature and the heat index shall be located at the st augustine airport ksgj in the event that this thermometer is out of service as determined by the city manager city manager designee or the police department the backup thermometer will be the thermometer located at the st augustine police department 151 king street st augustine florida  41111 periodic inspections the owner of an animaldrawn vehicle for hire shall subject the vehicle to a complete and thorough inspection in accordance with the policies procedures requirements and schedules established by the city manager the city manager shall exercise sole discretion in scheduling the time for such inspection but in no event shall the inspection occur less frequently than once every twelve 12 calendar months  41111 animal cleanliness drivers of vehicles drawn by animals and operated on the streets of the city shall 1 ensure that such animals are equipped with diapers or similar devices to prevent manure or droppings from falling on the city streets 2 be responsible for removal from the streets of all manure and droppings by  pm of the day of the occurrence and after completion of the last route of the day if the last route ends after  pm or in the event of a charter on a route other than a prescribed route immediately following the completion of that charter trip  41111 care of animals no animal shall be used to draw a carriage unless the animal is in good health and the following standards are met 1 the animal shall not have open sores or wounds nor shall such animal be lame or have any other ailments unless the driver has in the drivers possession a current written statement by a veterinarian that the animal is fit for such work notwithstanding such condition 2 the animal shall be properly and appropriately groomed 3 the animal is kept in good working condition 4 water shall be provided to each animal immediately after completing a tour 5 animals shall have at least fifteen 15 minutes rest between back to back tours 6 in a twentyfourhour period animals shall not engage in work more than eight 8 consecutive hours or shall not engage in work more than ten 10 hours in a twentyfourhour period without a one and onehalf 112 hour break being disconnected from the vehicle 7 animals shall not engage in work more than six 6 days in a sevenday period 8 animals shall not engage in work with equipment causing an impairment of vision other than normal blinders 9 animals shall not be driven at a speed faster than a slow trot 10 animals shall not be subject to any cruel or harassing treatment or equipment 11 animals shall not be sold or disposed of except in a humane manner in accordance with american association of equine practitioners guidelines  41111 feeding of animals a animals daily shall receive an adequate amount of equine feed free from contamination sufficient in quantity adequate in nutritional value and provided frequently enough to meet normal daily requirements for the animals condition special needs environmental factors and size of the animal so as to maintain satisfactory health b clean drinking water free from contamination shall be available to an out of service animal at all times c out of service animals shall at all times have access to salt in a block or loose form  41111 sheltering of animals within city limits stables within city limits shall be safe well lighted and ventilated and shall provide protection from the weather as described herein 1 stables and stalls shall be kept clean and in good repair and excreta shall be removed daily  2 the floors of the stalls shall be graded and raked to keep their surface dry  3 fans shall be used to increase ventilation when the ambient temperature reaches 90 degrees fahrenheit  4 sharp surfaces and any other hazards shall not be permitted in any stable or stall where they can come in contact with the animals  5 stables and stalls shall be kept free of leaks including but not limited to leaks from roofs or from plumbing  6 the practice of tethering the animal in a stall is permitted so long as the animal can lie down without the risk of entanglement or injury  7 occupied stalls shall have a minimum of three 3 inches of bedding or have a specialized surface so as to keep animals clean dry and free of concussion abrasion or pressure points  8 interior and exterior areas of the stable shall be kept clean
